Eye development is divided into two distinct phases, proliferation and differentiation. In the first phase, cells in the eye field asynchronously proliferate from the earliest larval stage until the third instar stage of larval life .
Prolonged hypertension is a prevalent and significant contributor to morbidity and mortality from heart failure. The DASH clinical trials provided evidence that diets rich in fruits and vegetables reduced blood pressure. Therefore, a whole food approach rather than altered nutrients alone may be a more appropriate dietary intervention to alter hypertension and related pathologies, including heart failure .
Ganaxolone , the 3β methyl analog of the progesterone metabolite allopregnanolone, is the first neurosteroid related agent to be evaluated in man for the drug treatment of epilepsy . According to a widely held definition, neurosteroids are endogenous steroids that directly modulate neural excitability through non genomic actions. The most studied and best accepted molecular target of neurosteroids is GABAA receptors .
As such, misregulated kinases are associated with many types of human disease. A very common mutation, G2019S, is found in the Mg2+ binding motif and increases kinase function . However, LRRK2 is a complicated molecule that includes protein protein interaction domains as well as a second catalytic region, the ROC  domain, which is an active GTPase , and an adjacent COR  region that may regulate the ROC domain via dimerization .
Bronchopulmonary dysplasia  is the most common cause of pulmonary morbidity in premature infants. Infants with BPD are at increased risk for death, and survivors have life long morbidities. Despite the increased survival of extremely premature infants, BPD remains a major morbidity., Approximately 40% of infants born between 22 and 28 weeks gestation are diagnosed with BPD, defined as oxygen supplementation at 36 weeks postmenstrual age .,, Developing drugs to prevent or treat BPD, a major goal of neonatal care over the past 20 years, would substantially decrease long term morbidity and reduce healthcare costs of premature infants .
Arterially perfused right and left ventricular wedge preparations have proved valuable in the elucidation of the cellular basis for the electrocardiogram  and the mechanisms underlying a variety of arrhythmogenic syndromes, including the Brugada, long QT, and short QT syndromes  as well as conduction disease, catecholaminergic VT , and ischemia related arrhythmias. ,  In all cases, transmural heterogeneities, or differences in the action potential duration and morphology across the ventricular wall, have been shown to contribute prominently to arrhythmogenesis attending these syndromes . Timothy syndrome, also referred to as syndactyly associated long QT syndrome  or LQT8, is a multisystem disorder characterized by developmental defects causing dysmorphic facial features including round face, flat nasal bridge, receding upper jaw, thin upper lip and webbing of the toes and fingers .
Obesity is a major public health concern. Despite efforts to decrease obesity prevalence, the number of obese adults continues to rise. To combat the obesity epidemic, many weight loss programs focus on the energy balance equation, specifically decreasing energy consumed and increasing energy expended.
Loma Linda University, in collaboration with Northern Illinois University and UC Santa Cruz, has built and tested a pre clinical prototype proton CT  scanner based on a design presented previously . The system is designed for scanning of head sized phantoms and small animals. This report presents some of our preliminary test results for the scanner installed on the research beam line at Loma Linda University Medical Center  .
Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  are a diverse family of ligand gated cation channels found primarily in neuronal and muscle cells in humans. nAChRs can be formed by any grouping of α2 α6 subunits together with β2β4 subunits; leading to a large assortment of different receptor subtype combinations. , The α6 containing nAChRs are primarily expressed at the presynaptic endings of catecholaminergic neurons in the brain, where their activity modulates the release of dopamine  and norepinephrine.
The degree of diversity that exists among H. pylori strains was first shown when the second genome sequence became available for this organism; strains 26695  and J99  have a 6% difference in their genomic content. Three common mechanisms by which deletions and/or insertions may arise in H. pylori include horizontal gene transfer, transposition and gene conversion. In addition to inter strain rearrangements, H. pylori has several direct and indirect repeat sequences that can result in intragenomic rearrangements .
Testicular germ cell carcinoma  is the most common malignancyin younger men. Age, history of undescended testes, family history of testicular cancer, and race/ethnicity are the only established risk factors for the disease . Although not entirely consistent, associations observed for inguinal hernia, estrogen excess during gestation, maximal height attained, and the relatively young age at which testicular cancers are diagnosed compared to other cancers suggest that early life events are involved in testicular cancer carcinogenesis .
Sterol carrier protein 2  is known as a nonspecific intracellular lipid carrier. However, four genes encoding single SCP 2 domain proteins have been identified in the yellow fever mosquito Aedes aegypti . The mosquito SCP 2  and SCP 2 like proteins have very similar temporal and spatial expression profiles , but vary in their affinity to different lipids .
Systemic hypoxia occurs in a variety of conditions, diseases and accidents often precipitated by dysfunctional respiration , but loss of blood based oxygen carrying capacity, reduced oxygen transportation from capillaries to tissue  and environmental oxygen loss  are also common precipitants. In the medical setting, hypoxia is often a component of congestive heart failure , heart attack  and infectious and non infectious lung diseases . These symptoms are especially common in those suffering from acute mountain sickness  and can be experienced during both the hypoxic episode and after return of the individual to normal oxygenation .
The website is designed such that patients can make side by side comparisons of hospitals that are geographically close to one another with the stated purpose to “help you make decisions about where you get your health care.” As such, the website fits into an overarching goal of healthcare reform for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services  to increase the patient centeredness of healthcare by providing the patient with data so that he or she can intelligently participate in his or her care decisions . Among the measures that CMS reports on the website are a group of surgical process of care measures called the Surgical Care Improvement Project . Publicly reported quality measures in surgery may be particularly impactful given that many surgeries occur on an elective or semi elective basis, allowing time for patients to review data on hospital quality in their search for a provider.
Retail clinics provide a new model of urgent care. Located in retail stores such as pharmacy, discount, or grocery chains, these clinics require no appointments, are open on weekends and evenings, report little waiting time, and offer services limited to immunizations and treatment of minor acute conditions. Compared to outpatient physicians, retail clinics serve a population that is younger, more likely to be uninsured, and less likely to have a primary care physician.
Although SJIA represents only 10 20% of all JIA, it accounts for more than 2/3 of JIA mortality . Uncontrolled monocyte activation may result from a killing defect in NK cells. There is some evidence that activation of normal monocytes is associated with resistance to apoptosis .
Hematopoietic cell transplantation  is a complex treatment procedure for various malignant and non malignant hematological disorders. Patients who may benefit from allogeneic HCT are often referred to larger treatment centers. Transplanted patients often stay in the hospital or close to the transplant center for an extended time during the peri transplant period.
Proteases play a critical role in tumorigenesis by facilitating rapid cell cycling, mediating local invasion, fueling angiogenesis, and promoting metastasis . Specifically, cathepsin B , a lysosomal cysteine protease, has been shown to be involved in tumor initiation, hyperproliferation, and de differentiation and is up regulated in early human colon adenomas, carcinomas and metastasic lesions . In previous work, we developed a novel class of optical imaging agents that are “smart” near infrared  protease activatable agents that become brightly fluorescent in areas of increased CTSB expression, as is seen in colorectal neoplasia .
Frontotemporal lobar degeneration  describes a heterogeneous group of non Alzheimer forms of dementia with onset of illness usually before 65 years of age arising from the degeneration of the frontal and temporal lobes. When the behavioural and personality changes of FTD are accompanied by clinical motor neurone disease , the syndrome of FTD with motor neurone disease  emerges  . However, a tau negative, ubiquitin positive  histology  is the most common histological change underlying FTLD and accounts for about 55% of cases .
Holding these systemic factors constant, atherosclerosis does not occur randomly in the vasculature system, but is most likely to be found at sites with a particular vessel geometry, certain geometry induced flow patterns, and in the presence of endothelial injury. Atherosclerosis is typically associated with vessel branching, curvature, low wall shear stress  , or external mechanical factors . The adductor canal  is the region in which the femoral artery passes from the anterior thigh at the femoral triangle, between the vastus and adductor muscles, to the posterior thigh at the adductor hiatus where it exits the canal and becomes the popliteal artery .
The senile plaque is a pathological hallmark of Alzheimer’s disease  and is composed of β amyloid , activated microglia, astrocytes and degenerating neurons . Microglia, the mononuclear phagocytes of the brain , accumulate in senile plaques in AD patients and in animal models of AD . Aβ can activate microglia to produce cytokines and neurotoxins, hence promoting neurodegeneration .
T1 weighted gradient echo and T2 weighted spin echo imaging is a routine component of pediatric abdominal MRI for evaluation of the abdomen. Although respiratory triggering and navigation is routinely used for T2 weighted imaging and coronary imaging , there has been less attention to mitigating motion artifacts in T1 weighted imaging. One common approach is phase reordering .
These and most other screening applications require the quantification of tens to thousands of biomarker targets in a single sample. A technology that could accommodate higher density without loss of performance or increase in cost would be an enabling tool . Ideally, substrates used for biomolecule quantification would be based on non fouling materials, have a high target capacity, and provide solution like hybridization thermodynamics.
5 Fluorouracil  based neoadjuvant chemoradiation therapy has become standard care for patients with advanced rectal cancer, resulting in decreased local recurrence rates, improved tolerance of prescribed therapy, improved organ preservation, and fewer treatment related complications . However, with current preoperative treatment strategies, complete pathologic response only is observed in approximately 20% of cases with ∼40% of the tumors demonstrating no pathologic response . Molecular mechanisms resulting in therapeutic resistance in colorectal cancer  are poorly understood.
Brugada syndrome  is a primary arrhythmogenic disease that can cause sudden cardiac death in young populations. It is inherited as an autosomal dominant trait, with approximately 20% of BrS cases caused by mutations in the SCN5A gene that encodes the α subunit of the cardiac sodium channel. Electrophysiological studies using animal models and mammalian cell lines have suggested that reduced sodium currents account for loss of the epicardial action potential  dome, which may lead to the exaggeration of the transmural AP dispersion in the right ventricular outflow tract and gives rise to the typical ST segment elevation in the right precordial electrocardiogram  leads.
Cystine  and cysteine residues are important for protein structure and function. In their reduced form, cysteines participate in the active site of different enzymes and, together with histidine, are the two most common residues involved in the coordination of zinc ions in Zn finger motifs  . The motivation to compute 13Cα chemical shifts arises from the fact that they are exquisitely sensitive to, and depend mainly on, the backbone torsional angles , although the influence of the side chain torsional angles, χ’s, cannot be disregarded .
Uterine leiomyosarcoma  is a high risk malignancy that is diagnosed in only a few thousand women each year in the United States. Single agents with moderate activity in LMS include ifosfamide  and gemcitabine . Phase II trials have shown the following agents to be inactive: cisplatin, mitoxantrone, amonifide, oral etoposide, diazoquone , intravenous etoposide, topotecan, paclitaxel, thalidomide, and trimetrexate.
Centrosome duplication in somatic cells is regulated so that the parental centrosome assembles one and only one daughter centrosome during each division cycle . At the core of the centrosome lies a pair of microtubule based structures known as centrioles. Normally, daughter centrioles  called procentrioles  assemble at right angles to each of the pre existing centrioles .
eIF4E mediated translational modulation of these mRNAs plays an important role in both tumor formation and metastasis . The rate of synthesis of any given protein is determined by the rate of translation initiation . The function of eIF3 is not only linked to prevent premature association of the 40S with the 60S ribosomal subunits but also is linked to prevent the premature association of the 40S ribosome to the mRNA by binding to eIF4F complex generating a preinitiation complex called 48S.
Rabies is an important zoonotic disease that is estimated to kill at least 60 000 people worldwide each year . PEP readily prevents development of clinical rabies and death when given soon after exposure to a rabid animal . Unfortunately, because many do not have access to proper medical care, whether for financial or logistical reasons, or may not recognize a potential RABV exposure, prompt administration of rabies PEP to at risk individuals is not always achieved .
Although diabetes prevalence and incidence continues to increase in the United States , the burden of diabetes varies greatly among race/ethnicity subgroups, with nationally representative data indicating African Americans having the highest prevalence followed by Latinos and whites . Diabetes burden also varies among US immigrants by place of birth, with foreign born Asians having the highest diabetes prevalence . When compared to US born individuals, diabetes prevalence is typically higher among foreign born individuals .
For decades, psychopathy researchers have theorized that the extreme affective and behavioral traits that characterize the disorder could arise through different causal mechanisms. If there are indeed multiple, distinct causal mechanisms for psychopathy, then one may expect the different etiological subtypes to exhibit distinct psychological and neurobiological profiles within the context of similarly flagrant antisocial behaviors. The question, then, is how to differentiate primary psychopaths from secondary psychopaths for the purposes of research.
Several recent quantitative muscle architecture studies have used DT MRI based muscle fiber tractography . Moreover, DT MRI appears to reflect damage and recovery processes distinctly from T2 . In addition, the transverse diffusivities appear to be sensitive to gender  and age .
An essential function of the visual system is to maintain stable representations of the environment across saccadic eye movements. As the eyes move, the retinotopic  positions of objects change, while their spatiotopic  positions remain stable. In both types of remapping, the response is to a stimulus presented before the saccade, even if the response continues after the saccade.
Disengagement from mental health services and other supports jeopardizes the potential for future community adjustment, and warrants interventions that establish, maintain and strengthen adequate linkages to ongoing care . Researchers have focused on continuity of care  as a key indicator of quality of care in health services generally , including in the domain of mental health services  for persons with severe mental illness . COC is a complex, multidimensional construct  that is employed in a variety of ways, with little agreement about which elements are most important .
Helicobacter pylori infects half of the world’s population and is a causative agent of gastritis, peptic ulcer, gastric cancer and lymphoma . The host response to H. pylori provides an environment in which epithelial cells may be damaged by mediators of inflammation including cytokines , proteases and reactive oxygen and nitrogen species . Apoptosis is executed by the activation of caspases which act as effector molecules .
It is widely appreciated that with aging comes an increasing risk of cancer incidence, yet epidemiologic data indicate that at ages greater than about 60 years, the rate at which incidence increases begins to diminish, and at sufficiently old ages, may even decrease . Several factors likely contribute to the diminished incidence in older adults, including that the data may not be as reliable for older individuals . This explanation is insufficient, however, as studies in animal models demonstrate the same pattern .

One area that will likely benefit the most from transient BBB disruption is the use of chemotherapy for the treatment of brain tumors.
Postoperative hypersensitivity  can be defined as pain in a tooth associated with mastication or with contact with hot, cold, sweet, or sour stimuli that occurs 1 week or more posttreatment. Pain associated with clenching, which may indicate a restoration in hyperocclusion, is typically excluded from definitions of POH . A 2006 survey of the authors’ practice based research network  revealed that POH following posterior resin based composite  restorations is a common concern among its member practitioner investigators.
Long lived serological memory is the product of long lived memory B cells  and plasma cells . IgM Bmem cells are produced independent of T cell help, differentiate in the absence of GC structure , produce natural antibodies  and part of circulating marginal zone B cells . Upon exposure to their cognate antigen, Ig switched and IgM+ Bmem, rapidly divide to daughter Bmem and differentiate to PC .
Adolescents’ involvement in high risk sexual behaviors renders them vulnerable to unplanned pregnancies and sexually transmitted infection  . An emerging body of research has investigated this problem from the perspective of Life History Theory  . LHT, a branch of evolutionary biology, maintains that organisms maximize their reproductive success in response to environmental conditions .
We report here on a new genome scan meta analysis   of genome wide linkage scans  of schizophrenia . Here we analyze 32 scans that included 3255 pedigrees with 7413 affected individuals . Genome wide association  study methods have proven more successful than GWLS for common diseases: they detect smaller effects of common single nucleotide polymorphisms  as well as some copy number variants , and have identified many common disease associations.
Regaining mobility at the community level is a fundamental component of successful rehabilitation among stroke survivors . Being able to move around in the community is multidimensional capability, reflecting not only physical function but also cognitive function, social integration, and community participation. Spatial neglect is a cognitive disorder that affects perception and/or motor execution, and that predominantly occurs after a right hemispheric stroke .
Stressors increase alcohol craving and subjective anxiety and induce autonomic changes , and several studies have demonstrated an increase in alcohol consumption following acute stress in social drinkers  and alcoholics . Furthermore, preliminary studies conducted in our laboratory have demonstrated that heavy drinkers who ordinarily engage in binge drinking consume more alcohol during stress, compared to heavy drinkers who do not binge . It has been suggested that stress activates brain substrates of the incentive system , thus increasing individuals’ sensitivity to the positively reinforcing properties of drugs leading to increased motivation to use drugs .
Parkinson disease  is an age associated neurodegenerative disease clinically defined as a progressive movement disorder. Research data have clearly indicated that during PD, SN dopaminergic neurons are subject to oxidative and nitrosative stress . During PD, there is a selective inhibition of mitochondrial complex I  resulting in mitochondrial dysfunction .
Dynamic cerebral autoregulation adjusts cerebral perfusion pressure  in response to arterial pressure fluctuations on a beat to beat basis within a relatively short time, ranging from 6 to 12 sec . Impairment of autoregulation is observed after traumatic brain injury  , and it is one of the mechanisms rendering the brain vulnerable to secondary ischemia and leading to fatal outcomes . Reliable assessment of cerebral autoregulation is clinically important for monitoring of patients requiring neurological intensive care .
In addition, activated Ras down regulates an array of anti oncogenic genes that promote apoptosis, cell cycle arrest, DNA repair, and differentiation. Thus, Ras induced transformation involves activation of oncogenic genes as well as silencing of many critical genes that suppress tumorigenesis . This requirement involves an anti apoptotic activity of C/EBPβ linked to expression of insulinlike growth factor I, which functions as an autocrine survival factor in these cells.
Membrane proteins carry out their functions by changing their structures under specific environmental cues. The M2 protein forms a pH gated tetrameric proton channel in the virus envelope that is important for virus replication . The membrane spanning helix of the M2 protein contains the pH sensing , gating , and amantadine binding residues , and is thus the functional core of the protein .
The kidney derives from the intermediate mesoderm  that is a narrow strip of mesodermal cells sandwiched between the paraxial mesoderm and the lateral plate mesoderm. During embryogenesis, three sets of nephric structures  emerge from the nephric cord within the IM in succession from an anterior to posterior direction. The pair of epithelial ducts connecting the mesonephros to the cloaca are called the mesonephric duct or Wolffian duct .
Although men are at greater risk for stroke, older women have a higher risk for stroke than men , more fatal strokes, greater post stroke disability and mental impairment . However, hormone therapy to postmenopausal women significantly increases the risk for stroke , while, paradoxically, low dose oral estrogen based contraceptives does not significantly increase stroke risk in young women . These clinical studies suggest that age and the hormonal milieu interact to modify cerebrovascular disease, however most animal studies have not recapitulated this age dependent estrogen effect.
Allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation  is a curative therapy for hematological malignancies , owing to the graft versus leukemia/lymphoma  effect mediated by alloreactive T cells, but graft versus host disease  mediated by the same alloreactive T cells remains as a major obstacle . It has long been proposed that, in the pathogenesis of acute GVHD, recipient hematopoietic antigen presenting cells  such as dendritic cells play a major role in initiating allogeneic T cell activation and induction of acute GVHD . Critical cellular interactions occur in secondary lymphoid organs such as mesenteric lymph nodes  that function as the meeting ground between host APCs and donor T cells .

In combination with measurements of other MR parameters , evolving tissue status can be assessed over experimental time courses of minutes or hours  . Quantification of CBF using ASL methods is an active area of research .

Among the key classifiers of aggressive glioma subtypes are mitogenic receptor tyrosine kinases , epithelial growth factor receptor  and platelet derived growth factor receptor alpha  . Gliomas are tumors with high cellular complexity.
Cyclooxygenase II  is one of two enzymes that catalyze the rate limiting step in the synthesis of prostaglandins. COX 2 is associated with mammographic density, a significant risk factor for breast cancer . In combination with p16/Rb pathway malfunction, high COX 2 expression predicts progression of pre invasive ductal carcinoma in situ  lesions to invasive ductal carcinoma   .
We report a boy who received two allogeneic stem cell transplantations from umbilical cord donors to treat chronic granulomatous disease . The CGD was cured after the second transplantation, but 2½ years later, he was diagnosed with Duchenne muscular dystrophy  . Examinations of his DNA, muscle tissue, and myoblast cultures derived from muscle tissue were performed to determine whether any donor dystrophin was being expressed .
One way of shaping the auditory system is to use auditory training exercises. Animal studies have shown that auditory processing can be altered with training and such changes have been attributed to a number of processes including: 1) greater numbers of neurons responding in the sensory field, 2) improved neural synchrony , and 3) de correlated activity among neurons, whereby each neuron responds differently in relation to their functional specificity relative to other members of the population  Scalp recorded brain activity  has been used to measure training related changes in humans. In a series of studies, we trained naive listeners to identify two within category pre voiced ‘ba’ sounds differing in voice onset time  .
Substrates, including proteins and organelles, are initially sequestered within double membraned, immature autophagic vesicles that are not acidified and do not contain lysosomal hydrolases. Early studies appreciated that delivery of lysosomal hydrolases occurs via fusion with lysosomes . For example, it has become evident that components of the ESCRT complex machinery are essential to autophagosome maturation, either in the process of autophagosome closure, fusion with target vesicles, or both , .
Cortical bone is a composite material containing approximately 25% water by volume . This water is present in various locations and in different binding states. Specifically, higher pore water fraction is seen in more porous and weaker bone, whereas higher bound water fraction  is seen in stronger bone.
Photodynamic therapy  has been investigated as a postoperative treatment option following surgical tumor resection . PDT with endogenous protoporphyrin IX , a potent photosensitizer induced by 5 aminolevulinic acid , or its derivatives, has been established for routine clinical treatments of several pre malignancies and malignancies. For example, the high ALA tumor selectivity has been exploited for fluorescence guided resection of glial tumors .

Using DNA DNA hybridization,  reported, in broad terms, that based on DNA DNA hybridization data and in contrast to some earlier reports involving morphology as well as mtDNA, galliform birds form two clades one of which include chicken, guinea fowl, Old World quail, and turkey.

Total body irradiation  causes direct loss of hematopoietic cells by inducing the DNA damage response, which results in apoptosis, necrosis or cell senescence . There are currently no pharmaceuticals approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration  to mitigate hematopoietic ARS . With growing concern over the threat of a nuclear disaster leading to a mass casualty scenario, there is an urgent need to develop medical countermeasures that can be administered after exposure to radiation .
According to the 2006 Monitoring the Future National Survey, 6% of 8th graders, 19% of 10th graders and 30% of 12th graders reported being drunk within the past 30 days . An important property of alcohol that contributes to adolescent drinking is its ability to facilitate certain forms of social behavior, particularly interactions with peers . This ethanol induced social facilitation is not restricted to human adolescents.
Ischemic heart disease is the leading cause of death worldwide. At present, the only curative treatment for end stage congestive cardiac failure is cardiac transplantation with its obvious limitations and complications. There is a medical necessity to improve traditional treatments and develop alternatives to current organ transplantation given the worldwide mismatch between patients waiting for transplants and the availability of donor organs as well as infectious and malignant consequences of long term immunosuppression .

The carcinogenicity of PCBs in humans has been examined in several epidemiological studies, and associations have been noted in some studies between PCB exposure and cancers of the liver, biliary tract, and intestines, as well as malignant melanoma . Generally those compounds which are inducers of cytochrome P 450  were more potent as promoters. Although PCBs clearly have promoting activity in the liver, their mechanism of action is not known.

In spite of its significance, the effects of freezing/thawing induced biophysical phenomena on post thaw cell ECM interaction and cellular physiology are not well understood. Thus, preserving the ECM microstructure during freezing/thawing is a key for cryopreservation of functional tissues .
Depression is an often overlooked but pervasive disorder having a lifetime prevalence of 16% among the U.S. population  with women twice as likely to be affected as men . In women, depression has been studied in relation to polycystic ovarian syndrome , in vitro fertilization treatment success , and premenstrual dysphoric disorder . In addition, women with mental disorders, including clinical depression, are more likely to report menstrual cycle disturbances .

This approximation makes model creation difficult because one must decide how many lines of action  to use, where to place the origin, insertion, and path of each compartment, and how to estimate the muscle and tendon parameters  for each compartment .
Our knowledge of the prospective association between two major public health problems of adolescents, depression and the use of addictive substances, remains limited. Externalizing behavior problems, including conduct disorder, attention deficit hyperactivity, and oppositional defiant disorder, have been identified as strong predisposing risk factors for later substance use , but the role of internalizing disorders, namely depression and anxiety disorders, is less studied. Other hypotheses, e.g., depression enhances genetic predispositions for smoking, emphasize the importance of early onset depression in developmental trajectories of substance use  .
Pelvic floor muscles  in women, which support the pelvic organs, include the levator ani and the coccygeus muscles, but do not include the external urethral sphincter  or the external anal sphincter. The PFM in female rats has a similar bowl shaped anatomic organization as humans with some exceptions, such as lack of a recognized puborectalis muscle. , There are conflicting opinions regarding levator ani and pudendal nerve innervation of the PFM.
Atherosclerosis contributes to nearly one half of the mortality in the western world and is growing in epidemic proportions in rapidly developing countries in Asia. While several therapeutic modalities including cholesterol synthesis inhibitors , cholesterol absorption inhibitor , blood pressure lowering drugs, platelet adhesion inhibitors and many more are either prescribed alone and/or in combination, there is a need for novel approaches to mitigate the initiation and progression of atherosclerosis. However, these therapeutic modalities do not decrease atherosclerotic plaque burden.
RNA molecules are extremely versatile functional biopolymers that participate in key informational pathways that characterize living organisms on Earth. Far from being simply coding for proteins as mRNA, a plethora of non coding RNAs are actively contributing to proteins translation as ribosomal RNAs and transfer RNAs, and various catalytic and regulatory functions as ribozymes, riboswitches and regulatory elements. The remarkable functions of RNA stem from the ability of RNA to fold and assemble into exquisite modular and hierarchical three dimensional  shapes that, in a cell, are only surpassed by proteins.
In hepatocytes, generation of reactive oxygen species , including H2O2, O2• , and OH•, contributes to lethal cell injury from oxidative stress, various hepatotoxicants and ischemia/reperfusion . In particular, ROS formation initiates onset of the mitochondrial permeability transition  caused by opening of non specific permeability transition  pores in the mitochondrial inner membrane . These events lead either to necrosis from ATP depletion or apoptosis from release of proapoptotic proteins such as cytochrome c .

Most of these studies, however, lack a critical comparison of the extent to which craniofacial variation is influenced by brain variation. Comparative analyses of extant species can help to identify aspects of brain organization that were present before the divergence of the hominin panin lineages and those that have diverged across panin and hominin evolution, supplementing information that can be gleaned from endocranial evolution .
Studies on both animals  and humans  have suggested a role for pathogens in the etiology of atherosclerosis, including cytomegalovirus , herpes simplex virus , hepatitis A virus , Helicobacter pylori , and particularly Chlamydia pneumoniae . The observation that periodontitis is related to atherosclerosis  further supports an infectious etiology. In addition to individual pathogens, pathogen burden  has been also found in association with atherosclerosis  .
Almost half of all deaths due to childhood pneumonia occur in sub Saharan African . World Health Organization  recommendations for case management of pneumonia in children aged 2  59 months have been credited with contributing to substantial reductions in mortality . For over two decades, these guidelines have recommended classification into four classes of severity based on clinical signs at initial presentation with inpatient management reserved for the severe categories   .
Stroke patients with higher density of cerebral blood vessels fare better and survive longer than those with lower vascular density . Adult bone marrow stromal cells  selectively target the injury site, participate in arteriogenesis and angiogenesis, and induce a neovascular response resulting in a significant increase in blood flow to the ischemic area which aids in repair of injured brain . Thus, strategies which promote BMSC migration into the ischemic brain may augment the BMSC regenerative treatment of stroke.
Not surprisingly, microbial dysbiosis is associated with numerous intestinal disorders including inflammatory bowel diseases  and colorectal cancer . Subsequent experiments using preclinical models of CRC have confirmed the carcinogenetic potential of both Fusobacterium and Enterobacteriaceae/E. coli .
HDACs are a family of enzymes that were initially characterized as histone deacetylases . Accordingly, HDACs have been extensively and almost exclusively studied for their roles in transcriptional regulation and chromatin remodeling. To date, it is not known which of the HDAC family members are the critical targets that underlie the anti tumor activity of HDAC inhibitors.
B cell commitment, survival, and immunoglobulin assembly are all products of a carefully orchestrated network of transcription factors guiding gene expression. The transcription factors E2A, EBF and Pax5 are each required for the transition from CLPs to the pro B cell stage. With respect to the transcriptional hierarchy, E2A regulates expression of EBF and Pax5, as ectopic expression of EBF can rescue B cell specific gene expression in E2A deficient cells.
Individuals with exceptionally precise motor control, such as champion dart players and microsurgeons, have very low tremor; drugs which artificially reduce tremor are banned in many sports. Although many factors contribute to tremorigenesis, an important component comes from neural oscillators rhythmically active at ~10Hz  . During a sustained contraction, primary motor cortex  shows oscillations at both ~10 Hz and ~20 Hz .
Inhibition of AR function is standard therapy for the initial presentation of disseminated prostate cancer . Unfortunately, the clinical benefit of these new therapies is not durable . These observations further emphasize the importance of AR signaling in PCa development and progression.
Chemokines are 812 kDa sized secreted proteins that mediate the directed migration  of leukocytes. The chemokine family encompasses nearly fifty members, which are classified based on the relative position of their conserved N terminal cysteine residues . Upon ligand binding, chemokine receptors activate G proteins of the Gαi family, leading to inhibition of adenylyl cyclases and mobilization of Ca2+ from intracellular stores.
It has been also proposed that the respiratory network within the BOT/pre BOT is a crucial part of the central pattern generation neuronal network for cough reflex  . During cough, the activation of E dec units promotes the termination of the cough I period. This activity also slightly postpones the activation of a subset of E aug neurons in the BOT known as E aug early, due to a temporal shift of their activity patterns during cough.
Measures of arterial pulse pressure  variation and left ventricular  stroke volume  variation induced by positive pressure breathing vary in proportion to preload responsiveness. However, the accuracy of commercially available devices to report dynamic LV SV variation has never been validated . We compared the accuracy of measured arterial PP and estimated LV SV reported from two FDA approved aortic flow monitoring devices, one using arterial pulse power  and the other esophageal Doppler monitor  .
Pediatric stroke may occur in as many as 1 in 4000 births  and complications due to hypoxia/ischemia are common . The thrombolytic agent tissue type plasminogen activator  remains the only approved treatment for acute stroke , but its use in children has been limited and its benefit remains unclear . Patients often remain hospitalized after an initial ischemic event because of the risk of recurrent cerebrovascular thrombosis, indicating a clear unmet need for safer and more effective treatment and thromboprophylaxis .
Bone marrow derived mesenchymal stromal cells  have been widely investigated for their therapeutic potential in both autoimmune and alloimmune diseases . Murine BMSC, which clearly have an ability to modulate immune responses during experimental inflammatory conditions, may operate by several proposed mechanisms . By comparison the successful clinical translation of BMSC therapy is still in question  and the mechanism of action remains largely unknown , representing an obstacle to further clinical applications of BMSC .
In the mammalian forebrain, most excitatory synapses are located on dendritic spines, small protrusions of dendrites. Spine morphology modulates synaptic properties and the ability to undergo plasticity, . Spine enlargement parallels various forms of potentiation, including long term potentiation , whereas long term depression  seems associated with spine shrinkage.
Ideally, family implies a functional group living situation in which opportunities exist for economic and instrumental cooperation, informal communications, and reciprocated social and emotional obligations among family members . Family interaction and living provides the context for physical maintenance, familial affection, and social control of family members. Often, family involves the rearing of and caring for children.
The generation and photoentrainment of mammalian circadian rhythms is mediated by a hierarchical timekeeping system consisting of a master pacemaker located in the suprachiasmatic nuclei  of the anterior hypothalamus and local oscillators in most peripheral tissues and cells throughout the body. Evidence for their autoregulatory interactions and function in the clock mechanism is based on the observations that disruption or knockout of these PAS genes alters the regulation of other core components in the molecular feedback loops and abolishes circadian behavior . The circadian timekeeping system has a notable impact on biochemical and physiological processes associated with the metabolism of ingested xenobiotics such as drugs and environmental contaminants.
Few studies have analyzed the cohort effects of lifecourse socioeconomicposition  on racial disparities in body mass index  trajectories. We assessedthe contribution of lifecourse SEP on racial differences in BMI trajectories among twodifferent age cohorts of women . Four waves of the Americans' Changing Lives' study  were usedto compute BMI trajectories for 2194 Black and White women.
Protein isoforms can differ in their biological activity, regulatory properties, temporal and spatial expression and intracellular location . Protein isoforms harbor variations in the amino acid sequence and can originate from separate genes that have evolved from a single ancestor gene generated by gene duplication or from a single gene by alternative splicing. The myofilament proteins, arranged to form the sarcomere of a myofibril, are the main regulators in striated muscle  contractility.
At present, it is unclear why physically identical information sometimes does and sometimes does not reach awareness. For example, T2 detection has been found to benefit from a diffusion of attention . Although initially the practitioner frequently “clings” to objects in a way that takes up resources available to process information related to current experience, eventually, a trait is thought to emerge such that one can sustain the “non clinging” state in which one is attentive to the content of experience from moment to moment.
TiO2 nanoparticles  are a promising vehicle for the delivery of therapeutic and diagnostic agents. The unique surface chemistry of particles smaller than 20 nm allows for the conjugation of drugs, imaging contrast agents, and fluorescent dyes to create biologically active nanoconjugates ., , ,  Moreover, the semiconductor and photocatalytic properties of TiO2 make it a potent source of electrons and electropositive holes as well as reactive oxygen species —all of which can react with cellular DNA., , ,  However, in order for NCs to be useful cytotoxic agents they must first be internalized and retained by cells. Furthermore, the subcellular localization of NCs is another important factor in determining their biological function.,  Therefore, the ability to control the uptake of NCs and target them towards specific cells and subcellular compartments would be very useful.
Animals need to process a variety of temperature stimuli appropriately to exhibit a proper behavioral response. However, it is unclear how a range of temperature information is processed and integrated into neural circuits. Drosophila exhibit a robust thermosensory response .
The early down regulation of CB1  was first observed in post mortem tissue of HD patients and occurs in most mouse models of HD, including R6/2, R6/1, YAC128 and HdhQ150 mice . It was recently reported that mutant huntingtin acts at the Cnr1 promoter and inhibits CB1 expression in neurons . Down regulation of CB1   the neuronal population expressing the highest amount of CB1 receptors   precedes the loss of other synaptic proteins, including dopamine D2 and D1 receptors and striatal synaptophysin .
Photoreceptor cells are the sensory neurons in eye that absorb light to initiate vision. Since these cells are post mitotic, loss of photoreceptors results in permanent blindness. This has been clearly demonstrated in models where exposure to subtoxic levels of stress  induced changes in retinal tissue that protect photoreceptors from a subsequent dose of lethal stress  .
The pharmacokinetics of mycophenolic acid , the pharmacologically active component of mycophenolate mofetil  are well described in transplant recipients and population pharmacokinetic models are reported. After oral intake, MMF is rapidly and completely absorbed, hydrolyzed into the active MPA, which is 98% bound to plasma proteins, including albumin. MPA is primarily metabolized by glucuronidation to form the 7 O glucuronide conjugate  which then undergoes elimination via the kidneys or enterohepatic recirculation back to MPA in the gastrointestinal tract.
The size and asymmetry of neurons result in a non uniform distribution of demand for mitochondrial functions such as ATP synthesis and calcium homeostasis. As a result, neurons redistribute their mitochondria in response to immediate and local physiological conditions, both in vivo and in vitro . Mitochondria are concentrated in areas of the neuron expected to have higher ATP consumption; indeed, synapses were first recognized ultrastructurally based in part on their high density of mitochondria .
They are particularly important in cardiac cells where they underlie IK1, the cardiac inwardly rectifying potassium conductance, and play a crucial role in shaping the action potential. Kir2.2 knockout mice show a 50% reduction in IK1, supporting the idea that heteromers of Kir2 channels comprise native IK1  . Reductions in Kir2.1 have been linked to hypertrophy , while gain of function mutations are associated with atrial fibrillation  and short QT Syndrome .
In the United States depression affects up to 2.5 percent of children and 8.3 percent of adolescents . The selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor  fluoxetine  is approved by the Food and Drug Administration for child and adolescent depression . SSRIs are also used in anxiety and conduct disorders such as separation anxiety and aggression in these populations.
Hepcidin, a hormone peptide, has been recognized as a potential biomarker for iron related disease. Pathological excess or deficiency of hepcidin could lead to a variety of iron disorders and be used as a diagnostic tool in clinic. However, the fact that hepcidin levels in circulation are elevated in ACD, but lowered in IDA, can aid in a more accurate diagnosis.
Discovery of antibodies to citrullinated protein antigens  has improved our understanding of the seropositive subset of rheumatoid arthritis . ACPAs and rheumatoid factor  are present in serum of RA patients years before clinical diagnosis of RA. Testing for RF and anti CCP simultaneously can improve sensitivity by ~47%, while maintaining high specificity .
Pain present 6 months following root canal treatment  may be either of odontogenic or nonodontogenic origin. This is importance because treatments and prognoses are different; therefore the aim of this study was to provide specific diagnoses of patients reporting pain 6 months after receiving initial orthograde RCT . We enrolled patients from the Midwest region of an existing prospective observational study of pain after RCT.
The loss of skeletal muscle mass and alterations in contractile function known as sarcopenia is a common, though poorly understood phenomena of aging . Although the origins of sarcopenia are yet unknown, oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction are believed to play a role . Recent evidence in sarcopenic gastrocnemius muscle of young and old rats revealed increased proteolysis, reactive oxygen species  overproduction and vulnerability to apoptosis .
Bioluminescence is a naturally occurring phenomenon in certain species such as the firefly resulting from oxidation of luciferin to oxyluciferin in the presence of molecular oxygen and adenosine triphosphate. This reaction is catalyzed by the enzyme luciferase and results in the emission of light . This is an extremely valuable experimental tool in cancer biology ; non invasive whole body BLI allows repeated, real time, in vivo monitoring of tumors in experimental animal models, regardless of tumor location .
Mechanical loading of cartilage explants can regulate chondrocyte metabolism and direct growth and remodeling . This technique of shaping cartilaginous tissues may have applications towards creating grafts of specific shapes for joint repair or craniofacial reconstruction and towards understanding the effects of physical forces on the developing morphologies of cartilage structures . Flexure is a physiologically relevant mode of deformation for many types of cartilage including those located within the nose, ears, and ribs.
Obesity is a significant public health problem, and the impact of caring for increasing numbers of obese individuals is being felt worldwide and across medical disciplines. Both animal and human studies have demonstrated that obesity is associated with adverse health consequences, including susceptibility to a diverse group of diseases affecting the cardiovascular, pulmonary, renal, and endocrine systems . A growing body of literature has been devoted to examination of the pathophysiologic mechanisms that link obesity to these maladies, with a general consensus that chronic inflammation provides the connection  .
Recent structural analysis revealed that human IDE consists of two roughly equally sized N  and C terminal domains . Outside of insulin and Aβ, several short peptides with molecular weights of 310 kDa have been shown to serve as substrates of IDE, such as insulin like growth factor II ; , amylin, glucagon, transforming growth factor α , and atrial natriuretic peptide  . The unique size of this chamber allows the enzyme to preferentially cleave peptides smaller than 80 amino acids long.
Human transplant recipients harbor significant numbers of alloreactive memory T cells generated by previous encounter to alloantigens, via heterologous immunity or homeostatic proliferation as a result of lymphoablation . Immunologic memory is thought to be one of the major barriers that preclude the induction of antigen specific tolerance in clinical transplantation . Donor reactive memory T cells can precipitate costimulatory blockade resistant allograft rejection .
One theory is that Myc’s wide range of functions is linked to its widespread euchromatic function associated with specific histone modifications such as acetylation of lysine 9 and methylation of lysine 4 of histone H3  . There is growing evidence of key roles for myc genes at endogenous levels in both somatic stem cells such as NSC and ESC. Conditional disruption of N myc in NSC severely disrupts murine brain growth, particularly that of the cerebellum, while a similar KO of c myc moderately impairs growth .
Higher arterial stiffness and pressure pulsatility, hallmarks of aging, are associated with increased risk for cardiovascular disease  morbidity, including incident hypertension. Carotid femoral pulse wave velocity , the current reference standard measure of global aortic stiffness, is associated with CVD events including coronary heart disease, stroke, and CVD mortality. Arterial calcification, in turn, is also associated with CVD events and mortality, whether assessed in the coronary arteries ,,  thoracic aorta ,,  or abdominal aorta .

Rapamycin is a macrolide fungicide that inhibits mTOR signaling by binding to FK506 binding protein 12 . These findings have prompted further studies of the mechanism behind the growth inhibitory effects of rapamycin with the goal of developing effective rational combinatorial therapies .

A different approach is to constrain genetic analysis to candidate genetic factors that are known to alter processing in brain regions critical for the cognitive process of interest . In the domain of reward based decisions, considerable evidence implicates a critical role for dopaminergic processes within reinforcement learning systems of the basal ganglia .
In the U.S. and Europe, approximately 1033% of all HIV infected individuals are coinfected with HCV. ; It is estimated that at least 2030% of all HCV infected persons develop cirrhosis within 2 to 3 decades, of whom 1 to 4% develop hepatocellular carcinoma  per year. The effect of combination antiretroviral therapy  and immune status, including nadir CD4 count, last known CD4 count, and cumulative time with undetectable HIV viral load on HCC risk may play a role in cancer development, although it has not been thoroughly examined.
For example, enhanced memory has been shown when estrogens are given by chronic , sub chronic , or acute  treatment regimens to ovariectomized  rats in a variety of tasks, such as the delayed matching to position  T maze, Morris water maze, eight arm radial maze, object recognition, trace eyeblink conditioning and inhibitory avoidance tasks . Effects of estrogens are mediated through receptors , and for almost fifty years, it was thought that this receptor was a single ligand dependent transcription factor acting in the nucleus to enhance nuclear transcription . In addition, more recent results support nongenomic steroid actions initiated at the level of the cell membrane through ERs spanning the plasma membrane that mediate effects on pathways linked to G protein and tyrosine kinase pathways .
Cardiovascular disease, including coronary artery and peripheral vascular disease, is the leading cause of mortality in the United States and accounted for over 30% deaths in 2004. , However, this approach requires multiple surgical procedures and is often limited by the amount of adequate autologous vessels available. These techniques include culturing vascular cells on a collagen matrix, other biodegradable scaffolds, or without exogenous scaffold. Recently, an alternative tissue engineering approach involving the decellularization of native tissues has shown success in a variety of applications.
Glioblastoma  is the most common malignant primary brain tumor in adults. Once the diagnosis of GBM has been made, the overall median survival time for patients treated with surgery, radiation and chemotherapy is only 14 to 15 months . An intriguing molecular target for GBM therapy is casein kinase 2 , which is a highly ubiquitous and conserved protein serine/threonine kinase composed of two catalytic subunits  and two regulatory subunits  .
Protein isoforms coded by alternatively spliced pre mRNAs expand the functional repertoire of genes. Mutations in the fragile X mental retardation gene  result in fragile X syndrome, a leading form of heritable mental retardation. Human FMRP may exist in at least 20 isoforms that arise from alternative splicing , but the contributions of FMRP isoforms to neural plasticity are largely unknown .
Myocardial perfusion imaging  with radiotracers is a well established noninvasive method of assessing the coronary blood flow. 99mTc has a 6.02 h half life with the single photon energy of 140 keV. The combination of its nuclear properties and diverse coordination chemistry makes 99mTc the ideal isotope to develop new perfusion imaging agents.
L selectin is a type 1 transmembrane adhesion protein expressed by leukocytes. L selectin cleavage occurs by cis protease activity and is abrogated by hydroxymate inhibitors of zinc dependent metalloproteases . ADAM17's substrates are shed with varied efficiency and at dissimilar rates, suggesting differential regulation of the proteolytic process.
Human plasma high density lipoprotein  particles have been classically defined as a group of pseudomicellar, quasispherical protein/lipid complexes with hydrated densities in the range of 1.063 to 1.210 g/ml. Apolipoprotein A I  is the most common protein constituent, accounting for approximately 70% of HDL protein mass, with apoA II comprising 15 20%. The remaining 10 15% of protein mass is composed of minor amphipathic proteins, including apoC’s, apoE, apoD, apoM and apoA IV, with enzymes and lipid transfer proteins such as lecithin:cholesterol acyl transferase  and cholesteryl ester transfer protein .
Lynch Syndrome, also called hereditary non polyposis colon cancer , is an autosomal dominant inherited cancer predisposition syndrome characterized by predisposition to develop a number of cancers at an early age and high penetrance with mutation carriers having a significantly increased lifetime risk of developing colorectal  and other forms of cancer . The range of mutations identified in MSH2 and MLH1 includes missense, nonsense, frameshift, splice site mutations and deletion mutations as well as the more recently appreciated rare epimutations . In addition, there are apparently polymorphisms in MMR genes that may cause increased risk of developing cancer .
While interferon  plays crucial roles in the defense against viral infection, excessive production may lead to pathogenesis of autoimmune diseases . The function of the Z DNA binding domain is not well understood but possibly binds to particular Z DNA structures during gene transcription . Both isoforms of ADAR1 convert adenosine to inosine on its double strand RNA substrates, potentially changing the coding information on mRNAs .
For WHO grades II and III diffuse gliomas classification is based on morphologic determination of cell type . Additional factors, such as microvascular proliferation and tumor necrosis play a role in the grading of oligodendroglial and oligoastrocytic tumors . Regarding proliferative activity in diffuse glioma, there is flexibility in the interpretation of the proposed WHO grading criteria, without strict criteria for delineation of mitotic figure cut offs to distinguish grade II from grade III tumors.
Embryonic stem cells harbor a consistent capacity for multi lineage differentiation . Stem cell based cardiopoiesis originates from undifferentiated progenitors that are specified into early cardiac mesoderm . Yet, the risk of unregulated growth and neoplastic transformation, inherent to pluripotency, limits therapeutic applications .
Maternal psychosocial stress has been associated with adverse maternal child outcomes. Vulnerable women’s experiences with stressors during pregnancy and their desires and priorities for appropriate and useful stress reduction interventions for pregnant women are not well understood . Qualitative interviews with low income, urban women explored their stress exposures and reactions during pregnancy, ways that stressors overlapped and interacted, and their priorities for stress reduction.
Alcohol abuse is a leading cause of preventable death and illness, and the economic cost of alcohol abuse is estimated to be $185 billion annually in the USA alone. Adoption and twin studies suggest that alcohol use disorders  are 50 60% genetically determined,. Thus, low cerebellar sensitivity to EtOH may be a risk factor for AUDs.
Aging increases the latency of eye movement onset and decreases peak velocity, acceleration and range of eye movement . We and others have shown that apoptosis is involved in sarcopenia . The increase in apoptosis with skeletal muscle aging has been postulated to result from changes in mitochondrial function .
Attention and emotion impart a value system to sensory processing, allowing the central nervous system to mold sensory experience into a subjective landscape . Imaging studies of attentional pain modulation commonly show that decreased pain during distraction is paralleled by decreased activity in thalamo cortical ascending pain pathways . Such areas include thalamus, primary and secondary somatosensory cortices , insular cortex , and anterior cingulate cortex  .

Previous research identified a recessive missense mutation in the TPI gene in Drosophila named sugarkill that exhibits progressive locomotor impairment, neurodegeneration and reduced longevity. In humans, inheritance of TPI deficiency is recessive and caused by several specific missense mutations.
In our recent paper describing the heating of human skin by mm waves we used a homogeneous skin model . The Pennes bioheat transfer equation  , frequently used in thermal modeling, fitted well to the experimental data obtained in the forearm with low blood flow rates. In the homogeneous model, the skin is considered to be a tissue with uniform physical and thermo physical properties and with uniform blood flow over the entire tissue volume.
The transition between wakefulness, NREM, and REM sleep is accompanied by neuromodulatory changes. Accompanying these changes in neuronal activity are variations in energy metabolism. In waking and REM sleep overall brain metabolism is high in both animals and humans .
MicroRNAs , a class of small noncoding RNAs, serve as key post transcriptional regulators of gene expression and mRNA translation , . miRNAs are increasingly recognized as mediators in a variety of biological processes including cardiovascular development and disorders , . Highly specific miRNA expression patterns have been reported in association with heart failure , , myocardial infarction , and cancer .
The majority of yeast display antibody libraries that have been constructed to date utilize the single chain variable fragment  format, and there are only three examples in the literature of combinatorial antigen binding fragment  yeast display libraries. Because both scFv and Fab libraries have unique advantages and disadvantages, there is controversy over which format is better suited for antibody display. ScFvs are generally less stable and more prone to aggregation than Fab fragments,, and due to their decreased stability, scFvs generally bind with lower affinity than Fabs.
Inhibition studies are routinely performed to gain insight into the structure and function of transporters, particularly when a transporter crystal structure is not available. Hence, inhibition studies can benefit from elucidating the type of inhibition by which various compounds inhibit. These conclusions suggested that enalapril and glycylsarcosine bind at the same binding site, whereas quinapril binds at a different binding site than glycylsarcosine.
Mesial temporal lobe epilepsy  is the most common type of epilepsy in adults , and frequently becomes resistant to drug therapy, leaving ultimately only a neurosurgery option to control seizures. TLE develops following a variety of insults, including brain injury and status epilepticus . The TLE in rats that arises several weeks after a lithium pilocarpine induced SE reproduces most clinical and neuropathological features of human TLE, and presents a very useful animal model of the disease .
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention  has prioritized interventions to reduce sexual risk taking among HIV positive persons . Disclosure of HIV positive status to sexual partners may reduce risk of transmission in serodiscordant partnerships . Elucidating the relationship between disclosure and risk remains a critical health priority .
PTEN , the tumor suppressor gene located at 10q23.3, is known to participate in the pathogenesis of a wide variety of hereditary cancer syndromes and sporadic malignancies . Germline mutations in PTEN have been described in hamartoma syndromes, including Cowden syndrome , BannayanRileyRuvalcaba syndrome , Proteus syndrome , and a Proteus like syndrome . In cutaneous melanoma, PTEN is the second most frequently altered tumor suppressor , whereas in cultured melanoma cell lines, the frequency of intragenic mutations and homozygous deletions is 60% .
The estimated number of new ovarian cancer cases in 2008 in the U.S. was 21,650 with an estimated 15,520 deaths . Paclitaxel resistance develops leading to treatment failure and death. Proteins that affect apoptosis, growth factor and cytokine signaling, and cell cycle behavior also have been implicated in drug resistance.
Obesity or accumulated adiposity is an important etiological factor in the clustering of clinical conditions that comprise the metabolic syndrome  . Having the MetS in turn, predisposes individuals for more serious chronic clinical outcomes, such as cardiovascular disease , type 2 diabetes, and possibly some cancers  . Although, high precision imaging techniques, including computed tomography  or dual energy x ray absorptiometry  imaging, are considered to be the gold standard for measuring fat distribution, their clinical value is often undermined by the cost and time burden associated with CT or DXA.
Although the classical teaching has been one of a chronic inflammatory demyelinating disease marked by multi focal white matter lesions, multiple sclerosis  is being increasingly recognized as a disease of the central nervous system  characterized by widespread demyelination, axonal loss and gliosis, and neurodegeneration . In line with these diffuse histopathological changes, prior study, such as through PET examination, has revealed decreased oxygen utilization and extraction, with extensive reduction in cerebral glucose metabolism in MS patients . As tissue damage in MS has been shown to invariably extend beyond the focal plaque, modern MRI techniques are being developed to allow for the qualitative and quantitative demonstration of the global, diffuse nature of neuropathological changes in order to closely monitor disease severity, progression, and response to therapy .
Airway secretions contain a broad spectrum of endogenous antimicrobial factors  which contribute to the inherent host defense of the respiratory tract. AMPs encompass both cathelicidins and defensins. Cathelicidins exhibit broad spectrum antimicrobial activity against gram positive, gram negative, and fungal organisms in addition to mediating a complex array of immunomodulatory responses.
Cataract is an opaqueness of the lens that causes decreased visual acuity . Cataract becomes more common with increasing age and is one of the leading causes of blindness and visual impairment among the elderly population throughout the less developed world . Thus, identification of factors that could delay or prevent cataract development would be important both for increasing the well being of older adults and for reducing medical care costs.
Because of their fundamental importance, crystallographic studies of DNA fragments have been pursued for over two decades. , Two key features are variation of the width of the minor groove and bending of the DNA double helix. Such conformational variations contribute to sequence specific recognition of DNA by proteins.
Among term infants, hypoxicischemic encephalopathy  due to acute perinatal asphyxia is an important cause of neurological morbidity and mortality. An early and reliable diagnostic test is essential to guide and monitor treatment. MRI has proven to be the most reliable imaging modality to evaluate the extent, quality and degree of brain injury.
The latter use derives from the observation that PSA is expressed on the neural cell adhesion molecule  in a developmentally regulated manner  and plays a key role in the modulation of NCAM mediated adhesion . PSA has also been implicated in the process of metastasis of small cell and non small cell lung carcinoma . In contrast, there is little knowledge of the structure and function of endosialidases.
Parkinson’s disease  is a neurodegenerative disorder where there is a loss of dopamine  neurons of the substantia nigra . In addition to deficits of motor performance such as bradykinesia, or slowness in the initiation, execution and termination of movements or generating movements of smaller amplitude than desired , patients with PD often display cognitive motor deficits such as abnormal movement sequences . However, if there is impairment in planning, actions are heavily dependent on feedback control.
The incidence of type 1 diabetes is on the rise , particularly in children ages 5 and younger . The demands of caring for a young child with type 1 diabetes can feel relentless and constant vigilance is required . Exploration of sleep in relation to diabetes management is a relatively new area of study .

The mildest phenotype is HGprt related hyperuricemia  and includes overproduction of uric acid leading to hyperuricemia, nephrolithiasis, and gout . The motor impairments are dominated by dystonia, but are sometimes accompanied by choreoathetosis or spasticity .
Female sexual dysfunction is a multicausal and multidimensional problem that combines sexual, physiological, physical, psychological, and interpersonal determinants, having a major impact on interpersonal relationships and quality of life. ,, Community based studies indicate a prevalence of sexual dysfunction among all women between 25% and 63%, ,, while the prevalence of sexual dysfunction in post menopausal women varies from 68% to 87%. The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders  describes dyspareunia as recurrent or persistent vaginal pain associated with sexual intercourse in either a male or a female.

Epidemiological evidence on the association between red and processed meat and lung cancer has been suggestive, yet limited, inconsistent, and mainly based on retrospective data. High temperature cooking of meat results in the formation of heterocyclic amines , , and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons , which are also present in cured and smoked foods. N nitroso compounds , another group of known carcinogens, are found in preserved meat and are endogenously produced when red meat is consumed, .
Executive functioning is hypothesized to be closer to discrete avenues of gene expression than the more complex behavioral traits it indexes, as it refers to discrete cognitive skills that neuroimaging and lesion literatures have associated with specific brain circuits. In addition to attention deficit hyperactivity disorder , EF has been identified as an etiologically important intermediary component in literatures on conduct problems and antisocial behavior , substance use disorders and alcoholism , and personality disorder  . In a study involving 52 sibling pairs with ADHD, significant correlations were found between many of the measures of response inhibition and attentional control .
Organophosphorus  compounds inhibit serine esterases by organophosphylation of the active site serine . Although there are many causes of peripheral neuropathy , including chronological aging and diabetes , OPIDN is a specific chemically induced disorder that involves a combination of peripheral neuropathy and axonopathy in spinal cord tracts . However, when an OP compound is neuropathic, cholinergic toxicity will be mild, and sufficient NTE can be inhibited and aged to initiate OPIDN.

The C/EBPβ LIP protein that completely lacks this N terminal end can function as an inhibitor of both C/EBPβ LAP*  and C/EBPβ LAP mediated gene regulation . Several reports indicate a critical role for C/EBPβ mediated transcriptional control during osteogenesis.
Despite initial optimism, application of regenerative medicine in the myocardium has been stymied by the marginal regenerative potential of adoptively transferred stem cell populations. Thus, benefits observed are likely mediated by a small population of surviving cells, leading to the postulate: improving cardiac progenitor cell  survival and proliferation will have dramatic consequences for enhancing myogenesis and empower therapeutically relevant implementation of myocardial regeneration . CPCs have been isolated and used with modest success for treatment and regeneration of damaged heart tissue after infarction,  .
Of the Angiotensin  receptors, the AT1 receptor is known to mediate most of the Ang II actions, including vasoconstriction, antinatriuresis, aldosterone secretion, increased sympathetic outflow and cellular growth/proliferation. However, the AT2 receptor has been implicated in cardiovascular functions such as vasodilatation, depressor effect on blood pressure or cardio protection. The AT2 receptor null mouse develops hypertension associated with an inhibition in pressure natriuresis.
Children who are overweight are more likely to become overweight adults . Obesity is the result of an imbalance between the energy consumed and the energy expended . Dietary behaviors that have been positively associated with increased body mass among children include energy intake , percent energy from fat  and energy density  while fruit and vegetable intake has been negatively associated .

Since bone mass is lost throughout adult life as part of the aging process, a major risk factor for the development of osteoporosis is the failure to obtain a normal peak bone mass during early adulthood . Multiple studies have shown that alcohol abuse is an important risk factor for osteopenia . During the M to G1 transition, preRCs are assembled, which entails the assembly of an ORI that is composed of ORC16 at many sites in the genome. Recruitment of MCM is termed replication licensing because the origin recognition complex  is now capable of supporting DNA replication. The ability to initiate DNA replication is acquired during oocyte maturation around MI and requires protein synthesis, but DNA replication does not occur until following fertilization or egg activation .
The CSCs are believed to encompass a rare subtype of highly tumorigenic cells that possess self renewal capacity and promote malignant progression . For these reasons CSCs are of great translational importance with a variety of therapeutic implications. Despite some obvious limitations, these approaches improved our understanding of liver CSC biology, and allowed a reproducible characterization of the CSCs and exploration of the molecular drivers promoting CSC unique oncogenic properties .
Since the beginning of the South African epidemic, an estimated 2 million adults have died from HIV/AIDS,, 6.1 million South Africans are currently living with HIV, the prevalence in the 1549 year age range is 17.9%, and the incidence is 1.43% per year among those aged 1549. South Africa’s HIV Testing and Counselling campaign and rollout of antiretroviral therapy  are well established. More South Africans are learning their HIV status and entering clinical care, presenting a unique opportunity to link HIV treatment with HIV prevention behavioral interventions for persons living with HIV  on ART.
Designing and engineering polypeptides that have specific structures or functions in biological membranes remains one of the more intractable problems in bioengineering. Instead they depend on interfacial activity, which is defined here as the ability of a molecule to partition into in the membrane water interface and to alter or strain the packing and organization of the lipids. For antimicrobial peptides, this hypothesis explains why compelling structure activity relationships are so difficult to find.

Because adult S. pulcher feed heavily on urchins, they are an important species for indirectly regulating kelp growth in southern California’s coastal waters . The lack of understanding of the basic mechanisms of HIV 1 transmission and dissemination in the female lower genital tract is a limitation to developing efficient protection measures as evidenced from the recent controversial results on the efficacy of vaginal microbicides ,  . In order to reach its primary cell targets in the female lower genital tract, i.e. CD4+ T lymphocytes, dendritic cells  and sub epithelial macrophages , the virus must circumvent mucosal barriers . The nature of these barriers is both physical  and biological, including secreted factors endowed with anti HIV activity such as CCR5 binding chemokines, secretory leukocyte peptidase inhibitor  and β defensins .

Adolescents account for 50% of new HIV infections worldwide, and fewer than 50% of this age group are able to identify ways of preventing HIV transmission . Kaposi’s sarcoma  is a multifocal angioproliferative inflammatory condition well described in its classical, post transplantation and African endemic forms before the advent of the epidemic of HIV 1/AIDS. Histologically, KS evolves from a small patch of new blood vessels to a vascular tumor, with a sparse inflammatory infiltrate to nodular lesions with proliferating spindle cells. The balance of signaling by such opposing influences will determine the proliferative state of the VSMC under different physiological and pathophysiological conditions .

Accordingly, PIN is frequently an isolated finding, occurring in biopsies without invasive carcinoma and, if not present in at least 23 separate biopsy cores, is not associated with an increased risk of cancer diagnosis on subsequent biopsies done within the following year . In stark contrast, intraductal carcinoma is associated with underlying high grade invasive carcinoma in more than 90% of cases .

There is some biologic evidence that antidepressants are related to cancer risk. Certain antidepressants promote mammary tumor growth in mouse models. Further, administration of antidepressants has been associated with acute increases in prolactin levels in woman, and higher serum prolactin levels have been associated with increased breast cancer risk.

Brain tumors are collectively the leading cause of childhood cancer related mortality. High grade gliomas have a particularly poor prognosis, with a long term survival rate of less than 20%, despite conventional surgical, radio therapeutic, and chemotherapeutic interventions . Although these tumors are comparable morphologically to malignant gliomas that arise in adults, childhood gliomas have a number of distinctive molecular characteristics, which suggests the involvement of somewhat different pathways of tumorigenesis.

Additional supporting evidence comes from mathematical models , voltage activated Ca channel  current measurements in nerve terminals , and cleft  measurements with fluorescence probes  . Thus, a physiological decrease in o following exocytosis should impair subsequent transmitter release.
Intestinal macrophages, which are continuously exposed to commensal bacteria in the intestinal tract, express low levels of TLRs and other activating receptors, but exhibit high phagocytic efficacy . Macrophages display protective and detrimental functions in patients with inflammatory bowel disease , including ulcerative colitis and Crohn’s disease, and in animal models of colitis . Innate immunity plays an important role in the onset and severity of IBD .
