Antigen mediated CD8 T cell responses undergo various phases, starting with activation, followed by extensive proliferation and subsequent differentiation to effector cells capable of killing  and/or secreting lymphokines capable of inhibiting tumor growth. Another important phase of typical CD8 T cell responses involves the contraction phase, which not only shuts down the response when it is no longer needed but also allows to generate and maintain a small pool of memory cells that could help provide long term protection against tumor recurrences . The mammalian target of rapamycin , a serine threonine protein kinase related tightly to the family of the phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase related kinases, exerts different biological functions primarily through forming two complexes with the essential partner protein raptor  and rictor  . The conventional mTOR inhibitors, rapamycin and its analogues , are specific allosteric inhibitors of mTORC1 with weak activity against mTORC2. Some TORKinibs have been tested in clinical trials .

The structural organization of multiple convergent sensory modalities in the brain is an important determinant in identifying mechanisms of multimodal integration in neural circuits. The superior colliculus  in the midbrain of vertebrates integrates multimodal sensory information and generates motor responses. Compared with birds and mammals, non mammalian vertebrates, including fish and frog tadpoles, accomplish multisensory integrative tasks with relatively small numbers of cells , suggesting that the identification of the components of the integrative circuitry in these animals may reveal the basic circuit units required for the integration of multiple modalities .
N RAP is a striated muscle specific scaffolding protein involved in myofibril assembly . The N RAP gene is highly conserved between mouse and humans, and consists of 42 exons spread over 70 kilobases . These exons encode a 196 kilodalton protein consisting of an N terminal LIM domain, 11 modules homologous to single nebulin repeats, and an additional 35 modules arranged into 5 super repeats homologous to nebulin super repeats.

Considering the childhood obesity epidemic and that schools are common targets for obesity prevention and health promotion,  there is interest for integrating assessment of children’s dietary intake and physical activity to maximize resources and minimize subject burden. Children have simultaneously reported dietary intake and physical activity in two validation studies.
This locus is classically referred to as the “W” or dominant spotting locus, because heterozygotes have white belly spotting, white feet and white tail tips. There are 95 Kit alleles and in about half of them, the causative mutations have been identified. Mutations at the Kit locus affect embryonic stem cell migration, resulting in pleiotropic effects on hematopoiesis, primordial germ cell development and melanogenesis.
Abdominal desmoid tumors are the most common and can be classified into sporadic and familial forms . At the molecular level, the development of desmoid tumors has been associated with a constitutive activation of the Wnt signaling pathway . FAP associated desmoid tumors are usually caused by germline adenomatous polyposis coli  mutations followed by somatic inactivation of the wild type APC allele  while sporadic desmoids are usually characterized by oncogenic mutations in the β catenin gene, both identical molecular alterations to those found in the vast majority of colorectal cancers  .

Lung adenocarcinoma is the most common subtype of lung cancer, with over 90,000 patients diagnosed each year with this form of lung cancer in the United States alone . Despite its significance, systems to address the question of whether lung adenocarcinoma metastatic progression conforms to a traditional late evolution model or a parallel progression model have not been developed.
Massively parallel  resequencing is potentially a powerful tool with which to study heteroplasmic mitochondrial DNA  mutations due to the high breadth and depth of coverage possible. Studying very low level variants  is likely to yield the most useful insights into somatic  mtDNA mutation, but is challenging due to the difficulty in differentiating true variants from background noise at this resolution. Recent studies using amplicon based re sequencing  have indicated  that mtDNA mutations at ~0.2% heteroplasmy level or greater can be successfully resolved, but only after very stringent data cleaning, including the exclusion of homo polymeric tracts which are known hot spots for technical artefact on this platform.
In vertebrates, the Notch signaling pathway consists of four Notch family receptors  and five Notch ligands . Receptor ligand interactions between neighboring cells initiates the proteolytic cleavage of the Notch receptor extracellular domain, the Ɣ secretase dependent release of the Notch intracellular domain , and its subsequent translocation to the nucleus where it associates with the DNA binding protein, RBPJK/CBF1/Su, as well as a co activator of the Mastermind like  family, thereby triggering the transcription of downstream target genes, including Hey/Hes family members . However, despite the fact that even subtle changes in Dll4 expression impair vascular development , ,  , the regulatory systems that fine tune Dll4/Notch signaling during the development of the embryonic vasculature in vivo remain largely undefined .
Schwann cells are often described as expressing one of only two possible phenotypes, myelinating or non myelinating . Recently, however, this view has been modified by the discovery that Schwann cell growth factor expression is regulated by both the modality of their axonal partners and by their central peripheral location along the neuraxis . Predominately sensory and motor phenotypes have also been found to support regeneration on a modality specific basis.
The Office of National Drug Control Policy  advocates prescription drug monitoring programs  as one strategy for reducing prescription drug abuse. PDMPs have been implemented in nearly every state to monitor for controlled substances; these statewide databases collect information on varying schedules of controlled substances dispensed to patients. PDMPs were originally developed with law enforcement in mind to identify patterns of drug misuse, diversion or excessive prescribing .

Cardiac vessel distribution and patterning are important for the proper maintenance and function of the myocardium. During cardiac development and exercise induced physiological hypertrophy, an increase in organ size coincides with a subsequent increase in capillary bed density . Taken together, these observations suggest that capillary bed density and patterning are critical for the normal functioning of the heart.

In Western societies, intervertebral disc degeneration  related lower back pain affects between 60% and 80% of the population at some point in their lives, making it one of the most important public health issues today. The traditional surgical discectomy does not reconstitute the functions of disc or allow the spine to regain its characteristic multi directional flexibility conferred by unique combination of properties of the annulus and nucleus. The challenge of developing a therapeutic method that is able to restore disc functions has therefore been a long standing aim of researchers .

Melanoma is the sixth most common malignancy in the United States; the estimated 62,480 new cases that will be diagnosed this year justify ongoing efforts to identify variables that will accurately predict outcome. In evaluating these variables, age has become an important factor. Could an age related alteration in the lymphatic environment affect metastatic processes?
Nonspecific effects play a significant role in symptom improvement in a wide range of medical conditions, particularly those that have components of pain or psychological symptoms . As discussed by Roberts , there is no single placebo effect and no consensus on a definition of placebo, with the result that identification and understanding of non specific effects in treatment responses must be evaluated in the context of specific treatments . Placebo effects are expected in hot flash treatment.
Parathyroid hormone  is a major regulator of calcium metabolism that defends against hypocalcemia, in part by stimulating bone resorption and thereby the release of calcium from the skeleton. As a result, intermittent treatment with the 1 34 fragment of PTH is an FDA approved treatment modality for postmenopausal osteoporosis . iPTH stimulates bone formation by increasing the number of OBs, a phenomenon achieved through activation of quiescent lining cells, increased OB proliferation and differentiation, attenuation of OB apoptosis, and signaling in osteocytes.
DMGDH is a mammalian flavin mitochondrial enzyme , which catalyzes the oxidative demethylation of dimethylglycine . When this reaction is studied in vitro the products of reaction are sarcosine, hydrogen peroxide and formaldehyde . In the cell, the redox partner of DMGDH is an electron transferring flavoprotein  .
During the past decade, animal models of Alzheimer’s disease  have made considerable contribution to our understanding of molecular and pathophysiological mechanisms of AD leading to memory deficits , which are difficult to address in human studies and impossible in cultured cells. Although to date no perfect model of AD has emerged, transgenic mice that overexpress the mutated human amyloid precursor protein , presenilin  and tau genes or combine more than one of these mutations successfully recapitulate many aspects of AD such as β amyloid  plaques, neurofibrillary tangles, gliosis, synaptic degeneration, and neuronal loss to some extent. Furthermore, extensive behavioral studies have demonstrated progressive Aβ dependent memory impairments in a series of AD transgenic mouse models, using a broad battery of hippocampus dependent memory assays such as Morris water maze, Y maze, fear conditioning and object or social recognition tasks.
Alzheimer’s disease  and progressive supranuclear palsy  are two common neurodegenerative tauopathies. In both, the severity and neuroanatomic distribution of tau pathology at autopsy is correlated with disease phenomenology prior to death. In contrast, PSP is a relatively “pure” tauopathy and is characterized by deposition of 4R tau.
Lung cancer remains the leading cause of cancer related deaths in the US and worldwide. Adenocarcinoma is the most common type of lung cancer and encompasses lesions with widely variable clinical outcomes. In the absence of noninvasive risk stratification, individualized patient management remains challenging.
Radiation therapy  is commonly used as primary treatment and as an adjuvant to the surgical excision of oral squamous cell cancer in the head and neck. While these procedures have been proven effective, they require extended hospitalization for flap monitoring and recovery, generally compromise normal anatomy and require a secondary donor site with associated morbidity and complications . As an alternative to the use of free tissue transfer, tissue engineering approaches are being developed to regenerate large skeletal defects.
Classic congenital adrenal hyperplasia  is an autosomal recessive condition caused by an enzymatic deficiency. In over 90% of cases, the deficient enzyme is 21 hydroxylase, and this deficiency results in low levels of the glucocorticoid cortisol and in high levels of adrenal androgens, including testosterone, starting at about the seventh week of gestation . Androgen excess during the prenatal period causes genital ambiguity in newborn females with CAH.
The constant sickling and unsickling cycles result in RBC lysis in the microvasculature and the release of acellular HbS . Binding of Hb to Hp prevents the release of free heme and filtration of Hb by the kidneys. In sickle cell disease plasma Hp and Hpx levels are low due to chronic hemolysis .The Hb Hp complex binds to CD163 receptors expressed on the macrophages of the spleen, liver, bone marrow and kidneys.
Linoleic acid  and α linolenic acid  are the parent compounds of ARA and DHA, respectively. Both LA and ALA are considered to be essential fatty acids because they cannot be produced endogenously by humans. LA is commonly found in nut, seed, and vegetable oils and is the most abundant omega 6 fatty acid in the diet.
Recent studies using array based platforms allow genomic analysis at much higher resolution, and are now confirming, refining and extending the abnormalities detectable by cytogenetic techniques . Array based studies have also demonstrated that smaller deletions and duplications are present as polymorphisms in the general population  and a current challenge in the field of molecular cytogenetics is to sort the disease causing abnormalities from the benign . JAG1 mutations can be identified in about 94% of patients with AGS and deletions of the entire JAG1 gene are found in 36% of patients, while the remainder have intragenic JAG1 mutations .
Parkinson's disease  is a progressive neurodegenerative disease characterized clinically as gait and motor disturbances such as rigidity, resting tremor, slowness of voluntary movement, and postural instability. In some cases these evolve to frank dementia . A plethora of host and environmental factors affect the onset and progression of PD including genetics, environmental cues, aging, peripheral immunity, impaired energy metabolism, and oxidative stress .
The hyper IgE syndromes   are rare primary immunodeficiencies , characterized by the clinical triad of recurrent staphylococcal skin abscesses, recurrent pneumonia and serum IgE levels of >10 times the upper norm. Although most cases are sporadic, both autosomal dominant  and autosomal recessive  inheritance have been described. In this form of HIES extra immune manifestations occur, including skeletal abnormalities such as retained primary teeth and a typical facial appearance.
The burden of lung cancer in the world remains extremely high: the International Agency for Research on Cancer  estimated 1.6 million new diagnoses in 2008  and 1.4 million deaths  . In the U.S. and Canada, incidence  is 48.5 for males and 35.8 for females, while mortality is 37.9 and 24.2, respectively, and cumulative risk  of dying from lung cancer is 3% in females and 4.6% in males. In the U.S. 228,000 new cases of lung cancer and about 160,000 deaths were estimated for 2013 .
Newborn screening  for cystic fibrosis  aims to identify newborns with CF and initiate treatment before symptoms arise. In the United States, NBS begins with an initial blood test at birth and those infants with a positive screening result for CF require additional follow up testing to determine whether they have the disease. The child’s primary care provider  is responsible for notifying parents of the infant’s initial NBS result and for arranging the appropriate follow up testing.
The LGI1 gene, located in 10q24, was isolated through its association with a chromosome translocation breakpoint in the T98G glioma cell line  and has since been shown to regulate cell movement, invasion, and growth in soft agar phenotypes in glioma cells , and is frequently inactivated in head and neck cancer . Although reports of LGI1 specific antibodies support the loss of expression in high grade gliomas, the suggestion that these antibodies may cross react with other members of the LGI family of proteins cautions over interpretation of these observations . The GFP gene was introduced at the ATG start codon of LGI1 using homologous recombination within the context of the LGI1 cis regulatory elements present on the BAC .

Ghrelin and its receptors have been isolated from various tissues including the stomach, hypothalamus, pituitary gland, blood vessels, and myocardium. Recent studies focused on the cardiovascular system have demonstrated that ghrelin is able to cause vasodilation and increase cardiac index, stroke volume, left ventricular contractility, and left ventricular fractional shortening.
Transcription, DNA repair, and replication are associated with changes in chromatin . Histone acetyltransferases  are the class of enzymes that catalyze the acetylation of histones , wherein they transfer the acetyl group from acetyl CoA to the lysine amino tails of histones and other proteins at specific lysine residues. Thus, HATs are also referred to as lysine acetyltransferases .
The CD4 T cells play a key role in regulating the magnitude and function of humoral and cellular immunity . HIV preferentially infects virus specific CD4 T cells, with memory CD4 T cells being the primary target of HIV infection . Sustained expression of these inhibitory receptors has been associated with immune dysfunction in murine , non human primate , and human model systems .
Within the systems level framework of emotion, the amygdala contributes several component processes, such as stimulus appraisal, relevance detection, activation of neuroendocrine responses, and somatic motor expressions of emotion . Indeed the amygdala evaluates the emotional quality of facial expressions and vocalizations, and mediates several other aspects of social communication such as eye contact and the perception of personal space . As a manifestation of its role in assessing the relevance/significance of stimuli, the amygdala is involved in allocating attention to stimuli of importance .
Indeed, such experiments allow one to hone in on fundamental, relatively low level mechanisms that underlie adaptive motor control. On the other hand, the learning that occurs during the more natural circumstances of daily life must be optimized for a complex sensory  environment in which the particular ‘contextual’ circumstances in which the learning takes place dictate the necessary type of response. In other words, because environmental or sensory conditions can change suddenly, the brain must be capable of learning different behavioral modes to produce accurate movements under multiple circumstances.
Type 2 diabetes mellitus  and Alzheimer’s disease  are chronic, age related degenerative disorders that are leading causes of morbidity and mortality in the elderly. Consistently, a number of well designed epidemiological studies have established a link between these two diseases , implicating T2DM as a risk factor for developing AD. Hence, an effective treatment strategy against T2DM could have potential value in AD .
While anatomic MRI based primarily on T2 weighted contrast provides delineation of zonal anatomy, extracapsular extension, and regions of cancer, functional MRI studies have been shown to further increase sensitivity and specificity over anatomic imaging alone by improving the differentiation of cancer from benign processes. As with many other applications, the impetus behind the use of higher magnetic field for prostate MRI is driven by the promise of improved disease characterization resulting from increased spectral dispersion, parallel imaging performance, and signal to noise ratio . In addition to increasing SNR and thus spatial resolution, the increase in field strength can be used to improve temporal resolution by reducing the necessity to signal average and, even more significantly, by improved parallel imaging performance.
Inappropriate ICD shocks can be caused by problems associated with the device such as lead failure, physical damage to the device, far field atrial sensing, diaphragmatic potentials, T wave oversensing, and electrical noise . Those who experience frequent shocks are at a high risk for experiencing cardiac arrhythmia and sudden cardiac death, even when shocks are appropriate . These deaths usually occurred within the first three months after of an electrical storm  .

Such an approach allows for the study of eye head coordination using more natural behavior.

The labile border between infection and autoimmunity in these diseases is nevertheless epitomized by progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy , a pathology that appears during the treatment of HIV infection. Thus, whereas highly active antiretroviral therapy  can lead to restoration of JC virus  specific immune defenses, thus resulting in longer symptom free survival of patients , HAART can in some cases induce new demyelinating lesions and worsen the prognosis of PML .

Currently, AMP activated protein kinase  pathway was revealed to be one of the signaling pathways that protect against cardiac ischemia . Alzheimer’s disease and vascular dementia are the two most common forms of cognitive impairment in the elderly. For decades, each was considered a distinct disorder; recent results, however, show that they share many characteristics, including risk factors, neuropathology, and hemodynamics. This has led to a new conception that “ and  are at the extremes of a spectrum of pathologies in which vascular and non vascular factors coexist to varying degrees”, a shift in thinking that has led to prioritization of investigating vascular contributors to dementia by the American Heart Association and American Stroke Association as well as by the National Institute on Neurological Disorders and Stroke .
Disparities in risk for alcohol related problems among sexual minority women may be linked to factors such as greater exposure to stress and greater use of drinking contexts. Parks  found that lesbian women were most likely to describe heavier use of alcohol or drugs in two time periods: when they were becoming aware of their attraction to women, but had not yet become involved in the lesbian community and when they began to immerse themselves in the lesbian community. Although these studies provide useful insights, many of these studies focus on lesbian identified women, excluding other sexual minorities, and do not include comparative narrative data from exclusively heterosexual women.
Major depression  is more common in subjects with coronary artery disease  than in the general population, with prevalence ranging from 17 to 30% . Depression may be predictive of CAD , although life style factors such as poor diet, lack of exercise, excessive smoking, and poor compliance with medical treatment may also contribute. We previously reported that premenopausal women with MDD had increased levels of prothrombotic factors , which may induce coronary or aortic calcification and plaque formation  .
Acquired immune deficiency syndrome  is a devastating disease that has claimed the lives of an estimated 36 million people. The etiologic agent of AIDS is human immunodeficiency virus type 1 , a constituent of the lentiviridae subfamily of retroviruses. Like all viruses it is dependent on host cell proteins and factors for productive replication and spread.
Biomarkers that can be measured in blood products are of particular interest for their potential to provide a low cost, noninvasive screening modality suitable for application to large populations. CA125 is the most commonly used currently available ovarian cancer biomarker . It is a high molecular weight glycoprotein that is elevated in the serum of 75% to 90% of patients with epithelial ovarian tumors .
These cells have the ability to self renew, are multipotent and have a high proliferative capacity. In prostate cancer, the CD44+ cells are enriched for TICs . Second, TICs appear to be more resistant to conventional chemotherapy thereby leading to resistant disease .
Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease  is the most prevalent respiratory disease in the world and is the 5th leading cause of death in developed nations . It is characterized by airflow limitation that is not fully reversible and commonly affects both the airways and lung parenchyma. Moreover, disruption of endothelial function in experimental animals leads to alveolar epithelial cell death and airspace enlargement, suggesting that maintenance of alveolar structure and function requires an intact capillary endothelium  .
Lung cancer is the second most common cancer and the leading cause of cancer deaths, accounting for 30% of male and 26% of female cancer deaths . With treatment, clinical stage 1A non small cell lung cancer  has a 5 year survival of 61%, while stage IV disease has a 5 year survival of only 1% . Even the most advanced efforts in molecular staging focus on the characteristics of the tumor, to the exclusion of host factors of potential biological significance, such as the immunological milieu in which the tumor developed.
Vascular disorders, including ischemic stroke, are leading causes of mortality and morbidity in modern societies. The underlying patho physiology is likely to be under the influence of both genetic and environmental factors . Telomeres are tandem repeats of DNA sequences located at the ends of eukaryotic chromosomes with the primary function being to protect the telomeric regions from recombination and degradation, thus avoiding a DNA damage cellular response .
Breast cancer remains a leading cause of death amongst women worldwide. There has been a dramatic rise in the incidence of ductal carcinoma in situ  in the US which is at least partially due to the use of screening mammography . Currently, therapy for DCIS involves surgical resection with or without radiation and sometimes adjuvant hormone therapy .
Until recently most research focusing on American Indian/Alaska Native  people and communities was conducted by researchers from academic institutions. These researchers were often “outsiders”; in other words they were not familiar with the community/participants under study nor did they spend time in the community or attend to important cultural differences. This generally resulted in studies with questionable findings  that had little or no benefit to the participants or their communities and, unfortunately, often resulted in harms of omission  or outright harms .
In recent years, our understanding of responses by free living animals to potential stressors has been greatly enhanced by the development of methods for non invasive hormone sampling , mainly because more traditional methods of blood sampling can themselves be stressful . Many species excrete multiple steroid metabolites, which can be extracted and measured with immunoassays like those used to measure circulating steroid hormones  . As this plasticity far exceeds that observed in other large African carnivores, responses observed in spotted hyenas may represent conservative indicators of how more specialized carnivores might respond to the same potential stressors .
Ionising radiation is a potent human carcinogen. Several tissues and organs are susceptible to the transforming effects of ionising radiation, including the breast in adolescent and young women in whom risk is both dose  and age dependent. In women treated with radiotherapy for Hodgkin lymphoma, there is a linear relationship between radiation exposure and breast cancer risk, with those under the age of 20 years at the time of exposure at the highest risk of developing subsequent breast cancer.
High mobility group box 1 protein  is a ubiquitous 215 amino acid nuclear protein that binds to DNA and promotes its bending, while maintaining genome stability, DNA processing and repair, and controlling autophagy and autophagic clearance of defective mitochondria by regulating the transcription of heat shock protein 27. In addition to these intracellular homeostatic functions and regulation of energy metabolism, HMGB1 can be released from necrotic and non lethally damaged cells into the extracellular milieu where it behaves as a pro inflammatory cytokine. HMGB1 released locally and systemically exerts an array of actions typical of a damage associated molecular pattern  signal molecule, such as activation of monocytes and dendritic cells, disruption of epithelial and endothelial barriers, cytokine production, mobilization and differentiation of stem cells, and facilitation of tissue repair and regeneration.
However, core needle biopsy  and fine needle aspiration biopsy  procedures both suffer from significant nondiagnostic sampling rates when in the hands of inexperienced operators  or, in the case of CNB, when small or non palpable masses are targeted . Nondiagnostic samples, typically classified as those which are void of epithelial cells , occur in up to 35% of palpation guided FNAB  procedures and 12% of image guided CNB procedures targeting nonpalpable lesions . In this work, we have studied the application of a fiber optic imaging device and associated computer aided detection techniques to this problem.
Tuberculosis  is a leading global cause of death. Vitamin D deficiency associates with susceptibility to active TB in numerous settings  and vitamin D supplementation enhances antimycobacterial immunity . Vitamin D is synthesized in the skin during exposure to ultra violet light and is metabolized by the liver to form 25 hydroxyvitamin D D), the major circulating vitamin D metabolite and accepted measure of vitamin D status.
We, and others, have shown that erythropoietin  is neuroprotective to photoreceptors and retinal ganglion cells . Treatment is effective regardless if EPO is delivered systemically or intraocularly . To avoid this complication, intraocular delivery was tested.
Human decision making can be biased by context and risk . For example, a supermarket might advertise yogurt as “99% fat free” instead of “1% fat” to encourage sales, although these statements mean the same thing. The fact that these biases are observed across different cultures  and are difficult to eradicate even with training  implies that hard wired genetic influences may play an important role in determining susceptibility to biases during decision making .
However, all reported direct visualizations of blood flow have employed fluorescent contrast agents to improve signal to noise in the images. Although the fluorescence based measures are accurate, they are invasive, and the time span for visualization of the leukocytes is limited . First, the retinal vasculature is embedded in the retina’s thick, multilayered structure.
It is widely accepted that the number of people identified with autism spectrum disorders  has risen over the past decade . Autistic disorder and PDD NOS often co occur with mild to moderate intellectual impairment , but intellectual disability is not required for the diagnosis. By definition children with Asperger’s disorder do not show intellectual deficiency or communication delay.
Although classic “box and arrow” models of basal ganglia organization  have spurred much fruitful research, it has also been recognized for some time that we require greater knowledge about the dynamics of brain activity in these circuits to reveal their operational principles. In particular, there is evidence that dopamine depletion in Parkinson's Disease leads to enhanced beta frequency  synchronization in the basal ganglia , that can be reversed with therapeutic treatments including dopaminergic drugs and deep brain stimulation . However, the normal functional role of oscillations in these circuits are poorly understood, in part because they have most commonly been investigated in anesthetized and/or restrained animals  rather than during active task performance .
School readiness is a multi dimensional construct that refers to how physically, cognitively, emotionally, socially, and behaviorally prepared for school children are. A large body of research has focused on school readiness not only because of its importance for children’s transition to formal education but also because school readiness has been associated with important long term outcomes including school completion and academic achievement . The vast majority of research on school readiness has examined North American or European samples, which has led to important understanding of these contexts.
Colour vision in most mammals, including mice, is dichromatic, being mediated by M and S opsin photopigments for sensitivity to medium long  and short  wavelengths of light, respectively . Opsins are expressed in cone photoreceptors which are generated before birth in the mouse . Cones begin to express S opsin near birth and M opsin at P8 .
The Central Brain Tumor Registry of the United States  states that the 5 year survival rate from the time of diagnosis is only 3.3%. Standard of care treatment involves radiation, chemotherapy, and maximal surgical re section of the tumor; however, as the poor survival rate indicates, these treatments have not been effective in preventing disease progression. Infiltrating cells extend from the tumor body into the surrounding brain parenchyma, making complete surgical removal of tumor nearly impossible and recurrent tumors often appear within 2 cm of the initial lesion.
Several missense and deletion mutations of DJ 1 cause early onset familial Parkinson’s disease. Several studies suggested DJ 1 may be involved in oxidative sensoring , ubiquitin proteasome system  and post transcriptional regulation  . The expression pattern of DJ 1 in the brain remains controversial.
Therefore, TMEV infection of mice results in an autoimmune mediated demyelinating disease . Pattern recognition receptors, including the Toll like receptors , recognize PAMPs and signal the cell to respond to the pathogen. Several agonists for TLRs have been determined including viral PAMPs such as double stranded RNA recognized by TLR3 and single stranded RNA recognized by TLR7/TLR8 .
Retinal cell loss is the cause of many degenerative human diseases, including retinitis pigmentosa and age related macular degeneration. In humans as well as other mammals, retinal cell loss is irreversible and ultimately leads to blindness. However, mammalian MG normally respond to injury by undergoing reactive gliosis, which leads to scarring .
During the 1990’s, preclinical, early ecological and observational studies historically reported that dietary fat intake was positively associated with breast  and colorectal cancer  risk. A sizeable randomized, controlled trial with adequate statistical power was designed to test this hypothesis. The Women’s Health Initiative  randomized low fat dietary modification  trial  was initiated with incidence of  breast cancer and colorectal cancer as primary outcomes, to test the hypothesis that an intervention involving reduced total fat  would reduce incidence of these outcomes over a 9 year period in 48,000 free living postmenopausal women .
Many studies have demonstrated the ability of folic acid supplementation to prevent neural tube defects  . Folic acid fortification of the food supply was implemented in the U.S. in early 1998, with the goal of reducing NTD prevalence. Indeed, NTD prevalence has declined in the U.S. subsequent to fortification .
The increasing prevalence of obesity among older adults is a major public health problem, because of the increasing number of older adults and the medical complications associated with obesity . Obese older adults are at particularly high risk for developing nonalcoholic fatty liver disease  because both obesity  and aging  are associated with increased IHF accumulation. The development of NAFLD in older adults has serious clinical implications, because of the potential progression to severe liver disease and the association of NAFLD with metabolic risk factors for coronary heart disease, including insulin resistance, diabetes, and dyslipidemia .
Convection enhanced delivery  uses fluid pressure at the tip of the delivery cannula and bulk flow to propagate substances within the extracellular fluid spaces . Our understanding of CED distribution has been further enhanced by elucidation of the physiologic effects of the local pulsatile vasculature , the complexities of the extracellular matrix , and the biophysical properties of the extracellular space volume fraction . With the increasing use of CED in clinical neurosurgery , investigators have sought to visualize the delivery of therapeutics intra operatively.
It is argued by some that, as an organizing principle for US health care, approaching each patient strictly as an individual is obsolete, and that the population health approach is an alternative for improving and maintaining the health of everyone in the community . Consequently, we derived a disability staging system based on the ICF concepts  of activity and participation. IADLs, more complex domestic life and household management tasks, are necessary for all individuals if they are to participate in community life .
Over the past decade, there has been a precipitous decline in HIV related deaths worldwide because of the wide availability of antiretroviral therapy , which means that HIV infected parents are living healthier and longer and are increasingly likely to have children and/or raise their children into adolescence or adulthood. They may struggle about the timing, approach, and content of the disclosure, and many of them are not confident in talking about HIV with children or explaining the cause of their infections . However, empirical data on these issues are limited to date .
Orthopaedic trauma comprises the vast majority of these war wounds, as 70% of casualties involve the musculoskeletal system, 26% are fractures, and 82% of the fractures are open. Thus, it is not surprising that the incidence of osteomyelitis  in combat related extremity injuries is between 2% to 15%, and is of great concern. Surprisingly this pathogen has been reported in less than 2% of nosocomial infections within the United States, but has emerged in over 30% of admitted deployed soldiers.
TMPs comprise 20 30% of the coding potential of most genomes, mediate many critical physiological processes and are important targets of a large number of clinically useful drugs. Furthermore, structures of TMPs from eukaryotic sources appear to be particularly elusive. Some of the reasons for the difficulty of TMP structure determination are well known: 1) TMPs generally can not be overexpressed to the same extent as soluble proteins.
Tumor antigen specific CD4+ helper T cells play important roles in the induction and maintenance of antitumor immune responses. In addition, immune potentiating cytokines from CD4+ T cells may help other immune cells to overcome the actions of immunosuppressive factors . Recently, accumulating evidence demonstrates that APCs at the tumor microenvironment are frequently immunosuppressive and lead to unresponsiveness of T cells .
Binding of uPA to its receptor  initiates a proteolytic cascade that ultimately results in degradation of extracellular matrix  components and activation of matrix metalloproteases . These processes in turn lead to tumor invasion and metastasis. Components of the uPA system, including uPAR, are overexpressed in various cancers, including human breast, prostate, and colorectal cancer, and overexpression is correlated with poor prognosis due to increased rates of metastatic relapse .
These disorders are linked to substance use disorder , thus possibly representing a vulnerability to addiction . With the eventual goal of assessing whether deficits of impulse control predate and/or potentially predispose to drug use, our laboratory studies impulsivity in adolescents who are at high risk for poor impulse control . The traditional Go NoGo task measures “rapid response” impulsivity by evaluating the ability of a subject to inhibit a prepotent response when the subject is asked to respond to a series of rapidly presented Go stimuli and to withhold responding to less frequently presented NoGo stimuli .
In mice, we have recently found that, amongst leukocytes, ACKR2 is highly restricted to innate like B cells   and B1 B cells), and is the best unifying marker of these cells. IBC serve key roles during homeostasis, autoimmunity and infection, and new properties of these cells continue to be defined. What sets ACKR2 and other atypical chemokine receptors apart is their inability to couple to signaling pathways activated after classical chemokine receptor engagement.
The intracranial vascular anomaly is most often unilateral and involves the occipital and parietal lobes, although it might affect other lobes and spare the most posterior region in some cases . Seizures are the most common neurologic complications, varying from 72% to 93% in unilateral and bilateral involvement, respectively . Proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy  is more available and provides noninvasive information on some tissue metabolites with well established applications in the assessment of various brain disorders .
Several examples of DNA templated organic reactions have been reported, but far fewer stereo  and regio specific DNA mediated polymerization reactions are known. In previous work, we have reported the attachment of dicarboxyl and diamino groups to the 2′ position of uridine nucleoside analogs. In the design of the strands reported in our earlier work, the modified nucleosides were flanked on both sides by short stretches of oligo dT.
The AAS are synthetic derivatives of testosterone whose therapeutic use has been overshadowed by illicit self administration of excessive doses of these drugs resulting in adverse effects on reproduction and sexual behaviors . AAS abuse by teenagers  may present even greater risks than for adults, given the greater hormone sensitivity of the brain during adolescence . Administration of supraphysiological levels of AAS in rodents alters pubertal onset and reproductive behaviors and is associated with suppression of gonadotropin secretion and disruption of the hypothalamic pituitary gonadal  axis .
CD8+ lymphocytes have the ability to recognize and directly kill tumor cells, and can be readily isolated from certain tumors, activated and expanded ex vivo for reinfusion into cancer patients to achieve varying degrees of responses . Since the expression of MHC II on these tumors is unknown, the mechanisms mediating this potentially Th1 dependent therapeutic effect need to be clarified. Conventional thought has limited the effects of the CD4+ T cell population in antitumor immunity to a role of merely providing additional and beneficial, yet non essential stimuli for supporting the maintenance of the anti tumor CD8+ T cell population .
We hypothesized that the degree of preserved functional connectivity within the DMN during the first week after cardiopulmonary arrest  would be associated with functional outcome at hospital discharge . Independent component analysis was performed to delineate the DMN. Connectivity strength in the DMN was compared between CPA subjects and controls, as well as between CPA subjects with good outcome  and those with bad outcome .
It has been argued that metastatic cancers are selected for their ability to export acid . Acid is a by product of glucose metabolism, and notably, elevated consumption of fluorodeoxyglucose by more aggressive cancers has been observed with fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography  . The current work tests the hypothesis that neutralizing the acid pH of tumors will inhibit invasion and, hence, reduce the incidence of spontaneous metastases.
In 2014, approximately 55,070 new cases of head and neck cancer, the majority of which are of a squamous histology , will be diagnosed in the United States and an estimated 12,000 individuals will die of these cancers . Alcohol and tobacco use are the major risk factors for HNSCC. HPV is also strongly associated with some HNSCC, especially oropharynx cancers  .
Multiple studies have demonstrated particular involvement of the parahippocampal cortex  in successful memory formation . Neuroimaging and neuropsychological studies of patients with damage to the prefrontal cortex  have also suggested the contribution of the PFC to the encoding of long term memory  . Although imaging studies have commonly reported PFC and PHC activity in lockstep during associative encoding, the hypothesis of the present study was that activity in these two regions is dissociable, with PFC activity preceding PHC activity, supporting a mechanism for topdown modulation of MTL structures involved in associative encoding .
Acute Myeloid Leukemia  is an aggressive malignancy of the bone marrow characterized by accumulation of early myeloid blood cells that fail to mature and differentiate. The course of the disease is marked by poor prognosis, frequent relapse, and high disease related mortality . Such investigation determined that cytogenetic abnormalities are prognostic, some favorable and others unfavorable , yet up to 50% of patients have normal karyotype AML with a wide range of clinical outcomes.
Trigeminal pain in women changes with the menstrual cycle. Headache and TMDs share common features , and both may be accompanied by significant allodynia . Use of exogenous oestrogens, such as hormone replacement therapy or oral contraceptives, increases the risk of TMD pain .
Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor A  is an essential regulator of vascular physiology. VEGF A plays key roles in vasculogenesis and angiogenesis during development. ,  VEGF A can bind to two different but closely related endothelial receptor tyrosine kinases : fms like tyrosine kinase  and kinase insert domain receptor .
Ewing's family tumors are malignancies that share histological features as well as a recurrent and specific t chromosomal translocation . This translocation results in a chimeric transcript encoding the N terminal domain of the RNA binding protein EWS and the DNA binding domain of the ETS family transcription factor Fli1 . The resultant EWS Fli1 chimeric fusion protein is known to affect both gene transcription and RNA splicing  .
Fortunately, cells contain a number of dedicated and functionally conserved DNA repair and damage signaling proteins that promote cell survival. Over the last 50 years scientists in the field of Genetic Toxicology have dedicated considerable time and effort to the identification of activities that promote the repair of DNA lesions, as well as understanding the regulation of repair activities after DNA damage. One of the first genetic screens to identify DNA damage induced genes utilized a randomly integrated reporter construct to identify five damage inducible  loci in E. coli.
B cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia  represents the most common form of leukemia in adults of Western countries, accounts for 25% of all cases of leukemia in adults. However, this traditional view has changed in the past decade. Abnormal cytokines production is another feature of B CLL.
Coronary heart disease is an important threat to public health in the world . Intensive and sustained lifestyle modifications such as physical activity and diets especially when associated with weight loss, reduced TG levels, but for many individuals pharmacological interventions are needed to achieve substantial reduction in TGs. Fenofibrate is an efficacious therapeutic agent for hypertriglyceridemia by reducing plasma TG levels by 3550% and raising HDL C levels by 1020%  .
Historically, therapeutic alliance has received considerable attention in adult treatment, with over 7000 studies of therapeutic alliance in adult psychotherapy . The most common definition of therapeutic alliance makes reference to the development of an affective bond, agreement on tasks, and agreement on goals . In child psychotherapy, therapeutic alliance has been strongly associated with improved parenting , reductions in the child’s symptomatology , and improved family functioning .
Malnutrition is a substantial confound in regards to brain development . We also have limited stress exposure to the first postnatal week, since this time window represents the most dynamic and plastic period in the development of somatosensory cortex . We chose Balb/CByJ mice for this paradigm because of their high stress responsiveness  as well as high potential for developmental plasticity .
Measuring older adults’ decision making competence  reliably and validly is critical for  identifying individuals whose decision making abilities are impaired;  avoiding inappropriate removal of decision making power from competent individuals, and  advancing theories of when and how decision makers across the adult lifespan are able to meet the demands of various decision environments. Even though robust assessment tools are essential for modeling and assisting successful aging, few tools provide a performance based analysis of older adults’ DMC. In this article, we report progress in an ongoing research program that aims to measure older adults’ decision skills using behavioral decision tasks .
Styrene  is an important industrial chemical widely used in the manufacture of plastics, resins, and synthetic rubbers. Styrene has been detected in cigarette smoke, engine exhausts, heating systems, newly installed carpets, painting, and even food and drinking water stored in polystyrene containers., The highest levels of human exposure to styrene occur in the reinforced plastic industry. The National Toxicity Program lists styrene as reasonably anticipated human carcinogen.
Chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome  is a common but poorly understood condition. CP/CPPS is defined only by symptoms. This results in significant confusion in the treatment of CP/CPPS.
Although cardiac dysfunction is the primary pathological insult, the resulting syndrome of heart failure alters numerous physiological systems to impair functional capacity. These peripheral skeletal muscle adaptations limit physical function independent of cardiac impairment and persist despite correction of cardiac dysfunction. Aerobic fitness is commonly assumed to be the primary determinant of physical function in heart failure patients because exertional fatigue and dyspnea are predominant symptoms of the disease.
Regulation of connexins is critical in maintaining normal cell function. Cx43 is the most widely expressed connexin and is critical in various physiological events, such as cell growth, differentiation, and certain developmental processes . Therefore, proper regulation of Cx43 levels, and thus Cx43 gap junction channels, is essential in maintaining normal cellular functions .
A member of this family, KLF4, also known as gut enriched Kruppel like factor/GKLF or epithelial/endothelial zinc finger/EZF, is highly expressed in epithelial cells of different tissues . Thus, the broader role that Klf4 may play in the maturation program of other cell types in the intestinal mucosa is not clear. For example, expression of Klf4 is decreased in intestinal adenomas of ApcMin mice  and in colonic adenomas and carcinomas of FAP  patients, , consistent with a tumor suppressor role of Klf4 .
OSU 03012, a derivative of the drug Celecoxib, lacks COX2 inhibitory activity . Expression levels of COX2 do not simplistically correlate with tumor cell sensitivity to COX2 inhibitors . After 28 days of treatment the C max was ~2 μM.
Tooth development is largely under genetic control and all familial cases as well as the majority of sporadic cases of congenital tooth agenesis are likely to be caused by sequence variations in one of the many genes that are involved in tooth development . Hypohidrotic Ectodermal Dysplasia  is such a syndrome, which features hypoplasia of most epithelial appendages including variable numbers of missing teeth, sparse hair, hypoplastic or aplastic sweat glands leading to hypohidrosis with potentially life threatening hyperthermia. The EDA gene occupies a 425 kb segment of the long arm of the X chromosome   and encodes a protein, which belongs to the tumor necrosis factor  superfamily of ligands.
Cystic fibrosis  lung disease is characterized by airway obstruction, chronic infection, and neutrophil dominated inflammation leading to progressive and irreversible lung destruction. Neutrophil derived DNA contributes to the increased viscosity of airway secretions. Dornase alfa  hydrolyzes DNA, reducing the viscosity of CF sputum.
Alcohol is the most commonly used intoxicant among underage youth in the U.S. followed by marijuana, with 45% of teens report drinking and 18% report using marijuana in the past month . Alcohol related effects on sleep have been extensively studied in adults. Acute and subacute alcohol withdrawal  have been associated with decreased Slow Wave Sleep  and higher Rapid Eye Movement  pressure .
Epithelial cell sheet migration has a central role in skin wound healing. Myosin II, an abundant motor protein in nonmuscle cells, has key roles in this respect during cell migration, in posterior cell retraction, and via poorly understood mechanisms, in helping stabilize nascent focal adhesions in the anterior portion of the cell . Multiple signaling pathways are capable of activating myosin II function in adherent cells, and myosin II containing structures in cells appear to have diverse roles, not all of which are pro migratory.
Leishmaniasis, caused by infection with parasites of the Leishmania genus, affects millions of individuals worldwide causing serious morbidity and mortality. In Brazil, L. braziliensis is the most prevalent species, and can cause at least two major clinical forms: cutaneous leishmaniasis  and mucosal leishmaniasis . Non self healing lesions usually respond well to antimonial administration, although this treatment is toxic to patients.
Both acini and ductal cells can synthesize and secrete large amounts of proteins but acinar cells typically produce most protein. The understanding of salivary gland atrophy and its reversal through regeneration is clinically important because salivary secretion is vital for the protection of the oral environment. Obstructive sialadenitis can be mimicked experimentally in the rat by ligation of the main excretory duct of the submandibular gland producing a histological appearance comparable with, though more widespread, than occurs in human disease .
However, calculating entropy is traditionally a highly challenging problem, especially for complex molecules. One long standing approach is the quasi harmonic approximation,, which approximates the probability density function  of a molecule's internal coordinates as a multivariate Gaussian distribution. , Recently, two novel methods of estimating configurational entropy from molecular simulation data, which do not rely on any specific model of the probability distribution of molecular coordinates, have been introduced .
NF κB can be activated by many anticancer therapeutics . In most cell types the major one is the canonical pathway, which consists of IKK , IκB, and NF κB  and is activated by proinflammatory cytokines such as tumor necrosis factor  and a variety of cellular stresses . When this pathway is turned on by binding of TNF to the TNF receptor 1, IKK is recruited to the TNFR1 signaling complex through TRAF2 and activated through a RIP mediated mechanism that involves MEKK3 .
The distribution of 5 HT4 receptors in human brain is postsynaptic and is relatively dense in basal ganglia and hippocampal formation, less dense in neocortex and absent in cerebellum . Perturbations to 5 HT4 receptors have been implicated in some neuropsychiatric disorders, including Alzheimer’s disease , depression , and eating disorders . Thus, for example, administration of 5 HT4 agonists in animal models of Alzheimer’s disease increases acetylcholine release and improves memory and cognition .
Benign prostatic hyperplasia , the most common benign neoplasm in American men, is a chronic, progressive condition associated with the development of lower urinary tract symptoms . While LUTS rarely progress to become life threatening, they frequently have a negative impact on men’s quality of life. It has been demonstrated that the effect of moderate LUTS on health related quality of life  was comparable to that of having diabetes, high blood pressure or cancer, while the effect of severe LUTS was comparable to having had a heart attack or stroke.
Although language delay is not a general characteristic of AS , individuals with AS may have initial mild deficits in their language development, and have semantic pragmatic deficits in their language use . Furthermore, auditory hypersensitivity is common in AS , and might be partly explained by the enhanced cortical sound discrimination ability reported in this syndrome  . showed that adults with autism spectrum disorders required a higher signal to noise ratio in order to be able to perceive and repeat sentences during various kinds of background noise.
Identification of new biomarkers to predict bad pregnancy/fetal outcomes would be of enormous clinical benefit. In particular, a non invasive detection of a biomarker that can identify pregnancies at risk would allow determining optimal timing of delivery and implementation of neuroprotective strategies to the mother. Currently, there are very few methods to predict adverse pregnancy/fetal outcomes .
The incidence of delayed fracture healing, or non union, is estimated to occur in 5 10% of fractures . Studies have found mechanosensitivity to have a genetic basis . One such pathway is the phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase  Akt pathway which leads to osteoblast differentiation .
Animal models of PD have been constructed by over expression of α syn, and several of these have been used to identify factors that protect against α syn toxicity. In a recent study, a nematode model of α syn induced misfolding and age dependent DA neurodegeneration was used to screen a candidate list of ∼900 starting targets, derived from analysis of proteins or pathways implicated in PD, as well as co expressed and interacting partners . In a secondary analysis, select candidates were expressed together with α syn in C. elegans DA neurons, and loss of DA neurons was assessed.
The isolation of highly pathogenic strains of MARV  now makes rates of fatality from MARV similar to those of EBOV in Zaire, Sudan and Ivory Coast —fatalities originating from a viral induced hemorrhagic fever that reach rates of up to 90%  . The MARV genome, like other members of the order, is a negative sense single stranded  RNA genome just over 19kb in length that encodes seven genes . Transcription is known to initiate at the 3′ terminus  of an encapsidated genome with one or more stem loop genomic RNA structures functioning as promoter elements for RNA dependent RNA polymerase  binding and transcriptional initiation .
Cross cultural studies of substance use behaviors have demonstratedconsiderable variation in the types of substances most commonly consumed, as well asthe social and physical contexts in which they are consumed . We find this use ofthe concept of cultural norms, published in NIAAA's practitioner directed journalAlcohol Research & Health, to be fairly typical of theliterature in our field . Incases where women either did not drink or drank small amounts of alcohol intheir countries of origin, adopting the drinking norms of the generalpopulation of U.S. women translates into consuming more alcohol.
Human plasma phospholipid transfer protein  is a 476 amino acid protein secreted by a wide variety of tissues  and is associated predominantly with apo A I containing lipoproteins in plasma . Among the diverse biological functions proposed for PLTP is its role in modulating vascular lipoproteins. In vitro, PLTP can facilitate the transfer of phospholipids and cholesterol from the lower density lipoproteins to high density lipoproteins .
The proportion of women who are overweight  25 30 kg/m2) or obese  when they become pregnant is substantial and rapidly increasing; a recent study estimated that over 20% of US women are obese at the start of pregnancy. High pre pregnancy BMI, particularly obesity, increases the risk of numerous adverse maternal and fetal outcomes including preeclampsia, gestational diabetes and fetal death. The impact of obesity on physical health during pregnancy has been studied extensively, while the relationship between obesity and maternal mental health has been largely neglected.
Immune mediated impairment of glandular function results in keratoconjunctivitis sicca and xerostomia . Alpha fodrin was identified as a potential autoantigen in mouse models  and some human patients , although the relevance of this putative autoantigen to disease remains controversial . Thus, the identification of additional autoantigens remains a priority for understanding Sjögren’s Syndrome .
Urinary tract infections  occur in women with diabetes mellitus more frequently than in women without diabetes, are more severe, with pyelonephritis occurring at a five fold higher rate, and often result in complications that are otherwise rare, such as emphysematous cystitis, and fungal infections . The presence of ASB in diabetic women is not associated with a faster decline in renal function , or greater risk of diabetic complications or mortality. The most common infecting organism in asymptomatic bacteriuric women with diabetes is Escherichia coli; other organisms include Klebsiella spp., Enterococcus spp.
The costs of an uncomplicated renal transplant event are approximately $100 000 for the first in 90 days of care . CMS is the primary payer for most of kidney transplant patients and though kidney transplantation is cost effective compared to long term dialysis, kidney transplant recipients consume significant healthcare resources . Reducing adverse outcomes following kidney transplantation may be one strategy for reducing these high costs.
The memories most sensitive to propofol are those that are consciously accessible in rich detail and include contextual information such as when and where they occurred. Long term memory is defined here as memory that is not working memory, i.e. memory retained longer than 20 seconds after encoding in the absence of rehearsal. We have recently presented suggestive evidence that event related potential measures of recognition memory in the presence of propofol are altered even when performance is unchanged.
Brainstem regions appear to provide a tonic homoeostatic autonomic control function  and much is known from animal studies about these autoregulatory centres . However, we do not yet have complete understanding of how peripheral arousal is integrated with, and influences, human emotional behaviour. In fact, it is likely that an integration of visceral afferent information and motivational processes underlying emotion occurs within a hierarchy of central structures .
In principle, a macrocycle iron+n species and its analogous iron+ macrocycle radical cation can be resonance forms of one another. When an energy barrier exists for electron transfer between the macrocycle and the iron atom, the two species will be isomers of one another, specifically electronic isomers  that are also known as valence tautomers . The barriers that isolate the isomers from one another kinetically can be reasonably large due to, for example, considerable differences in bond lengths and relative atom positions.
Type I and type II pyrethroids are commonly used as potent and effective insecticides for agricultural and public health applications  and can easily enter the exoskeleton of insects. These axonic poisons cause paralysis and ultimately death of the organism by keeping sodium channels open in the neuronal membranes. This relatively low toxicity is attributed to a combination of efficient detoxification mechanisms in mammals  and lower sensitivity of ion channels .
Interactions between hippocampal and thalamocortical networks during sleep are considered critical for systems memory consolidation, a process by which episodic memory recall progressively becomes independent of the hippocampus and relies more on neocortical regions . The reactivation of place cells occurs during brief high frequency oscillations  in the hippocampal local field potential  and is thought to have a direct role in memory consolidation . CA1 ripples occur both before spindles  and locked to the troughs of the spindle oscillation .
Despite continually evolving therapeutic options, we have witnessed little improvement in survival for patients with squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck  over the past three decades . While immunotherapy has the potential to improve outcomes, broad clinical application will require improved understanding of the immuno regulatory and cytotoxic potential of specific effector cell populations . However, such vaccination approaches designed to stimulate anti tumor T cell immunity for SCCHN have demonstrated only limited efficacy .
Cognition is a set of high level brain functions that vary substantially among individuals. Twin studies also indicated a high heritability  for attention problems . Genes involved in synaptic signaling or plasticity have been implicated in cognitive variability.

Most treatment studies focus on acute phase outcomes, and those studies which report long term outcomes generally continue the acute phase treatments into long term care. Remission rates, however, have been low.
Gastric cancer  is a major cause of cancer related death, worldwide. Helicobacter pylori  plays an important role in gastric carcinogenesis, although the majority of individuals with H. pylori infection do not develop gastric cancer. Surveillance of these high risk patients using reliable and accurate predictive markers is important for reducing the incidence of cancer and its mortality.

The SR BII isoform also mediates holopartical uptake and internalization of HDL . CD36 also binds oxidized low density lipoprotein  facilitating foam cell formation and development of atherosclerosis .

Lipoxygenases  are a family of non heme iron containing proteins that catalyze the dioxygenation of polyunsaturated fatty acids containing the 1 cis 4 cis pentadiene moiety to form bioactive lipids. Dependent on the predominant position of the incorporation of hydroperoxy group, LOXs are classfied as 5 , 8 , 12 , and 15 LOXs, whose main products are 5 , 8 , 12, and 15 HETE, respectively .
After definitive host penetration, the parasite transforms into a schistosomulum that enters the circulation and migrates to the hepatic portal and mesenteric veins surrounding the liver. Here, schistosomula develop into sexually mature adults  that can evade immunity and thrive for many years. The binuclear manganese metalloenzyme arginase may comprise just such an alternative.
Experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis  is a CD4+ T cell mediated demyelinating autoimmune disease of the central nervous system  in mice , which serves as a model of multiple sclerosis  in humans. Autoreactive T cells directed against myelin antigens produce high levels of proinflammatory cytokines such as IFN γ, IL 17, while resistance to, or recovery from, the disease is mediated through the immunoregulatory cytokines IL 4, IL 5, IL 10, and IL 27, among others  . Mast cells  are derived from haematopoietic stem cells, which migrate into vascularized tissues and serosal cavities where they complete their maturation .
Most CHDs are caused by abnormalities in septation and valvulogenesis. In EMT, endocardial cells invade into the cardiac jelly between the endocardium and myocardium and become mesenchymal cells, subsequently contributing to the formation of septa and valves . In addition, cells derived from the secondary heart field play a critical role in the orientation and patterning of the cardiac outflow tract .
Thus, given the promise, yet limitation, of current anti mitotic therapies, the identification of mechanisms supporting intrinsic resistance to paclitaxel in NSCLC is essential. Efficacy of paclitaxel and other anti mitotic agents hinges on the coupling of mitotic defects to cell death. By inhibiting the dynamic instability of microtubules, paclitaxel disrupts chromosome alignment, thereby preventing satisfaction of the spindle assembly checkpoint .
Kaposi sarcoma associated herpesvirus , also known as human herpesvirus 8  was first described in 1994 . Successful KSHV infection is characterized by both virus entry and the ability of the virus to establish latency. The lytic infection is also critical for the spread of KSHV to different organs .
Alcohol exposure during adolescence may induce long lasting neurobiological changes that could attenuate responsiveness to alcohol later in life . Considering that a decreased response to alcohol is associated with an increased risk of alcoholism , the early initiation of alcohol use may lead to alcohol abuse disorder during adulthood  . The adolescent brain is more sensitive to the neurotoxic effects of alcohol than the adult brain .
Multiple health organizations, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention , the World Health Organization, and the American Academy of Pediatrics, recommend exclusive breastfeeding for the first four to six months of life . Despite this, the CDC estimates the national rate for exclusive breastfeeding among new US mothers at infant age three months to be only 35 percent . Many studies over the past decade have examined barriers to breastfeeding, including education, smoking, working full time, and disparities that contribute to differences in breastfeeding rates among different socio demographic groups .
About one third of US HIV infections among MSM occur in black men. Multiple contextual factors are potentially driving disparities in HIV/AIDS among BMSM and WMSM. First, individuals who serosort likely do so to lower their perceived risk for HIV infection, i.e., make them feel safe while not using condoms.
In the United States, there exists a common stereotype of the Asian model minority: a group of individuals who excel academically and exhibit few behavioral difficulties . For this reason, at risk Asian American youth remain relatively understudied. This group, however, is growing.
Currently, mechanisms leading to reduced glial glutamate transporter functions and molecular mechanism by which IL 1β alters synaptic transmission in the spinal dorsal horn remain obscure. Two types of glial glutamate transporters  and one neuronal glutamate transporters  exist in the spinal dorsal horn . Deficient glial glutamate uptake enhances activation of AMPA and NMDA glutamate receptors, and causes glutamate to spill to the extrasynaptic space and activation of extrasynaptic NMDA receptors in spinal sensory neurons .
Solid state NMR experiments on uniformly 15N labeled proteins are straightforward because they have no nitrogen atoms directly bonded to other nitrogen atoms in either backbone or side chain sites. It is feasible to make accurate measurements of 1H chemical shift, 15N chemical shift, and 1H 15N heteronuclear dipolar coupling frequencies for individual sites, as well as to detect 1H 1H and weak 15N 15N homonuclear couplings using a wide variety of multidimensional NMR experiments . However, there are two disadvantages to the 1H/15N double resonance approach: it is restricted to the amide nitrogen sites in the polypeptide backbone and the few nitrogen containing side chain sites, and the direct detection of 15N signals has low sensitivity because of its low gyromagnetic ratio.
EC have been shown to play a central role in vasculogenesis during development and in angiogenesis . Besides their potential role in regenerative medicine, EC are an important tool for studying vasculogenic and angiogenic mechanisms involved in the pathogenesis of vascular disease, cancer, and diabetic retinopathy. In addition, endothelial signaling in developmental organogenesis appears to be universal in vertebrates , making them important for tissue engineering.
Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia  remains a life threatening disease process prevalent among immunosuppressed populations. Mortality is particularly high, up to 8090%, among those patients who require admission to an Intensive Care Unit. Therefore, there is an identifiable group of patients with PcP who would benefit from an improved treatment regimen for PcP, were one available .
One unique developmental feature concerning 5 HT is its transient presence in thalamocortical afferents, particularly those involved in primary sensory circuits . Hence, manipulations of brain 5 HT levels either through genetic means or perinatal drug treatments have been shown to affect not only cortical organization related to barrel formation, but also behaviors associated with aggression and/or anxiety related behaviors . These findings suggest that abnormal development of the 5 HT system could lead to altered wiring of neural circuits and inappropriate behavior .
Rheumatoid arthritis  is a systemic inflammatory disease of unknown etiology characterized by destructive joint disease, significant morbidity and increased mortality . There are numerous genetic factors associated with increased risk for RA including HLA alleles containing the shared epitope , PTPN22 polymorphism, and others . These genetic factors are thought to predispose individuals to the development of autoimmunity, likely due to genetic and environmental interactions .
Low back symptoms were the most common cause of work impairment among a cohort of North Carolina commercial fishermen . Risk factors for prevalence of low back symptoms include age, length of time in the occupation, type of fishing and gear, job title, and fishing part time or working more than one job . However, the importance of these factors from a prevention standpoint is limited by the degree to which they are modifiable.

They are at heightened risk for numerous mental health problems, including depression, anxiety, and disruptive disorders , , as well as for a variety of chronic medical illnesses, including cardiovascular disease, arthritis, and some cancers , . This is the notion of resilience, that is, individual characteristics or situational processes that can buffer those facing adversity from poor outcomes , .

Despite a wide variety of reversible hormonal contraceptive methods available for women , no new reversible contraception options have been developed for men since the invention of condoms over 400 years ago. Several trials have explored the role of allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation performed in first remission,. Others have tested the efficacy of dose intensification of several of the drugs that are standard components of ALL regimens,.
Family relationship quality predicts medical outcomes in stroke , end stage renal disease , and heart failure . Important aspects of family relationships include the extent to which family members are critical or blaming of each other, and the extent to which family members can express their feelings with each other and confide in each other. Family relationships may be particularly important in COPD given the high prevalence of depression and anxiety among individuals with COPD .

Using similar experimental approaches, the results of recent studies argued that the chromosomes were arranged similarly in maternal and daughter cells , or that positions of chromosomes in daughter nuclei were conserved only partly and in most cases largely differed from the positions seen in mother cell nuclei  . While the biomedical effectiveness of antiretroviral therapy  for HIV/AIDS is well established , far less is known about the “social effectiveness” of ART for adults in sub Saharan Africa. Social effectiveness can be defined as a patient’s contribution to household welfare after initiating ART, as compared to what their contribution would have been in the absence of HIV infection. One primary way that working aged adults contribute to household welfare is by generating income in either the formal or informal sector.
The immediate early gene  Arc/Arg3.1  was identified as a hippocampal transcript strongly induced by seizures and synaptic plasticity inducing electrical stimulation in the rat hippocampus . Hippocampal Arc/Arg3.1 transcripts are induced during exploration of a novel environment in a subset of context activated pyramidal neurons , and the levels of Arc/Arg3.1 expression correlate with learning in hippocampal dependent spatial tasks . Arc/Arg3.1 induction has also been employed for mapping neural activity in several cortical and subcortical areas in the rodent brain.

Although 80% 90% of patients initially respond to first line chemotherapy agents carboplatin and paclitaxel, less than 1015% remain in complete remission and most patients eventually recur with chemoresistant tumors . Neural differentiation of embryonic stem cells  has become a prolific area of stem cell research. This can be attributed to molecular embryologic studies of the developing nervous system which have resulted in major discoveries defining the mechanisms underlying developmental processes and because ESCs readily differentiate into neural lineages in vitro , . Coupled with the therapeutic potential of these cells, the ability to efficiently produce pure populations of various neural subtypes is a promising goal, especially for therapeutic purposes.

Historically, GPCR signaling was considered linear and drug development programs focused on the discovery of ligands that would either activate or block receptor function. However, this simplistic view has gradually evolved along with new pharmacological data.
Cancer cells can become growth factor independent through the activation of pathways that mimic growth factor signaling and inhibition of these pathways has proven an effective way to eliminate cancer cells. The BCR Abl fusion protein, for example, can maintain glucose uptake and cell survival. Tyrosine kinase inhibitors  are also used to treat a number of solid cancers, including breast, colorectal and lung cancer, but development of resistance to these small molecule inhibitors represents an obstacle to long term remission.

As similar changes are also apparent during vascular morphogenesis and modeling of the embryonic vasculature  , we postulated that the control of cell growth and maintenance following vascular injury may share similar signaling patterns . Hedgehogs  are a class of 19 kDa morphogens that interact with heparin on the cell surface through an N terminal basic domain and are tethered to the surface through cholesterol and fatty acyl modification .
Symptomatic seizures in infancy are associated with later life epilepsy and cognitive deficits. There is no known causal relationship between epilepsy and autism, including in acquired models of epilepsy. However, the high association of these disorders suggests they may share anatomical and molecular mechanisms, especially during brain development .
Social phobia is characterized by pervasive social timidity, social distress and avoidance, and for some individuals, difficulty in basic social discourse. Although different research clinics use somewhat different criteria by which to define subtypes, the distinction can be made reliably .
