Aromatase, a member of the cytochrome P450  protein superfamily  is a unique gene product of the CYP19 gene. Aromatase regulates the last step of estrogen biosynthesis, aromatizing the A ring of androgens such as androstenedione and testosterone to estrone and estradiol respectively. Aromatase is expressed in various organs including the brain .
The umbilical ring and/or abdominal wall are hypothesized to be compromised by vascular disruption of the omphalomesenteric artery, resulting in herniation of the bowel outside the abdomen . Evidence in support of this hypothesis comes from both human embryology and clinical observations. Normal re routing of the blood supply in the area of the developing abdominal wall results in an asymmetry, as the left omphalomesenteric artery undergoes apoptosis and the right side is retained .
The prognosis of acute internal carotid artery  occlusion may be difficult to predict. Patients with acute ICA occlusion may be asymptomatic or experience neurological effects ranging from transient ischaemic attack to devastating stroke. One possible explanation for such variation is that relatively good prognoses may be associated with robust collateral circulation from other arterial sources .
The ductus arteriosus is a prostaglandin sensitive fetal vascular shunt. Timely closure of the ductus arteriosus after birth is critical for successful postnatal circulatory adaptation. The relative contribution of each COX isoform and whether the prostaglandins that act on the ductus are derived from the circulation or from the ductal wall are not fully resolved.
Prior studies have demonstrated the importance of FFR, with identification of ischemia causing lesions associated with worsened survival, and with FFR guided revascularization enhancing event free survival . By invasive and pathologic studies, high risk anatomic plaque features have been established as fundamental to the processes of acute coronary syndromes  and sudden cardiac death . For these lesions, several common characteristics are shared, including plaque burden, thin cap fibroatheroma, positive arterial remodeling, necrotic cores, spotty calcifications, and macrophage infiltration .
Crohn's disease  is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease that often has its onset during young adulthood and is characterized by a protracted course of relapses and remission, . Advances in medical therapy over the past two decades has significantly revolutionized the management of CD and improved our ability to achieve remission, and reduce the number of surgeries and hospitalization . Yet, nearly half the patients with CD continue to require at least one surgical resection during the course of their disease.

Conditional knockout mice, lacking Gata4 in specified cardiomyocytes, and transgenic mice expressing only 30% of the normal levels of GATA4 in the heart, both display atrioventricular canal defects and a hypoplastic ventricular myocardium.
It is generally appreciated that the intrinsic mechanical properties of soft tissues provide insight into a variety of disease processes including liver fibrosis , breast lesions , myocardial infarction , hypertension , diastolic dysfunction , arterial stiffness , and muscle function . While in clinical practice the assessment of tissue stiffness using palpation has proven effective, this technique is limited due to its superficial and subjective nature. In response to the need for improved methods of assessment of tissue elasticity, several imaging based approaches have been developed.
Serine and glycine are nutrients that fuel metabolic pathways including one carbon metabolism and sulfur metabolism. They also include polyamine synthesis and work in the maintenance of redox status as determined by glutathione biosynthesis and NADPH production . The network also provides the substrates for methylation reactions that may have relevance to maintaining cellular epigenetic status  .
Stress incontinence and pelvic organ prolapse are highly prevalent conditions which are often managed surgically. Since the introduction of the tension free mesh slings in the late 1990’s for incontinence and the subsequent development of vaginal mesh procedures for pelvic organ prolapse, the surgical management of both conditions has increased substantially. With these recent changes in surgical practice, an assessment of the lifetime risk of surgery for stress incontinence and pelvic organ prolapse is necessary to understand the overall public health impact and burden of pelvic floor disorders.
Differentiated epithelial and endothelial cells have strong attachment requirements, presumably to prevent cellular vagrancy and consequent tissue disorganization. During transformation, cells lose such anchorage context and not only survive but also proliferate without attachment to solid matrix. Certain pathways downstream from integrins may influence detachment signals.

The metabolic syndrome is characterized by a) central obesity, b) atherogenic dyslipidemia , c) hypertension, d) insulin resistance or glucose intolerance, e) a prothrombotic state, and f) a proinflammatory state.
In the developing retina, neurogenesis begins in the central retina as newly differentiated neurons signal to the adjacent retinal progenitor cells  to initiate a central to peripheral wave of neurogenesis. Subsequently, the later cell types, bipolar cells, rod photoreceptor cells, and Müller glial cells, are produced. This is especially true for RGCs, for which extensive analysis has revealed the transcriptional network circuitry critical for RGC specification and differentiation .

HER 2/neu is a 185 kDa transmembrane protein homologous to epidermal growth factor receptor . It is overexpressed in several cancers of epithelial origin including breast, colorectal, ovarian and pancreatic carcinomas . Among all the HER 2/neu class I epitopes, p369 377  has been studied extensively .
Allergic disease, including food allergy, allergic rhinitis , atopic dermatitis , and asthma, is one of the major causes of morbidity worldwide . Its prevalence has been rising in many parts of the world and the global prevalence differences are lessening . As such, the economic burden of these diseases is substantial in both developed and developing countries .

WKY rats also exhibit reduced open field activity , reduced active coping in the forced swim test , and increased basal acoustic startle response magnitudes  . On the other hand, WKY rats exhibit enhanced acquisition of passive  and active lever press  avoidance; enhanced avoidance acquisition could result from enhanced acquisition of stimulus stimulus associations.
Clinical applications of 13C MRS have been explored in a wide range of human brain diseases from the new born to advanced age . 13C enriched glucose and acetate have been used to distinguish neuronal from glial metabolism and, with low power  decoupling within the FDA limits of power deposition , previous no go frontal areas of the brain have become accessible to 13C MRS examinations . Data analyses based on complex, steady state multi enzyme models have been replaced by simpler single step calculations, to distinguish between normal and diseased states of neurons .
Unremitting bacterial infection increases nitrogen excretion resulting from an imbalance between rates of whole body protein synthesis and degradation . Although sepsis induced changes in protein balance can be detected in several tissues, much of the urinary loss of nitrogen and increased protein turnover is attributable to the erosion of muscle mass . The mechanism by which prolonged sepsis leads to muscle atrophy involves both a decreased rate of protein synthesis and increased the rate of proteolysis .

PSGs are highly glycosylated, with N linked glycosylation composing approximately 30% of their molecular mass . To date, 17 murine Psg genes  have been identified.
Osteocytes can detect mechanical loads by sensing fluid flow through the lacunar canalicular network , an interconnected pore system surrounding osteocytes and their processes . Osteocyte derived sclerostin negatively regulates osteoblastic bone formation through the Wnt signaling pathway . OPG binds to RANKL and prevents RANKL from binding and activating receptor activator of nuclear factor κB  on osteoclasts and osteoclast precursors .
Recently, it has been estimated from national data that 20.6% of full time college students meet DSM IV criteria for an alcohol use disorder  and 7.9% meet criteria for a drug use disorder . Researchers have long advocated for early identification, screening, and intervention with high risk students as part of a comprehensive approach to reducing problems related to substance use . Screening instruments that have been suggested for use, such as the CAGE , DAST , or diary methods to track consumption levels, focus on the assessment of drinking behavior per se .
One of the most effective strategies to improve BP control involves team based care that includes collaborative care or independent management by a pharmacist. We conducted a systematic review of the literature that included 37 controlled clinical studies of either nurse or pharmacist assisted BP management. The reduction in SBP when a pharmacist was involved was 9.3 mm Hg and 4.8 mm Hg in studies involving nurses.

The cellular mechanisms underlying nigral dopaminergic degeneration associated with various pathological conditions such as Parkinson’s disease  and methamphetamine abuse are yet to be clarified. ,  Oxidative damage triggered by reactive oxygen species  such as hydrogen peroxide  can activate a series of signaling events ultimately leading to programmed cell death, or apoptosis. Caspase 3 represents a convergence point for both mitochondria dependent and  independent pathways in cells undergoing apoptotic cell death in response to oxidative stress or to various dopaminergic neurotoxins.
Sickle cell disease  is a chronic disease associated with a diversity of serious pathophysiologic complications including, but not limited to, chronic hemolytic anemia, stroke, acute chest syndrome, pulmonary embolus, pulmonary hypertension, cholecystitis, hepatic and splenic sequestration, retinal detachment and hemorrhage, aseptic necrosis of the joints, priapism, iron overload, and chronic leg ulcers. Patients with SCD often present to the emergency department  with acute pain crisis, often referred to as a vaso occlusive crisis . It is common for both SCD patients and providers to be frustrated by ED care.
Cancer is the leading cause of death in U.S. and many developed countries. The number of global cancer deaths is projected to increase 45% from 2007 to 2030 . Several different approaches have been implemented for prevention, early detection, diagnosis and treatment of various types of cancers.
There is increasing evidence to suggest that size at birth and childhood growth are important determinants of body composition and chronic disease in later life . Although maternal birth weight, smoking, exercise levels and adiposity in pregnancy have all been shown to influence bone mass at birth , less is known about the prenatal determinants of other aspects of neonatal body composition such as fat and lean mass, and the extent to which these effects are modified by the early postnatal environment. Many epidemiologic studies of obesity have used BMI as the main outcome measure but interpretation of BMI is difficult because it reflects both fat and muscle mass.
The five subunits comprising AChRs are 2αs, β, δ and γ/ε. The embryonic type γ is replaced by the adult type ε as the synapse matures  . A group of genetic disorders have mutations in genes coding for components of the NMJ.
Oxidative stress, defined as an imbalance between the production of reactive oxygen species  and the antioxidant defence system, plays an important role in the pathogenesis of insulin resistance and type 2 diabetes mellitus  . Attention has therefore been focused on the potential protective role of dietary antioxidants in the aetiology of impaired glucose tolerance and T2DM . However this is not consistent with findings of randomized controlled trials of antioxidant vitamin supplements, that failed to show benefits of increasing antioxidant intake .
The presence of epileptiform abnormalities on electroencephalogram  augments clinical information about seizures and helps with both diagnosis and classification. Since the first EEG does not always show an epileptiform abnormality and serial EEGs may all be normal , multiple EEGs are often recorded in an effort to find an epileptiform abnormality that may guide treatment, particularly if patients continue to experience seizures . Most previous studies of the yield of epileptiform abnormalities on EEG in new onset seizures have evaluated a single EEG.
These results are consistent with Bernstein's intuition that task performance typically involves “repetition without repetition” . Although the role of motor abundance in decreasing performance variability  has been emphasized in past work , we hypothesize that a major advantage is that it facilitates the performance of multiple tasks, or the solution of multiple task constraints, simultaneously with minimal interference among tasks or among components of a given task . In this paper, by “stabilization” of a performance variable, we imply relatively low variability across trials compared to what one could expect if all elemental variables affecting that performance variable varied independently of each other .

Patients with less severe enzyme deficiencies generally develop symptoms later in life, with skeletal muscle weakness, especially of respiratory musculature, but not cardiac failure . Pathological analyses have correspondingly focused on glycogen accumulation in skeletal muscle and heart, but several of the early  and more recent  pathological accounts describe abnormalities also in the CNS and peripheral nervous system .
Poly  based hydrogels are currently being investigated for a myriad of biomedical applications, including drug delivery, surface modifications, diagnostic devices, and tissue engineering due to their appeal as a hydrophilic and cytocompatible biomaterial as well as the range of physicochemical properties that can be achieved to meet the needs of the application . These materials are of particular interest for tissue engineering applications because of their ability to mimic the extracellular matrix of tissues and direct the growth of neo tissue within a three dimensional architecture ,. Many tissue engineering strategies involving hydrogel scaffolds have taken advantage of their high water content to deliver a variety of bioactive molecules and encapsulated cells to promote tissue regeneration ,.
The ability to track drug delivery and disposition is critical to the development and assessment of new therapeutic agents. The underlying assumption in this approach for soluble agents is that sequestration of the agent at the intended site of effect is driven by concentration gradients in the blood, interstitial space, or tissue of interest . The recent emergence of new platforms and paradigms for drug delivery with the use of high payload, molecularly targeted nanoparticle drug/gene carriers represents a challenge to the application of these conventional modeling approaches.
The ability to rapidly change the velocity and direction of whole body center of mass is a fundamental locomotor skill in most sports. In fact,  identified agility as the best variable to discriminate between a group of elite and sub elite soccer players. Thus, identifying factors that influence proficiency of this motor skill could be useful for the development of training programs aimed at improving sport performance .
In endochondral bone development mesenchymal condensates differentiate into chondrocytes that proliferate to form and enlarge the bone structure . They express predominantly type X collagen , attract blood vessels and induce adjacent perichondrial cells to become osteoblasts, leading to the formation of a bone collar. This region of chondrocyte proliferation and maturation adjacent to the PS is often called the fetal growth plate.

TheBCL 2 family is divided into proapoptotic and antiapoptotic members that share BCL 2homology  domains. Nur77 is an orphan nuclear receptorthat interacts with the BCL 2 N terminal loop region and induces a BCL 2conformational change .

Optimal recovery of cerebral blood flow  has been implicated as a critical factor in determining neuronal survival after asphyxial cardiac arrest  in infants and children. CBF after CA is well described in adult animal models; however there are limited data on CBF after pediatric asphyxial CA. In adult CA models CBF after CA is phasic in nature, with global hyperemia present for 15 30 min after return of spontaneous circulation  characterized by CBF 2 3 times higher than baseline, followed by delayed hypoperfusion that occurs after 15 30 min and continues for several hours after ROSC  .

The stem cell niche is essential in the maintenance and differentiation of stem and progenitor cells in vivo . Supporting stromal cells within this microenvironment not only provide a structural scaffold but also communicate with stem cells to support a balance between long term survival and differentiation. Indeed, the first demonstrated derivation of spermatogonial stem cells in vitro could be achieved only after the addition of certain growth factors, including glial cell line derived neurotrophic factor , which is produced by Sertoli cells , epidermal growth factor, and basic fibroblast growth factor  .
Prominent among these is an increased risk for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder  and other non clinical cognitive issues in children of smoking mothers, suggesting that a component in tobacco can adversely affect neurodevelopment . Of the approximately 4000 substances in tobacco , nicotine is a known neuromodulator, with psychoactive properties , likely due to the widespread expression of nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  throughout the developing central nervous system  . A number of methods of administration during pregnancy and the early postnatal period have been employed in rodents to assess the potential of nicotine to alter neurodevelopment .
Taxol disrupts microtubule dynamics by promoting tubulin polymerization and stability, which leads to cell cycle arrest at the G2/M phase, activates mitotic spindle checkpoint, and results in apoptotic cell death . However, despite a remarkable response of initial treatment with Taxol, progressive diseases eventually develop in most patients. Therefore, better understanding of the molecular mechanism of Taxol resistance and strategies to overcome Taxol resistance are urgently needed for effective and individualized chemotherapies .
Trichomonas vaginalis is a sexually transmitted protozoan that causes vaginitis in approximately 2050% of infected women, and non gonococcal urethritis in a small percentage of infected men. Most other cases are asymptomatic. ,  We previously hypothesized that this lack of specific symptoms might facilitate persistent and undetected trichomonosis  in men, thereby providing T. vaginalis with greater opportunity to ascend to the prostate than other more symptomatic sexually transmitted agents.
Strikingly, low and middle income developing countries have accounted for 84 % of suicides . Suicide is a well recognised public health challenge ranking as the second leading cause of death for the 1519 years age group, and one of three leading causes of death in the most economically productive 1544 year age range . Experts emphasize the importance of a diathesis stress explanation in theoretical formulations of suicide across the lifespan with predisposing biological factors , pre morbid personality , cognitive vulnerability , and exposure to negative life events , and co occurring psychiatric and physical disorders  .

Identification and characterization of these important interactions in protein structures may aid in understanding key aspects of protein folding, molecular recognition, and drug design.

In particular, the financial burden is becoming a more urgent concern for our field as insurance reforms limiting the reimbursement for these “preventable” complications become more common. These inherent limitations of traditional transgenic or gene targeting approaches may be overcome by using constructs which provide spatial or temporal control over transgene expression. Notably, the Cre/loxP system is used in mice to allow for conditional activation or inactivation of mutations. Any genetic sequence of interest, if flanked by loxP sites, can be subsequently removed in the cells which express Cre recombinase .
Neuromyotonia is defined as persistent muscle contraction following voluntary movement, resulting from hyperexcitability of the peripheral nerve and not the muscle itself. More recently, a patient with a homozygous H112N variant was also described . HINT1 mutations were also identified in patients with distal hereditary motor neuropathy, a related disorder with distal motor axon degeneration, but without neuromyotonia, indicating clinical variability, but a common theme of predominantly motor involvement  .
Voltage gated ion channels are multi functional . VGSCs isolated from mammalian neurons are heterotrimers, composed of a single α subunit, one non covalently linked β subunit , and one disulfide linked β subunit  . Co expression of β with α subunits in heterologous systems shifts the voltage dependence of activation and inactivation, changes the rates of inactivation and recovery from inactivation, and increases channel cell surface expression .
Nevertheless, more information about sequelae of mild stroke is necessary . We explore one of these issues, namely, the potential cognitive sequelae of self reported mild stroke in older adults . Mild stroke may be characterized by the same neurological factors used to document and measure neurological damage in severe stroke.
Neurons of the major pelvic ganglia  innervate urogenital organs and components of the lower bowel. The MPG are unique autonomic ganglia in that they contain both sympathetic and parasympathetic postganglionic neurons and receive input from the lumbar sympathetic and sacral parasympathetic nerves. However, the presence of a diversity of neurotransmitter and neuromodulator substances indicates neurotransmission through the ganglion might be more complex than originally perceived .
It is well recognized in economic theory, as well as in everyday life, that purchasing decisions are influenced by price and disposable income. This principle applies to the sale of cigarettes as it does other consumer goods. Studies have repeatedly illustrated that a 10% increase in the price of cigarettes typically results in a 2.55% decrease in cigarette consumption.
Through interactions with its substrates, calpain plays an important role transducing signals of cell migration, differentiation, and proliferation . Because VEGF mediated angiogenesis is at least partially attributed to endothelial cell production of nitric oxide  ,, we became interested in whether some of the undiscovered roles of calpain deal with VEGF production of NO• and angiogenesis. Changes in membrane and cytosol specific activities of calpain, and their relevance to downstream signalings, were studied in depth .
The two emerging techniques for the study of fetal brain function in utero are functional magnetic resonance imaging  and fetal magnetoencephalography . This is because whole abdomen recordings were impossible before fMEG, and also, no coregistered 3D ultrasound  imaging technique was available. In this field, 3D MRI recordings are used to generate a conducting sphere model of the head.
The likelihood of having periodontal disease among people with diabetes is about 3 times greater than for people without diabetes . In addition, dry mouth is a common diabetic phenomenon . Frequent daily intake of refined carbohydrates may also contribute to a higher incidence of caries among people with diabetes .
Peripartum hysterectomy, a surgical procedure performed at the time of delivery or in the immediate postpartum period, although a rare event, is associated with increased morbidity and mortality. Moreover, it is considered one of the most devastating complications in obstetrics resulting in high costs to the health care system, and adverse outcomes for women desiring to maintain their fertility. Many studies have estimated an incidence rate in the US between 0.8 and 1.5 per 1,000 deliveries,, although, the incidence has been reported to be as high as 2.28 per 1,000 deliveries.
Minority families often reside in neighborhoods with few supermarkets or alternative healthy food options , making fresh produce difficult to obtain. This qualitative study identified factors influencing fruit and vegetable shopping and use of alternative healthy food options . Forty eight minority women with children completed interviews regarding food shopping habits and use of and attitudes toward alternative healthy food options.
Glioma is one of the most fatal tumors and its etiology is largely unknown . The biological mechanism behind this association is thought to be elimination of pro cancerous cells by increased immuno surveillance due to the hyperactive immune state seen in atopy. Currently, the number of studies that have evaluated the association between glioma and atopy history is less than a dozen .
While tuberculosis  control programs have made major strides in reducing TB incidence in adults in many high burden countries, assessing program impact on pediatric TB remains difficult because of the lack of a dependable “gold standard test”. Technical and economic factors compound these diagnostic problems. The best available diagnostic tests are costly, while traditional methods are slow and insensitive.
It is likely that environmental cues contribute to social and habitual tobacco use. Mesolimbic DA release is believed to underlie the primary reinforcing effects of drugs of abuse including nicotine . In particular, DA release in the nucleus accumbens  shell is thought to regulate motivation for drug and natural rewards .
Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease , a hepatic manifestation of the metabolic syndrome, and NASH, a progressive form of NAFLD, are two of the most common chronic liver diseases in the United States and worldwide. These two pathological states have been shown to progress to cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma. The successful prevention and treatment of NASH relies on the ability to identify vulnerable subpopulations and detect the disease early and greatly depends on a better understanding of the underlying molecular mechanisms involved in NASH pathogenesis.
Carcinomas are epithelial cancers that constitute 90% of human malignancies and are fatal due to their metastases. No curative therapies are available for patients with metastatic NSCLC, whose median overall survival is approximately 12 months. Metastasis is a complex process whereby neoplastic epithelial cells lose their ability to adhere to each other and to the basal membrane, become motile, penetrate the vascular endothelium, survive passage through the circulatory system, extravasate, colonize sites distant, and generate secondary macroscopic outgrowths.,  Genes that disrupt cell polarity and epithelial architecture contribute to invasive and metastatic phenotypes.
One type of RNA editing involves the conversion of adenosine residues into inosine  in double stranded RNA  through the action of ADAR  . Since the translation machinery reads inosines as if they were guanosines, when it occurs within the coding sequence, RNA editing could result in the synthesis of proteins not directly encoded by the genome. 5 HT2CR is detected exclusively in the central nervous system and plays roles in various physiological and behavioral processes.
Activated protein C  is an endogenous serine protease with anticoagulant, anti inflammatory and cytoprotective activities . Its anticoagulant activity is mediated by irreversible inactivation of the coagulation cofactors, factor Va and FVIIIa . In the central nervous system, activation of the protein C  cellular pathway results in neuroprotection after transient brain ischemia or embolic stroke .
Understanding supervisory turnover is therefore essential . Estimates range from 18.5% to 25% across staffing positions. The degree to which programs experience a “revolving door” with respect to management/supervision is of particular interest because it restricts an organization’s ability to implement and sustain program level change .
Plasma and red blood cell  fatty acid  composition have both been proposed as biomarkers for cardiovascular disease  risk . Previous work from our group has shown that RBC levels of n 3 FAs can distinguish healthy controls from cases admitted to the hospital with an acute coronary syndrome . A major weakness of these types of case control studies is that the marker of interest  is always measured after the event has occurred, and thus a physiological response to the event itself could have altered the marker, making it potentially useful diagnostically, but not prognostically.
Breast cancer  survivors face unique health challenges, such as lymphedema, which may impact their health related quality of life . In BrCa survivors, lymphedema is chronic, progressive swelling that involves the arm, shoulder, neck or torso from physical disruption or compression of lymphatic channels from tumor invasion, surgery or radiotherapy. , Lymphedema is often clinically defined as swelling of at least 200cc by volume or 2cm by circumference measurement of the affected limb compared to the other.
Homeodomain containing transcription factors  were discovered on the basis of their remarkable role in specifying positional information along the body axis, a function widely conserved among metazoans . Subsequently it became evident that Hox proteins regulate many other processes, including sexual development . ABD B also is required for male specific gonadal development in Drosophila, specifying a group of male specific gonadal cells .
Binge eating  and night eating  are behaviors associated with dysregulated eating. Each represents a core behavioral feature in a proposed DSM eating disorder category . Between 9%  and 47%  of individuals seeking treatment for obesity report BE .
Wound classification  has an interesting background. The study results were first published in the Annals of Surgery in 1964 with a further report in 1968., The study introduced wound classification as a way to describe the degree of bacterial or infection load present at the time of surgery. The reported infection rates were much higher than current day experience, with 5.1% of clean, 10.8% of clean contaminated, 16.3% of contaminated, and 28.6% of dirty wound class cases developing infections.
In amyotrophic lateral sclerosis , unlike other motor neuron diseases, both the cortical and spinal components of motor neuron circuitry progressively degenerate . Therefore, bringing effective treatments to ALS requires targeting both the spinal motor neurons  in the spinal cord and the corticospinal motor neurons  in the motor cortex. Viral vectors offer a great tool for gene therapy and replacement studies in CNS .
Antibiotics are the most commonly prescribed medications to children across all age groups. Despite an overall decline in antibiotic prescribing for US children  inappropriate use of expensive broad spectrum antibiotics is rising , which substantially increases health costs, promotes bacterial resistance, and contributes to increasing rates of antibiotic associated adverse effects. Outpatient antibiotic overuse has been correlated with higher rates of antibiotic resistant pathogens  .
Niemann Pick C disease  is a lethal, neuronopathic autosomal recessive neurodegenerative disorder of childhood caused by mutations in the NPC1 or NPC2 proteins, leading to an accumulation of unesterified cholesterol and glycosphingolipids  in lysosomes . About 95% of human NPC disease is caused by mutations in the NPC1 gene . Both NPC1 and NPC2 are required for the proper intracellular lipid trafficking.
CKD progresses through 5 stages; Stage 5 CKD requires renal replacement therapy . From information provided by the National Kidney Foundation, CKD triggers many other healthcare issues such as anemia, cardiovascular diseases, hyperphosphatemia, secondary hyperparathyroidism, and other complications. The five year average mortality rate is ~33% , and the mortality risk increases with disease progression  .
Of the influenza positive specimens, 79% were influenza A viruses and 62% of these were of the H1 subtype . Infected infants younger than six months of age have higher hospitalization and mortality rates than do older children . Complications of influenza infections in infants typically include lower respiratory tract involvement and although these infections occur less frequently than respiratory syncytial virus  infections in infants, they are also a significant cause of wheeze .
Pain interference  refers to the degree to which pain limits or interferes with individuals' physical, mental and social activities. This domain is increasingly recognized as important for both understanding patients' experiences and as a key outcome in pain clinical trials . A number of measures of pain interference have been developed including a 9 item scale from the West Haven Yale Multidimensional Pain Inventory  , a 7 item scale from the Brief Pain Inventory , a 6 item Pain Impact Questionnaire  , a 3 item scale from the Chronic Pain Grade , and the 7 item Pain Disability Index .
In musculoskeletal medicine an increasing clinical need exists for bone regeneration and grafting strategies to treat bony voids after spinal fusion, maxillofacial surgery, implant fixation, resection of primary tumors and metastases, or trauma. Autologous bone is commonly used for grafting as it contains many crucial features such as mesenchymal progenitor cells, osteoinductive factors, and an osteoconductive matrix that together support skeletal healing. However, its use is restricted by limited graft availability and donor site morbidity, two major disadvantages that ultimately drive the quest for alternative approaches to efficiently fill any kind of bony defect.
In recent years there has been a growing appreciation for the importance of the mechanical properties of the developing embryo, particularly in the case of tension dependent signaling through adhesion receptors  . Cohesion of the mesendoderm tissue is maintained by cadherin based cell cell contacts across which tensile forces are distributed . These responses are dependent on adhesion of mesendoderm cells to a Fn substrate.
Great strides have been made in reducing incidence and mortality from colorectal cancer  in the United States over the last decade. In addition, mortality rates decreased from 19.0 cases per 100,000 in 2003, to 16.7 per 100,000 cases in 2007. Relatives of patients with CRC are at increased risk of developing the disease.

Traditionally comprising three major families: the Conidae , the Terebridae , and the Turridae s.l. , the superfamily Conoidea is an extremely biodiverse group of venomous marine snails. This treatise on turrids summarized the nine subfamilies and more than 500 genera proposed to belong to the family Turridae.
Adenovirus vectors have garnered significant attention as candidate vaccine platforms due to their large transgene coding capacity and potent immunogenicity. Ad vector based vaccines are being pursued for a number of viral infections, including Ebola , influenza , hepatitis C , rabies  and HIV 1 . Recently we have evaluated an Ad26 vector based vaccine for HIV 1 in clinical trials , and preclinical studies with Ad26 based vaccine regimens in non human primates resulted in partial protection against acquisition of infection as well as virologic control following SIVmac251 challenges .
Mechanical circulatory assist  devices such as ventricular assist devices  are often employed to augment the function of failing ventricles in patients with advanced heart failure. These conditions make platelets more susceptible to shear induced activation, resulting in enhanced coagulation and formation of thromboemboli . Patients implanted with such devices are routinely prescribed antiplatelet and anticoagulant agents to limit such complications .
The increase in resistance of bacterial strains to existing antibiotics is a major public health concern  World Health Statistics 2008. Although initially termed antimicrobial peptides  due to their ability to kill microbes directly, the immunomodulatory properties associated with many of these peptides have resulted in their designation as host defense peptides  . HDPs have received increased interest as antimicrobial therapeutics, because of their antimicrobial activity against a variety of pathogenic bacteria, including those that are resistant to conventional antibiotics .
Onset of bipolar disorder  during childhood significantly affects an individual’s psychosocial development. Moreover, youth with BP are at high risk for suicidal behaviors and completed suicide, substance abuse, and legal problems, and have particularly high rates of health services utilization . Some of the most common comorbid disorders among youth with BP are the anxiety disorders .
Over 28,000 solid organ transplants are performed annually in the United States . Improved survival of transplant recipients in recent decades is due in large part to the effectiveness of current immunosuppressive therapies in preventing organ rejection, but the acute and long term immunosuppression also increases recipients’ risk of a number of malignancies . Epstein Barr virus  is prominent in the etiology of PTLD , but recipient age, variations in pharmacologic immunosuppression, and type of organ transplanted have also been associated with PTLD risk .
In the United States, approximately 39,000 women will be diagnosed with endometrial cancer and over 7,400 deaths will be attributable to this disease . The underlying cause of this racial disparity in endometrial cancer outcome among Black patients with endometrial cancer is felt to be multifactorial  . Population based studies have suggested that inequalities in treatment may contribute to poor survival observed among Black women with endometrial cancer  .
17 allylamino 17 demethoxygeldanamycin  was the first in class HSP90 inhibitor to enter clinical trials in both adult and pediatric patients , and is currently in phase II/III clinical trials in adults. The combinatorial effect of HSP90 inhibitors on multiple oncogenic pathways explains the broad spectrum of anticancer activity of HSP90 inhibitors, and allows them to overcome resistance to various other anticancer therapies . This combinatorial action might also render the probability of cells escaping treatment with HSP90 inhibitors by using alternative resistant pathways less likely to occur.

Importantly, macrophages also function as sentinel cells of innate immunity involved in recognition of microbial pathogens that leads to both activation and regulation of host immune responses to wide ranging microbial pathogens. Innate immune stimulation of monocyte derived macrophages  and related monocyte derived dendritic cells from HIV infected subjects have frequently been reported to show attenuated or altered host cell responses, but these observations are unlikely to represent direct effects since the extent of HIV 1 infection of monocytes in vivo, is estimated to be very low,.
Thermal ablation with radiofrequency  and microwave energies is becoming an increasingly important treatment for unresectable tumors of the liver, kidney, lung, and bone . Prior to use in patients, ablation device performance is typically predicted by computer modeling, or characterized with experiments in ex vivo and in vivo models . The expected size and shape of an ablation zone created by a given device is often based upon these experimental results and utilized to predict clinical performance during human application.
In the absence of stress, p53 levels are low and the protein likely exists in an inactive conformation. It is not surprising that the localization of p53 is tightly controlled and greatly complex . Normally, p53 shuttles between the cytoplasm and the nucleus.

Constructs such as allostatic load aim to capture this multi system impact, and thus are thought to provide a more holistic approach to understanding the biological impact of depression and anxiety. However these models are limited in that they still rely on circulating levels of extracellular biomarkers that are known to vary substantially over the course of the day and be influenced by various acute environmental exposures .
Haloferax volcanii is a halophilic archaeon  commonly isolated from hypersaline environments such as the Dead Sea. This contrasts with the typical biological strategy in which cells accumulate organic solutes and pump salt ions out. Their ranking among some of the earliest life forms and ability to tolerate high doses of UV and radiation have also made them of interest in the field of astrobiology including discussions on the origins of life and survival on Mars.
Recognition memory is supported by the medial temporal lobe , as damage to this brain region across species impairs performance on recognition memory tasks . Studies have consistently demonstrated a role for the perirhinal cortex in this type of memory ; however the role of the hippocampus has been subject to much debate. According to the Dual Process Signal Detection model , recollection is represented by a threshold process, while familiarity is represented by a standard signal detection model based on a Gaussian distribution of memory strength.

Protons in these semisolids have a very broad spectrum and can be selectively saturated by off resonance RF pulses. Using this tissue dependent feature, MT contrast  sequences can produce MTC images with useful diagnostic information.
To effectively prevent and treat ocular NV, a more thorough understanding of the cellular and molecular mechanisms involved in the angiogenic process is necessary . Neovascularization within the eye is often the result of ischemia, which induces tissue hypoxia . Of the growth factors involved in retinal angiogenesis, vascular endothelial cell growth factor  is thought to be a principal mediator .
G6PD is a key component in the pentose phosphate pathway, employed by erythrocytes to handle oxidative damage. Earlier studies generally indicated that male hemizygotes and female homozygotes were protected from malaria ,  although a few authors have suggested that it is female heterozygotes who receive protection  . The 202A/376G G6PD A  allele is considered to be the commonest G6PD deficiency allele in Sub Saharan Africa.
Distraction osteogenesis is an example wherein gradual lengthening of long bones is realized by the sequential application of axial forces. , In order to better understand these clinical effects, researchers have been studying the molecular and cellular responses to mechanical stimulation with increasing intensity. Several other transmembrane proteins capable of mechanical transduction have been recognized since that time.

One of the patients had a family history of sudden cardiac death .

Many choose to treat their patients with either vinorelbine or gemcitabine based on subgroup analyses from first line studies, small phase II trials, or retrospective analyses. Reduced hip abductor strength has been noted in individuals with patellofemoral pain syndrome  compared with non PFPS individuals . Significant associations are found between increased hip adduction angles and elevated knee abduction angles and torques in women, but not in men population . Because of the influence of the proximal controllers to distal segments particularly in the frontal/coronal plane, recent studies focused on strengthening of hip musculature to improve knee joint mechanics.
Autism is a behavioral syndrome defined by the presence of social deficits, abnormalities in communication, the presence of stereotyped, repetitive behaviors, and a characteristic course . Cognitive abilities may range from severe mental retardation to above average intelligence . Clinical heterogeneity is thought to be due to underlying etiologic heterogeneity.
Most of the molecules found in living systems are naturally prepared via the iterative assembly of a limited number of bifunctional building blocks . For example, proteins are usually derived from just 20 amino acids, and DNA and RNA are each made from only 4 nucleotides. In a similar vein, a recent analysis revealed that 75% of all mammalian oligosaccharides are comprised of just 36 monosaccharide units, and an increasingly general platform for automated oligosaccharide synthesis is broadening access to this class of biomolecules as well.
Radiation transport is modeled using, as the name suggests, the well validated Geant4 engine. There is also a tool for tracking optical photons within a scintillation detector. For PET modeling, there is a coincidence sorter which allows pairing of single detection events in a wide variety of ways, including most of those currently used by commercial systems and several others that may be of more interest for research.
Human immunodeficiency virus  infection severely impacts the immune system causing phenotypic changes in peripheral cells altering both innate and adaptive immune responses. Within weeks of infection, during the acute phase, HIV 1 attacks and kills CCR5 expressing CD4+ T lymphocytes in the gastrointestinal tract, which impairs the mucosal layer and integrity of the barrier function . Lipopolysaccharide in the plasma interacts with LPS binding protein and subsequently binds cell surface receptor CD14 prior to transfer to the toll like receptor 4  and MD2, a secreted glycoprotein required for LPS binding to TLR 4 .
Glial innate immune activation is a mechanism that is elicited in virtually all CNS conditions whereby astrocytes and microglia play intricate roles in modulating neuronal function and fate. While there are early studies reporting LPS activation of primary cultures of rodent astrocytes , these studies were often suspected of having “contaminating” microglial cells as the source of LPS responses . A number of approaches have been taken to eliminate microglia in these cultures including the use of L leucine methyl ester with or without anti mitotic agents , liposomal clodronate , transgenic expression of a myeloid specific suicide gene , or repeated passage of the mixed culture .
The current paradigms use thermodynamic and/or kinetic arguments for cryosurvival in mammals, plants and insects. Little is known of the cryoprotection chemistry for microbes, the predominate organisms in cold environments. Microbial communities have been discovered in ice, snow, permafrost, and at the polar ice caps.
Chronic and excessive alcohol intake is associated with increased oxidative stress , a decrease in antioxidant enzymes , and induction of the cytochrome P4502E1  enzyme . Chronic alcohol intake also induces bacterial endotoxin , which is associated with activation of the nuclear factor κB inflammatory pathway, leading to the activation of several proinflammatory cytokines, including tumor necrosis factor α , and increased hepatic infiltration by inflammatory cells. Whereas some antioxidants such as tea polyphenols are protective against alcohol induced changes in the liver , others such as vitamin E have no beneficial effect  .
Tenofovir , a Food and Drug Administration  approved microbicide , has been proven to prevent HIV transmission through the vagina. TFV belongs to the class of anti retroviral drugs under the sub category of nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitors . It is a weak acidic, hydrophilic drug with the molecular weight of 287.213 g/mol.
When transcribing through homopolymeric tracts, RNA polymerases  may perform pseudo templated transcription that results in the synthesis of RNAs whose sequences do not correspond to the encoding template. The mechanism of this phenomenon is unclear and has been attributed to “transcript slippage” . Aside from its significance with regard to the fidelity of gene expression, transcript slippage has also been implicated in termination of transcription at certain signals, as well as other regulatory roles, .
Severe tissue burns are the source of great distress for the subjects affected. On the other hand, the continuous suffering from inflammatory and neuropathic like pain that derive from the burned area  . This may be due in part to the paucity of animal models available for such studies.
In a recent paper by Edelman et al., a novel method for Magnetic Resonance Angiography  was presented based on the off resonance properties of blood after the administration of gadolinium . This results in an off resonance signal behavior: the Larmor frequency shifts, resulting in changes of the sensitivity to frequency selective radiofrequency pulses, which is exploited to generate the angiographic contrast . With short echo times, large flip angles and short TR, the background is well suppressed and the images are relatively insensitive to flow artifacts.
Neutrophils are typically short lived cells that can engage a constitutive programme of apoptosis , leading to down regulation of neutrophil pro inflammatory functions and clearance by phagocytes . There is abundant evidence the balance between neutrophil survival and death by apoptosis is exquisitely regulated by a range of extracellular factors, including host derived cytokines and pathogen derived molecules to which neutrophils are exposed in the circulation and in tissues . Neutrophils are exposed to ATP in a variety of in vivo situations and its role as a signalling molecule in pathophysiological situations is increasingly recognised .
Type I collagen is the most abundant protein in human body and is highly expressed in skin, bone and tendon ; . Fibroproliferative disorders are characterized by excessive and persistent production of type I collagen in parenchimal organs and 45% of all deaths in the USA are attributable to fibroproliferative disorders . The regulation is complex, because type I collagen is a heterotrimeric protein requiring synthesis, modifications and folding of two α1 chains and one α2 chain .
Recognizing a genetically predisposed state has significant clinical importance; however, the ultimate health concern is whether these individuals, if they choose to consume alcohol, escalate their consumption to dangerous levels . As it is difficult to account for environmental variables and the subjects’ alcohol use history in human studies, animal models offer a powerful approach for addressing this issue . Numerous lines of rodents have been selectively bred for divergent alcohol intake .
Stroke incidence and mortality rates are lower in premenopausal women relative to men of the same age, but the incidence of cerebrovascular events rapidly increases in women after menopause, and because women live longer, more women are affected by stroke than men . Changes in stroke risk and sensitivity in women after menopause have been linked to estrogen. Estrogen promotes vasodilation and exhibits vasoprotective properties .
Heart failure afflicts more than 5 million Americans, approximately half of whom have concomitant chronic kidney disease . Both of these diseases are increasing in prevalence,  and both elevate the risk of all cause death.,  The implantable cardioverter defibrillator  has a survival benefit in individuals with left ventricular dysfunction at risk for arrhythmic death;,  however, CKD is associated with an increased risk of non arrhythmic death. Further, patients with advanced CKD were underrepresented in the clinical trials establishing the efficacy and cost effectiveness of the ICD., ,  An association between CKD and death has been observed in the general population,  as well as among primary prevention ICD recipients.,  A graded relationship between CKD severity and death has also been observed in the general population and high risk cohorts.
Following contact with the presumptive lens ectoderm, the OVs invaginate to form the optic cups . The inner layers of the OCs, contain the retinal neuroepithelium. However, the molecular mechanisms that underlie the postulated competence states of the RPCs remain largely elusive  .
Perinatal hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy  continues to be an important cause of cerebral palsy and neurodevelopmental delay and pediatric neurologists may be called upon to prognosticate in this clinical setting . Therapeutic hypothermia is now widely used in term neonates with moderate to severe [HIE as several large trials have shown that cooling within 6 hours lowers mortality and lessens major neurodevelopmental disability at 1824 months of age with a relative risk reduction of 0.76  . As in non cooled infants, perinatal MRI is widely used as a short term surrogate outcome measure, and as a biomarker of the treatment efficacy of cooling .
Sudden death in children is a relatively uncommon but devastating problem. There are few prospective population based studies and the annual incidence is poorly defined. Existing retrospective death certificate based studies suggest that the annual incidence of sudden death in US children ranges between 0.8  6.2 per 100,000 population .
Biological tissues rely on complex interactions between different cell types to function. This has allowed the creation of stripes, islands, and other patterns of tissue for the investigation of cellcell interactions or geometrical dependencies. The limitation of these methods was that patterning was often irreversible for the duration of an experiment.
Bacterial infections of the urinary tract, caused predominantly by type 1 fimbriated uropathogenic E. coli , are the second most common human bacterial infection. Over 90% of the luminal surface of the superficial umbrella cell layer of the bladder urothelium is covered by rigid looking plaques , which are 0.3 1 μm in diameter and consist of two dimensional crystals of hexagonally packed 16 nm particles  composed of four integral membrane proteins, the uroplakins . We and others have shown that the 16 nm uroplakin particles have 6 inner and 6 outer structural subdomains,  and that each of these subdomains contains a cylindrical 4 helix bundled tetraspanin uroplakin  in association with a single pass transmembrane uroplakin .
Osteocytes, the most abundant cells in bone, are believed to serve as mechanical sensors and as modulators of other bone cells during bone adaptation and remodeling . Recent evidence suggests that osteocytes play more active roles in bone physiology through matrix maintenance and modification and the regulation of systemic phosphate metabolism . These interconnected osteocytes are encased within the lacunar canalicular pore system   where they may detect external mechanical loading in terms of substrate deformation, load induced fluid flow, pressure, as well as secondary signals such as streaming potentials and chemo transport  and subsequently transduce biochemical response signals to other osteocytes or effector cells either intracellularly via gap junctions  or extracellularly via the pericellular space .
Infected women can pass the virus on to their baby during pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding, but programs for the prevention of mother to child transmission of HIV  have been proven effective if adhered to correctly . CBIs often share common elements of providing information about medical care systems and helping participants learn how to identify problems, create and use social support systems, overcome environmental barriers, and acquire and maintain coping skills  . Mothers living with HIV  in South Africa are in need of education and psychosocial support.
Melatonin  is an indoleamine involved in biochemical regulation of the circadian rhythms and other biological functions throughout the body . Melatonin is also synthesized in extrapineal sites that include retina, Harderian glands, gut, ovary, testes, bone marrow, lens and skin . In mammals, melatonin metabolic degradation occurs either directly at the site of production, or in the liver  proceeding through complex pathways.
Ensuring and improving the quality of nursing home  care is a primary concern of the federal and state governments, policy makers, and consumers . In addition to government regulations which set minimum criteria of care , and the national quality improvement activities by Quality Improvement Organizations , NH quality report cards have played an important role in the national strategy of market driven quality improvement . Currently, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid  maintain a website entitled “Nursing Home Compare” that publishes outcome measures derived from resident health assessments.

Children with autism tend to manipulate toys or objects in a rigid or stereotyped manner  and less often spontaneously initiate creative symbolic play activities . They are more likely to use pointing and attention skills to regulate others’ behaviors rather than to share interest  . There are few randomized controlled trials  in which joint attention and play skills have been examined as outcomes of the intervention although the intervention may have focused on these core areas of development .

Prion diseases are fatal neurodegenerative disorders of humans and animals that uniquely present as sporadic, genetic, or infectious maladies . These diseases are caused by prions, which are formed from the conformational conversion of a ubiquitous and noninfectious isoform of the prion protein  to disease associated and infectious isoforms . Prions are unprecedented pathogens because nucleic acids are not involved in their replication .
Most of our knowledge about plasmid DNA partitioning comes from studies on the large low copy number plasmid R1 . The current model for type II partitioning assumes that ParR binds cooperatively to several repeats of the parC locus while ParM bound to ParR pushes the two newly formed plasmids to the opposite poles of the bacterial cell via ATP dependent polymerization . High throughput experiments have transformed biology and we have reached a time where it is possible to develop comprehensive models of entire biological systems. One example is a mathematical model of the minimal bacterium Mycoplasma genitalium  that integrates genomic, proteomic, and metabolomic data into a fully connected metabolic reaction network. Molecular level whole cell models promise to predict biological phenotypes from physical principles.

There are over 100 HPV types with approximately 30 types associated with genital tract lesions . The incidence of thyroid cancer, the most common endocrine cancer, varies widely by geographic area and ethnicity . Such variation may reflect differences in genetic background, environmental factors, and access to health care . Few risk factors for thyroid cancer have been identified apart from female sex , ionizing radiation in childhood , benign thyroid conditions , obesity , smoking and alcohol consumption .
The past few decades have seen an explosion in the analysis of the components of the meiotic spindle, and clarifying contributions to spindle dynamics of microtubules, molecular motors , chromosomes and other regulatory proteins  . Seminal work provided quantitative analysis of forces that act on chromosomes during cell division in intact grasshopper spermatocytes. The effects of changes in pressure and temperature have revealed the dynamicity of the metaphase spindle and also provided certain thermodynamic parameters.

Similarly, reduced GTPase activity or increased guanine nucleotide release underlies the aberrant signal flow through the MAPK cascade promoted by most NS causing KRAS mutations . In addition, enhanced RAS MAPK signaling has been established in other clinically related conditions, including cardiofaciocutaneous syndrome , which is caused by activating mutations in the KRAS, BRAF , MEK1, and MEK2  genes in approximately 6080% of affected subjects , Costello syndrome , which is caused by HRAS  missense mutations , and neurofibromatosis type 1  and related phenotypes, which are caused by inactivating mutations or deletions of the NF1  and SPRED1  genes  . While the clinical overlap occurring among these disorders and the shared pathogenesis with respect to RAS MAPK signaling justifies their grouping within a disease family, the substantial phenotypic variation observed among and within these conditions as well as the documented phenotypic heterogeneity associated with individual disease genes provide evidence for the diverse potential of individual mutations to perturb developmental processes.

Spinal and bulbar muscular atrophy  or Kennedy’s Disease is an x linked disorder associated with degeneration of the anterior horn motor neurons and dorsal root ganglion cells. The clinical features of motor neuron degeneration resemble amyotrophic lateral sclerosis  with morbidity due to weakness, but SBMA has greater chronicity with a fairly normal life span. This expectation suggests that programs implemented at a higher level of integrity will produce the strongest and most consistent findings . Monitoring how programs are carried out can also provide insight as to components that are critical to intervention success  and the feasibility of implementing the intervention .

The incidence of esophageal adenocarcinoma  has been dramatically increasing over the last 30 years in several regions in North America, Europe, and Oceania. Specifically, EAC incidence has increased 350% since the 1970s in Caucasian men in the USA, which currently results in approximately 10 000 deaths per year. BE has been reported to as much as 612% in patients screened for reflux disease, and in 1025% asymptomatic patients undergoing endoscopy for other reasons., Patients with BE have a 50  to 100 fold increased risk of developing EAC, although the annual incidence of cancer in BE cases is though to be between 0.4% and 0.5%.

Repeated administration of opioids such as morphine results in the development of tolerance and physical dependence. In addition to the common behavioral effect of attenuating morphine tolerance, CB1 and NMDA receptors have been linked neurochemically, vis a vis their influence over and dependence on glutamatergic synaptic transmission, respectively. Specifically, activation of CB1 cannabinoid receptors inhibits excitatory neurotransmission by decreasing glutamate release, thereby reducing activity at glutamatergic NMDA receptors .

Numerous quantitative trait loci influencing microbial pathogenicity have been discovered from the inherent differential susceptibility of inbred mouse strains . We have previously shown that the decreased survival in mice that carry a point mutation in Usp18 results from increased bacterial load in the spleen and liver, an increased inflammatory response and increased type I IFN signaling through STAT1 activation .
Over the past several years, we have performed numerous studies of whole body and organ glucose metabolism with 18F labeled 2 fluoro 2 deoxy D Glucose  in rodent models  of burn injury. Among the most common and striking findings of these studies, were alterations of glucose metabolism in the brain and heart . These results are surprising, since glucose is the primary substrate for CNS energy metabolism and CNS uptake of glucose is maintained in most pathophysiological states .
The global mortality rate among infants and children of less than 5 years of age has declined significantly in recent years. Currently, cotrimoxazole  is used, in developing countries, to treat pneumonia and sepsis in neonates by home based healthcare providers . Between 1988 and 1990, pneumonia specific mortality rate in the control area was 29.1 in 1000 in the postnatal period , whereas intervention managed by community health workers  using the combination of gentamicin and SMX TMP resulted in a reduction in mortality to 17.4 in 1000  .

Several methods are available for lipid analysis, among the most common are those based on chromatography coupled to mass spectrometry . ,  Electron ionization , electrospray ionization , and matrix assisted laser desorption ionization  are well established ionization techniques that allow interrogation of a wide range of lipids.

The heat shock response is an evolutionarily conserved, primitive endogenous cellular defense mechanism characterized by the rapid intracellular expression of a class of proteins collectively known as heat shock proteins . The structure, mode of regulation, and function of Hsps are highly conserved among different species, and Hsps have been identified in virtually all eukaryotic and prokaryotic species examined to date . The release of the 70 kd Hsp72 into the extracellular environment was first reported in cultured rat embryo cells after exposure to increased temperature in the late 1980s .
In people living with HIV/AIDS , disclosure of HIV positive status is positively associated with increased access to key support networks, improvements in mental health, and earlier initiation and better adherence to anti retroviral therapy  . Consequently, those PLWHA that disclose their HIV status have been reported to have delayed disease progression compared to those who have not disclosed, and may also be less likely to transmit HIV to their sexual partner  . Moreover, the adoption and therefore success of many current and anticipated preventive measures including voluntary medical male circumcision , pre exposure prophylaxis , and treatment as prevention  may depend largely on couples discovering HIV sero discordancy via mutual disclosure .

The epidermal growth factor receptor  family plays a key role in normal development and oncogenesis . In the latter case, both EGFR gene amplification and expression of the activated mutant known as EGFRvIII are responsible for constitutive activation and alteration of EGFR signaling . The latter process is often associated with both procoagulant events and proinvasive cellular changes described as epithelial to mesenchymal transitions .
Oral cancer, predominantly oral squamous cell carcinoma , is a high impact disease in the oral cavity, affecting more than 34 000 people in the United States each year . OSCC is usually detected at late stages when the cancer has advanced and therefore results in poor prognosis and survival. Saliva has gained notable attention as a diagnostic fluid because of its simple collection and processing, minimal invasiveness and low costs.
Selecting the best course of action requires a consideration of multiple decision variables, in particular the magnitude of the action’s payoff, its probability of success, and the costs in terms of time and effort . We have shown that single neurons in the anterior cingulate cortex , lateral prefrontal cortex  and orbitofrontal cortex  encode the predicted value of choices based on these three decision variables . However, decision making frameworks highlight that optimal behaviour not only rests upon the valuation of each choice alternative based on these variables , but also on the evaluation of the experienced outcome in order to determine whether adaptations in future choice behaviour are necessary .
During the inflammatory response leukocytes migrate out of the bloodstream by squeezing between tightly apposed endothelial cells of postcapillary venules at the site of inflammation. There are a number of endothelial molecules concentrated at the cell border whose blockade by antibody, knockdown, or genetic ablation has been shown to inhibit diapedesis. These include PECAM , CD99 , ICAM 2, JAM A, and Polio Virus Receptor .
African Americans  have the highest lung cancer incidence and mortality rates when compared to other racial/ethnic groups,  despite reporting lower daily smoking rates and a later onset of smoking. Gender is likely to influence the co occurrence of certain modifiable cancer risk factors among AA smokers. Low SES is also associated with behavioral risk factors and negative health outcomes.
Clinical studies have shown that transmural variation in the contractile function of human myocardium may influence clinical end points . For example, a study by Wachtell et al.  followed 840 patients for 3,914 patient years and showed that shortening of the middle transmural region of the left ventricular free wall is a better predictor of cardiovascular morbidity than the shortening of other regions, or ejection fraction. However, the mechanisms that underlie these results, which may include transmural variation in cellular and molecular properties, are not well understood .
Humans become infected by eating raw or undercooked fish containing the infective stage  which excyst in the gut and migrate via the ampulla of Vater into the bile ducts of the liver where they develop and become sexually mature adult flukes. While many O. viverrini infections are asymptomatic, chronic disease is associated with a range of hepatobiliary complications, including inflammation, epithelial desquamation, goblet cell metaplasia, adenomatous hyperplasia and periportal/periductal fibrosis . The most serious symptoms, however, are cholangitis, cholecystitis and the development of bile duct cancer  .

A variety of approaches are currently used in the study of these interactions, including phage display and yeast based assays, as well as other biophysical and biochemical methods . Most bZIP and bHLH families, such as Jun Fos , Myc Max , and the classic bacteriophage λ repressor and Cro proteins, belong to this class of transcription factors.

Fungal infections are a serious threat to many patient populations, particularly the immuno compromised . Treatment of localized fungal infections, such as osteoarticular infections, can be particularily refractory, perhaps because they take on an abcess like or granulomatous form where they are relatively sequestered from circulating drugs. Infection of medical devices can necessitate their removal.

Current cytotoxic chemotherapy for lung cancer lacks adequate specificity and efficacy, which provides an impetus to develop targeted therapies to achieve greater efficacy with fewer side effects. Unlike traditional small molecular contrast agents or drugs, image visible nanomedicine has the potential to provide simultaneous molecular diagnosis and therapeutic treatment in one system. Such integrated diagnostic and therapeutic designs allow for the timely tailoring of nano medicine modules to address the challenges of tumor heterogeneity and adaptive resistance, which can ultimately help achieve the goal of personalized therapy for lung cancer .
Temporal lobe epilepsy  is a common neurological condition affecting approximately 1% of human population. It is associated with characteristic changes in neuronal circuitry, which render the brain more susceptible to seizure generation . Circuit modification includes hippocampal cell loss and axon sprouting, which have been associated with the development of TLE in animal models and humans .
In the case of lung cancer, hundreds of genetic alterations spanning 18 signaling pathways have been found.,  The large number of mutations make it a significant challenge to identify effective treatments for this disease. It is characterized by poor prognosis and aggressive behavior. New treatments with lower toxicity and greater efficacy are urgently needed .
Community associated methicillin resistant Staphylococcus aureus  pose a significant threat to human health, and infection can manifest as a variety of diseases, including pneumonia, necrotizing skin infections, endocarditis, arthritis, and sepsis . Human polymorphonuclear leukocytes  are the first responders in most bacterial infections, including those due to S. aureus . In general, PMN readily phagocytose bacteria and use a variety of agents stored in granules and PMN generated HOCl to kill ingested microbes .
Individuals with hypertension often elicit exaggerated cardiovascular, hormonal, and behavioral responses to stress . The amygdala is a complex structure in the forebrain that has been linked to modulation of autonomic, neuroendocrine, and behavioral responses to different types of stress, including internal stressors, such as hypotension or inflammation, and external stressors, like physical restraint or fearful social contexts . As a result, it has been hypothesized that dysregulation of the amygdala may predispose an individual to develop hypertension  .
There has been increasing evidence that high insulin levels increase the risk of breast cancer recurrence and death . Three recent studies have observed an approximate triple risk of all cause mortality among women in the highest category of insulin or c peptide, a marker of insulin secretion, relative to the lowest category of insulin or c peptide . Thus, therapies to reduce insulin levels in breast cancer survivors could dramatically decrease breast cancer related deaths.
AA is metabolized by cyclooxygenase into prostaglandins and thromboxane A2, by lipoxygenase into 5 , 12 , and 15 hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acids , by cytochrome P450  ω hydroxylase into 20 HETE, and by epoxygenase into epoxyeicosatrienoic acids  . Prostaglandins E2 and I2 and EETs contribute to antihypertensive mechanisms , whereas prostaglandin precursor PGH2, and 20 HETE contribute to prohypertensive mechanisms . Moreover, inhibitors of lipoxygenase and CYP4A minimize Ang II dependent hypertension .
In nature, fatty acids must be activated before they can be assimilated into various metabolic pathways. The universal mechanism of n fatty acid activation involves conversion of fatty acids to their corresponding coenzyme A  derivatives by a family of omnipresent fatty acyl CoA ligases . The cell envelope of tubercle bacilli is endowed with complex lipids, many of which play an important role in its pathogenesis,.
Animals achieve behavioral goals by decomposing complex tasks into a sequence of steps and resolving each step by the systematic application of behavioral strategies. In the case of navigational behavior, the task is to translocate to preferred surroundings. As animals explore their environments, navigational strategies are utilized at sequential points along their trajectories.

AA amyloidosis results from the aggregation and deposition of serum amyloid A  protein, as fibrils, in peripheral organs leading to dysfunction and death. In humans  and mouse models , SAA protein is elevated due to an inflammatory response. Accumulation of AA amyloid, once induced by AEF injection, is dependent not only on the level and processing of SAA but also the loss or removal of AA once the SAA levels have diminished.

Premature infants are at increased risk for abnormal long term neurodevelopmental outcome. It is well accepted that exposure of immature brain to adverse events that lead to brain developmental disruption or injury during the critical period of perinatal brain development is primarily responsible for abnormal long term development. Although magnetic resonance imaging  is increasingly used to evaluate white matter injury, the use of MRI to evaluate brain myelination in premature infants before discharge from the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit  can be challenging and is often limited in prognostic and research value before term equivalent age  for long term neurodevelopmental outcome.
The human brain has a remarkable ability to efficiently recognize faces. A face presented in the upright orientation, compared to one flipped upside down, is more easily recognized and automatically draws earlier and more sustained attention from healthy infants  and adults . Furthermore, preferential saccades toward an upright face take place within 100 140 ms following presentation , demonstrating that detection of an upright face occurs quite early in visual processing.
The CNS is a favored site for persistence of viruses and other pathogens because T cell surveillance is less effective than in other organs. One commonly studied variant, J2.2 V 1, selected using a neutralizing antibody directed against the surface  glycoprotein , causes an acute, mild encephalitis and a subacute encephalomyelitis, with predominant infection of glia, especially oligodendrocytes. J2.2 V 1 RNA but not infectious virus can be detected in the CNS for up to two years post infection  .
Although there is controversy over whether screening with computed tomography  may reduce lung cancer mortality , there is little doubt that thin slice multi detector row CT  allows the detection of more lung nodules, often of smaller size, than both thicker section CT examinations and chest radiographic images . MDCT examinations of the thorax are now commonly reconstructed at 13 mm slice thickness and often with overlapping intervals , resulting in a large number of images to be interpreted. Fatigue caused by the increased workload of reviewing more images per examination, combined with pressures to be time efficient, may result in false negatives .
Phytochemicals, microbial metabolites, and other natural products and their synthetic analogs have been extensively used for drug development and treatment of various diseases including cancer . Curcumin has also been evaluated in humans, and one of the major problems associated with clinical applications of curcumin is the low bioavailability . The effects of curcumin in various tumor models is highly variable and dependent on both tumor type and cell context.
A common feature of aging related diseases, such as osteoarthritis , is the progressive accumulation of damaged macromolecules leading to cell dysfunction and death. In fact, chondrocytes, the only cell type of adult articular cartilage, are capable of responding to structural changes in the surrounding cartilage matrix but the capacity of the adult articular chondrocyte to regenerate the normal cartilage matrix architecture is limited and declines with aging . As a protective mechanism, safeguard organisms against normal and pathological aging by regulating the turnover of dysfunctional organelles and proteins .

The minimum echo time in UTE imaging is limited only by the hardware transmit/receive switching times, which are generally about 100 µs, but can be as short as 8 µs . Slice selection is achieved by adding together the acquisitions from two excitations with the slice select gradient inverted. Several techniques based on accurate characterization of gradients and k space trajectories have been proposed to compensate for these eddy current distortions .

A number of observational studies suggest that estrogens are effective in reducing age related decline in working memory . Gayle et al. reported differential outcomes between the sexes after a 12 hour fast, showing a more marked ‘rebound eating’ in females than in males when given renewed ad libitum food access; this was accompanied by higher fasted plasma ghrelin levels and reduced plasma leptin . Similar results were also reported by others in human studies . Hence, drastic dietary regimens are unlikely to achieve successful weight loss retention in adult females, because their orexigenic responses will likely lead to compensatory hyperphagia .
