Toll like receptors  are innate immune sensors that recognize pathogen associated molecular patterns and promote immune responses . Nucleic acid binding is a shared characteristic amongst common lupus autoantibody targets.
Bile salts, multifunctional, amphipathic end products of cholesterol metabolism, vary considerably in structure between species . Additional structural variation arises from the configuration of the A/B ring juncture , and the number and orientation of hydroxy groups on the steroid nucleus and side chain. After their synthesis, bile alcohols are esterified with sulfate; C27 bile acids are N acylamidated  with taurine; and C24 bile acids, with taurine or glycine.
The existence of publicly available sequencing data from the NIEHS SNPs Program , SeattleSNPs , HapMap ENCODE  and dense HapMap data  have provided investigators with the means to more rigorously select variants for subsequent association study. The utility of currently available genetic data resources is immense, and many successful findings have resulted . However, it is also important to recognize the limitations, especially with respect to identifying the less common underlying variants that are sure to exist .
HER2 is a member of the epidermal growth factor receptor  family of tyrosine kinases, which includes HER1/erbB1 , HER2/erbB2, HER3/erbB3, and HER4/erbB4. The development of inhibitors targeting various portions of the HER signaling axis is an active and clinically important area of research. In combination with chemotherapy, Tz extends overall survival and slows disease progression in HER2+ breast cancer patients.
Prion infections can be induced by oral challenge  and occur naturally as a result of food borne contamination, as shown for kuru, transmissible mink encephalopathy , bovine spongiform encephalopathy , and variant Creutzfeldt Jakob disease  . vCJD in humans is believed to have been caused by consumption of beef products contaminated with BSE prions. Among such risk factors there may be genetically determined, host encoded modifiers.
Tissue factor pathway inhibitor  is a potent inhibitor of coagulation. When tissue factor  is exposed with damage to the vessel wall, it initiates coagulation via factor VII. TFPI reversibly binds and inactivates factor Xa and the TFPI Xa complex inhibits factor VIIa TF complexes.
Insulin action is essential for growth, development, and metabolism. Upon stimulation with insulin, insulin receptor  stimulates its intrinsic tyrosine kinase activity and phosphorylates IR substrate 1 . A large number of kinases function as IRS1 serine kinases and play negative regulatory roles in insulin action.
Genetic variability in the envelope glycoproteins of HIV 1 is one of the most important obstacles to overcome in the development of an effective vaccine. These glycoproteins form a trimolecular complex of three surface gp120 molecules bound non covalently to three transmembrane gp41 molecules on the virus surface, where the trimer spike mediates cell attachment and subsequent membrane fusion events that allow the virus to enter cells . Neutralizing Abs block virus entry by binding and disabling the trimeric Env spike .
Spatial compounding techniques are widely used in ultrasound to suppress speckle noise and improve image quality . Similarly, shear compounding coherently compounds the shear elasticity maps from shear wave fields that are illuminated by shear waves with different incident angles . Shear compounding improves the signal to noise ratio  of shear elasticity maps because random noise can be suppressed by averaging multiple reconstructed maps.
However, clinical results to date have yielded minimal success , and the reasons for this remain unclear . In mice, DC maturation is characterized phenotypically by upregulation of surface markers such as MHC II, CD80 and CD86. In breast carcinomas, MHC II+ DCs can aid tumor progression by generating IL 13 producing CD4+ T cells .
Reading is a learned ability specific to humans. Given the negative individual and societal implications associated with illiteracy in both children and adults, furthering our understanding of these changes as they relate to typical brain development is necessary, and may be useful for the development of targeted reading interventions . Learning to read is a protracted developmental process supported by the parallel development of multiple cognitive and linguistic skills, including fluency, accuracy, and phonological awareness .
Magnetic resonance spectroscopy  is increasingly used for the noninvasive assessment of cellular metabolism, both in vitro  and in vivo . In the field of cancer, MRS has emerged as a promising tool for characterizing disease and assessing response to therapy . Other studies showed that progression from the normal to the malignant phenotype is associated with an increase in PC and tCho .
The receptor tyrosine kinase HER2 is amplified and/or overexpressed in 2030% of all breast cancers , leading to constitutive proliferative and survival signaling via the downstream Ras/Erk and PI3K/Akt pathways. Amplification or overexpression of HER2 is associated with poor prognosis, and perturbation of HER2 signaling with trastuzumab or lapatinib has led to clinical benefit in HER2 positive breast cancer patients . However, many patients with early stage disease experience tumor recurrence despite adjuvant treatment with trastuzumab, and patients with metastatic disease inevitably develop resistance to anti HER2 therapies .
Due to the majority of literature referring to lipid droplets  and suggestions to adopt this term , LDs will be used as a general descriptor for the cyanobacterial structure central to this work . LDs of all types are proposed to have a neutral lipid core surrounded by a lipid mono layer membrane containing polar or charged headgroups . Alterations of LD dynamics in animal cells have been linked to certain metabolic diseases such as obesity, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and atherosclerosis  .
Magnetic Resonance Imaging , with its high temporal and spatial resolution, high soft tissue contrast, and favorable safety profile, is an excellent imaging modality for repeated noninvasive assessment of biomaterials in vivo. Contrast agents , which increase the relaxation rate of water molecules and can help to increase the contrast between tissues of interest, are widely used in experimental and clinical settings. The efficiency of a MRI CA at relaxing surrounding protons is given by its relaxivity, which describes the change in relaxation rate in the surrounding protons per unit of agent concentration.
Parkinson’s disease  is a chronic neurologic disorder with cardinal motor signs of muscle rigidity, tremor, slowness of movement , and/or paucity of movement . Although classical models of PD pathophysiology focus on altered GPi firing rates, growing evidence suggests that an increased prevalence of burst discharges  may be more important in the pathophysiology of PD . Treatments that ameliorate PD signs  also reduce α  and β  frequency oscillations in spiking  and local field potential  activity  in the GPi.
Behavioral theory posits that environmental context is an important determinant of risk for substance use disorders. This conceptualization of drug abuse has been supported by research demonstrating a robust relationship between availability of alternative, non drug reinforcers and the probability of substance use. Nonetheless, the limited literature that is available on this topic supports the existence of an inverse relationship between drug use and engagement in non drug related activities among samples of college undergraduates , psychiatric outpatients , and adults in outpatient treatment for cocaine dependence .
Cancer testis  antigens are a category of tumor antigens with restricted expression in normal testis and active expression in various types of tumors due to disruption of gene regulation . Currently, approximately 20 CT antigens or antigen families have been identified by T cell epitope cloning, serological expression cloning, and differential mRNA expression analysis . Mage3 has been characterized as a more frequently expressed CT antigen in many tumors, including melanoma, non small cell lung carcinoma, head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, and hepatocellular carcinoma .
Daily oral methadone administration suppresses withdrawal symptoms,reduces relapse potential by blocking heroin induced euphoria, and improves generalhealth outcomes . However, conclusions based on observational group comparisonstudies can be limited due to lack of experimental control, individual differencesin patient populations, and selection biases for groups. To date, only three studies have measured cognitive performance in MMP as afunction of time relative to methadone dosing .
However, those who study visual perception know that surrounding colors have a great influence on color perception . The neural mechanisms of color perception make computations that take into account the spatial layout of the scene as well as the spectral reflectances of the target surface . Parvocellular neurons and their retinal ganglion cell inputs  are chromatically single opponent because they have inputs from two cone types  and middle wavelength  sensitive cones) that are of opposite sign  but each cone input is of one sign across visual space .
Infants in the neonatal intensive care unit  are exposed to a large number of medications, most of which are not labeled for use in infants because clinical trials for safety, dosing, and efficacy of drugs are lacking in this population. Hospitalized infants are often excluded from clinical trials due to ethical concerns and difficulties with recruitment. Furthermore, these hospitalized infants in the NICU are more likely to be pre term, with greater proportions exhibiting renal and hepatic dysfunction.
Since the introduction of cytological screening in the 1940s, the incidence of cervical carcinoma has declined in many developed countries . Considerable efforts have been made to classify preneoplastic and neoplastic lesions , and an association between HPV infection, especially high risk HPV types 16 and 18, and the development of precancerous lesions has been proposed . The fragile histidine triad  gene is a candidate tumor suppressor gene located at chromosome 3p14.2 and encompassing the FRA3B common fragile site .
Proponents of fuzzy trace theory  and dual process models  generally support this view . Thus, improving general thinking among adolescents should promote problem recognition and increase motivation to change. Higher motivation should stimulate better engagement in treatment and educational activities related to change, resulting in a greater capacity to benefit from these activities.
The inbred DBA/2J  mouse strain is a well established model of spontaneously elevated intraocular pressure , progressive glaucomatous loss of retinal ganglion cells , and early damage of RGC axons at the level of optic nerve head, which represent the hallmarks of glaucoma . Pigment dispersion impairs drainage of aqueous humor and results in progressively elevated IOP. Young  D2 mice have normal iris, normal IOP, and normal histological appearance of RGCs and optic nerve .
Of these effects, immune suppression including inhibition of B lymphocyte differentiation into antibody secreting cells is one of the most sensitive consequences of TCDD exposure . The CH12.LX B cell line has provided a useful model in studying the effects of TCDD on Ig expression in B cells and has lead to the identification of a novel transcriptional target of TCDD: the Ig heavy chain  locus . The 3′IgHRR is a large, approximately 40 kb region that lies downstream of the IgH constant regions.
The ε4 allele of the apolipoprotein E gene  is the strongest known genetic risk factor for late onset Alzheimer's disease  . However, inheritance of the ε4 allele of APOE is neither necessary nor sufficient for AD . In addition, APOE 3/ 4 heterozygotes have a higher proportion of apoE E3 than the E4 isoform in plasma whereas the opposite proportion is present in cerebrospinal fluid  .
Although prostate cancer is the most frequent malignancy detected in men in Western Countries, there is a general lack of information regarding the molecular mechanisms involved in the progression of this cancer. To identify the cellular processes and proteins that are involved in the development of prostate cancers, tissue expression microarrays have been used to monitor the changes in gene expression during malignant transformation. Myosin VI contains a N terminal motor domain that binds actin and ATP, a short neck region with bound calmodulin, and a C terminal tail, the cargo binding domain .
Several methods have been established that enable the production of transgenic livestock including pronuclear injection, intracytoplasmic sperm injection , sperm mediated gene transfer and somatic cell nuclear transfer . These methodologies, each having advantages, have all been utilized to create transgenic large animals. In recent years, SCNT has primarily been used due to several advantages such as the lack of mosaic transgene integration  and SCNT is the only method to knock out  a gene in domestic animals   The efficiency of SCNT to create transgenic clones relies heavily on the ability to make genetic modifications to the somatic cell genome prior to nuclear transfer.
Schizophrenia is a debilitating psychiatric disorder that typically strikes in early adulthood, likely due to a disturbance of synaptic maturation or stabilization processes that normally occur in dendritic spines during adolescence . The failure to form and maintain dendritic spines ultimately leads to the reduction of synaptic connections, contributing to the disruption of normal perception, cognition, affect, and motor skills in individuals affected by schizophrenia . Genetic susceptibility and environmental stressors are both major risk factors for schizophrenia.
Many everyday objects involve distinctive manipulations with certain motor movements appropriate to their intended usage. These motion properties are not only involved in manipulating an object physically, but also are intrinsic to the representation of the object itself as we think and talk about it. In an eye tracking study, participants looked at the manipulation related picture  significantly more often than the unrelated ones  or the visual control  when asked to touch the corresponding object on a display in response to an auditory input .
Several chronic inflammatory diseases affecting the gastro intestinal tract, as well as a variety of other organ systems, are associated with alterations in gut microbiota composition, suggesting involvement of the microbiota in these disorders . Hence, ablation of the microbiota via use of germ free mice and/or antibiotic treatment prevents development of disease in mouse models of inflammatory diseases . Somewhat analogous phenotypes, and associated changes in microbiota composition, have also been observed in mice lacking TLR2 and Nod like receptor P6 , .
Hypertension affects 30% of adults in Western populations and predisposes to myocardial infarction, stroke, heart failure and renal failure.,  Despite the prevalence of this disease, the etiology of hypertension in most adults is unknown and perturbations of the central nervous system, the kidney and the vasculature have been implicated. Very recently, Mattson et al. have shown that T cells play a role in hypertension in Dahl salt sensitive rats. Recent data suggests that T cells release cytokines that mediate sodium retention in the kidney and vasoconstriction.
However, traditional affinity based purification with packed bed columns has substantial limitations including long separation times, difficulties in packing large columns, relatively high pressure drops, and slow intra bead diffusion of solutes. , Unfortunately, membrane adsorbers have a low internal surface area relative to porous beads, which leads to a relatively low binding capacity. To overcome this problem, Muller proposed grafting of polymer chains from pore surfaces to allow multilayer protein adsorption, and we and other research groups have achieved high protein binding capacities by modifying the pores of membranes with polymer brushes.
It is hypothesized that maternal obesity leads to developmental programming of excessive weight and adiposity in the offspring . Epidemiological and clinical studies  strongly support this hypothesis, including a recent study of 37,000 individuals that showed greater risk of cardiovascular disease and pre mature death in those born to overweight and obese women . Also, findings from numerous animal models  show that maternal obesity and obesogenic diets program obesity risk in the offspring.
A number of studies that employ strength training regimens have been shown to improve glycemic control, increase skeletal muscle size and strength, and positively change body composition. They suggest that anaerobic exercise may be an effective strategy for the treatment of insulin resistance and type 2 diabetes ,,,. However, the direct effects of exercise on the phenotype of insulin resistant muscle have not been widely studied.
The impact of a postoperative troponin elevation on long term survival after vascular surgery is not well defined. We hypothesize that a postoperative troponin elevation is associated with significantly reduced long term survival . The Vascular Study Group of New England registry identified all patients who underwent carotid revascularization, open abdominal aortic aneurysm repair , endovascular AAA repair, or infrainguinal lower extremity bypass .
Renal nerves also stimulate renin secretion, which increases sodium reabsorption and raises blood pressure via the actions of angiotensin II and aldosterone. Additional effects of the sympathetic nervous system on the renal vasculature may also contribute, by altering renal hemodynamics. Interestingly, however, a little cited study published more than 30 years ago, using micropuncture techniques, reported that acute isoproterenol infusion stimulated salt transport along the DCT.
The Monopolar spindle one binder  family of zinc binding proteins is conserved from yeast to humans . These findings suggest Mob proteins may have important functions within postmitotic neurons, in addition to regulating cell proliferation . While S. cerevisiae has two Mobs, D. melanogaster, C. elegans, and D. rerio have four, and H. sapiens has seven .
Leukocyte telomere length has been inversely associated with multiple diseases including osteoporosis, hypertension, myocardial infarction , coronary heart disease , type 2 diabetes , and Alzheimer’s disease. Growing evidence suggests that telomere length plays a critical role in cellular aging, . As loss of telomeric DNA is impacted by cell division and oxidative stress, and induces cellular senescence, telomere length has been postulated as a biomarker of senescence and human aging in many published studies, .
The today’s longer life expectancies requires improving the durability and the reliability of joint implants, especially for younger patients with greater physical activity . In gait analysis, a realistic geometrical model is the first step towards creating an accurate musculoskeletal model  . In more advanced studies the bone shape has been deformed by scaling with multiple factors .
Recombinant adeno associated virus  is a nonpathogenic parvovirus that has shown great promise for efficient gene delivery to both dividing and nondividing cells of many tissues. It is generally accepted that rAAV genomes integrate at a low frequency and that the majority of genomes remain episomal, as either linear or circular concatamers. These findings suggest that integration may be higher in certain stem/progenitor cell types.
Warfarin  is an anticoagulant with a narrow therapeutic window and wide inter individual response. In 2007, and again in January 2010, the United States Food and Drug Administration approved label changes for warfarin to recommend lower initial doses for patients known to have single nucleotide polymorphisms  in two genes: one affecting warfarin metabolism , and the other affecting sensitivity  . Several pharmacogenetic algorithms incorporate SNPs in both genes , but these SNPs alone explain only one third of the variability in warfarin dose .
The complement system is an essential element of the innate immune system . The lack of any complement component may severely disturb host defenses. A C4 gene duplication is always concurrent with its neighboring genes RP at the 5' region and CYP21 and TNX at the 3' region .
Recent success in crystallization has yielded significant advances in our understanding of GPCR structure and function, with significant implications for drug discovery, as reviewed in ,,. The use of fragments of receptors for biophysical analysis is subject to uncertainty regarding whether the behavior of fragments of membrane proteins is similar to that of the full length protein. Although there are some GPCRs that contain native disulfide bonds important for maintaining the structure and function of the receptor, not all GPCRs contain important disulfides.
Fibrosis is a common feature of many systemic inflammatory conditions and can also occur as a primary progressive disease. A more thorough delineation of the processes that underlie fibrogenesis requires the investigation of novel pathways and cell types . Fibrosis is characterized by accumulation of activated fibroblasts and excessive deposition of fibrotic extracellular matrix proteins, especially type I collagen.
Neurons adapt to changing electrical activity patterns in a plastic manner by up  or down regulating subsequent synaptic signaling. Because it is of opposite polarity to the inducing stimulus, homeostatic plasticity may be an important adaptive response to prevent excitotoxicity or runaway excitation, or simply to keep Hebbian mechanisms  from saturating synaptic machinery . Presynaptically silenced neurons exhibit reduced glutamate release after a period of increased spiking or tonic depolarization.
The nucleus accumbens , a key brain reward region, is important for integrating sensory and cognitive inputs that drive motivationally relevant behaviors in response to environmental stimuli . The NAc also has been implicated in behavioral abnormalities associated with drug addiction and depression. ΔFosB has been proposed as a potential molecular switch guiding the transition from recreational drug use to the chronically addicted state , as its accumulation in NAc enhances rewarding responses to several drugs of abuse.
Two mechanisms controlling reinnervation are acute inflammation , and activation of extracellular matrix  molecules surrounding synapses . Surrounding ECM forms the environment where immune molecules operate, and stabilizes synaptic structure . Among immune mediators of synaptogenic onset, both chemokines and cytokines are critical .
Stroke is the fourth leading cause of death and the leading cause of serious long term disability in adults in the United States . In the late stages after ischemic injury, revascularization also consists of a surge in angiogenesis through endothelial cell proliferation and the subsequent formation of new blood vessels . Thus, post stroke angiogenesis is an important target for therapeutic interventions.
Mitochondrial permeabilization and cyt c release are key events that trigger caspase activation and apoptosis in mammalian cells . Neurons have been shown to strictly inhibit caspases by the X linked Inhibitor of Apoptosis Protein  and by the maintenance of a highly reduced cellular environment that prevents cyt c oxidation and restricts its pro apoptotic activity . However, the exact fate of cytosolic cyt c in these situations when mitochondria are permeabilized but the cells survive remains unknown .
Most semaphorins bind directly to plexins to activate plexin mediated signal transduction, but class 3 semaphorins, however, do not appear to bind plexins directly. Neuropilins are membrane receptors. Two related secreted semaphorins, semaphorin 3 B  and semaphorin 3F , were isolated from a region on human chromosome 3p21.3 commonly deleted in cancer .
Candida species are a leading cause of infectious disease related morbidity and mortality in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit. ,  The incidence of candidemia in extremely low birth weight neonates  is 7% and the incidence is 12% in neonates < 750 g birth weight. Candidemia has an attributable mortality of 2030% and frequently results in severe morbidity, including neurodevelopmental impairment, among survivors .
Native collaterals are pre existing arteriole to arteriole anastomoses that bridge adjacent arterial trees in healthy tissues. Their density, diameter and capacity to enlarge following arterial obstruction , which are important determinants of their ability to protect against ischemic tissue injury, vary widely within and among species. Surprisingly, no studies have examined when  these unique vessels form.
Geobacter sulfurreducens biofilms are a well studied electro chemically active biofilm system that utilizes conductive elements to respire on electrodes . However, EIS will not discriminate between electron transfer impedances and mass transfer impedances in the overall biofilm impedance. Electrochemical systems used to assess the role of mass transfer processes are generally a variant of a flow cell where flow velocity is varied, a rotating electrode where rotation rate is varied, or an impinging jet electrode.
Within the antioxidant system, manganese superoxide dismutase  is found in the mitochondrial matrix, from which approximately 75% of cellular superoxide  is generated. The tumor suppressive effect of MnSOD is supported by many studies demonstrating that overexpression of MnSOD in transformed cell lines leads to the reversion of the malignant phenotype  and MnSOD overexpression alone has a largely non cytotoxic tumor suppressive effect in many cancer cell types . Also, coexpression of MnSOD and either catalase  or glutathione peroxidase  can reverse the inhibition of cell growth induced by MnSOD overexpression.
In recent years, droplet based systems are showing increasing utility as they allow for sample aliquoting on chip and for carrying out many simultaneous experiments on the samples with no inter sample mixing  . At present, techniques for encapsulation of species within aqueous droplets have matured  . For example, conducting single cell experiments in droplets is attractive because the droplet effectively isolates the cell and allows for control of the localized environment surrounding the cell.
Mature human immunodeficiency virus type 1  protease  is an aspartic protease that is responsible for processing the Gag and Gag Pol polyproteins to yield mature proteins required for viral maturation. Although several PR inhibitors are in clinical use, selection of drug resistant variants hampers the long term effectiveness of these inhibitors. Amino acid residues that are essential for the PR structure and/or function are unlikely to be selected for drug resistant mutations.
The congenital long QT syndrome  is an inherited channelopathy that is characterized by a prolonged corrected QT interval  and an increased predisposition for polymorphic ventricular arrhythmias and sudden cardiac death  in young individuals without structural heart disease. Genetic mutations leading to LQTS have been identified in 12 susceptibility genes, with the LQT1 3 genotypes comprising more than 95% of genotype positive LQTS. Prior studies have shown that prolongation of the corrected QT interval  is a major risk factor for arrhythmic events in LQTS patients.
KRAS is a small G protein that acts as a transducer in the epidermal growth factor receptor  signaling pathway . Most  KRAS mutations occur in codons 12 and 13 in the phosphate binding loop of KRAS , and mutations in either codon possess transforming capacity . In vitro and mouse model data have showed that, although p.G12V mutated CRC were insensitive to cetuximab, p.G13D mutated cells were sensitive, as were KRAS wild type cells  .
Attempts and approaches at manipulating p53 activity in treating human cancer have been numerous and diverse. For example, viral mediated introduction and expression of wild type TP53 in p53 defective tumor cells has been extensively investigated for more than a decade, including through clinical trial activity . Perhaps because of it being counter to conventional thinking about the role of tumor suppressor genes in cancer etiology, as well as being counterintuitive regarding the way in which tumor suppressor genes are viewed in relation to the treatment of cancer, there has been relatively little research directed towards the development of anti tumor therapeutic strategies that include a p53 inhibitory component.
Dysregulation of apoptosis in the bone marrow is a central feature in patients with myelodysplastic syndrome  . Clonal expansion of autoreactive T lymphocytes is observed in many patients , and upregulation of tumor necrosis factor α and TNF related apoptosis inducing ligand  occurs in almost all patients . TRAIL  induces apoptosis preferentially in neoplastic cells .
The drug is also cytotoxic to drug resistant human and murine cell lines . When adriamycin resistant human ovarian cancer cells  are exposed to HMN 176, the expression of the multi drug resistance gene MDR1 is down regulated, apparently due to the ability of HMN 176 to prevent NF Y transcription factor binding to the MDR1 promoter . Tumor stabilization and decrease in serum tumor markers were demonstrated in select patients .
Stroke is a major cause of serious, long term disability in the United States, with an estimated 795,000 strokes occurring every year. Traditionally a disease of late adulthood, stroke is increasingly affecting younger individuals still actively involved in productive employment and community roles. Cognitive deficits not detected with typical screening measures may make it difficult for these individuals to meet former job demands under previous work conditions.
The separation of ON and OFF pathways starts at the synapses between photoreceptors and BCs. Glutamate activates metabotropic glutamate receptors on cone ON BCs and rod BCs and thereby hyperpolarizes the membrane potentials of these cells. All ON RGCs only synapse with ON BCs in the sublamina b of the IPL and all OFF RGC only synapse with OFF BCs in the sublamina a of the IPL .
These models are supported by data demonstrating that anxious individuals preferentially allocate attention  towards threatening, as compared to positive or neutral, stimuli. , The visual probe task provides a more direct measure of attention by requiring responses to neutral probes that replace threat and non threat stimuli. Participants must indicate on which side the probe appears using a button press.
Military veterans who participated in atmospheric nuclear weapons testing conducted by the United States between 1945 and 1963 are being studied for late occurring health effects. Radiation doses are being estimated for a sub cohort of 1,857 individuals that will be used for the analysis. About 12,000 members of the study cohort also participated in test series other than those in the Eight Series Study and their additional doses are included in the dosimetry .

RON is minimally expressed in normal breast epithelium but is highly expressed in approximately 50% of human breast cancers. Here, we identify a novel nuclear effector of RON activation, the DEK oncogene .
Potential sources of C. difficile infection  in humans include domestic and farm animals since an overlap between isolates from humans and animals has been demonstrated . Several outbreaks in North America and Europe demonstrated the increased severity of CDI due to the presence of a hypervirulent antibiotic resistant strain, BI/NAP1/027 . Pathogenic C. difficile strains cause diarrhea and colitis by releasing two toxins, an enterotoxin  and a cytotoxin .
Monoclonal antibody  L8A4 binds specifically to the epidermal growth factor receptor variant III  that is present on gliomas but not normal tissues, and is internalized rapidly after receptor binding. Because of the short range of its β emissions, labeling this mAb with177Lu would be an attractive approach for the treatment of residual tumor margins remaining after surgical debulking of brain tumors . L8A4 mAb was labeled with 177Lu using the acyclic ligands  trans  cyclohexane 1,2 diamine  pentaacetic acid  and 2  6 methyldiethylene  triaminepentaacetic acid , and the macrocyclic ligands S 2  1,4,7,10 tetraazacyclododecane tetraacetic acid  and α  1,4,7,10 tetraazacyclododecane 1,4,7,10  tetraacetic acid .
With recognition that the nucleus tractus solitarii  is the primary site of termination of cardiovascular reflex afferent nerves , electrophysiological and anatomical studies contributed to an understanding of reflex transmission from those afferents to NTS neurons and beyond. Amongst the sites to which the NTS projects and from which it receives afferent projections is the cerebral cortex . Because lesions affecting cortical areas are known to produce autonomic dysfunction and, at times, sudden cardiac death , the reciprocal connections could be critically important in clinical medicine .
Nef defective HIV strains have been isolated from infected patients that remain asymptomatic for long periods in the absence of antiretroviral therapy, providing strong evidence that Nef is a critical virulence factor for HIV pathogenesis. Previous studies have identified distinct structural motifs that are required for specific Nef functions. Among the best known are the PxxPxR motif, which forms a polyproline type II helix required for SH3 domain binding and host cell kinase activation, a polyglutamate stretch near the N terminus that is involved in MHC I downregulation, and a dileucine motif within a flexible internal loop required for downregulation of cell surface CD4.
The RAS RAF mitogen activated protein kinase /extra cellular signal regulated kinase  kinase  ERK and phosphoinositide 3 kinase  PTEN AKT signaling pathways play central roles in the signal transduction networks promoting tumor initiation and tumor progression. This is highlighted by the high frequency of mutations of RAS, RAF, PI3KCA, AKT, and PTEN as well as amplification of AKT present in a broad spectrum of human malignancies . Because signal transduction networks integrate multiple upstream inputs, targeting pathways downstream of the receptors could conceivably result in greater therapeutic efficacy and broader applicability.
Glutamate is an endogenous excitatory neurotransmitter, and it was estimated that this neurotransmitter is utilized by as many as one third of the synapses in the central nervous system . One of the pathways is mediated by the ionotropic glutamate receptors , which triggers Ca2+ fluxes and leads to cell death by alteration of calcium homeostasis and subsequently accumulation of reactive oxygen species . In this neuronal oxidative stress model, high concentrations of extracellular glutamate cause intracellular GSH depletion and increase ROS production .
Vertebrate vision is based on two physiologically different photoreceptor cell types: rods and cones. The turn off and recovery of the visual signal are achieved by reactions inactivating R* and the Gαt1GTP/PDE6 complex, and restoration of cGMP levels through Ca2+  dependent activation of retinal guanylate cyclases. Yet, the physiology of rods and cones is remarkably distinct.
During the first human H5N1 outbreak in 1997, 18 cases of H5N1 influenza A infection in humans were confirmed, and more than 300 infected individuals have been diagnosed since 2003. First, data from H5N1 IAVinfected patients reveal that inflammatory cytokine levels in blood can elevate dramatically during severe infection , and viral replication in the upper respiratory tract correlates with increased concentrations of several of these cytokines . Second, the expression of genes that encode many cytokines and chemokines  1β, MIP 1α, RANTES, TNF α) is strongly induced in human monocyte derived macrophages infected with human H5N1 isolates , and high levels of TNF α and IP 10 proteins are secreted from macrophages infected with several H5N1 IAVs .
Glutamate is the major excitatory neurotransmitter and essential for many functions in the mammalian central nervous system . Glutamate receptors can be divided into two classes: ionotropic glutamate receptors and metabotropic glutamate receptors  . Eight mGluR subtypes have been identified and classified into three distinct groups based on pharmacology and sequence homology.
Regeneration is a process by which damaged or lost structures are perfectly or near perfectly replaced . The zebrafish  caudal fin has become a valuable model for studying regeneration. In contrast to mammals, urodele amphibians and teleosts have the ability to regenerate multiple structures.
The interplay between the immune system and cancer is an ongoing focus of scientific interest. Increasing evidence indicates that dysregulation of the immune system, as for example found in allergic and autoimmune disorders, can affect survival of cells in developing tumors . This observation suggests that the cancer rates in individuals affected by such disorders might be different from those in individuals that do not suffer from allergies or autoimmune diseases.
Only a few studies have tested how well models of auditory processing generalize to more natural conditions in auditory cortex  or homologous auditory systems . In this study, we evaluated one commonly used model, the spectro temporal response function  in terms of how it describes cortical responses to speech. Typically, STRFs are estimated using synthetic broadband stimuli .
G6PD catalyzes the first reaction in this pathway by converting glucose 6 phosphate to 6 phosphogluconolactone . NADPH is concomitantly produced during this reaction, providing 5075% of the necessary reducing equivalents for fatty acid biosynthesis in liver . G6PD expression is inhibited by polyunsaturated fat through a posttranscriptional mechanism involving decreases in the efficiency of splicing of the pre mRNA .
Similar to cells in metazoans, yeast cells undergo replicative and chronological aging. Chronological life span  is defined as the length of time that a non dividing cell remains viable. Importantly, stationary phase is not simply a cessation of cell division.
Tumor hypoxia is known to contribute to tumor radioresistance and poor clinical outcomes . The presence of oxygen during radiation exposure is necessary to achieve generation of free oxygen radicals and DNA damage for tumor killing and is the basis for the so called “oxygen effect” . Tumor cells that survive hypoxic stress are selected for reduced apoptotic potential, increased anaerobic glycolysis, tolerance to extracellular acidity, increased migration, and angiogenic signaling.
Methadone is an evidence based medication for the treatment of opioid dependence, and has been available in the U.S. for over four decades.,  In the U.S., the delivery of pharmacological treatments for opioid dependence has long been relegated to a specialty sector of the healthcare system due, in large part, to government regulations and physicians’ reluctance to prescribe medications for addiction treatment.,  Buprenorphine was approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for the treatment of opioid dependence in late 2002. The less stringent regulations also reduced patient burden, as buprenorphine patients could receive treatment in an office based setting, pick up prescriptions from a pharmacy, and receive take home medication sooner than patients receiving methadone. Publicly funded buprenorphine treatment began to expand in Baltimore City with the launch of the Baltimore Buprenorphine Initiative  in 2006.
As access to antiretroviral drugs is expanding in sub Saharan Africa and second line treatments are often not readily available in the setting, it is imperative that adequate assessment on the prevalence and transmission of drug resistance mutations is performed to ensure optimization of treatment efficacy . These mutations can persist in chronically HIV infected, ART naïve individuals, and the prevalence of these resistance variants is likely to increase overtime . In addition the presence of these mutations has been demonstrated to have a negative impact on the antiretroviral therapeutic response and shortens the time to the first virological failure .
Autism is defined by impairments in the areas of social interaction and communication and marked by the presence of a restricted repertoire of behavioral activities and interest. Although not identified as a core phenotype of autism spectrum disorders , face processing and recognition is thought to be a relative area of weakness for many individuals with ASD . Briefly, alterations in face processing in ASD may include: biases toward high spatial frequency information in faces ; reduced configural processing of faces ; alternative patterns of attention to features within the face such as atypical or reduced eye attention ; and differential patterns of responses to familiar vs. unfamiliar faces .
Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease  is a major cause of chronic liver disease. Although hepatocyte injury and death are uniformly worse in NASH than in steatosis, the outcomes of NASH are variable . The liver harbors resident populations of cells that regulate innate immune responses.
For example, CdSe quantum rods were prepared by solution techniques using structure directing agents, metallic nanoparticles, micellar templating techniques, etc, . Their stokes shift is strongly dependent on the aspect ratio  of the rod. Both studies have showed the advantages of QRs as biocompatible targeted imaging probes.
The study of RNA enzymes, or ribozymes, is of considerable interest due to their importance in biology, their evolutionary implications, and potential impact for the design of drugs and new biomedical technology. Catalysis results from in line nucleophilic attack of the 2′O of C17 to the adjacent scissile phosphate, followed by cleavage of the P O5′ bond of C1.1 to produce a 2′,3′ cyclic phosphate and a 5′ hydroxy terminus in two RNA product strands. The catalytic activity of HHR motifs have promise in a number of biomedical applications.
Constitutive signaling through deregulation of the pathway is common in human cancers, and drives tumor development by inducing angiogenesis, motility, invasion, progression, and survival . Accordingly, several PI3K inhibitors are currently in clinical trials with promising results in glioblastoma, breast, hematological and non small cell lung cancer studies  . Consequently, the utility of such traditional imaging methods as computed tomography and magnetic resonance imaging  in monitoring early response is limited.
Suicide is an enormous public health problem in the United States and around the world. Each year over 30,000 people in the United States and approximately 1 million people worldwide die by suicide, making it one of the leading causes of death . Reports from the World Health Organization  indicate that suicide accounts for the largest share of the intentional injury burden in developed countries  and that suicide is projected to become an even greater contributor to the global burden of disease over the coming decades .
The global burden of morbidity and mortality from hepatitis C virus  infection is truly pandemic . There is no vaccine for the prevention of HCV infection and current therapeutic regimens for HCV infection are limited by efficacy, cost, and treatment side effects. HCV is transmitted primarily through percutaneous exposure to blood contaminated with HCV.
HCV is found in virtually every region of the world with an estimated 170 million people and 12% of the general population of most countries infected . Chronic HCV may cause cirrhosis or liver cancer and, in the United States, is the most common indication for liver transplantation as well as the most common cause of hepatocellular carcinoma . HCV is not only an important cause of disease, but it is also an ideal infection in which to study viral evasion mechanisms because infection persists in the majority of infected individuals but not all since approximately 25% of those infected successfully clear the virus.
Bland et al.’s theoretical model of specialty choice suggests that both student “needs” and “perceptions” are important in formulating career decisions. Previous authors have explored the “needs,” or values and goals, of students choosing primary care., , , , , ,  Researchers have also demonstrated that students who choose primary care describe primary care physicians’ competence, “appropriate” scope of practice, quality of scholarship,,  “importance,” and appropriate role in the health care system differently than students who choose specialty careers. In summary, primary care oriented students have different beliefs about the value of primary care.

In the past decades, therefore, an important task in CaP research is to elucidate the molecular alteration occurring in the development of CR tumors. The human genome may encode over 1000 miRNAs which negatively regulate approximately 60% of human genes .
Apolipoprotein E in its ε2 and ε3 isoforms plays a fundamental role in cell maintenance and repair through its function in lipid transport and cellular metabolism; however, the effectiveness of the ε4 isoform in this role is questionable. By contrast, young ε4 carriers have been shown to demonstrate better episodic memory performance and reduced learning  and retrieval related activity , suggesting that the negative effects of the APOE ε4 allele accelerate with age . Studies have shown that these changes are characterized by word finding difficulties on tests of verbal fluency and object naming.
The antimitotic agent Docetaxel has been used as a potential adjuvant treatment for pancreatic carcinoma, though clinical results comparing gemcitabine docetaxel combination to gemcitabine alone have been mixed . The spindle checkpoint monitors both the attachment of microtubules to the kinetochores and the tension exerted by these attachments . Agents that prevent this mitotic process from proceeding are referred to as mitotic inhibitors or antimoitotic agents .
In addition to this, it is also a key regulator of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal  axis . This nucleus is comprised of two major neurosecretory components: the magnocellular  and parvocellular  subdivisions . Moreover, there is evidence that the neurohypophysial and HPA axes may functionally overlap but the extent of this interaction is not fully understood .
It is generally accepted that the tendency of insulin to self associate in solution is strongly enhanced in the presence of zinc ion , which is normally present at a concentration of ca 0.2 mM in human serum . In particular, under conditions where zinc free insulin exists in monomeric form, insulin in the presence of zinc is thought to exist primarily as a hexamer binding two moles of zinc per mole of hexamer . The concentration dependent self association of bovine Zn insulin at pH 7.0 was previously studied by Milthorpe et al  via sedimentation equilibrium over the concentration range 0.03  0.6 mg/ml, who reported that over this concentration range the sedimentation equilibrium could be accounted for by an equilibrium between monomer and hexamer.
Synchronization of cortical areas in the human brain plays an important role in the understanding of the computational basis for human cognition . A possible role for cross frequency coupling between distant sites could be information exchange due to distributed cortical processing of complex behavior. This measure is sensitive to quadratic, i.e., multiplicative, interactions between signals.

There is strong evidence that the synaptic vesicle protein synaptotagmin 1  acts as the Ca2+ sensor for this process ; ; ; . When bound to Ca2+, the C2 domains of syt1 penetrate into lipid bilayers that contain anionic phospholipids ; ; .
SGNs extend a peripheral process to hair cells and a central process to target neurons in the cochlear nucleus . Type I SGNs innervate single inner hair cells, whereas each type II SGN innervates ~3060 outer hair cells . The central processes of SGNs bifurcate into ascending and descending branches within the CN and maintain a tonotopic map .
Over the past several years, three different laboratories have independently isolated mitotically active germ cells from juvenile and adult mouse ovaries that can be propagated ex vivo , generate what appear to be oocytes in defined cultures in vitro , and differentiate into fertilization competent eggs after intraovarian transplantation in vivo . These findings, coupled with identification of a comparable population of oocyte precursor cells in ovaries of reproductive age women , add strong support to claims made almost a decade ago that, contrary to longstanding beliefs in the field of reproductive biology , adult mammalian ovaries are capable of oocyte and follicle renewal . In cultures of mouse or human OSCs, without any somatic feeder cell population, two groups have independently reported that the cells spontaneously differentiate into large spherical cells that have many characteristic features of oocytes .
Peer relationships provide a socialization context of great importance during adolescence, in part because adolescents who are similar to one another tend to aggregate in groups and to influence one another’s behavior in those groups . However, less is known about the stability of social standing in the peer group, individual characteristics that may predict changes in social standing, and implications of changes in social standing for subsequent behavior. Understanding stability in social standing is important not only because of the basic knowledge of adolescent peer groups such understanding can impart but also because understanding how changes in peer standing are related to behaviors may improve interventions designed to reduce adolescents’ problem behaviors by intervening through important peer contexts .
Germline copy number variants can be used for phenotypic mapping in genome wide association studies, and have been linked to various diseases . A powerful way to find cancer genes is to identify genomic regions with recurrent copy number alterations  in tumor genomes. Ideally, such characterization should include both the precise identification of the chromosomal breakpoints of each alteration and the accurate estimation of copy numbers in each chromosomal segment.
Disclosure of HIV status among people who test positive for HIV has important implications for preventing new HIV infections and for the treatment, care and support of people living with HIV/AIDS  . The potential preventive health benefits of disclosure have been emphasized in health research and programs  with a particular focus on HIV disclosure to sexual partners  . There is mixed evidence that disclosure to sexual partners leads to sexual risk behavior change .
Mental disorders are leading causes of disability in the U.S. , and antidepressant medications are a mainstay of treatment for depressive and anxiety disorders . However, many people do not receive effective treatment, particularly ethnic minorities . Previous reports have indicated that less than half of black Americans with depressive conditions were prescribed antidepressants compared to about two thirds of whites .
Alcohol production and consumption in India have shown increasing trends . Alcohol use is significant in Goa, one of India’s smallest states . For instance, 31% and 56% of male drinkers respectively, among industrial workers and male primary care attendees, drank at levels likely to create physical and mental health problems  .
In the USA in 2010, approximately 780 women died from vaginal cancer and 2,300 new cases were diagnosed . Treatment options for primary squamous cell carcinoma of the vagina  depend on the progression of the disease. Once cancer has developed, treatments include irradiation  and surgical removal of the cancerous tissue.
This immunity, however, appears to be slow to develop and ineffectively maintained , also demonstrated by the low prevalence of Plasmodium falciparum  malaria antigen specific memory B cells  even in high endemic areas . While the complex nature of the parasite  and the high degree of antigenic variation  certainly contribute to this apparently impaired generation of humoral immune memory, there is also increasing evidence that the malaria parasite actively alters B cell function . These changes observed in acutely infected or continuously exposed individuals include increased levels of transitional B cells , reduced levels of IgD+CD27+ marginal zone like non switched MBCs  and an enlarged proportion of atypical MBCs , which have become a recent research focus .
Systemically, ETB receptors clear ET 1 from the circulation and protect against ETA receptor dependent vasoconstriction, cell proliferation, matrix accumulation, and inflammation. The ET system has been implicated in a variety of renal diseases including chronic proteinuric disorders such as diabetes, hypertension and glomerulonephritis. Over expression of ET 1 in the kidney causes renal inflammation and fibrosis.
Type II diabetes mellitus  is a metabolic disorder with multiple derangements in metabolic and immune pathways that predisposes individuals to cardiovascular disease. While glycemic control is of paramount importance, recent data indicate that broad pleiotropic strategies that target multiple pathways are more likely to succeed in the reducing cardiovascular risk in these patients. Emerging evidence suggests an important role for theincretin hormone, glucagon like peptide , in the regulation of post prandial glycemic control and satiety.
In addition to these systemic effects, obesity is associated with expansion of perivascular adipose tissue  immediately adjacent to the adventitia of large arteries. Also, inflammatory cell infiltration was reported to be markedly increased in PVAT surrounding atherosclerotic human aorta as compared with non diseased aorta. Thus, both the amount of PVAT and the degree of PVAT inflammation correlate with cardiovascular disease in humans .
Ligand engagement can result in either removal of the ligand from the extracellular environment or stimulation of specific intracellular signaling pathways. Determination of the contribution of LRP1 to vascular diseases was hindered initially by the embryonic lethality of whole body deletion. Numerous studies have demonstrated a role for angiotensin II  in several vascular pathologies, particularly atherosclerosis and aortic aneurysms.
Chronic hyperactivation of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal  axis results in long term exposure to elevated circulating glucocorticoids, which exert long lasting and often detrimental effects on an organism’s growth and development , immune functioning , reproduction , mood and addictive tendencies , and cognitive functioning. For example, in healthy adults both the administration of glucocorticoids and the implementation of a brief stressor increase salivary cortisol levels and adversely affect non emotional memory processes . In contrast,  subsequently reported that decreases in salivary cortisol within a testing session were associated with better learning and association on a preferential looking task.
Diagnosis of the sporadic form of the fatal motor neuron degenerative disorder amyotrophic lateral sclerosis  depends on clinical criteria and electromyographic evaluation for definitive confirmation. Despite progress in the field, radiographic tests such as diffusion tensor tractography and serum biomarkers such as angiogenin have not yet achieved widespread utility in this clinically heterogeneous disorder . Quantitative non invasive tests would improve not only the diagnosis of ALS but also the tracking of disease progression over time  .
Since the early 1980s, the incidence of P. aeruginosa pneumonia has been steadily rising. The bacterium is uniquely problematic because of a combination of inherent resistance to many drug classes and its ability to acquire resistance to all relevant treatments. Among the virulence factors described is the type III protein secretory system .
Tetraspanins are defined by four transmembrane domains and by the presence of conserved cyteines in addition to a CCG motif in the large extracellular loop. These associations are thought to occur mainly in membrane compartments such as lipid rafts and tetraspanin enriched microdomains , thereby forming a membrane network known as the “tetraspanin web”. Since they regulate the function of their binding partners, tetraspanins play roles in diverse cellular processes including adhesion, proliferation, fusion, and signaling .
In addition, persons with hyperglycemia even below the threshold for the diagnosis of diabetes are known to be at high risk for cardiovascular events  . Elevated glucose levels are thought to induce hyperglycemia mediated coronary microvascular dysfunction and result in myocardial injury  . Previous studies have shown that persons with pre diabetes or diabetes have an increased prevalence of atherosclerosis as measured by carotid intimal thickness or coronary artery calcium .
In the adult skeleton, bone is continuously being formed and resorbed. Bone resorption and formation do not occur along the bone surface at random. The osteoclastic bone resorptive sites contain a number of soluble osteotropic factors, including transforming growth factor β1 .
Salivary glands  have an important role not only in oral health but also for general health and well being. The salivary gland system consists of the major and minor salivary glands. Remarkably, post irradiation stem cell treatment with c Kit+ adult salivary gland stem cells restored radiation induced dysfunction .
In contrast, Type II endometrial cancers are E2 independent and are diagnosed mostly in post menopausal women, thin and fertile women, or women with normal menstrual cycles . PTEN  is one of the most frequently mutated tumor suppressor genes in human cancers . This mutation and subsequent Akt activation resulted in the activation of ERα dependent pathways which play an important role in endometrial cancer tumorigenesis .
Folliculogenesis is a coordinated process driven by signals from ovarian cells as well as the anterior pituitary. This growth is accompanied by differentiation of the granulosa and theca cells, leading to antrum formation and increased steroidogenic function. Regulation of this process occurs through paracrine and endocrine factors, the follicular extracellular matrix, and communication between the follicular compartments  .
Neurotransmitter release is essential for communication between neurones and thus brain function. It is stimulated by influx of extracellular calcium  via voltage dependent Ca2+ channels on nerve terminal depolarization by action potentials . Because of the tight coupling between Ca2+ and exocytosis many laboratories have examined their relationship.

However excessive autophagy promotes programmed cell death under some specific condition . High mobility group box 1 protein  is a highly conserved nuclear protein which acts as a chromatin binding factor that bends DNA and promotes access to transcriptional protein assemblies on specific DNA targets .
Transcranial magnetic stimulation  can be used within the MRI scanner to noninvasively manipulate brain activity while subjects undergo functional neuroimaging. As the technical challenges related to delivering TMS in the scanner have been overcome , this multimodal approach has been increasingly used to causally map motor, sensory, and cognitive brain networks in humans . Importantly, while great attention and effort has been directed to accounting and correcting for TMS influences on image acquisition , the influence of the scanner’s magnetic field on TMS remains relatively unexplored .
The introduction of α1,3 galactosyltransferase gene knockout  pigstransgenic for human complement regulatory proteins, markedly improved pig xenograftsurvival in non human primates  . However,dysregulation of coagulation in the form of thrombotic microangiopathy in the graft and/orconsumptive coagulopathy  in the recipient remains a major barrier . It has beenreported that increased immunosuppressive therapy  significantly prolongs organxenograft survival, but not systemic anticoagulation .
Chronic kidney disease is now recognized as a major public health concern. ,  It is estimated that approximately 26.3 million adults in the US have non dialysis dependent kidney disease and over 470,000 have end stage renal disease, collectively representing over 13% of the US population. In the next 20 years, the burden of chronic kidney disease is expected to increase, with over 2 million individuals projected to be receiving renal replacement therapy  by 2030.
Although the initiating factors and sequence of molecular and cellular events leading to the dysfunction and death of neurons in Alzheimer's disease  are not fully understood, the accumulation of amyloid β peptide  and hyperphosphorylated tau, oxidative stress, impaired energy metabolism and a disruption of neuronal Ca2+ regulation are implicated . In addition, cerebral neurovascular alterations that result in reduced cerebral blood flow , impaired blood brain barrier  function and reduced glucose utilization have been shown to occur early in the disease process . Excessive and sustained increases in the intracellular Ca2+ concentration in neurons may impair synaptic function, and damage and kill neurons in AD .
Several neuroimaging studies have activated right PFC in specific conditions of logical reasoning tasks. In the latter condition, the presence of conflict, be it belief logic conflict, where the logical conclusion conflicts with our beliefs , or even the simple presence of inverted relations , results in activation in right prefrontal cortex  . Such findings have led  to speculate that the left prefrontal cortex is necessary and sometimes sufficient for logical reasoning, while the right prefrontal cortex is sometimes necessary but not sufficient.
Compared to other members of FABPs in the family, E FABP has particularly wide tissue distribution, suggesting its diversified functions. It is highly expressed  as early as E14 in the rat, and the high level of expression is sustained during the first three weeks postnatal followed by a lower expression in the adult brain and spinal cord . Furthermore, we and others have reported that E FABP is induced in motor neurons after peripheral nerve axonal injury .

Since triglycerides, stored as fat in white adipose tissue, are the most efficient means of energy storage, alterations in energy balance favoring “energy input” can lead to obesity . The density of bacterial cells in the colon has been estimated at 1011 to 1012 per ml, which makes the colon one of the most densely populated microbial habitats known on Earth, .
The vocal fold mucosa is a layered structure comprised of epithelium and lamina propria ; both of which are superficial to the thyroarytenoid  muscle. Together, these mucosal structures facilitate vocal fold immune, transport and barrier function, and underpin self sustained tissue oscillation for voice production . The LP is especially important for vocal fold oscillation as it contains an extracellular matrix  rich in proteins and glycans with favorable viscoelasticity .
Dysfunctional RyR2, exhibiting enhanced Ca leak has been implicated in arrhythmogenesis and heart failure . Homotetrameric RyR2s have a transmembrane channel domain, and regulatory and scaffolding cytoplasmic domain . Human and rat FKBP12 differ in only 3 residues, and human and rat FKBP12.6 are identical.
Health literacy has been defined as “the degree to which individuals have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions” . Evidence for the negative impact of poor health literacy is accumulating. Genetic literacy pertains to one's capacity to understand and apply genetic information to make appropriate health and lifestyle decisions.

They bind to both intracellular and membrane receptors that transduce extracellular signals to downstream effectors . There are three primary MAPK subclasses: extracellular signal regulated kinases ; c Jun N terminal kinases ; and p38.
The epidermal growth factor receptor  is the prototypical receptor tyrosine kinase. One way that EGFR signaling is regulated is via the endocytic pathway. In addition to biochemical responses, ligand binding also triggers the internalization of the ligand:receptor complex via clathrin mediated endocytosis.
The contraction of striated muscles is regulated by the troponin complex, which controls the association of actin and myosin in a calcium dependent manner. Following membrane depolarization, the rise in intracellular  is sensed directly by the Ca2+ binding subunit of the troponin complex, troponin C . In various models of myocardial injury, a consistent observation has been the decrease in force production by permeabilized cardiac muscle fibers, along with a progression from Ca2+ desensitization to Ca2+ sensitization of the myocardium with advancing heart disease .
The receptor for IL 22 is expressed in barrier sites such as skin, intestine, lung as well as in liver, pancreas and kidney . IL 22 production is attributed to many immune cells types such as CD4, CD8 and γδ T cells, NK cells and subsets of innate lymphoid cells  . IL 22 plays an important role in the homeostasis of mucosal surfaces.
Alveolar Capillary Dysplasia with Misalignment of Pulmonary Veins   is a rare, lethal disorder of the lungs. Histopathologically, ACDMPV is characterized by malposition of pulmonary veins adjacent to small pulmonary arteries, medial thickening of small pulmonary arteries, deficient lobular development, a paucity of alveolar wall capillaries, and occasional lymphangiectasis . Heterozygous point mutations or genomic deletions of FOXF1  have been reported in most patients with ACDMPV .
In the acute treatment of arterial thrombi, strategies that target both platelet activation and the generation of fibrin have led to the greatest clinical success . Heparin has played a central role in the treatment of arterial and venous thrombosis . Unfractionated heparin's primary mechanism is to accelerate antithrombin's  inhibition of thrombin , factor Xa, and factor IXa .
Cytokines, such as TNF α, can augment aGVHD through direct cytotoxic impact on host tissues . IL 6 is a pro inflammatory cytokine with pleiotropic biological activities in immune regulation and inflammation . Recently, there have been anecdotal clinical trials suggesting the benefit of such an approach in a limited number of patients .
The olfactory bulb has been well studied with respect to its synaptic organization .The superficial nerve layer is composed of glial cells and unmyelinated axons from olfactory sensory neurons . These two layers thus sharply differ in their cellular contents and can be expected to show differences in metabolism . 2DG studies showed high energy demand in both glomeruli and in the adjacent nerve layer .

Evidence supports a possible association of acute graft arterial injury and GA  . HMG CoA reductase inhibitors  exhibit immunomodulatory  and anti inflammatory  effects independent of their lipid lowering actions.
Currently, more than 2 billion individuals have been infected with M. tuberculosis and about 5%10% those infected will develop active TB disease during their lifetime. Therefore, a novel, safe and effective vaccine against TB for both HIV negative and HIV positive individuals is urgently needed. For pre exposure, two main approaches are currently being evaluated .
Motor related, cortical areas have long been thought to contribute more to movements than simple commands. These “higher order” processes have been suggested to include memory, prediction, timing, abstraction or targets, etc. but specific demonstrations of how these processes are manifest during specific movements has been lacking generally.
Sodium channel blocking insecticides  are a relatively new group of insecticides. Indoxacarb , the first registered insecticide of this class, causes cessation of feeding, poor coordination, paralysis, and death  in a wide range of agriculturally important pests. Indoxacarb, a proinsecticide, is activated by insects to its more potent, N decarbomethoxylated metabolite, DCJW  .
Patients receiving hospice care have a variety of distressing symptoms and problems facing them, with fatigue and pain being among the most distressing. As patients near the end of life, priorities may shift from concerns about work and health to concerns about what comes after death. Thus, many patients may strengthen or renew their relationship with God, however they may define that relationship, confirming the need for clergy to be included in the interdisciplinary team.

Bupropion HCl is a first line treatment for TD that alleviates withdrawal symptoms , and is more effective than placebo in maintaining abstinence . Bupropion HCl has been shown to block the dopamine transporter in the human striatum , though at low levels , and has been found to increase whole brain dopamine and norepinephrine in animals .
For example, islets produce high levels of at least two ligands for the epidermal growth factor receptor , heparin binding epidermal growth factor like growth factor  and betacellulin. ,  Thus, the high level of expression of EGFR ligands in islets could be deleterious to the surrounding exocrine pancreas. Due to the juxtaposition of these two tissues, mechanisms must exist to segregate the effects of EGFR ligands, maintaining their effects in the endocrine pancreas while preventing their effects on the exocrine pancreas .
The paired box transcription factor  family consists of 9 highly related members with critical roles in organogenesis and tissue specification during development, including skeletal muscle, pancreas, central nervous system, kidney, and immune system . In various cell model systems, PAX genes have been implicated in the maintenance of the multipotent state, the initiation of differentiation programs, cell migration, proliferation and survival. Mutations and gene rearrangement of PAX genes are frequently associated with human diseases and cancers .
Amblyopia, also known as “lazy eye,” is a spatial vision disorder that affects about 3% of the population . It is characterized by reduced visual acuity in one or both eyes without any organic origin. Although conventional wisdom on visual development suggests that spatial vision becomes hard wired after the critical period  and only infant and young child amblyopes are treated in current clinical practice, a number of recent studies suggest that perceptual learning might be a potential treatment for adult amblyopia .
Indeed, lymphopenia is also a hallmark of severe H7N9 influenza virus infection . With some exceptions the virulence in mice infected with human H5N1 isolates corresponds to the severity of disease in humans . One such pair of viruses is A/Hong Kong/483/97  and A/Hong Kong/486/97 .
Body dissatisfaction is pervasive among adolescents  and has been linked with poor emotional well being  and weight and shape control behaviors . In the 2011 Youth Risk Behavior Survey, a nationally representative sample of US high school students, 61% of girls and 32% of boys reported trying to lose weight; 12% of adolescents reported fasting, 5% reported using diet pills, and 4% reported self induced vomiting or laxative use for the purpose of weight control . In addition, there is growing awareness and concern regarding the use of muscle enhancing behaviors among adolescents .
In the olfactory system, volatile odorants are detected in the periphery by ORNs which transduce chemical stimuli into electrical signals that are relayed downstream to the OB or the AL. These odor evoked ensemble responses, which contain information about odor identity, intensity, and timing , are reliable over repeated trials, and, particularly in insects, can be quite elaborate, often consisting of sequences of excitation and inhibition that together can long outlast the eliciting odor stimulus . These dynamic patterns change most rapidly during the odor's onset and offset .
Carcinomas arise from transformed epithelial cells and account for >80% of adult malignancies. The Rb/p16 pathway is classically viewed as a linear pathway wherein p16 positively regulates Rb which in turn suppresses cell proliferation by inhibiting expression of E2F target genes . The tumor suppressor p16 inhibits cyclin D cdk4/6 activity thereby enhancing Rb activity and suppressing cell growth.
E2F1 directed transcription is mediated by coordinated activity of the ‘winged helix’ DNA binding domain and C terminal transactivation domain, which recruit basal transcription machinery to target gene promoters . In these cases, E2F1 is stabilized by phosphorylation and protected from degradation through an interaction with the protein 1433τ . E2F1 regulation and function have been studied primarily in cycling cells.

A major rapid, early wild type  host response to P. aeruginosa infection is the CFTR dependent uptake of this pathogen by nasal and bronchial epithelial cells via a lipid raft dependent mechanism . These fractions also retain the caveolin 1  and caveolin 2  proteins.

It is noteworthy that this exit pathway differs from that of most spliced mRNAs, which employ cellular Tap and Nxt proteins to mediate nuclear exit . The HIV 1 Env protein is translated from incompletely spliced 4 kb viral mRNAs to yield a glycosylated 160 kDa polyprotein  that is routed to the plasma membranes  of infected cells via the vesicular transport pathway .
In addition, agonists acting at α2ARs and ORs interact in a greater than additive  manner when co administered to the spinal cord . Synergy is important in clinical pain management as it makes possible production of analgesia at lower doses for each drug, thus reducing undesired side effects and improving treatment outcomes . Despite the widespread evaluation and characterization of these interactions, the mechanisms underlying analgesic synergy are unclear .
Psoriasis is a common chronic inflammatory skin disease of unsolved pathogenesis. Psoriatic plaques are dominated by T lymphocytes as well as innate immune cells such as dendritic cells and macrophages . Crosstalk between immunocytes and keratinocytes, which results in the production of cytokines, chemokines and growth factors, is thought to mediate the disease.
Pneumonia, an inflammatory condition of the lung, causes greater mortality than any other respiratory disease globally . More than AIDS, malaria and tuberculosis combined, pneumonia is responsible for about 19% of all deaths in children below five years . Pneumonia is the primary complication of influenza infection and, as such, accounts for the majority of influenza mortality .
