The development of SLE is influenced by many factors, as genetic, environmental, and hormonal contributions have been well documented . TLRs are involved in the recognition of numerous microbial components and products, including lipopolysaccharide , bacterial flagellin , and viral products such as single stranded  RNA  and double stranded  RNA  .
The danger of cancer is organ failure caused by metastatic tumors that are derived from the primary tumor . Understanding this step may lead to new therapeutic concepts for tumor metastasis targeting tumor cell arrest and adhesion in the microcirculation. Regardless of these attempts, however, to date very little has been learned about the mechanisms governing tumor cell adhesion without loss of their physiological and dynamic microenvironment.
Subsequent to the advent of HAART, the rate of venous thrombotic events  among HIV infected persons has reportedly been on the rise,,  yet little is known about the risk factors or the specific impact of antiretroviral drugs . HIV patients may be at particular risk of thromboses by several mechanisms. Various abnormalities in coagulation pathway have been described among HIV patients including: the presence of antiphospholipid antibodies, such as anticardiolipin antibodies and lupus anticoagulants; increased levels of von Willebrand factor, fibrinogen, and D dimers; and deficiencies of protein C, protein S, antithrombin III, and heparin cofactor II .
Metal and nucleic acid interaction has been a fascinating field of study with potential for advancement of both basic coordination chemistry and structural biology, and practical biotechnological and pharmaceutical applications. The Catalytic RNA, often called ribozymes, occur naturally, whereas Catalytic DNA  have not yet been isolated in nature and they are obtained in the laboratory by a combinatorial biology technique called in vitro selection. , Since their discovery, these nucleic acid enzymes have been mainly studied with respect to the divalent metaldependent activity and folding.
Infection of Escherichia coli by bacteriophage T7 has been extensively studied . The A0  promoter is in the reverse orientation to all T7 genes and its function is unknown. mRNAs produced from these promoters code for several phage proteins involved in the shut off of host defenses and macromolecular synthesis, such as gp0.3, an antirestriction protein; ; , and gp0.7, a protein kinase that phosphorylates the β’ subunit of host RNAp and affects its termination properties.
Before ~200 ms, the information is encoded as words in a particular language in an extended network of regions that receive modulated input from an area of left ventral occipitotemporal cortex  centered on the fusiform gyrus . How early does the brain distinguish the language of word presentation? During the early visual word encoding stage , it has been suggested that the two languages rely on at least partially distinct neural systems, however it is unclear whether areas such as VOT are recruited in both the first  and second  languages to the same extent .
These three guanylate cyclases have also been respectively termed as GC A GC B and GC C  . The family became the transducer of both types of signals, generated outside and inside the cells. The recent discovery demonstrates that one member of this subfamily, ONE GC, is also a receptor of an extracellular ligand, the odorant uroguanylin .
The peroxisome proliferator activator receptors are ligand activated nuclear receptors that include PPARα, PPARγ and PPARδ . PPARγ, originally cloned as a transcription factor involved in fat cell differentiation , is activated by endogenous ligands, such as fatty acids produced by sterol response element binding protein 1  and fatty acids synthase  pathway  and synthetic ligands including the thiazolidinediones . Understanding the role of this receptor, including its possible role in cancer, is therefore important.
ARF BP1, previously called MULE and HUWE1, is a member of the HECHT type E3 family of ligases and was initially found to have a crucial role in cancer. Subsequent studies showed that it contributed to fine tuning of the balance of mechanisms governing proliferation and apoptosis in neuronal cells. Most recently, it was suggested that ARF BP1 may be operative in B cell transformation as part of a multimolecular complex that includes CTCF, MYC, ARF and p53.
Central to adaptive brain function is the ability to recruit appropriate brain regions for the task at hand. Nevertheless, the extent to which functional systems related to task performance are predefined remains poorly understood. The Eriksen Flanker Task is commonly used to probe attention and has well characterized activation patterns .
Human papillomavirus , a sexually transmitted virus, is the central etiologic agent in the development of cervical cancer and precancerous cervical lesions. At least 13 of these anogenital HPV types are considered oncogenic. The standard logistic regression and Cox model approaches commonly employed in HPV research up until now may not always be optimal for such analyses.
Assessing success of surgery for nasal airway obstruction  can be a challenge. Treatment is focused on the anatomic source of obstruction as determined by the surgeon, but the ultimate judge of a successful treatment is the patient’s reported relief from the sense of obstruction. Health related quality of life  measures have become important in all fields of medicine.
Nanoparticles are being investigated for a variety of biomedical applications including imaging, gene transfer, immune system activation, and targeted drug delivery. Active targeting, a method commonly employed in drug delivery applications, requires conjugation of a targeting moiety to the surface of delivery vehicles, such as nanoparticles. Thus, developing a nanoparticle with a targeting component built into its structure would increase the nanoparticle's versatility .
Gene delivery from the scaffold can target infiltrating cells to induce the expression of tissue inductive factors to promote cellular processes that synergize with the scaffold architecture to organize complex tissue structures. As an example, nerve growth factor  binds to tropomyosin receptor kinase A  and plays an important role in the survival and outgrowth of sensory neurons, while motor neurons contain trkB and trkC receptors that mainly respond to brain derived neurotrophic factor  and neurotrophin 3 , respectively . Patterned expression of neurotrophic factors within channels positioned to correspond with the location of the tracts within the spinal cord may enable the factors to be available in the appropriate spatial context, which could facilitate regeneration .
Perhaps the most common approach to this issue has been to contrast mutual liking  and group based liking or disliking  . MDDs appear to be a relatively common experience among elementary and middle school children, with reports of between 29 percent and 67 percent of children and preadolescents having at least one MDD, or ‘enemy’, depending on the type of assessment . It is likely that a subset of MDDs can be characterized as bully victim dyads .
Tuberous sclerosis complex  is an autosomal dominant neurocutaneous syndrome of high penetrance, characterized by a highly variable phenotype and the development of multiple hamartomas at various sites throughout the body . More than 1,500 mutations and more than 800 unique mutations have been identified in TSC1 and TSC2 combined. However, 10 to 15% of TSC patients have no mutation identified , despite a thorough molecular diagnostic assessment, including analysis for large genomic deletions.
African Americans are disproportionately affected by HIV and other sexually transmitted infections . According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention , African Americans account for approximately half of Chlamydia and syphilis cases and 75 % of Gonorrhea cases . Therefore, it is pertinent to examine and understand factors associated with STIs among African American women in order to decrease the risk of HIV/STIs in this population.
The obesity epidemic represents an emerging public health crisis  because obesity promotes the development of various diseases, such as cardiovascular disease and type 2 diabetes, that greatly increase mortality . Procedures that combine gastric restriction and malabsorption, such as Roux en Y bypass , promote superior and longer lasting weight loss and elimination of co morbidities compared to purely restrictive maneuvers . Furthermore, RYGB promotes complex metabolic changes which promote weight loss  and make it a preferred procedure for bariatric surgery .
To the best of our knowledge, no research has been dedicated to studying early visual selective attention in old old age . The current work investigated processing that underlies age related changes in selective visual attention in very old adults. They were told to respond to target letters in a specified color and to ignore stimuli in the other color.
Shortening of telomeres below a critical length leads to apoptosis and cell death, and there is a strong correlation between telomere length and aging. The core components of telomerase for catalytic activity are telomerase reverse transcriptase  and telomerase RNA . The H/ACA and CR7 domains are important for TER accumulation, localization, and 3’ end processing.
The objective of the study was to investigate the brain activation associated with reading comprehension and different orthographies in two Japanese writing systems, and in English, a second language. A remarkable characteristic of the Japanese writing systems  is that they present readers with the cognitive challenge of decoding different types of mappings of words to sound and to meaning. In the study, participants read kanji sentences and hiragana sentences, their native language , as well as English sentences, their second language .
Neuropeptide Y  is a potent hypothalamic orexigenic peptide. Central administration of NPY causes robust increases in food intake and body weight and, with chronic administration, can eventually produce obesity . Although NPY immunoreactivity is widely distributed throughout the hypothalamus , in situ hybridization histochemistry has revealed that Npy expressing neurons are primarily localized in the arcuate nucleus  and the dorsomedial hypothalamus  .
Nitric oxide  and endothelin 1  are important endothelium derived mediators that regulate the vascular tone. ET 1 is one of the most potent vasoconstrictors, produced by endothelial cells , airway epithelial cells, macrophages, fibroblasts, cardiomyocytes, and various brain neurons . Its primary action is via activation of G protein coupled receptors .
Current treatment guidelines suggest that HIV 1 infected patients should receive at least two  fully active agents when constructing a new antiretroviral regimen following treatment failure to achieve maximal virologic suppression . Antiretroviral agents in new drug classes are especially useful because there is no concern about cross resistance resulting from virologic failure to prior regimens, as substantiated by clinical trial results for recently approved agents in new drug classes  . CCR5 antagonists have established virologic activity in patients with HIV 1 strains using CCR5 as the exclusive coreceptor for entry into CD4+ T cells  .
The pathophysiology of neither IBD nor IBS is adequately understood; however, improved comprehension is likely to improve their treatment . The luminal microbiome is symbiotic but also constitutes a potential threat, requiring of the intestine a barrier to confine microbiota to the lumen and means to combat organisms that penetrate this barrier. These means include inflammatory, motor and secretory responses .
It is based on an implicit solvent model where the molecule and ionic solution are treated as low and high dielectric regions, respectively. Additionally, the PBE is now widely used to estimate the electrostatic component  of the binding free energy , which can be combined with estimates of the non electrostatic contributions to determine ΔΔG for drug design purposes . By reducing the number of points on the solution grid, the use of an ACG reduces both the solution time and memory compared to what would be achieved with uniform mesh spacing.
In addition to inflammatory nephritis, renal involvement in lupus can manifest as a fibrotic, atrophic nephropat hy with significant renal functional impairment and potential progression to end stage disease. Our group previously reported that SLE patients without traditional CV risk factors display a striking imbalance between endothelial cell damage and repair. This is manifested by an increase in circulating apoptotic endothelial cells uncoupled from proper endothelial repair, as shown by a significant decrease in the numbers and function of bone marrow derived endothelial progenitor cells  and circulating myeloid angiogenic cells  .
T cell development is an exceptionally favorable system in which to examine the mechanism of differentiation from stem cells in general. Also, because individual T cell precursors can be isolated relatively easily, it has been possible to define the series of distinct steps at which particular developmental alternatives are lost during the stages leading up to lineage commitment . T lineage specification is both triggered and sustained by Notch signaling.
Obesity is associated with increased risk of chronic disease, and with excess disability, morbidity, and mortality. Obese children tend to remain obese into adulthood ; therefore, the increasing prevalence of childhood and adolescent obesity is likely to drive adult prevalence, and its associated financial and health burden, for decades to come . Accurate measurement of childhood and adolescent obesity prevalence is an important component of surveillance and prevention efforts.
Plasma osmolality is primarily determined by the plasma sodium concentration. It is held within narrow limits under normal physiological conditions. In hypoosmolality, the secretion of antidiuretic hormone ADH is suppressed, which leads to decreased water reabsorption in the collecting tubules of the kidney and thereby increases water excretion.

Subsequently, it was found that a prior lesion in vivo also increased the rate of neurite outgrowth observed in vitro in explants of sensory ganglia and in cultures of dissociated sensory neurons . After sciatic nerve injury, LIF is expressed in the nerve distal to the lesion site and immediately proximal to it , and the cytokine is retrogradely transported by sensory axons to their cell bodies in dorsal root ganglia .
Chronicity and severity of PNALD are highest in preterm infants and in infants with intestinal failure secondary to short bowel syndrome, congenital absorption defects, necrotizing enterocolitis, and intestinal malformations . The intravenous lipid emulsion most commonly used in PN in the United States  is derived from soy oil . One of the components of SO emulsions implicated in PNALD is the presence of plant sterols  .
Near infrared spectroscopy  is a non invasive, real time bedside modality sensitive to changes in cerebral perfusion and oxygenation and is highly sensitive to physiological oscillations at different frequencies. However, the clinical feasibility of NIRS remains limited, partly due to concerns regarding NIRS signal quantification, which relies on mostly arbitrary assumptions on hemoglobin concentrations and tissue layers. In this pilot study comparing stroke patients to healthy controls, we explored the utility of the interhemispheric correlation coefficient  during physiological oscillations in detecting asymmetry in hemispheric microvascular hemodynamics .
The prospect to derive functional neurons directly from human fibroblasts has major translational implications for the evolving field of regenerative medicine and potentially very broad applications for pathogenetic studies of various neurodegenerative and neurodevelopmental diseases . Various somatic, non neuronal cells from mice and humans have now been reprogrammed into induced neuronal  cells by several groups . Unfortunately, to date the reported efficiencies of iN cell conversion in human fibroblasts have been low.
Striated muscle is formed by two sets of overlapping filaments, the thick myosin containing and the thin actin containing filaments. When filaments are activated the heads detach from the backbone and become disordered. While the mechanism of actin linked regulation by troponin and tropomyosin is well understood, , our knowledge of the mechanism of myosin linked regulation is less complete, .
Since 2002 there has been a rapid expansion in access to antiretroviral therapy  in low  and middle income countries. By the end of 2007, UNAIDS estimated that over 2 million individuals were receiving ART in Sub Saharan Africa, an increase of 54% in one year in this region alone . A systematic review found that after accounting for HIV prevalence, proportionally more women than men were on treatment .
Anthropometry plays an important role in the etiology of hormone related cancers , particularly breast and endometrial cancers . Interestingly in premenopausal women, higher adiposity is associated with a lower risk of breast cancer , possibly because in these women body fat is associated with lower estrogen levels . In a meta analysis of 28 population based studies of ovarian cancer risk, Olsen et al. reported a statistically significant, pooled relative risk  of 1.2 for overweight women  and 1.3 for obese women  compared to women with a normal weight .
More than 20 years ago Dr. A. K. Markov reported that exogenously administered fructose 1,6 bisphosphate  could provide impressive hypoxic ischemic protection. Respiring neonatal  rat cerebrocortical slices superfused in the magnet underwent a 30 minute period of hypoxia ischemia . Another group was not treated with FBP.
The Arrowsmith two node search tool  is designed to assist biomedical investigators in formulating and assessing scientific hypotheses. More generally, it allows users to identify biologically meaningful links between any two sets of articles A and C in PubMed, even when A and C share no articles or authors in common and represent disparate topics or disciplines. This fundamental text mining strategy provides a service that cannot be carried out feasibly via standard PubMed searches.
All of the approved antibody drugs consist of single mAbs . Despite this, analytical methods to characterize and measure the individual components of the mAb cocktails are required for use in product characterization, for production of clinical material, for pharmacokinetic studies, and for monitoring of drug product stability . Botulism is an orphan disease, with approximately 100 cases/year in the United States.
During the last seven years, Americans endured the worst economic downturnsince the great depression. During the great depression, a landmark documentary filmshocked the country by documenting the hunger faced by migrant farmworkers and namedthem the underfed. Food insecurity is defined as“whenever the availability of nutritionally adequate and safe foods or theability to acquire acceptable foods in socially acceptable ways is limited oruncertain.”Forty two percent of households with incomes below the federal poverty level havefood insecurity and the prevalence of food insecurity among Latino households ishigher than the national average at 26.9%.,  Individuals from food insecure households engage in unhealthy compensatorydietary behaviors to save money,  and are more likely to become obesethan those in food secure households.
To explore the impact of enrichment on behavior and neurobiological indices related to learning and motivation , a simple animal model was developed comparing rats living in isolated or normal  conditions to those in comparatively ‘enriched’ conditions . Other impacts of lower socio economic status include drug use  and obesity . Interestingly, environmental enrichment in rats tends to result in decreased self administration of amphetamine .
Histone deacetylases  are enzymes that play key regulatory roles in gene expression and cellular differentiation. There are eighteen HDAC enzymes in 4 subclasses : classes I, II, and IV are zinc finger metalloproteinase; class III are NAD+ dependent proteins . Several other HDACi, including the pan HDACi panobinostat , are being investigated in clinical trials.
Clock drawing tests  are commonly used in the neuropsychological assessment of cognitive functioning and dementias . Additionally, errors noted on CDTs have been found to follow a consistent path along with longitudinally observed cognitive impairments associated with dementias, providing further support for the notion that CDTs can be validly used in the assessment of dementias  . A wide variety of CDTs have been developed, each relying on differing systems of quantitative or qualitative error scoring ; ; Royal, Cordez, & Polk, 1998).

Specifically, repeated cocaine exposure alters the function of Group II metabotropic glutamate receptors .
Interestingly, Mst1 not only induces apoptosis but also negatively regulates hypertrophy of cardiac myocytes . In Drosophila, hippo , a homologue of human Mst1, also regulates the size of organs, such as eyes and wings , . Hpo phosphorylates Wts and triggers cell cycle arrest and apoptosis , ,  .
The Na+/K+ ATPase transports Na+ and K+ against their concentration gradients across the cell membrane to maintain a low Na+ and high K+ concentration within the cells . The Na+ gradient also provides the driving force for various secondary active transporters that import glucose, amino acids, and other nutrients into the cell. Additionally, the ion concentrations maintained by Na+/K+ ATPase are important for regulating cellular volume and preventing cells such as neurons from swelling and lysing  .
Although Ag and costimulatory ligands, usually B7 1 and 2, are essential for the activation and proliferation of naïve cells, there is now considerable evidence that these two signals are not sufficient to promote survival, differentiation and establishment of memory. Consistent with these in vitro results, co administration of peptide Ag with IL 12  or IFNα  bypassed the requirement for adjuvant to generate strong in vivo responses, and avoided the tolerance induced when peptide alone was administered. In contrast, the response to LCMV infection was reduced by greater than ninety nine percent when the virus specific CD8 T cells lacked the receptor for Type I IFNs , while the response to vaccinia virus  infection was only partially reduced .
B cell survival and fate determination are strongly dependent upon phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase  signalling . PI3K signals are antagonized by two lipid phosphatases: the 3′ inositol phosphatase  and the 5′ inositol phosphatase . It was recently discovered that in contrast to T cells, B cells do not undergo malignant transformation upon PTEN deletion .
More likely, it seems, future gene delivery will utilize synthetic non viral vectors. While safer than viruses, these non viral alternatives currently suffer from poor performance. The inefficiency largely lies with extra  and intracellular barriers existing between the site of administration and the nucleus of target cells.
Stroke is the third leading cause of death in the United States and the major source of debilitation among adults. The mechanisms by which obesity affects stroke occurrence or outcome, however, have not been fully elucidated. Cerebral perfusion is regulated through active constrictor and dilator mechanisms and by the physical properties of the cerebral vasculature.
Colorectal cancer  is the second leading cause of cancer related death in the United States when men and women are considered together. Lynch syndrome is the most common cause of hereditary CRC, affecting approximately 1 in every 35 CRC patients. Therefore, several institutions are now adopting a universal tumor screening  approach to determine which patients should be offered genetic counseling and germline testing for Lynch syndrome., UTS programs are endorsed by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Office of Public Health Genomics based on evidence of analytic validity, clinical validity, and clinical utility.
Vision loss is a serious public health challenge today, and global efforts to reduce avoidable blindness by 2020 are underway., In the United States, age related eye diseases  and other eye conditions are common causes of vision loss. More than 3.3 million Americans 40 years or older are either legally blind  or have low vision  caused mostly by age related eye diseases. By 2020, the number of people with eye diseases and associated vision loss could increase by 50% or more because of the aging of the U.S. population.
In an envisioned scenario, the scar tissue resulting from pathological remodeling after myocardial infarction can be replaced by a synchronously contracting engineered cardiac patch. Importantly, engineered tissues that are being developed for applications in regenerative medicine can also find utility on a much shorter time scale in studies of development, disease progression, and drug screening, and in many other applications in biological and medical research . A large number of scaffolds that are biodegradable and biocompatible are available for cardiac tissue engineering, and significant efforts in the field of stem cell biology are underway to find clinically relevant source of cardiomyocytes.
The neural basis of locomotor behavior in the nematode Caenorhabditis elegans is a particularly attractive system for study because of the simplicity of its neuromuscular system. C. elegans propels itself forward or backward by the sequential contraction of 95 muscle cells arranged in 4 quadrants along the body . In adult hermaphrodites, muscle cells of the body wall are innervated by 75 motorneurons comprising 8 distinct classes .
Further, additional cofactors were found to be required for prolonged expression of the HPV E6 and E7 oncogenes leading to development and progression of cervical abnormalities . One major risk factor in HPV mediated cervical cancer is cigarette smoking, as it has been consistently linked with the progression of cervical neoplasia . Further, female smokers have two times higher risk of developing cervical cancer than non smokers  .
There is increasing evidence that amyotrophic lateral sclerosis  is a multisystem disease that extends beyond the anterior horn cells and corticospinal tracts. Transactive response DNA binding protein 43 Kda  links ALS to frontotemporal dementia, and disease progression fits a model of prion like spread of TDP 43 protein in a corticofugal direction. Impairment of the sensory system has also been reported.
As a commensal, C. albicans asymptomatically colonizes both oral and vaginal epithelial surfaces. Clinically, oropharyngeal candidiasis  is a significant problem in immunocompromized individuals and is extremely common during human immunodeficiency virus  infection, especially when CD4+ T cells are reduced . In contrast, vulvovaginal candidiasis  is common in immunocompetent, otherwise healthy women  .
Recent genome wide association studies and subsequent replication studies have found consistent associations between a common variant on chromosome 9p21 and Myocardial Infarction  or Coronary Artery Disease . The nearest genes to this marker are CDKN2b and CDKN2a, which are key regulators of the cell cycle. The possible involvement of these cell cycle control genes in heart disease may be mediated via reduced re growth of arterial intimal cells, a phenomenon implicated in the development of atherosclerosis.
MSI is most often asymptomatic and accounts for up to 75% of total ischemic burden . In the laboratory, MSI has been observed in 3060% of patients with CAD , depending on whether the ischemia is indexed by a decline in left ventricular ejection fraction, by new ventricular wall motion abnormalities, or by a decrement in myocardial perfusion. Vulnerability to MSI has prognostic significance above standard risk models that include positive exercise imaging procedures, with studies demonstrating between a 2.43.0 fold increased risk of acute coronary events over a 24 year , and a 3.0 rate ratio of death at 5 years  .

The recommendation also includes muscle strengthening activities at least 2 days/week and, among those with poor mobility, activities to enhance balance and prevent falls on 3 or more days/week. Similar physical activity recommendations exist from the United States  government  and jointly from the American Heart Association and the American College of Sports Medicine  .

Non invasive quantification of blood oxygenation can be achieved with MRI by measuring T2  or T2* , or from a measurement of the relative susceptibility  of intravascular blood since all three quantities depend on HbO2, which determines the blood’s paramagnetism. In T2 approach the relaxation rate is quantified with a CPMG based pulse sequence and it is assumed that 1/T2 scales as 2.
The advancement of molecular imaging resulted in the discovery of novel biomarkers and the development of many target specific molecules from monoclonal antibodies to monobodies, small bodies, polypeptides, proteins, RNA, nanoparticles and small molecules. However, efficient conjugation of fluorescent dyes to targeting macromolecules with multiple labeling sites remains challenging. For example, a typical IgG antibody molecule has 90 lysine residues, many of which are located close to each other ).
Women utilize a greater proportion of mental health services compared to men., Reasons for this gender disparity include increased biological susceptibility, social dynamics and exposure to violence. Primary care providers  form the “de facto” mental health system,, providing a large portion of mental health services in all communities. In rural areas, mental healthcare provided by PCPs is complex due to both patient characteristics and the rural environment.
A protease/antiprotease imbalance can equally be associated with inflammation and extracellular matrix degradation. Proteases have a number of functional effects that contribute to tissue destruction including tissue remodeling, cleavage of soluble innate factors and activation of receptors. Alternatively, proteases also play a critical role in microbial clearance as neutrophil proteases are critical for microbial killing.
Reoviridae is one of the largest families of viruses and comprises at least 12 genera of viruses with segmented dsRNA genomes. ;  These viruses are enormous macromolecular machines with the remarkable ability of endogenous RNA transcription either in vivo, inside the host cytoplasm, or in vitro, in a cell free environment. Some Aquareovirus isolates can lead to severe epidemic hemorrhagic disease and pancreatitis in fish, although the majority has been isolated from seemingly healthy finfish and shellfish.
Ductal carcinoma in situ with microinvasion  is a pathologic diagnosis defined by the presence of ≤1 mm of invasive cancer in a background of DCIS and comprises 0.6 3.4% of breast cancer diagnoses. In the American Joint Committee on Cancer  staging system, it is considered a subset of T1 disease . These patients are generally considered to have a better prognosis than “macroinvasive” cancers, but worse than DCIS alone., The rarity of DCISM has made study of risk factors, management, and outcomes difficult.,, The risk of axillary lymph node metastases is low, , but no studies have been able to consistently identify any pathologic or demographic factor predictive of nodal disease.,,  We have previously reported that 2.7% of 112 patients with DCISM had axillary lymph node macrometastases and 10% micrometastases.
The mammalian retina is a neural image processor designed to detected and encode information about distinctive visual features, the most basic of which are changes in luminance. This begins at the first synapse in the retina where photoreceptor signals are transmitted to bipolar cell types that differ by depolarizing in response to either an increase or decrease in light level . These cells are referred to as alpha RGCs  in recognition of their large somas.
Prevalence data vary; approximately one quarter of patients in an unselected primary care population presented with dysphagia. In at risk populations, these figures are significantly increased, including the elderly  and patients following recent neurological insult . The impact of disordered swallowing is profound.
A cone snail venom peptide can be assigned to a gene superfamily and to groups within a superfamily using several criteria. The signal sequences of precursors of all members of a conopeptide superfamily are highly conserved, sharing considerable sequence identity. The first group, the α conotoxins targeted to the muscle nAChR subtype have the following Cys pattern: .
Caveolins are key components of detergent resistant cholesterol lipid rich membranes including lipid rafts and caveolae. Despite similar name, the amino acid sequence between Cav 1 and Cav 2 is only 38% identical  , suggesting distinct functional roles for each of these proteins ). However, in contrast to extensively studied Cav 1, much less is known about Cav 2.
Multiple myeloma  is a clonal plasma cell disorder predominantly affecting the elderly, resulting in more than 10,000 deaths annually in the United States. The use of novel therapeutic agents such as immunomodulators and proteasome inhibitors, as well as the incorporation of high dose chemotherapy followed by autologous stem cell transplantation  in eligible patients has led to significant improvements in the survival of MM patients. However MM remains biologically heterogeneous with significant variability among patients in terms of clinical features, response to therapy and overall survival .
Downstream effectors of Rac and Cdc42 include the PAK  family of serine/threonine kinases. Mammals have 6 PAKs, which are divided into two groups based upon sequence homology: group A consists of PAKs 13 and group B of PAKs 46. Many potential targets have been identified for PAK1 3.
The Id proteins are dominant negative antagonists of basic helix loop helix  transcription factors and regulate differentiation in multiple lineages . The Id1 4 proteins are highly expressed during embryogenesis in partially overlapping patterns, and play major roles during development, for example cardiac and brain development . In the developing heart Id1 to Id3 are expressed exclusively in nonmyocardial layers, for example in the epicardium, endocardium and endothelium  .
The Burkholderia cepacia complex  is comprised of seventeen phenotypically similar but genetically distinct species. These Gram negative bacteria cause opportunistic infections in specific hosts such as those with chronic granulomatous disease  or cystic fibrosis . In one large study of Bcc isolates from patients with CF, 18% of isolates were resistant to all the antimicrobials tested; even the most active agents  inhibited only ~20 40% of the isolates.
Recognition of lipopolysaccharide  by MD 2 TLR4, is an important determinant of the innate immune response to Gram negative bacteria. Sensitive host responses to LPS are orchestrated by several LPS binding proteins. ,  Optimal CD14 mediated cell stimulation by LPS occurs at LBP concentrations that are considerably lower than those of normal human plasma.
Injection drug use is a serious public health problem that can lead to substantial morbidity and mortality. Of the many complications attributable to injection drug use, skin and soft tissue infections remain one of the most common problems, and are experienced by up to one third of injecting drug users, but abscesses, cellulitis, and other infections are not the only injected related wounds that cause health problems for injecting drug users. Injecting drugs can lead to myriad adverse cutaneous and subcutaneous effects, including thrombophlebitis, venous sclerosis, lymphedema, superficial scarring and discoloration, chronic venous insufficiency, and ulcers.
Over 130,000 reproductive age women are diagnosed with cancer in the USA annually  Program  Research Data , National Cancer Institute, DCCPS, Surveillance Research Program, Cancer Statistics Branch, released April 2011, based on the November 2010 submission), with haematological cancers accounting for 18% of new diagnoses in women under the age of 45 . Indeed, studies suggest that the majority of cancer patients are concerned about the risk of infertility associated with treatment, and a third report that concerns about the risk of infertility have an impact on their treatment decisions  . Over the past decade, there has been increasing interest in methods to expand the reproductive options of patients facing gonadotoxic therapies.
MR guided cryoablation is a promising method for minimally invasive therapy of prostate, liver, and kidney tumors . It is also being developed for preventing the most common cardiac arrhythmias in both children and adults . The recent review of MRI guided cryoablation by Morrison et al.  reports good clinical results using this therapy for selected patients, in a range of organ systems.
The key feature of this approach is that one or more small molecules can be used to selectively target a clustered set of binding sites in DNA and generate a biological response that is not observed for binding to single sites . Compounds bound in a more dispersed manner do not reach the critical level to initiate any significant response. With this design scheme the problems of preparation expense, solubility, stability and uptake can be dealt with in an effective manner.
Childhood Absence Epilepsy  accounts for 10 to 15 percent of pediatric epilepsy diagnoses . Prior studies point toward the presence of interictal attention problems, which can interfere with academic performance and daily functioning . The current study investigates attention related problems that might differentiate children with CAE from their healthy peers, and the role of disease on attention related problems in this group .
Late onset Alzheimer’s disease  is the most common neurodegenerative disorder affecting more than five million people in the USA alone. Statistical power is further degraded by the inherent heterogeneity of samples ascertained using clinical exams . An endophenotype based approach may help alleviate the issues of heterogeneity and statistical power.
The unfolded state under native conditions is operationally achieved by rapid dilution of the chemical denaturant to concentrations where the native state is strongly favored. Consensus on the properties of the unfolded ensemble of single domain globular proteins under native conditions has, however, been elusive. In this scenario, a negligible kinetic barrier, if any, exists between random coil and compact conformations .
Imprinted genes mostly occur in clusters, which are regulated by a cis acting imprint control element  that is inactivated by a germline DNA methylation imprint on one parental chromosome . Extensive progress has been made in the last decade towards understanding the mechanism, and today genomic imprinting provides one of the best models of mammalian epigenetic gene regulation . Paternal specific silencing of Igf2r, but not of Slc22a2 and Slc22a3, is accompanied by gain of promoter DNA methylation, but, surprisingly, this methylation mark is not necessary for Igf2r silencing  .
The human Apobec3 locus encodes seven homologous genes expanded in tandem on chromosome 22 ; . The HIV 1 accessory protein Vif counteracts the cellular innate immunity elicited particularly by APOBEC3G , APOBEC3F , APOBEC3DE  and APOBEC3H haplotype II  by promoting their degradation ; ; ; ; ; ;  and inhibiting their enzymatic activity . Antiviral activity causing detrimental hypermutation in limited time requires an efficient mechanism for enzyme translocation on ssDNA and target location.
Pemphigus foliaceus  is a tissue specific autoimmune disease in which antibodies against the desmosomal cadherin desmoglein 1  cause loss of keratinocyte adhesion in the superficial epidermis, resulting in skin blisters . Dsg1 is synthesized in the endoplasmic reticulum as an inactive precursor protein with an amino terminal propeptide , which is thought to prevent intracellular aggregation with other newly synthesized cadherins within the secretory pathway. In both models these autoantibodies cause blisters from loss of cell cell adhesion with the typical histology of PF  .
The presence of resveratrol in red wine may contribute to this beverage's proposed cancer preventive effects . The anticancer activities of resveratrol were first appreciated when Jang et al.  demonstrated in a two stage mouse skin cancer model that resveratrol possesses cancer chemopreventive activity against all three major stages of carcinogenesis comprising initiation, promotion and progression. In contrast to resveratrol, neither derivative induced p53 activation or apoptosis.
These patterns are often directed by morphogen signals diffusing from organiser regions, which specify and determine cell fate and location. A major focus of developmental neuroscience is to understand how this specificity is attained: the identification of genes which control the development of key brain regions and how the regions themselves develop spatially in 3D and temporally during gestation and postnatal development . Much of the work on determining patterns of gene expression in the developing brain has been carried out in the mouse and other organisms, but less so in human.
The detection of both spontaneous motor unit activity  and spontaneous muscle fiber activity  can be conventionally achieved by needle EMG. An earlier study using rat preparations  recorded EMG baseline of denervated muscles with conventional surface electrodes. It was found that fibrillation potentials from denervated rats are not readily discernible in the time domain, but can be clearly discerned in the frequency domain, evidenced by greatly increased energy in the frequency band of 100300 Hz compared with normal rat data.
A major threat to tuberculosis  control efforts is the increasing global burden of drug resistant TB. Inappropriate treatment regimens and poor adherence to therapy are the most common causes of drug resistant TB and in large part have led to the development and transmission of multi drug resistant  TB  and extensively drug resistant  TB . Georgian National TB Program  data from 2011 found the prevalence of MDR TB among newly diagnosed patients to be 10.8% and 31.4% among previously treated patients; 6.4% of those with MDR had XDR TB.
Glioblastoma multiforme  is the most common brain tumor comprising 23% of all primary adult brain tumors, and is the most deadly with a life expectancy of 9 12 month. Additionally, numerous studies have shown that a large percentage of primary glioma lines are resistant to TRAIL induced apoptosis. Viral vectors are advantageous in that viral gene therapy can deliver robust and long term expression of therapeutic proteins with high specificity in local tissue, reducing the systemic dose and nonspecific toxicity.
Most HIV infections occurs in the context of actions that are related to social behaviors, such as having sex and using drugs. There is an increasing body of evidence indicating that social network characteristics  may play an even more important role in disease transmission than individual background or risk characteristics . Bridge populations, for example, have been pinpointed as major contributors to both sexual  and drug injecting related transmission of HIV .
Cathepsin K is a cysteine protease with collagenolytic, elastinolytic and proteoglycan degradative activities known to be involved in early osteoclast action . Its highest level of expression is in osteoclasts . Patients lacking cathepsin K activity due to genetic mutations have a form of skeletal dysplasia known as pycnodysostosis that is characterized by osteosclerosis, short stature, and bone hypoplasia  suggesting a significant role for the enzyme in endochondral bone growth.
Fractures and loss of bone have significantly affected the quality of life for a large segment of the population. Due to the limitations associated with autografting and allografting, tissue engineering has emerged as an alternative strategy to regenerate or replace damaged or lost tissues . Biodegradable polymers such as poly, poly, and their copolymers  are the most prevalent materials for tissue engineering applications .
Thus it seemed that the bathhouse was an excellent venue to find a larger proportion of high risk men than might be found in other settings  . In addition to bathhouses and cruising areas, MSM historically have used communications media to meet other men for sex  . This may raise the potential for engaging in high risk HIV related behaviors.
Early stage prostate cancer requires androgen for growth and thus responds to androgen deprivation therapy . Although epidemiological studies investigating statin use and total cancer risk as the primary outcome have yielded conflicting results , a recent case control study indicates that statins may reduce the risk of more aggressive prostate cancer . In another clinical study, Moyad and colleagues found that statins, especially atorvastatin, improved clinical presentations in prostate cancer patients .
Circulating peripheral blood monocytes represent a pleiotropic population of cells which are essential for innate immune responses to pathogenic micro organisms in the blood, mucosal surfaces and tissues . For certain infections monocytes may be the key mononuclear phagocyte mediating cell mediated immunity . During bacterial infection monocytes perform distinct roles in the innate host response.
Ciclopirox olamine  , the ethanolamine salt of 6 cyclohexyl 1 hydroxy 4 methyl 2 pyridone, is a synthetic antifungal agent used to treat mycoses of the skin and nails for more than 20 years. ,  The mechanisms of these actions of CPX seem diverse, involving disruption of membrane function in fungi, or targeting different metabolic  and energy producing processes in bacteria. ,  In the yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae, CPX may also exert its effect by disrupting DNA repair, cell division signals and structures  as well as some elements of intracellular transport.
The knee meniscus is a fibrocartilaginous tissue that provides stability within the joint, while also bearing and transmitting loads during normal locomotion. In response to joint loading, its semi circular wedge shape increases congruence between the convex femoral condyle and relatively flat tibial plateau, resulting in an inhomogeneous stress strain distribution within the tissue. Meniscus cells are surrounded by a pericellular matrix , which together with the enclosed cells has been termed the “fibrochondron,” analogous to the “chondrons” identified in articular cartilage.
Acute myocardial infarction  is typically caused by platelet mediated thrombosis at the site of a ruptured or eroded atherosclerotic plaque. Both recurrent ischemic events and bleeding have been associated with increased late mortality.,  Recent studies have demonstrated wide variability of individual patient responsiveness to the inhibitory effects of clopidogrel on platelet aggregation, with potentially important implications for its clinical effectiveness and safety. Following percutaneous coronary intervention  or ACS, patients with low clopidogrel responsiveness and consequent high on treatment platelet reactivity have a higher risk of recurrent ischemic events, while patients with enhanced platelet inhibition have lower risk of cardiovascular events but a higher risk of bleeding.
Step length at preferred speeds is quite constant in healthy adults, but higher step length variability can be present in older adults without overt neurologic disease. Slower gait is common in older adults and is associated with higher gait variability, but age related increases in variability are independent of gait slowing . Step control is a multifactorial process with involvement from the musculoskeletal system, peripheral nervous system, and central nervous system .
Although close contact is a well recognised risk factor for tuberculosis, the proportion of tuberculosis cases found attributable to identifiable contact with other cases is generally low,. This proportion can be estimated through traditional case control studies, asking about contacts, or by molecular epidemiological studies in which cases with shared DNA fingerprint patterns  are investigated. Estimates in sub Saharan Africa of the proportion of “clustered” cases with identifiable links range from 11 27%,.
Eighteen α and 8 β subunits are identified in mammals  and they consist of a large extracellular domain, a transmembrane domain and a short cytoplasmic tail . The extracellular domain confers ligand specificity and is required for ligand interactions. Integrin α1β1 displays a higher affinity for collagen IV relative to collagen I , while integrin α2β1 preferentially binds collagen I .
In disease states such as heart failure, myocardial infarction and hypertrophy, changes in the expression and location of Connexin43  occur , and may predispose to arrhythmias. Stretch may be an important stimulus to Cx43 remodeling; however, it has only been investigated in neonatal cell cultures, which have different physiological properties to adult myocytes. We hypothesized that localized stretch in vivo causes Cx43 remodeling, with associated changes in conduction, mediated by the renin/angiotensin system  .
The concentric phase of the natural countermovement vertical jump is inevitably performed with a preceding eccentric phase that lowers the body center of mass to a certain countermovement depth . Namely, a typical implicit presumption has been that the tested subjects are able to select the movement pattern  that maximizes the jump height  and, thereafter, to reproduce it over a series of consecutive trials. As a consequence, both the differences among various populations  and the effects of the applied interventions  on various variables obtained from vertical jumps have been usually attributed to the differences in force and power producing ability of leg muscles, rather than to the differences between the jumping kinematic patterns .
Phosphatidylinositol and its phosphorylated derivatives  has long been known to have an important regulatory role in cell physiology . Phosphatidylinositol 3,4,5 triphosphate  and phosphatidylinositol 4,5 biphosphate  are two well known lipid second messengers . PIP3 target proteins are diverse in nature and include protein kinases, adaptor molecules, and GAP and GEF for small GTPases .
Interestingly, most mammalian organs contain resident progenitor cells , but it is not known why these cells are not mobilized for repair, suggesting that there may be an absence of instructive signals. The Xenopus larval tail is a complex organ containing multiple cell types: muscle, peripheral nerves, spinal cord, notochord, and vasculature. After tail amputation, wound healing occurs within 68 hours post amputation .
The primary risk factor for cervical cancer is persistent infection with oncogenic subtypes of human papillomavirus  . The development of a prophylactic vaccine to prevent HPV infection represents an important step in reducing cervical cancer incidence and mortality. In 2006, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration  approved the first HPV vaccine for administration to females 926 years of age for the prevention of cervical cancer  .
Hypertension is a cardiovascular risk factor common among hemodialysis patients  and one which that may be better assessed using out of office blood pressure  monitoring either by home BP measurements or automatic interdialytic ambulatory BP recordings . Most hemodialysis patients have absence of nocturnal decline in BP, a phenomenon known as non dipping . Augmented volume removal therapy  and restricted dialysate sodium delivery effectively treats hypertension in hemodialysis patients .
Glioblastoma  is the most common type of brain tumor and is associated with high morbidity and mortality rates. Previous studies have established that GBM cells overexpress many growth factors, including vascular endothelial growth factor , and several transcription activators have been identified in the VEGF promoter, including hypoxia inducible factor  1 and Stat3. However, an elevated level of VEGF production can often be detected in tumor cells located in the extreme periphery of the tumor where there is no apparent hypoxia.
In the case of the CP or LP, the initiating complexes of surface Ig bound C1 or carbohydrate bound MBL/MASPs trigger proteolytic activation of C4 to produce C4b. In this scenario surface deposed C3b, along with the pro enzyme factor B  and factor D , cooperate to generate the C3bBb complex. Furthermore, deposited C3b molecules also activate the terminal pathway of complement that results in the formation of the membrane attack complex  that can directly kill Gram negative bacteria .
The mesolimbic system, including the ventral tegmental area  and nucleus accumbens , is essential for reward seeking behavior. The NAcc integrates dopaminergic projections from the VTA and glutamatergic projections from limbic regions such as the basolateral amygdala , hippocampus, medial prefrontal cortex . It is hypothesized that the projection patterns of VP neurons allow the passage of limbic signals projected to NAcc to gain access to regions involved in appetitive behavior .
Xbp1 is required for development of specialized secretory cell types such as antibody secreting plasma cells  and pancreatic acinar cells  that are characterized by expansive networks of rough ER. This event efficiently impedes the formation of translation initiation complexes, providing a means for rapid repression of protein synthesis in response to ER stress . However, these conditions favor translation of activating transcription factor 4  owing to the presence of regulatory small open reading frames in the 5′ untranslated region of its mRNA .
The microbial flora of the human oral cavity can be highly diverse, encompassing approximately 700 bacterial species , of which about ½ has not yet been grown in vitro. Various bodily functions, such as the physiologic defense mechanisms and the salivary gland secretions, are reduced with age . Colonization of the oral cavity in the elderly with bacteria that may be normally a small part of the oral resident flora has been described in the literature .
Alzheimer’s disease  is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder that gradually damages the neocortex and hippocampus, reducing memory, learning and reasoning . AD is characterized by extensive amyloid deposition, neurofibrillary tangles , inflammation, and ultimately synaptic and neuronal loss . In normal brain, rapid proteolysis attenuates Aβ accumulation.
Treatment interventions for co occurring posttraumatic stress disorder  and substance use disorders  have shown promising results  and provide alternatives to traditional relapse prevention strategies for women in substance abuse treatment. However, given high drop out rates and difficulties with retention among this population, questions remain as to the specific conditions under which these women can best be engaged and benefit from treatment. While the evidence on racial/ethnic differences in prevalence rates of PTSD and SUDs is mixed , research findings indicate there are racial/ethnic disparities in the adverse consequences of these conditions and in access to mental health care .
Clinical resistance to anticancer therapies is a persistent problem that can be caused by genetic or epigenetic events occurring within cancer cells or by extracellular cues such as soluble factors or cell cell contacts . Ultimately, these diverse events lead to the activation of growth and survival signaling pathways within cancer cells that enable them to survive otherwise lethal pharmacological insults . By blocking these drug resistance pathways, it may be possible to improve the efficacy and durability of anticancer drugs.
Atrial fibrillation  is the most common cardiac arrhythmia and represents a significant health risk to the population. Therapy for AF seeks to restore normal sinus rhythm through pharmacologic cardioversion. Lack of ion channel selectivity and overlap in ion channel expression in the atria and ventricles however, underlies the nonspecific ventricular side effects of current pharmacological agents, .
Despite long standing interest in the relations between stress and eating behavior, the true nature of these associations and the underlying biological mechanisms involved remain poorly understood. Stress induced elevation in cortisol, a glucocorticoid hormone secreted by the hypothalamic pituitary adrenocortical  axis, has been linked to increased energy intake following stress. Surgical removal of the adrenal glands  results in decreased food intake in rodents, and administration of glucocorticoids reverses this effect .
Host cell invasion by these parasites is a multi step process  propelled by the gliding motility machinery. In T. gondii, four complexes composed of soluble and transmembrane microneme proteins or including rhoptry neck proteins  have been investigated and shown to perform non overlapping functions during invasion . A third complex is composed of the TM MIC TgMIC8 and the soluble protein TgMIC3.
The disease usually manifests in midlife and is due to an expansion in the CAG trinucleotide repeat within the gene encoding the protein huntingtin . Within the striatum, medium sized spiny neurons  are most susceptible to dysfunction and degeneration. In the cortex, pyramidal neurons of layers II, III and V degenerate.
Allogeneic bone marrow transplantation  is currently used for the treatment of a variety of hematologic malignancies. It has also shown promise in solid cancers such as renal cell carcinomas  and in autoimmunity , but significant obstacles regarding acute graft versus host disease  still limit the broader use of this procedure. In general, efforts to reduce the incidence of GVHD have also diminished beneficial graft versus tumor  responses with increased tumor relapse, suggesting that these two processes are intimately linked  .
Accumulation of amyloid β , the main constituent of senile plaques, is believed to be central in AD pathogenesis . Instead, soluble Aβ correlates with the density of neurofibrillary tangles  and loss of synapses , i.e. with measures that are known to better reflect disease severity . These include Aβ oligomers like dimers, trimers and dodecamers , but also various large Aβ aggregates, such as Aβ protofibrils.
Stereotactic body radiotherapy  is now a well established treatment for medically inoperable early stage non small cell lung cancer , with 2 year local control rates ranging from 80 97%. However, an early prospective trial indicated that patients with centrally located lung tumors were at increased risk for severe pulmonary toxicity when treated with SBRT. As a result, tumors within a 2 cm radius of the proximal bronchial tree, often described as the “no fly zone ,” were excluded from the landmark RTOG 0236 trial  and are now being studied separately in a phase I/II trial  , which aims to determine the maximum tolerated dose  for SBRT in central lung tumors .
In the stomach, gastrin has a well defined role in the maintenance and functioning of the gastric oxyntic mucosa involving both growth and acid secretion. Amidated gastrins  act primarily on parietal and ECL cells through binding to the CCK 2/CCKB receptor, a high affinity G protein coupled receptor . In most cases, the levels of the nonamidated precursor forms of gastrin comprise <10% of the total secreted peptide, but increased levels are occasionally observed in disease states, such as in patients with colorectal cancer  .
The risk of injury associated with alcohol use is a function of the simultaneous combination of a number of factors . One of the most important and easily identifiable is the degree to which the drinkers’ cognitive and/or motor functions are influenced, which is a function not only of how much and the manner in which the alcohol is consumed , but also factors such as the drinker’s gender, age, height and weight, and level of tolerance to the effects of alcohol. This technique, described as a pair matched case crossover approach, was first proposed in a study of the risk of myocardial infarction associated with the onset of an acute risk factor .
Two trials have shown that male circumcision reduces the prevalence of high risk penile human papillomavirus  infection by approximately 35% in HIV negative men , and several cross sectional studies have found a lower rate of prevalent penile HPV infection in circumcised HIV uninfected men . However, it is unclear whether circumcision reduces the incidence of HPV acquisition or increases the clearance of preexisting HPV infection. One longitudinal observational study of 285 U.S. men, 25 of whom were circumcised, found no statistically significant difference in the hazards ratio  of acquisition of either high risk HPV  infections  or any HPV infection  in circumcised versus uncircumcised men .
Device infection remains the most dreaded complication of penile prosthesis implantation as this inevitably results in additional operations with an increased risk of infection, tissues loss, urethral injury and penile shortening. Historically, infection rates have been cited as 3 5%, however, rates of less than 1% are often quoted in contemporary single surgeon series . Non infectious failure rates increase over time, with non infectious survival rates of 97.6 and 93.2% at 3 and 5 years in a contemporary cohort.
We assessed defibrillation strength shock induced changes of the membrane time constant  and membrane potential  in intact rabbit hearts after administration of lidocaine, a sodium  channel blocker, or nifedipine, a L type calcium  channel blocker . Periodic additional dye staining and/or a continuous dye infusion at submicromolar concentration were performed to offset washout of the dye in order to maintain a high signal to noise ratio throughout the experiment . , We assumed that the normal AP has a 100 mV amplitude and a −85 mV resting potential.
The beat to beat function of the L type calcium channel , CaV1.2, is to provide trigger Ca for excitation contraction coupling in cardiac myocytes. Over a longer time frame, LTCC Ca current  provides Ca that ultimately contributes to cellular Ca homeostasis. In atrial fibrillation ICa,L, and CaV1.2 decrease .
The major cause of morbidity and mortality of CF patients is chronic lung disease. Innovative therapies to prevent the onset or reduce the pulmonary damage are under intensive pre clinical and clinical investigation . However, current anti inflammatory drugs, such as corticosteroids, show limitations in terms of efficacy or occurrence of adverse effects in CF patients, suggesting the need of identifying novel molecular targets and more effective anti inflammatory drugs specifically tailored for CF pulmonary pathophysiology  .
Many congenital heart defects affect formation of the cardiac valves  structures needed to direct blood flow through the heart and prevent regurgitation. Understanding the cellular mechanisms needed to form, maintain and repair the valve leaflets throughout adult life will facilitate the development of new strategies to treat heart valve defects and disease . During heart development, at embryonic day 9.5 in the mouse, the endothelium overlying the endocardial cushions is stimulated to undergo EMT to provide interstitial cells to the developing valve leaflets.
Rett syndrome  is a neurodevelopmental disorder caused by mutations in the gene encoding methyl CpG binding protein 2  that are predicted to result in loss of function of the protein  . RTT patients display a range of phenotypes that are predominantly expressed in the CNS, including stereotypical hand movements, problems with gait, social behavioral deficits associated with autistic like features, heightened anxiety, and loss of cognitive abilities including some learning disabilities  . MeCP2 is expressed at high levels in postmitotic neurons and only low levels in immature neurons, although RTT is a neuro developmental disorder .
Lumbar disc surgery remains one of the most commonly performed operations, with rates exhibiting considerable geographic variation. Two recent randomized trials demonstrated that surgery provides faster pain relief and perceived recovery in patients with herniated disc. Outcomes were similar at 1 year for patients assigned to surgery and for those assigned to non operative treatment.
Dioxin like compounds are environmental contaminants of great concern produced as unwanted byproducts of industrial processes and combustion . Some are resistant to chemical and biological degradation and bioaccumulate in animals and humans . The most toxic dioxin is 2,3,7,8 tetrachlorodibenzo p dioxin .
A remarkable insight emerging from the molecular era of carcinogenesis research is the universality of certain molecular pathways in the pathogenesis of a diverse array of tumor types. Although particular tissues require specific programs for control of growth and differentiation, neoplastic evolution frequently involves a common set of genes and their downstream effectors. Promyelocytic Leukemia , a phosphoprotein localized to specific nuclear bodies  is now recognized to participate in multiple cell activities including the control of growth, senescence and apoptosis .
While chronic degenerative arthropathy is the main morbidity of hemophilia, a very high prevalance of low bone density is also seen in men and boys with hemophilia. The current study investigates bone degradation in the knee joint of hemophilic mice resulting from hemarthrosis and the efficacy of aggressive treatment with factor VIII in the period surrounding injury to prevent bone pathology . Skeletally mature factor VIII knock out mice were subjected to knee joint hemorrhage induced by puncture of the left knee joint capsule.
Gliomas are the most common primary tumors of the central nervous system, with glioblastomas  as the most malignant entity. Because local invasion of neoplastic cells into the surrounding brain is perhaps the most important aspect of the biology of gliomas precluding successful treatment, pharmacological inhibition of glioma cell migration and brain invasion is considered as a promising strategy for the treatment of GBM  . Microarray technology was used to explore the expression profile of migrating glioma cells.
Pushing is commonly used when opening doors or moving grocery shopping carts, as well as while moving goods in warehouse and distribution settings . The majority of studies are focused on investigating the magnitudes and directions of exerted pushing force . Turning the patient in bed or repositioning in the seat of the wheelchair are performed while standing asymmetrically , which may induce high load on the spine and lead to health related absenteeism .
Severe orthostatic hypotension and pre syncopal symptoms are the main cause of disability among patients with autonomic failure. The current recommended therapeutic approaches are limited to medications that increase sodium reabsorption and expand plasma volume such as fludrocortisones,,  or vasoactive agents such as the alpha 1 adrenergic agonist, midodrine. ,  In this context, previous studies have reported the beneficial effect of pyridostigmine as an alternative therapy for orthostatic hypotension.
Tositumomab is a monoclonal antibody that selectively binds to CD20 on the surface of normal and malignant B cells and can be labeled with I 131 to yield I 131 labeled tositumomab . In patients previously treated with chemotherapy, the reported overall response ranged from 47% to 68%, and the complete response ranged from 20% to 38%. While these results are promising, there is much room for improving efficacy with individualized treatment planning .
There are substantial socioeconomic differences in rates of obesity and chronic diseases, including type 2 diabetes, and cardiovascular disease. Diet is a modifiable risk factor for such outcomes and as such is a likely contributor to health inequalities. Understanding the social and economic patterning of diet is important for informing public health action, as recognised by Public Health England in 2013 .
Hormones such as these can access the circumventricular organs, which are adjacent to the cerebral ventricles and have a poorly formed blood brain barrier. The circumventricular organs implicated in blood pressure control include the organum vasculosum of the lamina terminalis , the area postrema, the subfornical organ and the anteroventral third ventricle  region. The AV3V region includes the median preoptic nucleus, the OVLT and the periventricular nucleus and has been shown to play an important role in several behavioral, neural and hormonal functions involved in body fluid and cardiovascular homeostasis.
The disease has a high prevalence in people of Askenazi Jewish origin , and it is characterized by the presence of widespread spongy degeneration in the brain and spinal cord . Affected individuals suffer from mental retardation, weakness, blindness and functional disability, and most die by the age of five  . ASPA is highly expressed in mature oligodendrocytes , where it catalyzes the hydrolysis of the most abundant amino acid in the brain, N acetylaspartate  to acetate and aspartic acid .
Male mammals display a wide range of complex social behaviors toward young that can range from aggression to indifference to parental care . The frequency of infanticide expressed by individuals of a species can be influenced by a number of factors including: prenatal hormone exposure, prenatal stress, age, sex, previous sexual experience, previous exposure to young and previous social experience . However, the neural and endocrine mechanisms responsible for these changes in behavior are unknown .
Citrobacter rodentium is a natural mouse pathogen. It is the causative agent of transmissible murine colonic hyperplasia, and is responsible for high mortality in suckling mice . As a member of the attaching and effacing  family of bacterial pathogens, and the only known AE pathogen to naturally infect mice, it is a valuable model organism for the study of pathogenesis of the clinically significant human pathogens, enteropathogenic Escherichia coli  and enterohaemorrhagic E. coli  .

Histone acetyltransferases  and histone deacetylases  work in an opposing manner by acetylating and deacetylating histones, respectively. Vorinostat is an HDAC inhibitor  that inhibits class I and II HDACs, and causes apoptosis and cell cycle arrest in leukaemia cell lines in vitro.
The recent advent of pathway targeted chemotherapeutic agents, such as gefitinib and erlotinib, has led to improved therapy for a small subgroup of patients with advanced lung cancer. However, research findings have demonstrated that tumors with similar clinical characteristics  may respond differently to the same drug. The mitogen activated protein kinase kinase  is one of the critical molecules in the Ras/Raf/MEK/ERK cascade, which mediates signal transduction from Ras/Raf to extracellular signal regulated kinases  through phosphorylation of both tyrosine  and threonine  residues of ERK proteins.
The concept of neighborhood holds significance in South Africa. Under the apartheid regime , residential areas were forcefully segregated through the Group Areas Act of 1950  which restricted certain racial groups in terms of ownership and land occupation. The 1980's in South Africa was arguably one of the most violent periods , characterized by civil unrest, torture, and the slaying of political figures, actions undertaken by the apartheid regime against its citizens .
The adolescent period is one of rapid and transformative development, characterized by efforts to confront and surmount challenges and to establish a sense of identity and autonomy. Of particular concern are behaviors that place adolescents at risk for HIV infection, other sexually transmitted infections , and unintended pregnancy, in essence, sexual risk behaviors  . The incidence rate of HIV in the United States is seven times higher among African Americans than among Whites , with disproportionate transmission through heterosexual contact .
The successful demonstration that epidural electrical stimulation of posterior spinal cord structures can suppress pain , led to a widely spread clinical practice of spinal cord stimulation  to modify the severity of perception of nociceptive and neuropathic pain. Clinical practice of SCS has been extensively reviewed . Other spinal cord segments have been also targeted, like cervical segments for lungs bronchial tree dilatation, lower cervical and upper thoracic spinal cord segments to control pain in angina pectoris, sacral segments to augment bladder functions and lumbar segments for spasticity control .
The hierarchy used for identifying hematopoietic and endothelial progenitors provides a unique quantitative method for assessing the degree of heterogeneity in stem cell cultures and may offer important insights into mesenchymal stem cell  biology. Hematopoietic high proliferative potential colony forming cells  obtained from both mouse and human bone marrow have been shown to form large colonies  in double layer agar cultures and differentiate into multiple hematopoietic cell types . Low proliferative potential colony forming cells  are defined as hematopoietic cells that can grow into colonies smaller than HPP CFC but greater than 50 cells .
