Taken together, these data suggest that p63 plays critical roles in development, maintenance, and differentiation of stem cells in stratified epithelia . Gene expression and whole genome chromatin immunoprecipitation studies have shown that p63 isoforms and p53 have overlapping and distinct target gene specificities .
Female pelvic floor disorders  are a heterogeneous group of conditions that include urinary incontinence , pelvic organ prolapse  and fecal incontinence. These conditions can have a negative impact on a woman’s quality of life. Estimates from population based studies in the United States reveal that in older, community dwelling women, the prevalence of UI is as high as 41% and POP is 25%.

Resistance to extinction treatment is one of the many challenges to the treatment of PTSD. However, the efficacy of early  extinction of fear has been controversial.
In 2008, 1 in every 7 US households was food insecure, or at risk of going hungry because of an inability to afford food. Food insecurity generally occurs cyclically and episodically, with periods of food adequacy followed by food scarcity; the average food insecure household experiences seven episodes of food scarcity annually. We hypothesized that the cyclic nature of food insecurity, and its associated fluctuations in dietary intake, would predispose patients with diabetes to wide variations in blood glucose levels, including clinically significant hypoglycemia .
Epidemiologic and animal studies support the health benefits of habitual green tea consumption that include anti obesity properties , reduced risk of cardiovascular disease , decreased levels of oxidative stress ; as well as anti proliferative , anti inflammatory  and anti diabetic effects . A number of mechanisms have been proposed by which green tea and its constitutive polyphenolic catechins may modulate body weight   . For example, green tea and its extracts have been shown to induce carbohydrate malabsorption ; downregulate fatty acid synthase  ; suppress pancreatic and gastric lipase ; induce thermogenesis  ; incite sympathetic nervous system activity and lipolysis ; reduce adipocyte differentiation ; and alter the satiety response  .
Numerous studies have associated the mesolimbic dopaminergic  system, originating from the ventral tegmental area , with ethanol addiction. For instance,  ethanol consumption is reduced by the administration of dopamine antagonists  or agonists , or by the genetic deletion of dopamine D1 receptors  ;  pharmacological manipulations of VTA DA neuron activity alter ethanol consumption ;  ethanol increases dopamine release, from both the synaptic terminals ) and the somatodendritic region in the VTA ; and  ethanol stimulates the spontaneous activity of VTA DA neurons . However, the specific mechanism by which ethanol excites VTA DA neurons has not been fully clarified .
Metal organic frameworks  have attracted the interest of chemists, physicists, and materials scientists due to their promising applications in catalysis, separations, optics, magnetism, host guest chemistry and gas storage, as well as for the variety of their often esthetically pleasing, highly symmetric structures. Bulky SBUs, serving as a large vertices joined by rigid organic links, favor the formation of interpenetrated extended frameworks. The trinuclear Cu3) moiety is a common cluster unit generated in situ from reactions of copper  and pyrazoles or triazoles.
Aberrant fucosylation of membrane proteins, however, is characteristic of many pathological conditions, including cancer, neurological disorders, immune dysfunction, and developmental defects. For example, deficiency in fucosylation impairs leukocyte vascular epithelium interactions, which leads to a congenital disorder known as leukocyte adhesion deficiency type II . GDP Fuc serves as the donor substrate for fucosyltransferases , enzymes located in the endoplasmic reticulum and Golgi, which transfer fucose from GDP Fuc to N  and O linked glycans or to protein acceptors directly   .
Fluorescence spectroscopy has changed significantly in recent years due to the discovery of Metal Enhanced Fluorescence , a metalfluorophore interaction that greatly increases the observed emission intensity . Since the discovery of MEF the phenomenon has been applied to several bioassays . The study here shows that the enhancement factors measured in this geometry are to an extent erroneous.

This empirical question is important because elucidating which neural systems might be engaged in this process could provide clues for effectively treating cocaine addiction . A previous investigation demonstrated that nucleus accumbens neurons undergo significant dose dependent changes in firing rate that are correlated with shifts in behavioral responding when different unit doses are available for self administration in rats .
Anaplastic lymphoma kinase  positive Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma  is an aggressive T cell lymphoma that carries a chromosomal translocation involving the ALK gene . The most common chromosomal aberration is the translocation t, occurring in nearly 75% of cases, which results in abnormal expression of a chimeric fusion protein, nucleophosmin  ALK . Currently, a multi drug chemotherapy approach is the mainstream treatment for ALCL .
Receptors for this family of cytokines share a common subunit, gp130, which complexes with a variety of cell surface and soluble receptor chains that provide specificity for the separate ligands . Functions of this family of cytokines in mucosal immunity are complex and overlapping due to the combinatorial expression of shared and specific receptor subunits on various cell types. Although the effects of OSM on structural cells in various systems have been described, fewer studies have examined its effects on hematopoietic immune cells.
Microbial recognition by the innate immune system is mediated by a multitude of cellular and endosomal membrane bound, as well as intracellular receptors. Toxoplasma gondii derived pattern activation molecular patterns , namely cyclophilin 18 and profilin have been shown to be recognized by receptors present in macrophages and dendritic cells, triggering cell activation and production of pro inflammatory cytokines, including IL 1β, IL 6 and IL 12. In fact, TLR11 that was previously found to mediate recognition of uropathogenic bacteria has been identified as a major component and is essential for development of protective immune response in infected mice through the induction of massive IL 12 production by dendritic cells.
To date, approximately 100% of large molecule drugs do not cross the BBB and 98% of small molecules cannot penetrate this barrier, thereby limiting drug development efforts for many CNS disorders. Gene delivery has recently been proposed as a method to bypass the BBB; however, widespread delivery to the brain and spinal cord has been challenging. Two of the most common motor neuron diseases are SMA and ALS, both debilitating disorders of children and adults, respectively, with no effective therapies to date.
It has been estimated that there will be about 226,870 new cases of breast cancer in United States in 2012, and about 39,510 women will die from this disease . Each of these subtypes has unique biologic and prognostic features. As microarray gene expression analysis is not routinely available, immunohistochemical surrogates have been developed which approximate the molecular subtypes of breast cancer .
In the absence of a single unifying molecular genetic event leading to the disease manifestation, the focus of new therapies should be based on biological pathways critical to tumor survival,,. Interactions between the myeloma cell and the marrow microenvironment leads to increased cytokine secretion both by the myeloma cells as well as the cells of the microenvironment, in particular VEGF, IL6 and IGF,,,,,,,,. The increased cytokine levels lead to an up regulation of signaling pathways within myeloma cells that ultimately results in increased transcription of proliferation related genes and decreased transcription of apoptosis promoting genes.
In personalized medicine, a detailed understanding of the molecular aberrations in the cell is utilized to select a drug with an appropriate mechanism of action. The potential for such strategies has been powerfully demonstrated for cancers that have translocations, mutations, or aberrant expression levels of key proteins. In human cells, apoptosis occurs through a cascade of events involving two main pathways: the intrinsic pathway and the extrinsic pathway.
Pacemaker cells  within the sinoatrial node  generate the electrical impulse that initiates each heartbeat. Sinus node dysfunction , characterized by loss of PCs and SAN fibrosis, is a common but poorly understood disease. With the advent of cellular reprogramming technology,,  there is increasing interest in understanding gene regulatory networks in PCs, both to improve our understanding of SND and to facilitate novel therapies such as biological pacemakers and SAN regeneration .
IL 6 and related cytokines bind to specific cell surface receptors that become associated through their cytoplasmic domain with tyrosine kinases such as the Janus kinase  family kinases , which phosphorylate specific tyrosine residues in STAT proteins , leading to homo  or heterodimerization with other STAT proteins then translocation into the nucleus to regulate gene transcription . The JAK/STAT3 signaling pathway plays important roles in carcinogenesis because many Stat3 target genes including cyclin D1, Bcl XL, Mcl1, Hspa1a and Cryab are involved in cell proliferation and survival . Therefore, it has been targeted for cancer therapy .
Individual differences in risk for mood and anxiety disorders likely stem from multiple predisposing factors, including genetic variants that shape the developmental formation and/or adult functional integrity of the neural circuitry subserving emotion . Of note, the C57BL/6J strain typically shows lesser anxiety  and stress related behavior but greater conditioned fear behavior relative to certain other strains including BALB/cJ and in some cases DBA/2J ) . Over the last thirty years, the C57BL/6J and DBA/2J strains have been intercrossed to produce a large and still growing panel of recombinant inbred  strains .
Pyrrolysine is the 22nd amino acid found to have entered natural genetic codes . To date, this residue has only been documented in methylamine methyltransferases initiating methane formation in Archaea such as Methanosarcina barkeri . The genes encoding these methyltransferases contain an in frame amber codon  that is translated .
The p75 neurotrophin receptor  is a potential therapeutic target for AD . Nerve Growth Factor  signaling through p75NTR may induce death or survival depending on the cellular context, while the pro form of NGF signals through p75NTR and sortilin to induce death . p75NTR also regulates neurite outgrowth through its interactions with the Nogo and LINGO co receptors .
MSCs are traditionally isolated from bone marrow. Moreover, MSCs and its progenies are involved in tissue or organ formation during embryonic development and adult fracture repair or remodeling . Recent studies demonstrate that the cholinergic system also plays a role in regulating the function of non neural tissues or cells .
The basement membrane  is a major functional component of the extracellular matrix. The BM plays a formative role in development, and synthetic matrices are being developed to support tissue regeneration after tissue injury . The kidney is an excellent organ in which to study BM targeted contrast agents, since 150 L of filtrate must pass through the glomerular basement membrane  in humans each day.
The striatum incorporates two major locomotor regulatory circuits, the direct and indirect pathways, which together modulate cortical output that determines locomotor activity. At the postsynaptic level, type A1 adenosine receptors  and type D1 dopamine receptors  form heterodimers on striatal neurons of the direct pathway, whereas heterodimers of A2A adenosine receptors  and D2 dopamine receptors  form on neurons of the indirect pathway ). Inhibitory interactions both within and between these heterodimeric receptors modulate striatal neuronal excitability and neurotransmission .
Individuals with physical disabilities are as sexually active and have the same reproductive health needs as those without a disability . However, individuals with disabilities experience multiple physical and attitudinal barriers to reproductive health services . Previous research shows reduced cervical and breast cancer screening among women with disabilities .
Airway epithelial overexpression of the epithelial Na+ channel β subunit , driven by the Clara cell secretory protein  promoter in transgenic  mice, results in epithelial Na+ hyperabsorption, airway surface liquid  dehydration, impaired mucus clearance, airway inflammation and early post natal mortality . The Scnn1b Tg mouse model recapitulates many features of cystic fibrosis  and other human airway diseases associated with relative dehydration of airway surfaces , including chronic bronchitis  and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease . The inflammatory infiltrate is characterized by enlarged/highly vacuolated macrophages, persistent neutrophilia associated with elevated KC, MIP 2 and TNFα, and transient eosinophilia with increased levels of IL 13 and eotaxin 1 .

Interestingly, Vpx also increases the ability of HIV 1 to efficiently infect macrophages, dendritic cells and resting CD4+ T cells when Vpx is incorporated into HIV 1 particles or supplied in trans . Some Vpx proteins target the N terminal region of SAMHD1 suggesting more than one mechanism for degradation .
Limitations in STM can interfere with perceptual processing and learning of speech. Increased STM capacity is required in adults when listening to speech in noise . However, complex working memory  shows a steep developmental slope up to the age of sixteen .
Much of what we know about the characteristics of attentional bottlenecks in vision has come from studies in which sequences of brief stimuli are presented to the steadily fixating eye. Under normal circumstances attention is not rigidly held in place by a fixation target, but is in continual motion, as saccadic eye movements take the line of sight from one region to another . These prior results came from studies of saccades made to designated targets, another convenient, but artificial, situation.
Dynamic contrast enhanced magnetic resonance imaging  measures the transit of a tracer such as a gadolinium chelate to estimate physiologic parameters related to perfusion or permeability in vivo. Observed tissue concentration versus time curves would then reflect regional/local perfusion, permeability, or volume fraction, with minimal confounding effects due to the shape of the input function. However for practical reasons, tracers are usually injected intravenously, resulting in unpredictable dilution and widening of the bolus by the time it arrives at the feeding vessels.

This competitive superiority is the likely mechanism for displacement of A. aegypti in some locations in the field . A second hypothesis is a colonization competition tradeoff, wherein species coexist in patchy environments when the superior ability to disperse among patches prevents local and regional exclusion of competitively inferior species . A third hypothesis is aggregation, in which species coexist because of spatial separation.
Atypical antipsychotic drugs are a mainstay of psychiatric pharmacotherapy and are used to treat a variety of psychiatric illnesses, most notably schizophrenia. These second generation drugs lack the extrapyramidal and other debilitating movement side effects that complicated treatment with first generation compounds. Drug therapy is typically continued in patients that are resistant to the weight gain promoting effects of antipsychotics, though the weight gain independent effects of these drugs are less well understood in humans.
The somatodendritic surface of CNS neurons is a highly dynamic membrane environment, in which the number of specific signaling receptors accessible to extracellular ligands is tightly controlled by vesicular trafficking processes . Endocytic removal of neural signaling receptors has been investigated in considerable detail , but less is known about how signaling receptors are returned to the somatodendritic surface. Endocytic recycling in neurons is remarkable both for its high throughput and biochemical selectivity.
There is a growing body of evidence suggesting that chronic vascular inflammation plays a role in the development of essential hypertension, either as a pathogenic or secondary event . Inflammatory mediators, such as C reactive protein , interleukin 1β ; interleukin 6 , tumor necrosis factor alpha , and reactive oxygen species , have been proposed to contribute to essential hypertension through several mechanisms, including enhancement of arterial stiffness and/or endothelial dysfunction . Long term complications of hypertension include target organ damage, especially in the kidney.
At high doses, it is responsible for the human neurotoxic illness known as amnesic shellfish poisoning , with symptoms that include seizures, memory loss, coma, and death . For humans, risks of exposure to high levels of domoic acid are managed by testing shellfish and regulating harvests based on toxin loads ; however, there are no regulatory guidelines in place for protection from long term low level repetitive exposure  due to a lack of knowledge regarding the health impacts of chronic or episodic low level domoic acid exposure  . Of particular concern are coastal and tribal communities that rely heavily on seafood products as a major food source.

Gene prediction programs identify protein coding genes using either ab initio prediction, evidence based prediction, or a combination of the two methods. The main mistake during manual annotation from previous genome projects was allowing the submission of incomplete data and data inconsistent with itself.
Protein biomarkers are critical for early detection of disease, prognosis and therapy monitoring. However, the number of new FDA approved biomarkers has greatly decreased in recent years , which has been attributed to the high false discovery rate of the “omics” methods, and the lack of robust methods for biomarker verification . While studies are being conducted to identify and standardize approaches that will circumvent these issues , it is equally important to use these new approaches for re evaluation of existing biomarkers.

In vertebrates, recombination rates, rather than natural selection, seem to drive changes in GS .
Stroke is a leading cause of death nationally and internationally  and is associated with enormous public health burden, reductions in quality of life, increased health care costs, and a loss in economic productivity. Stroke is the 4th leading cause of death in the U.S. . In South Carolina, stroke was the 3rd leading cause of death and ranked 8th among other states in 2006 .
Normal learning and behavior require the proper maturation and plasticity of synapses. Here, we identify the adenomatous polyposis coli  protein as an essential regulator, in vivo, of synaptic density, maturation and signal transduction networks in forebrain neurons . APC is a ubiquitiously expressed, large scaffold protein with multiple binding partners and functions.
Still, clinical success of adoptive immunotherapeutic approaches have been restricted to about 50% of patients, who show mostly partial rather than complete clinical responses  . Several factors clearly influence the challenge of an efficient immunotherapy: thymic selection, tumor released inhibitory cytokines and chemokines, the presence of regulatory T cells, altered macrophage differentiation, and defects in DCs . Consistent with this idea, we have previously shown that vaccination with mouse TRP 2, a melanoma associated self antigen , had only minor protective/therapeutic effect on B16 tumor challenge, due to an abortive immune response .
Oligodendrocyte precursor cells  are generated from progenitor zones in the forebrain beginning at various times during embryonic development . The mechanisms regulating the spatial and temporal production of OPCs have not been clearly elucidated; in particular, it is not clear why OPCs appear at later stages dorsally than ventrally. Wnts are secreted glycoprotein ligands that regulate development of dorsal CNS structures .
Argininosuccinate synthetase  catalyzes the third step in the urea cycle, the conversion of citrulline and aspartate into argininosuccinic acid with the cleavage of ATP into AMP and PPi. Complete deficiency of the enzyme results in classic citrullinemia. However it has been recognized that some patients with milder deficiency may present with later onset of learning disabilities, in acute crisis in pregnancy  or as an incidental finding with good long term follow up  .
In this study we provide global transcriptomic profiling and analysisof botulinum toxin A treated muscle over a 1 yearperiod . Microarray analysis was performed on rat tibialis anterior musclesfrom 4 groups  at 1, 4, 12, and 52weeks after BoNT A injection compared with saline injected rats at 12weeks . Dramatic transcriptional adaptation occurred at 1 week with aparadoxical increase in expression of slow and immature isoforms, activationof genes in competing pathways of repair and atrophy, impaired mitochondrialbiogenesis, and increased metal ion imbalance.
Nonetheless, these techniques have not yet reached submicron resolution. By utilizing endogenous sources of NLO signals, label free NLO imaging of unstained tissues has been intensively studied, and several examples of label free imaging methods have been reported. Specifically, two photon excited fluorescence  microscopy has been applied to tissue imaging with intrinsic fluorescence.
Oligomers of N substituted glycines, or “peptoids”, are a new class of unnatural materials that are capable of mimicking the structure and function of peptides and proteins. They are resistant to proteases and more membrane permeable, due to the lack of amide  NH groups, thus overcoming two major problems associated with peptide drugs. Combinatorial chemistry provides a powerful method for the rapid identification of high affinity ligands against macromolecular targets .
Defined as an accumulation of deficits  across physical, psychological, and social domains , this phenomenon may be a major contributor to disability,morbidity, and premature mortality. For decades, frailty has been written about andcharacterized; a seminal paper identifies frailty as a clinical syndrome withspecific hallmark characteristics  such as shrinking, weakness, exhaustion, slowness, and lowactivity. While other authors focus on signs, and disease classifications, oftenleading to adverse outcomes  .
Over the last several years published diagnostic guidelines for FAS/FASD have included; Institute of Medicine  guidelines , FASD 4 Digit Diagnostic Code , Center for Disease Control and prevention  guidelines , Hoyme FASD guidelines , and Canadian FASD guidelines . Variations in facial phenotypes across ethnic groups also complicate the diagnosis of FAS. For example, a recent study using facial anthropomorphometry to classify FAS and control cases using discriminant analysis of 16 different facial measures in 4 different groups  found that FAS and control cases could be classified with relatively high sensitivity and specificity in each group, but the discriminant analysis relied on different, unique combinations of measures for each group to achieve the best results .
rAAVs have a number of advantageous characteristics that identify them as one of the most feasible gene transfer vectors in the treatment of a variety of diseases, including neurological diseases. Convection enhanced delivery  is a method of delivering clinically relevant volumes of therapeutic agents to significantly larger areas of the brain in a direct intracranial injection procedure. The CED technique is designed to utilize the phenomenon of bulk flow and positive pressure to distribute macromolecules to a large volume within solid tissue.
The negative impact of having a family member with a serious mental health issues or chronic illness is well documented. Family members with a substance abusing loved one report difficulties in life domains such as emotional and physical wellness, finances, and involvement with the legal system . These difficulties include relationship dissatisfaction , enabling behaviors , negative communication styles , and interpersonal violence  .
Although PCBs were banned decades ago, they are still widespread environmental contaminants. The highest body burden is found in infants and toddlers, because of exposure through maternal milk and house dust . The PBDE congeners found at highest levels in human tissues are BDE 47 , BDE 99  and BDE 153  .
Respiratory syncytial virus  is a major cause of infant morbidity from severe lower respiratory tract infection with bronchiolitis worldwide. Early attempts at vaccination of seronegative infants and young children using formalin inactivated RSV were unsuccessful. Vaccinees, after subsequent natural RSV infection, exhibited a more severe illness characterized in several instances by enhanced pulmonary injury with extensive mononuclear cell infiltration and pulmonary eosinophilia, compared to placebo vaccine control children .
Mutations in leucine rich repeat protein kinase 2  underlie the most common known genetic cause of familial and apparently sporadic Parkinson's disease  cases . The LRRK2 protein contains several distinctive structural and functional domains . The function of LRRK2 as a signaling molecule has therefore attracted a great deal of scrutiny.
The HIV 1 matrix  protein represents the N terminal domain of the precursor Gag  protein that directs the assembly of HIV particles . However, alternative membrane binding domains  can replace MA in terms of directing the assembly of virus particles at membranes . Moreover, viruses carrying large deletions in the MA coding region can be infectious in cell culture systems, as long as the large cytoplasmic domain of SU is deleted .
The defining feature of FOX transcription factors is a conserved DNA binding region known as the forkhead box or winged helix domain. Use of a conditional mouse knockout model shows a requirement for Foxd3 in the establishment of murine ES cell lines . FoxD3 regulates specification of the neural crest lineage.
Small animal models of human disease play an important role in the development of new therapies for human diseases by providing a complete, functional biological system in which the effects of novel interventions may be tested and characterized. MRI is often used in assessing small animal models of disease because it yields high resolution images with excellent soft tissue contrast, it is non invasive, and it does not require the use of ionizing radiation . One complication inherent to this technique that limits its breadth of application is the poor linewidths that are observed over multiple volumes .
The ancient phylum of Apicomplexa encompasses thousands of unicellular animal parasite species, including important human pathogens such as Plasmodium, Toxoplasma, Cryptosporidia and Cyclospora species. ,,, In most eukaryotes, a profilin promotes the rapid elongation of actin filaments by delivering monomeric  actin, or G actin, to the filament barbed ends. ,, Apicomplexans lacking profilin can grow and replicate but they can cannot invade host cells, presumably because their ability to polymerize actin for host invasion is compromised.
Immunologic self tolerance is required for an effective immune system, and is provided by the concerted activities of central and peripheral tolerance. A growing body of evidence describes mechanisms underlying the generation and activity of regulatory T cells  that bear the CD4+25+Foxp3+ phenotype . Expression of TSA in thymus, including aire gene directed expression of TSA in medullary thymic epithelial cells, leads to negative selection of T cells specific for TSA , and to positive selection of Tregs specific for TSA , providing protection from autoimmune disease.
Intercellular calcium waves  provide a mechanism for long range signaling between astrocytes . Transmission of ICWs can involve both gap junction mediated direct cytosol to cytosol diffusion of second messengers such as IP3 and Ca2+, and release of molecules such as ATP that diffuse through extracellular space, interacting with receptors on neighboring cells to mobilize calcium from the intracellular and extracellular compartments  . The main type of glial cell in sensory ganglia is the satellite glial cell .
The creatine kinase  reaction has been studied in humans with phosphorus  ST MRS in the brain , skeletal muscle , and the heart . It reversibly transfers high energy phosphate between adenosine triphosphate  and phosphocreatine  through: PCr+adenosinediphosphate+H+↔krkfATP+creatine, where kf and kr are the pseudo first order forward and reverse rate constants, respectively. The four angle saturation transfer  method enabled for the first time studies of CK kinetics in human heart at 1.5T , and to date remains the only localized ST method applied in patient studies .
Misery perfusion constitutes a hemodynamic state in which cerebral blood flow falls yet oxygen metabolism is maintained by increased oxygen extraction fraction  . Several methods for measuring OEF have been developed. The steady state method with inhalation of 15O labeled gas  and the bolus method with bolus injection of 15O labeled water  both require arterial blood sampling during the PET studies in order to convert PET counts into quantitative OEF measurements.
Benzene, a component of gasoline, is associated with various hematological cancers . Multiple possible mechanisms of action are thought to be involved in benzene toxicity . Previously, using microarrays, we reported dose dependent changes in gene expression in peripheral blood mononuclear cells  associated with exposures to benzene ranging from less than 1 ppm to greater than 10 ppm in 83 workers in shoe manufacturing plants in China, compared to unexposed controls .
Recent high throughput sequencing of cancer genomes has led to newdiscoveries of mutations in cellular processes that were not previously known toplay a causal role in cancer. One such processes is RNA splicing . Among the recentlydiscovered spliceosome genes that are involved in cancers, SF3B1 is the mostfrequently mutated.
Surrogate decision makers of critically ill patients often have inaccurate expectations about their loved one's prognosis. This is problematic because prognostic information influences treatment decisions. Undue optimism in particular may lead to the use of invasive treatments that are inconsistent with patients' preferences.
Human interleukin 6 is a multifunctional pro inflammatory cytokine produced by many cell types including immune cells , vascular smooth muscle cells , adipocytes and skeletal muscle . Interleukin 6 has both an acute and chronic inflammatory role . The protein also provides various signals to regulate cell growth , immune responses , and acute phase protein secretion , Interleukin 6 is an important regulator of immune response, inflammation and hematopoiesis .
The regulatory functions of CD4+ CD25+ FoxP3+ cells  in maintaining peripheral tolerance, to self antigens has led to studies investigating their use in inhibiting alloreactive T cell responses following allogeneic marrow transplantation. A significant reduction of lethal graft versus host disease  has been observed following injection of freshly isolated or ex vivo activated Tregs. ,, Tregs have been reported to act in an antigen specific manner and are known to prevent CD8 T cell mediated allograft rejection.
S100A4, also known as Fsp1 , is well known to be over expressed in fibrotic diseases of the lung, kidney, liver, and heart . However, in the higher grade endometrioid carcinomas and the non endometrioid carcinomas, S100A4 protein is expressed in tumor epithelial cells. S100A4 belongs to the S100 gene family, a multi gene family of Ca2+ binding proteins of the EF hand type.
The acute respiratory distress syndrome  is a highly morbid clinical entity marked pathophysiologically by the flooding of the alveolar space with protein rich fluid which leads to severe impairment of gas exchange and hypoxia . Pulmonary endothelial cell  mechanics play a central role in the regulation of this barrier function as the formation of intercellular gaps and paracellular movement of fluid and solute are the primary mechanism producing vascular leak in pathologic conditions . In vitro, the edema generating compound thrombin stimulates the formation of transcellular stress fibers, cell contraction, and rounding to disrupt the EC barrier .
The yeast SUV3 protein localizes primarily in the mitochondrial matrix and displays RNA helicase activity . Together with the ribonuclease DSS1, SUV3 forms a RNA degradosome complex  that affects a variety of mitochondrial processes. The mammalian ortholog of the SUV3 gene, designated Supv3L1, is a member of the Ski2 family of DExH box RNA helicases, and has been shown in vitro to possess both RNA/RNA and DNA/DNA unwinding activities .
It has been established that substance P and calcitonin gene related peptide are associated with inflammation associated pain . Recently, the role of other neuropeptides has been investigated, especially the neurotrophin family, of which brain derived neurotrophic factor  belongs, and have been shown to play a role in airway inflammation . Further, it has been shown that dendritic accessory cells of the immune system are able to produce BDNF following stimulation with allergens and other mediators of inflammation  and also that monocytes actively produce and release neurotrophins, including BDNF, during allergic episodes .
Alzheimer Disease  is a neurodegenerative disorder involving severe cognitive decline that is characterized by initial synaptic dysfunction and later extensive neuronal death in the CNS . A hallmark of AD is the presence of extracellular amyloid plaques, formed by aggragated amyloid beta , a 40  or 42 aminoacid long peptide resulting from cleavage of the larger amyloid precursor protein  . Evidence suggests that soluble Aβ oligomers are the most toxic Aβ species in the AD brain .
A large number of new neurons are added to the dentate gyrus  of adult mammals . There is considerable evidence that these adult born granule neurons are physiologically functional  and contribute to hippocampus dependent behaviors . Despite the wide range of behaviors that appear to require new neuron function, little is known about the specific contribution of new neurons to hippocampal function .
Current efficacy data supporting the routine use of acellular dermal matrices  in postmastectomy tissue expander/implant reconstruction is limited. A multi center, blinded, randomized controlled study was designed to evaluate the effectiveness of ADM in the setting of TE/I reconstruction. The primary objective of the study was to determine whether the use of ADM would decrease patient reported, post operative pain.
Inherited deficiency of hepatic alanine:glyoxylate aminotransferase  in primary hyperoxaluria type 1  or glyoxylate reductase/hydroxypyruvate reductase  in primary hyperoxaluria type 2  results in marked overproduction of oxalate by the liver . Oxalate cannot be metabolized in the human body, thus the excess oxalate must be eliminated, largely by the kidneys, resulting in marked hyperoxaluria. Calcium oxalate crystals in the interstitium of the kidney induce injury characterized by recruitment of macrophages and release of inflammatory mediators, cellular infiltrates, granuloma formation, and scarring.
Although the role of B7: CD28 interactions in promoting initial T cell activation is well established, a separate role for B7: CD28 interactions in promoting T cell tolerance has only recently been acknowledged . Investigation of the severe and accelerated diabetes that develops in CD28 deficient  and B7.1/2 double deficient  NOD  mice  revealed that B7: CD28 interactions control regulatory T cells . The results suggest that the B7: CD28 costimulatory pathway is essential for the development and homeostasis of regulatory T cells.
Transforming growth factor βs  are multifunctional cytokines with widespread effects on cell growth and differentiation, migration, and extracellular matrix  deposition, and have key roles in wound repair . With respect to cutaneous repair, TGF β1 and TGF β2 are known to promote fibroplasia and scar, while TGF β3 may or may not reduce scar  . The transition from scarless fetal type repair to adult type repair with scar occurs between days 16  and 18  of gestation in fetal rat skin .
TMS holds significant promise as a tool for cognitive neuroscience  as well as psychiatric research in the areas of depression and obsessive compulsive disorder . Unfortunately, the poor spatial focus of the current generation of TMS coils severely limits the ability of the clinical investigator in psychiatry to more precisely direct neuronal stimulation. Present TMS coilss stimulate large regions of tissue at a time limited to areas near the surface of the brain, as the electric field drops as the inverse of the distance to the coil.
A growing consensus has indicated that the temperature sensitivity of the water proton resonant frequency   is the most well suited parameter to exploit to create temperature maps for MRI guidance of thermal therapies. The method is sensitive to changes in the local magnetic field between scans which appear as temperature variations. The magnitude of these artifacts depend on the local magnetic field gradients, and will thus likely be largest at regions with a large magnetic susceptibility mismatch, such as adjacent to bowel or lung.
Podosomes and invadopodia are related cellular structures present in cells with physiologically or pathologically invasive behaviors respectively . In contrast, many human cancer cells appear to contain invadopodia constitutively. But ROS production can also be of physiological benefit.
One of the best resources to study the lung cancer OncoGenome is the formalin fixed paraffin embedded  archival samples. FFPE tumor tissues serve as indispensable tools for determining proteinaceous antigens and therefore serve the cause of research, diagnosis and teaching . Embedding FFPE tumor tissues facilitates thin sectioning for antigenic analysis.
However, children have yet to develop these internal mechanisms of regulation, as amygdalaprefrontal circuitry undergoes protracted development through adolescence . Because of this relative immaturity, external sources  of regulation play a critical role in children's emotion regulation  . The mother* provides widespread regulatory influences in childhood that include physiological, thermal, and nutritional regulation .
Programmed cell death 4  is a novel tumor suppressor that inhibits tumorigenesis by interfering with translation initiation. As a result of its translation inhibitory effects, Pdcd4 inhibits transformation, migration and invasion in vitro . Instead, Pdcd4 levels are post transcriptionally regulated by miR 21 , and post translationally regulated by proteasomal degradation ,.
The domestic dog  exhibits the greatest morphologic diversity of any mammal . Variation in size between breeds spans two orders of magnitude with the 1 kg Chihuahua and 100 kg mastiff representing extremes of the continuum. An equally impressive level of variation is apparent when considering conformation.
Endothelial cell proliferation and migration are essential for angiogenesis. Typically, proliferation and chemotaxis of endothelial cells is driven by growth factors such as vascular endothelial growth factor  and basic fibroblast growth factor   . They are also expressed by a variety of tumor cells and tumor endothelial cells .
The goals of non surgical periodontal therapy  are debridement of bacterial plaque and removal of bacterial products from root surfaces. A. actinomycetemcomitans is strongly associated with aggressive periodontitis and recurrent adult periodontitis, while P. gingivalis is associated with severe chronic periodontitis, failing guided tissue regeneration, and acute periodontal abscesses. Use of systemic antibiotics in conjunction with scaling and root planing significantly enhances gains in clinical attachment level in comparison to treatment with scaling and root planing alone .
Obsessive compulsive disorder  and Tourette syndrome  are neurodevelopmental disorders with significant phenotypic and genetic overlap., One promising avenue for identifying cross disorder genetic risk factors in neurodevelopmental disorders is the study of genomic copy number variants , segments of DNA ranging from 1 kilobase to several megabases that show deletions or duplications compared to a reference. The association of large, rare CNVs with neurodevelopmental disorders including autism spectrum disorders , schizophrenia, and intellectual disability  has been one of the most important recent advances in psychiatric genomics. Both OCD and TS are highly heritable and have long been suspected to share genetic liability, though specific gene variants have been difficult to identify.
In resting cells, inhibitory IκB molecules bind NF κB dimers via ankyrin repeats and retain them in the cytoplasm. In this pathway, p100, which is mainly associated with RelB in non stimulated cells, is phosphorylated by IKKα at its C terminal region, leading to K48 linked polyubiquitination also by the SCFIκB complex. TRAF2, 5 and 6 also activate NF κB signaling upon overexpression, , , an activity not exhibited by TRAF3.
Bipolar disorder is characterized by recurrent episodes of hypomania or mania and major depression. The rate reported by a representative community sample of adolescents and young adults in Germany  appears lower than that from clinical samples. Higher rates of conversion are seen in the child and adolescent samples .
Head and neck squamous cell carcinomas  may arise in diverse locations but have a common etiologic association with tobacco and/or alcohol exposure. The management of HNSCC often consists of surgical resection, followed by postoperative radiotherapy or chemoradiation therapy. This subset of patients might benefit from surgery prior to adjunctive therapy but their identification remains a clinical challenge requiring new testing methods .
Biofilms, defined as surface attached bacteria encased in a hydrated polymeric matrix, are the cause of many persistent and chronic bacterial infections. Exopolysaccharides have also been implicated in adhesion, development, and maintenance of the structure of mature biofilms . The genetic loci responsible for the production of each of these polysaccharides have been identified, but many questions regarding how the exopolysaccharides are polymerized, exported to the periplasm and secreted remain to be answered .
Elimination is a modernized view of the older concept of cancer immunosurveillance that now takes into account that efficient tumor destruction requires the coordinated effects of both innate and adaptive immunity. Sometimes not all tumor cells are eliminated and the residual tumor cells enter the equilibrium phase where the immune system and developing tumor enter into a temporary state of balance that controls tumor outgrowth. Although many immune components that participate in the equilibrium phase are known, the underlying mechanisms remain poorly defined.
Early experience has been shown to have a profound impact on the prevalence of functional bowel disorders. Restricted fetal growth  significantly increases the incidence of irritable bowel syndrome  and a birth weight less than 1500g accelerates the age of symptom onset , most likely due to an immature gastrointestinal tract at birth . Nerve growth factor   and corticotropin releasing factor  have been implicated in the initiation and maintenance of altered colonic sensitivity and permeability.
Traumatic brain injury  is one of the most common causes of death and long term disability in the pediatric age range . Relative deficits are also observed on tasks with greater demands on self organization, inferencing, or metacognition, as opposed to those providing external structure or tapping the child’s existing knowledge base  . Younger age at injury is another predictor of more negative outcomes.
Oligodendrocytes  are necessary for myelination of axons in the central nervous system, and thus essential for proper brain function. Several well established markers are used to demonstrate gradual differentiation of OL lineage, from early oligodendrocyte progenitor cells , immunolabeled by chondroitin sulfate proteoglycan  and platelet derived growth factor receptor alpha , to late OPCs labeled with O4 antibody, and finally to premyelinating and myelinating OLs expressing myelin proteins, MBP  and MOG   . Several cell types are described as the initial oligodendrocyte progenitors: common oligodendrocyte and astrocyte progenitors  , glial restricted precursors , a common neuronoligodendrocyte progenitor in the ventral spinal cord , and adult subventricular zone .
Matrix assisted laser desorption/ionization time of flight mass spectrometry  is a well established rapid, selective, and sensitive analytical tool for characterization of biomolecules. The authors could observe at optimum conditions, mass spectrum signal intensities as good as that in conventional MALDI with very few background peaks, even at low mass. Another advantage of AuNP was demonstrated as its high salt tolerance ability for analysis of biomolecules by SALDI MS.  High salt tolerance of AuNP towards detection of biomolecules indicated utility of AuNP SALDI MS without any desalting step .
NMDARs are heteromeric assemblies composed of an obligatory GluN1 subunit and 1 or more GluN2  subunits . GluN2B expression decreases in favor of GluN2A during development . In adult cortex and hippocampus, GluN2A and GluN2B are the predominant subunits and confer distinct physiological and molecular properties to NMDARs therein.
In the liver, the APR is characterized by significant changes in its gene and protein expression profile, resulting in the up regulation of positive acute phase proteins  such as C reactive protein, as well as in the down regulation of negative APPs such as transthyretin  and albumin. The hepatic APR is mediated by several cytokines including interleukin 6 , interleukin 1β , and tumor necrosis factor α  . The study of the APR and the transcriptional changes in the APR genes provides an excellent system to dissect the basic molecular mechanisms involved in the modulation of gene expression .
In contrast to most other mammalian cell types, adult neural cells have traditionally been thought of as non regenerative cells. Adult neurogenesis is now widely accepted to have implications for most areas of neuroscience including synaptic integration, neurodegeneration, injury and epilepsy. In turn, neurogenesis is dependent upon a resident population of cells in the brain which can be induced to proliferate in response to various stimuli.
Progressive remodeling of the left ventricular  architecture occurs after myocardial infarction . Heart transplantation is applied as the last therapeutic option for patients with terminal heart failure, but requests for organ transplantation far outstrip the number of donor organs. Following MI, dilatation of the LV cavity has the effect of increasing LV wall tension, which triggers further dilatation of the LV cavity, and progression down a spiral of adverse cardiac remodeling towards the advanced stages of cardiac failure .
Recent estimates for the incidence of hypertriglyceridemia  levels over 150 mg/dl) is 30% of U.S. adults . But to date no therapeutic strategy targets GPAT . However, adverse side effects associated with these drugs remain a concern.
Imitation is one of the most common ways for children to acquire motor or speech/language skills. Children with SLI show poor performance in working memory , in attention control , in procedural memory , in nonverbal cognitive development , in visuospatial processing , and in gross motor control . We know that these factors affect language acquisition, but it is not clear which of these functions predict language impairment in specific disorders .
Vascular smooth muscle cells  arise from a diverse range of tissues including neural crest, somites, splanchnic mesoderm, gut mesothelium, and epicardium , and past data has demonstrated that many coronary VSMC  are derived from the embryonic epicardium, . While several genes have been identified that are essential for the formation, attachment, and spreading of the epicardium, few genes have been identified that are essential during epithelial to mesenchymal transition  and subsequent differentiation into cVSMC and cardiac fibroblasts . Platelet derived growth factor receptor  tyrosine kinases are one family of signaling proteins that are potentially involved in epicardial cell function.
Several of the biochemical constituents of saliva, such as acidic and basic proline rich proteins , lysozyme, lactoferrin, peroxidase, histatins, cystatins, mucins and secretory immunoglobulins A , have been isolated in sufficient quantities, mostly from pure glandular secretions, enabling studies to investigate their functional roles . Major groups of these salivary proteins, including acidic PRPs, statherin and histatins, have characteristics deemed important for oral health . Their beneficial properties comprise the inhibition of primary and secondary calcium phosphate precipitation which is essential for maintaining tooth enamel integrity  and antimicrobial activities critical for the host defense against oral infections .
Because the TPR domain of CHIP binds to both Hsp90 and Hsp70, both chaperones have been thought to target substrates for degradation . However, ubiquitination following geldanamycin treatment must be targeted by Hsc/Hsp70. Overexpression of CHIP has been shown to increase the degradation of many well studied Hsp90 regulated signaling proteins, such as the glucocorticoid receptor  , p53  and ErbB2 ; thus, CHIP is often regarded as the most important E3 ligase involved in chaperone dependent ubiquitination and degradation.
Toxoplasmosis is a serious infectious disease for humans. It is caused by Toxoplasma gondii, an obligate, intracellular, apicomplexan parasite that infects all human cells and tissues but has special tropism for the eye and the brain. They are self adjuvanting and have been successful in the induction of immune responses without additional adjuvants .
Despite an overall decline in mortality rates, the gap in mortality rates among socioeconomic status  groups has increased in many countries in the last couple of decades . In addition, international variations in the three established coronary risk factors account for less than half of the international variations in coronary heart disease mortality rates  . In general, low control, high demands, and low social support are associated with health risk behaviors , metabolic syndrome , coronary heart diseases , musculoskeletal diseases , and depression .
In most songbird species, adult males attract mates and repel competing males by producing learned vocalizations known as song . HVC and RA form part of a motor pathway involved in song production, whereas MAN and Area X form part of an anterior forebrain pathway involved in song learning and plasticity . Auditory input from an individual’s own songs or songs from another individual ascends via midbrain, thalamic, and telencephalic areas to the reciprocally connected caudomedial mesopallium  and caudomedial nidopallium  of the auditory telencephalon .
Mitochondrial dysfunction has significant implications for post ischemic recovery . Despite being the site of such pathological events, mitochondria are also involved in the protective mechanism of ischemic preconditioning  whereby short non lethal periods of ischemia protect the heart from subsequent prolonged ischemic insults . The mKATP was first described electro physiologically , then subsequently via its pharmacological sensitivity, both of which demonstrate similarities to plasma membrane and sarcoplasmic reticulum ATP sensitive K+ channels or “surface” KATP channels.
Well differentiated neuronal neoplasms composed of small neurons superficially resembling oligodendrocytes  have a tendency to arise within the ventricular system, most often in the septum pellucidum nearby the foramen of Monro. The term “central neurocytoma” is reserved for these lesions. Morphologically similar neoplasms may occur in the cerebral hemispheres or in the spinal cord parenchyma and are therefore referred as “extraventricular neurocytomas”   .
Although αA and αB crystallins have related amino acid sequences with similar structural properties, they vary significantly in their tissue distribution with different functions: they protect different proteins and are active under different conditions. Oxidative stress in general is accompanied by upregulation of the hosts of Hsp, including the α crystallins. The agents that induce oxidative stress include hydrogen peroxide , superoxide, hydroxyl radical, and others.
Microfluidic devices have been employed in studies of: axon regeneration, positioning neurons in microdevices, integrating networks of neurons with multielectrode arrays, and confining neurites for axon selective mRNA analysis. Patterned substrates have been used for defining and regulating extrinsic cues in order to direct neuronal growth and polarity. ,  Microfluidic devices can be used to form binary chemical patterns that can be used to present cells with stark differences in the substratum.
Recent data by Yeh et al.  and Hirshburg et al.  suggest that a chemical agent’s optical clearing potential is strongly tied to its ability to screen non covalent, hydrophilic, intermolecular attractive forces resulting in destabilization of high order collagen structures. Unfortunately, these agents typically possess hydrophilic properties, and hence are unsuitable as topically applied agents due to their inability to penetrate through the lipid rich stratum corneum. The primary objective of our study was to evaluate the optical clearing potential of DMSO  when applied topically to in vitro and in vivo skin.
Anemia, bleeding, and other potential indications for allogenic red blood cell  transfusions are common among patients admitted to intensive care units . Historically, pathophysiologic reasoning informed recommendations that a hemoglobin concentration  greater than 10 g/dL should be maintained in this patient population. However, based on more than a decade of clinical research evidence, more recent clinical practice guidelines advocate for using restrictive transfusion thresholds in ICU patients .
Obesity is a serious public health problem of dramatically rising prevalence in recent decades in the United States and the world, with currently over 65% of adults in the U.S. classified as either overweight or obese . Regions of increased response include the limbic areas such as the hypothalamus, amygdala, hippocampus, orbitofrontal cortex, and insula . These studies suggest that obesity is not only associated with altered response to food cues, but also a deficit in the ability to modulate this response based on metabolic need .
Retinal microvascular abnormalities that accompany diabetes include arteriolar constriction , capillary dropout, and localized areas of ischemia, the last of which is implicated in the eventual vision problems associated with the pathological growth of new blood vessels . The mechanisms of the decrease in blood flow have yet to be determined . However, existing reports of diabetes induced changes in retinal blood flow have shown a variety of responses, possibly due to the differences in the experimental animals, duration of hyperglycemia, and measurement techniques.
Tuberculosis  is an infectious disease caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis  and related species that is most commonly observed as a chronic pulmonary infection . However, the emergence of HIV that sensitizes latently TB infected individuals and the inevitable development of drug resistant TB strains through use of the same antibiotics for more than 50 years has led to a dramatic worldwide rise in TB mortality, which prompted the World Health Organization  to declare TB a global public health emergency. Ultimately, success in each area will be required to control TB .
The cerebellar cortex is one of the best characterized circuits of the central nervous system and is known to play a key role in the precise timing of motor control. Purkinje cells form the sole output of the cerebellar cortex and project to the deep nuclei of the cerebellum  where they form GABAergic synapses. Purkinje cells also exhibit local axon collaterals, which typically bifurcate in the granule cell layer and project back up to the Purkinje cell layer, and occasionally into the molecular layer.
Oxidative damage to DNA leads to activation of poly polymerase , which participates in DNA repair. Studies in cell systems demonstrated that over activation of PARP produces cell death by a mechanism that involves translocation of apoptosis inducing factor  from mitochondria to the nucleus . Focal cerebral ischemia is associated with an increase in PAR polymer accumulation and translocation of AIF to the nucleus .
Malaria is a significant cause of anemia in children living in areas of high and low intensities of transmission . In these children, the prevalence of malarial anemia is over 30%, and in the future, it is likely the prevalence and intensities of malarial anemia will increase as drug resistance in Plasmodium falciparum, already reported to artemisinin in Asia, increases and spreads to Africa and elsewhere. The anemia in malaria has been attributed to destruction of infected and non infected red cells and variable degree of dyserythropoiesis,   and both acute and sub acute infections contribute to the morbidity and mortality associated with malarial anemia , .
Emergency department  evaluation of syncope may benefit from improved epidemiologic understanding of patterns and predictors of short term, cardiac events. Previous studies have examined risk factors at 1 year following an episode of syncope, a timeframe not ideal for decision making in the acute care setting . Recent cohort studies identifying predictors of short term  events after syncope are relatively small ,  and reported prediction models have limited stability and generalizability.
It is well established that pregnant women are at a significantly higher risk of HIV acquisition during pregnancy and breastfeeding than their non pregnant counterparts. Research done in several low and middle income countries show that despite universal antenatal testing, HIV infected babies are born to women who had negative HIV tests during prenatal care, implicating seroconversion during pregnancy. Because of this concern, HIV testing of women at the time of labor and delivery has been implemented at the Grupo Conceiçao, a large public medical group located in Porto Alegre, the capital and largest city in the Brazilian state of Rio Grande do Sul.
In cemented total hip arthroplasty, the implant needs a mechanically stable cement bone interface for long term survival. These factors, combined with the quantity and morphology of the bone, contribute to a substantial variation in mechanical properties of the cement bone interface  . Although previously the strength of the cement bone interface has been investigated as a single variable , the strength of the cement bone interface has also been related to morphologic characteristics such as cement penetration depth and cement bone contact area.
Although vocal communication is essential for the survival of many animal species, the neurophysiological basis of the perception of intra specific communication signals is still not well understood. Depending on the type of information a listener is attending to , the variability of the acoustic signals that relates to the identity of the vocalizer , the production variance between renditions  or even the transmission variability ) might be of less importance and could be ignored by the listener . To study such natural categorization, one must use a model species for which the semantics of vocalizations can be easily derived from the observation of social behaviors.

Parish showed that a HisDC− knockout is auxotrophic for histidine, reflecting the essentiality of this pathway and uniqueness of its intermediates. Moreover, infection of macrophages by the HisDC− mutant was significantly attenuated compared to wild type .

Indeed, we propose, for the first time, that one of the cardinal signs of resolution is the recruitment of innate type lymphocytes to sites of tissue injury concomitant with inflammation switching off. Thus, innate immune responses are designed to combat infection and repair injured tissues in a timely manner.
The central nervous system  is composed of complex networks of synaptically linked neurons. The development and use of neurotropic viruses as an alternative to traditional tract tracing tools have greatly enhanced our understanding of complex neuronal circuitry, particularly the innervation of thoracic and abdominal viscera . Despite this progress there is a paucity of knowledge concerning how injury, particularly spinal cord injury , affects neuronal circuitry.
A “divergent pathway” model has been proposed to conceptualize the development of cutaneous melanoma. In contrast, those with large numbers of nevi, who are assumed to have an inherently high propensity for melanocytic proliferation, only require sun exposure to initiate carcinogenesis, after which host factors drive melanoma development. Similarly Thomas et al.  reported that people with large numbers of nevi on the back were more likely to have melanoma with mutations in BRAF or N RAS than people with low nevus counts on this site.
The EWS/ETS fusion protein has altered transcriptional activity. EWS/FL 1 is the most common chromosome translocation associated with Ewing’s sarcomas . Rapid tumor growth and extensive bone destruction are typical features of this tumor .
Another contributor to real time CMR research is known as dynamic imaging. Unfortunately, all acceleration techniques for MRI can only be pushed so far until image artifacts destroy the reconstructions, and each method has its own unique limitations. For example in CMR, partial Fourier methods are prone to reduced spatial resolution and ringing artifacts; segmented acquisitions can result in temporal blurring; EPI suffers from spatial blurring; parallel imaging is limited by spatial aliasing and noise amplification; and dynamic imaging reconstructions are degraded by motion artifacts.
The conserved kinase Chk1 is a participant in the first line of defense against DNA damage and replication blocks. The C terminal domain of vertebrate Chk1 has also been suggested to play an inhibitory role in the kinase activity of the protein. Many studies have suggested models regarding the structural requirements to set up the checkpoint by activation of the kinase Chk1, however, these models are based mostly on data from in vitro assays, and many aspects of vertebrate Chk1 regulation had not been tested in vivo.,, In a recent manuscript we described a yeast system that allowed us to explore the role of Chk1 in vivo in the recovery from replication blocks and in the response to DNA damage generated outside of S phase.

Alzheimer’s disease  is a progressive and gradual decline in cognitive function accompanied by extensive neurodegeneration. Abnormal tau, found in neurofibrillary tangles, is also found in a number of other neurodegenerative diseases. APP is sequentially cleaved by two membrane bound endoprotease activities, β  and γ secretase.
For CD4+ T cell responses, a primary goal is to achieve efficient delivery of antigen to the site of peptide loading onto MHC Class II molecules, namely the endolysosomal system of APCs . However, there is an incomplete understanding as to how the intracellular trafficking pathways of an antigen impact presentation and how this can be modulated. Fc receptors that bind to the Fc region of IgG encompass the classical Fc receptors  and the neonatal Fc receptor, FcRn, that can be distinguished in several important ways.
Coronary thrombosis on a ruptured coronary plaque is the main pathophysiologic event that leads to acute coronary syndromes . Current recanalization therapies in these disease states include pharmacological thrombolysis and percutaneous coronary intervention , both of which have improved the prognosis of patients with STEMI . Each of these therapeutic interventions, however, has significant limitations.
While overall distribution of the RF field for each coil can be obtained by measuring test objects or numerically solving the Maxwell equation based on the known coil geometry and sample model, the actual RF distribution is dependent on the conductivity, dielectric properties, and coil loading of each object. A number of B1 mapping methods have been introduced . Most methods estimate the RF field distribution as a function of the image intensities.
One of the most prominent characteristics of human STS is their resistance to apoptosis . Consequently, identifying factors that regulate the anti apoptotic phenotype and elucidating the underlying molecular mechanisms of these apoptosis regulatory factors are crucial for the success of molecular target based therapeutics for human sarcoma . IRF8  is a transcription factor of the interferon regulatory factor family .
Although it has been appreciated for decades that folding of RNA into biologically active structures is controlled by the rate of RNA synthesis by RNA polymerase ,, the mechanisms by which RNAP guides RNA folding remain poorly understood. In E. coli, transient pauses that occur about ten times per kb on average, are thought to arise by a sequence induced rearrangement of the RNAP active site that blocks loading of the template base. NusA enhances pause stimulation by exit channel duplexes ≥8 bpvia contacts of its N terminal domain  with the duplex and the flap tip, and promotes formation of biologically active ribozymes and riboswitches,,.
Body dysmorphic disorder , a severe disorder characterized by preoccupation with an imagined or slight defect in one’s physical appearance, affects an estimated 1.82.4% of the population . For example,  described a woman who worried excessively about her daughter’s “crooked” nose and tried “pushing on it to make it straight” . reported on a 63 year old male so distressed by the belief he had caused his daughter’s hair to thin that he committed suicide.
We and others have recently described a new subset of antigen presenting cells , termed Interferon producing Killer Dendritic Cells  or Natural Killer Dendritic Cells , that exhibit properties of both natural killer cells  and dendritic cells  . Upon stimulation in vitro with CpG oligodeoxynucleotides  or in vivo with Listeria monocytogenes  splenic IKDC killed typical NK targets and demonstrated the unique ability to produce interferon gamma , IFN α and interleukin  12 . Activated IKDC further differentiated into DC type APC that accumulated in vivo in lymph nodes  to activate CD4+ T cells.
Predicting the spread of these viruses is challenging because many of the drivers of disease are not easily identifiable. These drivers can be of an environmental, geographic, demographic, genetic, or other nature. Successful analysis of spatial epidemiological factors have identified air travel and global mobility as key drivers of influenza  but do not consider the key elements of molecular sequence analysis such as gene flow, cross species transmission , and viral mutations to support and complement their work.
Emergency Medical Dispatchers  play an important role in optimizing acute stroke care and facilitating rapid transport by initiating pre arrival instructions to callers and dispatching emergency resources at the appropriate high level of priority. ,  A more recent study of EMS calls in Germany similarly found that dispatchers recognized stroke in only 51% of stroke patients. In response to the availability of thrombolytic stroke therapy, a new algorithm for dispatcher use in interrogating 911 callers to identify stroke was implemented nationally in 2000.
Telomeres are repetitive DNA sequences that cap and protect chromosomal integrity. Average leukocyte telomere length is thought to provide a cumulative marker of cellular aging that integrates across multiple pathways, including DNA damage due to oxidative stress and the replicative history of various populations of WBC. Shorter telomere length has been associated with early mortality and outcomes such as cardiovascular and metabolic disease .
Posttraumatic stress disorder  is a stress linked disorder that affects a substantial proportion of the population, and is particularly prevalent in combat veterans. PTSD can be triggered by acute or chronic exposure to traumatic events, with intensity and duration of trauma considered important determinants in the trajectory of posttraumatic symptoms  There are several animals models of PTSD in the literature, including acute predator exposure , electric tails shocks, single prolonged stress, and inescapable stress, among others . Since combat related PTSD usually follows exposure to chronic and unpredictable trauma, we are interested in modeling the emergence of PTSD like pathophysiology following exposure to an unpredictable stress regimen  .
Only now, amid an ever growing threat from antibiotic resistant bacterial pathogens, is it being entertained again in the West. A phage that does not amplify fast enough or cannot access its host in some tissues may fail clinically, even if it works well in the lab. Most lab practitioners are aware that phages do not sterilize cultures of cells even under ideal conditions and may not even kill cells under poor growth conditions, but this and other empirical realities have not helped balance the promise with the prospects of a viable phage therapy enterprise .
Acute lung injury  and acute respiratory distress syndrome  remain major challenges in modern intensive care medicine that are still associated with high mortality and morbidity . Several targets to control PMN infiltration have been identified and some drug candidates are in clinical trials, but no specific drug is available for treatment of ALI patients today . Leukocyte recruitment to the lung is initiated by the release of chemokines into the alveolar space.
Myocarditis is an acute inflammatory disease of the heart which may lead to chronic inflammation of the myocardium and dilated cardiomyopathy  . In myocarditis and DCM, autoantibodies react with cardiac myosin . Innate immune cells including macrophages, neutrophils, dendritic cells , and several cytokines including IL 6, IL 1, TNF α are present in inflamed myocardium .
Helicobacter hepaticus  infection was discovered in the early 1990s in mice used in a carcinogenesis study . Although males and females may both become infected, hepatitis and hepatocellular neoplasms associated with the infection occur predominantly in males . Increased liver cell proliferation has been observed in infected mice .
Therefore, a considerable interest is being devoted to the development of non viral gene delivery vehicles  . Attempts to develop effective non viral vectors for in vivo delivery of nucleic acids to cancer cells through a systemic route are hampered by difficulties of combining high extracellular stability in the blood stream with ready availability of the nucleic acids following entry into the cells. The combined PEGylation and caging modifications of the DNA complexes led to the extended systemic circulation after intravenous administration to mice .
Diuretic drugs are central to the treatment of hypertension. It is therefore appropriate to consider ways in which their benefit can be optimized. Placebo controlled trials have demonstrated that diuretics are highly efficacious in reducing cerebrovascular accidents and yield a smaller but significant reduction in non fatal myocardial infarction.
Most mutations induced by carcinogens occur when DNA containing residual damage is replicated during S phase of the cell cycle. Such lesions perturb the structure of DNA and are likely to block replicative DNA polymerase complexes. Knowledge of fundamental mechanisms involved in the replication of damaged genomes, and of the factors that determine if this process will be error free or error prone, is likely to be useful in elucidating the origins of cancer and other human diseases.
Antiretroviral  adherence is a key determinant of clinical outcomes, including viral load suppression, emergence of drug resistance, and progression to AIDS and death . In the past decade, there has been a marked expansion in the distribution of highly active antiretroviral therapy  in resource constrained countries, as a result of international initiatives such as the US government's President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief  and the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria. Studies from low resource settings have reported adherence rates that are equivalent to or higher than those in resource rich countries .
Most current research involving measurement of gaze direction  employs video based eyetracking devices, which provide a relatively simple and cost effective way of obtaining two dimensional records. The horizontal and vertical differences between pupil center and corneal reflection location, once they have been calibrated using fixation targets at known locations, provide fairly accurate estimates of eye position. Some degree of nonlinearity can be dealt with by fitting polynomials to the calibration data.
In a warming Earth, isoprene emission will increase and so will its atmospheric concentration. Isoprene oxidation by the hydroxyl radical leads to ozone formation in the troposphere. ,, Consequently, a more complete understanding of this reaction will lead to better models of regional air quality, a better understanding of aerosol formation and a better understanding of reaction kinetics and dynamics .

Recent years have seen enormous interest in the Stop signal task. The dominant view contends that, in response to a Stop stimulus, a signal from the inferior and/or medial frontal cortex is sent to the basal ganglia to cancel the motor program triggered by the Go stimulus.

Prior to 2005, the allocation system was based upon the amount of time accrued on the waiting list. Under this system, patients with rapidly progressive diseases, such as idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis  frequently died before receiving a donor organ.

Their failures indicate an incomplete understanding of macromolecular complexes, the oncogenic pathways they drive, their crosstalk and drug driven compensatory mechanisms.
