For example, three recent GWAS consortia  identified dozens of common variants associated with blood pressure  and hypertension in European Americans . The missing heritability might be partially explained by rare and low frequency variants, with minor allele frequencies  below 5%  .
Repeated experience of alcohol withdrawal has been postulated to increase the vulnerability and susceptibility of future withdrawal episodes . Studies from our laboratory examined the effects of multiple deprivations on expression of an ADE in alcohol preferring  and high alcohol drinking  rats under 24 hour free choice alcohol drinking conditions , using a single ethanol concentration. As was the case for P rats, repeated deprivations increased the breakpoint values in both replicate lines of HAD rats , suggesting that repeated cycles of ethanol access and abstinence increased the reinforcing effects of ethanol .
This process is facilitated by integrase , a 32 kDa virally encoded enzyme. Following reverse transcription, HIV 1 IN, along with other viral and cellular proteins, binds to specific sequences in the long terminal repeats  of the viral cDNA to form the pre integration complex. IN cleaves two conserved nucleotides from the 3’ ends of both strands of the viral cDNA and, after nuclear importation, ligates the 5’ ends of the viral cDNA to the host chromosomal DNA by a process called strand transfer.
Therefore, new approaches are required to improve outcome in unresectable melanoma . Alteration of signaling through both the MAPK and AKT pathways plays a major role in melanoma development and progression. B Raf is a key member of the MAPK pathway, and activating B Raf mutations are found in approximately 70% of the cutaneous melanomas.
Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma  is an extremely rare soft tissue sarcoma affecting primarily young children and adolescents . This slow growing neoplasm is believed resistant to existing chemotherapeutic agents and radiation, limiting treatment primarily to surgical resection of the tumor. ASPS exhibits a unique histopathology which is the basis for clinical diagnosis.
The inflammatory reaction is critical for the control of the parasite proliferation. The synthesis of NO is mediated by nitric oxide synthase . The induction of NOS2 results in the production of elevated and sustained levels of NO .
Several different ligand receptor systems have been implicated in heterotypic cell interactions to regulate the development and maintenance of the vasculature. For example, High et al., demonstrated that Notch signaling between endothelial cells and VSMCs governs smooth muscle differentiation. ,  Mammals express four Notch receptors  and five membrane bound ligands  1, Jag2, Delta like 1, Dll3, and Dll4).
Standardization of visual acuity measurement is essential for accurate monitoring of the response to treatment in individual patients and in clinical trials. By consensus of experts, the Early Treatment for Diabetic Retinopathy  logMAR charts have become the gold standard for adult visual acuity testing. More recently, a computerized version of ETDRS that uses crowded, isolated letters was developed; the new Electronic ETDRS  has high test retest reliability and good agreement with ETDRS chart in adults and in children aged 712 years.
The role of estrogen and progesterone in the development of epithelial ovarian cancer is poorly understood. The effect of lifestyle factors, including diet and physical activity are unclear  . For breast cancer, reproductive factors and postmenopausal obesity are associated with only the risk of hormone receptor positive tumors .
Successful recollection engages a network of brain regions that includes the hippocampus, left posterior parietal cortex, medial prefrontal cortex , parahippocampal cortex, and retrosplenial/posterior cingulate cortex. These regions appear to be engaged regardless of the nature of the study and test materials employed or the type of retrieval test . This ‘core’ recollection network is thought to support cognitive processes contributing to successful recollection, but the specific roles played by the different regions comprising the network have not been fully elucidated.
Thus, layer 4 is broad, well defined, and packed with cells. Also, the inner and outer bands of Baillarger are densely myelinated. Ta was subsequently shown to contain two auditory areas: a primary area, A1, and a primary like rostral area, R , as well as remaining, more ventral, auditory areas.
Isocyanates , highly reactive chemical compounds essential to polyurethane production, are used to make a variety of foams, adhesives, coatings, and elastomers, and are well known to cause occupational asthma . Although isocyanates remain one of the most commonly reported causes of occupational asthma , the prevalence, incidence, and risk factors for development of isocyanate asthma under current work conditions are not well defined, as there have been few recent epidemiology studies of isocyanate exposed workers, despite the increasing use of polyurethane products in numerous industries . More recent studies have largely been limited to cross sectional studies of end users such as spray painters, rather than factory workers producing polyurethane products .
Cardiac diseases and arrhythmias are common with aging and at least partly linked to increasing cardiac electrophysiological and autonomic dysfunction., Heart rate variability  provides indices related to cardiac electrophysiology and autonomic regulation, including respiratory, baroreflex, and circadian fluctuations, that are indicative of healthier responses. With advancing age, increased HRV can also reflect abnormal  sinus patterns that are associated with increased risk. In middle aged populations, habitual physical activity  has been associated with more favorable HRV indices, especially those reflecting increased vagal modulation and reduced sympathetic activity.,  However, several key issues remain to be addressed in older adults, who are at much higher risk for both abnormal HRV and cardiac events than middle aged populations.
In addition, 21% of those with high blood pressure and 30% of those affected by diabetes are estimated to be unaware of their conditions. Over half  of the Hispanic population in 2007 were of Mexican origin. Mexican Americans have the highest prevalence of metabolic syndrome, “a clustering of specific cardiovascular disease risk factors.” About 32% of Mexican Americans are diagnosed with metabolic syndrome as compared to 24% of whites and 22% of African Americans, placing them at higher risk for developing and dying from heart disease.
Although their precise DNA metabolic roles are still unclear, germ line defects in three of the five human known RecQ helicases are associated with hereditable disease, as defects in WRN, BLM or RECQ4 result in Werner, Bloom or Rothmund Thomson syndrome, respectively. Moreover, the existence of an N terminal RNase D type domain, not present in other human RecQ members, confers to WRN an intrinsic 3′→5′ exonuclease activity . WRN possesses four DNA binding regions: the helicase, RQC, HRDC and exonuclease domains that, together, appear to confer specificity for particular DNA structures .
The adipokine Leptin regulates appetite and food consumption through central nervous system mechanisms, but it is increasingly recognized that leptin also exerts a broad range of actions on peripheral organs, including the cardiovascular system. Increasing evidence indicates that leptin influences cardiac remodeling, although it remains unclear whether the net effect is cardioprotective versus adverse. Some studies indicated direct hypertrophic effects of leptin on isolated ventricular rat cardiomyocytes, whereas other animal models suggest that leptin is essential for maintaining normal cardiac structure.
Lipid molecules play a key role in cell biology. Membranes also serve as an embedding matrix for many proteins, enabling their proper function. BLs are a new vesicle phase resulting from membrane shape evolution upon the addition of a membrane curvature forming and  stabilizing lipid, MVLBG2, to bilayers of DOPC .
Alcoholism is the second most prevalent axis I diagnosis among individuals aged 1544 , and is one of the most highly heritable addictive disorders . More than 18 million Americans  have been estimated to meet the diagnostic criteria of alcohol abuse or dependence . Withdrawal is a hallmark of alcohol physiological dependence, and constitutes a motivational force that perpetuates alcohol use and abuse .
Therefore, understanding the molecular mechanisms that facilitate the interaction between the multiple cell types in the tumor bone microenvironment can provide new targets for therapies that will be effective in controlling and/or curing prostate to bone metastases . Matrix metalloproteinases  are a family of 23 enzymes that collectively are capable of processing extracellular matrix  components including those that comprise the bone matrix . Given their role in bone matrix resorption, it is not surprising that osteoclasts express a large repertoire of MMPs.
Erectile dysfunction  affects approximately 18 million men aged 20 years or older in the US. Projections from US prevalence data indicate that by 2025, over 300 million men worldwide will have ED. The relationship between ED and cardiovascular disease  has received substantial attention.
Obesity is a major public health concern. Poor diet and inactivity are two of the greatest contributors to United States  deaths. To be effective, initiatives such as MyPyrimid.gov, Dietary Guidelines for Americans, Nutrition Facts Panels, and point of purchase restaurant labeling, require that the public understands concepts such as  what a calorie is,  where calories are found and  how many calories a person needs.
The Thai RV144 phase III vaccine trial demonstrated for the first time that a vaccine can prevent HIV infection . Nevertheless, extensive research to practice gaps are evident for existing prophylactic vaccines in the U.S., in particular, vaccines licensed for sexually transmitted infections . Decade long delays in successful implementation of Hepatitis B vaccines  and ongoing obstacles in HPV vaccine roll out with low coverage in young women  and young men   suggest the importance of an implementation science approach to prepare for the effective translation of future HIV vaccines from clinical trials into routine practice .
For example, increased MMP levels within the myocardium have been demonstrated in animal models of ischemia and reperfusion and heart failure. Using transgenic and pharmacological approaches, modifying MMP expression and activity has been shown to directly effect myocardial structure and function. While clinical studies have shown an association between MMP levels and disease progression, there have been no studies which have directly demonstrated and quantified interstitial MMP activity within the human myocardium and to what extent interstitial MMP activity is altered as a function of interruption of myocardial blood flow and with reperfusion .
Inverted urothelial papilloma  is an uncommon urothelial neoplasm  with a generally accepted benign clinical course and a distinctive histomorphology. A limited number of IUP studies using single gene based assays have identified mutations in FGFR3, in 9.8% to 45% of cases . However, IUP rarely show other features associated with UCA such as p53 overexpression, high Ki 67 expression, and chromosomal abnormalities highlighted by UroVysion FISH .
Hepatitis C virus  is a RNA virus that currently infects over 150 million people across the world. Since human immunodeficiency virus  and HCV share similar routes of transmission, such as exposure to contaminated blood and sexual activity, approximately 25% of HIV infected persons are co infected with HCV, which is much higher than the HCV prevalence in the general world population. HIV/HCV co infection has been shown to decrease the probability of spontaneous HCV clearance and increase the rate of progression to cirrhosis, decompensated liver disease, hepatocellular carcinoma, and death .
Low dose spiral computed tomography  scans have been introduced as a way to detect lung cancers at an earlier, potentially more curable, stage of disease . CT scans have been shown to improve detection of smaller chest nodules, increasing early detection of lung cancer , , . The largest randomized trial of CT scanning for lung cancer, the National Lung Cancer Screening Trial  found a 21% decrease in lung cancer mortality and a 7% decrease in all cause mortality in those getting CT scans compared to the chest radiography group .
Towards engineering improved blood compatible materials there is a need to investigate the role of the surface in influencing these responses . It is widely believed that the intrinsic coagulation cascade has little physiological significance and that the extrinsic cascade is the predominant pathway of coagulation in vivo . Elevated levels of activated enzymes of the intrinsic pathway from blood biomaterial contact associated with the use of cardiopulmonary bypass oxygenators, haemodialysis membranes and left ventricular assist devices underscore the significance of this pathway with the use of such medical devices  .
Roughening of the metal counterface is responsible for substantial increase of wear rate in metal on polyethylene total joint replacements . This has prompted several groups to study scratch patterns, toward a more definitive determinant of wear acceleration propensity ,,. It has been argued that even some 3rd body particles that are  softer than the counterface are capable of causing scratching  .
Both acute and chronic cocaine administration have been shown to alter the levels and/or activity of DAT, however the results of these studies are conflicted with reported of increases, decreases, or no changes in DAT appearing in the literature . Likewise, contingent versus non contingent cocaine administration can produce different neurochemical and behavioral adaptations . Another family of receptor trafficking proteins, G protein receptor kinases , phosphorylate G protein coupled receptors leading to arrestin mediated uncoupling of the receptor from the G protein complex and subsequent desensitization .
Fluoroquinolone  antibiotics were introduced in the mid 1980s and have been widely used against various infectious diseases including urinary tract infections . Both chromosomally mediated and plasmid mediated FQ resistance emerged rapidly and have since progressed. The increasing prevalence of FQ resistance among uropathogens in hospitals and long term care facilities  is a threat to the use of FQs as empirical therapy for UTI.
Fragile X associated tremor/ataxia syndrome  is seen in a subgroup of older adults who are carriers of premutation alleles  of the fragile X mental retardation 1  gene . The pathogenesis of FXTAS results from the direct neural cell toxicity of elevated levels of the expanded CGG repeat FMR1 mRNA , which leads to protein dysregulation . The natural history of FXTAS begins with late onset of a movement disorder involving intention tremor and/or gait ataxia, resulting in a progressive decline in mobility .
The ability to assess differences in RHP has been incorporated into several game theory models of animal conflicts . Individuals with relatively smaller RHP reach their threshold first and essentially “give up” sooner than their opponent, independent of their opponent’s RHP. As in mutual assessment models, in self assessment models contest duration is negatively correlated with the RHP difference between the contestants .
Inhibition of poly polymerase  has emerged as a promising drug strategy for the treatment of cancers mutated for BRCA1/2 because of its ability to selectively kill cells through synthetic lethality . Identification of other tumour genotypes susceptible to PARP inhibition will expand the utility of these drugs . The cohesin complex, named for its role in sister chromatid cohesion, is well conserved across organisms .
Human respiratory syncytial virus  is a major cause of viral bronchiolitis in infants, young children, elderly, and immune compromised patients. During 1960s, a formalin inactivated RSV vaccine  administered to children resulted in approximately 80% hospitalization and two deaths during next epidemic winter season, causing vaccine related enhanced RSV disease   . Despite the extensive endeavor to develop RSV vaccines, there is no licensed RSV vaccine .
The availability of allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplant  has expanded with the development of lower dose nonmyeloablative conditioning regimens, which depend on achieving a delicate balance between recipient and donor cells to obtain immunosuppression of the recipient, optimal anti tumor effect, and minimal toxicity. Nonmyeloablative HCT recipients often receive mycophenolate mofetil  and a calcineurin inhibitor  as postgrafting immunosuppression, which aims to facilitate allogeneic engraftment and control graft versus host disease . There is considerable variability in the clinical outcomes of these patients.
During conditions of increased glutamate release such as seizures, group I metabotropic glutamate receptors  activate many second messenger pathways that may contribute to epileptogenesis . Exposure to the group I mGluR agonist 3,5 dihyroxyphenylglycine  results in the induction of epileptiform discharges in hippocampal slices that persist for hours after DHPG is removed . In a number of models, the rate of interictal discharges is related to the duration of the afterhyperpolarization that follows repetitive firing of CA3 pyramidal neurons .
Acne has many different symptoms including comedones, papules, pustules, nodules, cysts and pilosebaceous inflammation. Genomic analysis of P. acnes has shown a variety of P. acnes pathogenicity . It has also been widely accepted that inflammatory acne is induced by host immune reactions to P. acnes.
Injection drug users  are often afflicted by serious health hazards, including overdose, blood borne diseases , and soft tissue infections. Abscesses result from introduction of an infectious agent, often Staphylococcus aureus, into the body through unsterile injection equipment or unclean skin. Antibiotics and lancing, or cutting open the infection, are the standard medical treatments for an uncomplicated abscess.
Rubella virus, a member of the Togaviridae family, typically causes a relatively benign illness, although arthritis and arthralgia have been observed in adults. Less frequent complications include both encephalitis and thrombocytopenia. Infection during pregnancy, especially early in pregnancy, can cause congenital rubella syndrome , leading to devastating fetal abnormalities.
Resting state functional magnetic resonance imaging  measures spontaneous low frequency fluctuations in the blood oxygen level dependent  signal that is correlated with intrinsic neuronal signaling . Considering the intrinsic neuronal signaling accounts for a large proportion of brain activity, the study of these spontaneous fluctuations has enabled systematical delineation of the functional brain architecture  and the examination of whether the functional architecture of intrinsic activity is altered in neurological and psychiatric conditions  and mild cognitive impairment  , and Schizophrenia  ). Several review articles  have provided extensive surveys of relevant studies.
One account invokes a process of specialization due to experience individuating faces . Another study  revealed that recently acquired expertise with novel objects results in a composite effect. However, there could still be measures that capture other aspects of face perception, even related to configural and/or holistic processing, that are truly independent of expertise.
Cancer cells in a primary tumor are adept at exploiting their local tissue microenvironment. By contrast, when metastatic cells leave these favorable surroundings, they must possess or acquire traits to enable survival and colonization of potentially hostile tissue environments, . For example, the blood brain barrier, composed of endothelial cells, astrocytes and pericytes, presents a more formidable structure for tumor cells to penetrate, compared to the fenestrated capillaries in bone marrow.
Despite numerous advances in tobacco dependence treatment, U.S. adult smoking prevalence and quit rates have stalled, and too few smokers who try to quit benefit from evidence based treatments. Evidence based cessation treatment policies have been underutilized, for the most part implemented and evaluated in isolation without regard to potential synergies. , If more fully implemented and better integrated, cessation treatment policies could yield substantial increases in adult quit rates and a reduction in the population prevalence of smoking.
The advancing field of proteomics offers promise for developing state of the art biomarkers that can detect extremely subtle physiologic changes associated specifically with alcohol use . reported eight serum proteins whose concentrations differed significantly between the FASD and control children. However, this study neither utilized high throughput proteomics, nor did it conclusively identify a reliable marker that can predict prenatal alcohol exposure .
Cell transplantation is being explored as an alternative therapy for treating patients with end stage heart failure. Fetal cardiomyocytes, skeletal myoblasts, immortalized cell lines, fibroblasts, smooth muscle cells, and hematopoietic stem cells have been transplanted into host myocardium for improved cardiac function . A number of studies using stem cell transplants report the differentiation of stem cells in the heart of murine and rodent models as well as the improvement of heart function deficits caused by cardiac injury .
Medulloblastoma , an embryonal neuroepithelial tumor of the cerebellum, is the most common malignant brain tumor in children . This highly invasive tumor has a tendency to disseminate throughout the central nervous system early in its course. Moreover, current medical treatments have associated toxicities that can cause significant disabilities in long term survivors .
Infection with oncogenic human papillomavirus  types is necessary for cervical cancer development. In this situation, it is possible that prevalent non vaccine types may be undetected. For instance, if a co infected specimen contains a much higher number of HPV16 genome copies, then it may overwhelm the minority type during PCR amplification, and as a result, the specimen may be erroneously labelled as negative for the minority type.
The capsaicin receptor transient receptor potential vanilloid type 1  is a nonselective cation channel that can be activated by many physical and chemical stimuli, including heat, protons, capsaicin, and anandamide . TRPV1 is highly expressed in small  and medium sized dorsal root ganglion  neurons and is located along the entire length of these sensory neurons from the peripheral nerve endings to the central terminals in the spinal cord. Stimulation of TRPV1 elicits the release of glutamate  and neuropeptides  from primary afferent terminals.
The B domain has no known homologues and the C domains are homologous to each other, to the C domains of FV, and are part of the discoidin family.In vitro, FVIII exists as a mixture of heterodimers of a variable length heavy chain  of the A1A2 domains with different length of the B domain due to limited proteolysis of the B domain by FXa or Thrombin, and a constant length light chain . , The LC and HC are linked noncovalently via divalent metal cations. Thus, activated FVIII  is a heterotrimer of the A1 and A2 domains and the LC.
Many co stimulatory  and co inhibitory  molecules have been described on T cells . PD 1 expression on T cells is strongly induced upon T cell activation . B7H1 interactions with both PD 1 and CD80 are required for induction of peripheral T cell tolerance, and blockade of either one can prevent induction of tolerance or augment autoimmunity .
Pancreatic islet cell transplantation is a promising treatment option, with allogeneic transplants used for patients with brittle type 1 diabetes and autologous transplants following total pancreatectomy used for patients with refractory chronic pancreatitis., In 2000, the Edmonton protocol opened a new era of allogeneic islet transplantation, achieving insulin independence in all islet recipients; however, there are still major barriers to its wide use, such as the need for multiple infusions with multiple donors, failed islet isolation, difficulty in maintaining long term graft function, and the use of strong immunosuppression. To that end, pancreatic ductal perfusion  at organ procurement was originally examined and shown to be effective in rodent models, where it was called prestorage ductal flush and intraductal distension and involved use of collagenase containing Hanks’ solution or University of Wisconsin solution ., These techniques allowed sufficient distribution of the collagenase solution in the entire pancreas, preserving pancreatic ducts and inhibiting cold ischemia injury in ductal epithelium. Sawada et al showed that ductal perfusion using UWS without collagenase could significantly improve islet yield and quality.
The disabled homolog 2  gene encodes a mitogen responsive phosphoprotein. In these studies, however, the function of DAB2 protein and the clinical significance of DAB2 down regulation in lung cancer were not further investigated . Given the increasing appreciation of DAB2 as an important tumor suppressor, the mechanisms underlying the down regulation of DAB2 expression in cancer cells have been investigated.
NMR spectroscopy has been used previously to analyze spore contents but typically offers limited detection sensitivity, due to small polarization of the nuclear spin reservoir, where the difference in spin populations aligned parallel or anti parallel to an external magnetic field at thermal equilibrium is typically just ~10 in a million nuclei. To make the technique more sensitive for demanding applications, chemical exchange provides another source of NMR signal amplification . This technique has been applied to 129Xe exchange between bulk aqueous solution and high Xe affinity, water soluble organic host molecules , organic solvents, and gas filled protein structures known as gas vesicles.
Early pre cancerous morphologies including small adenomatous polyps as well as aberrant crypt foci , the earliest detectable pre cancerous abnormalities, were found to be supplied with increased vascularization . In the colon, for example, the mucosa is only ∼100µm thick. Therefore, a large field of view is required to obtain a representative average of the tissue sample .
Significant advances have been made in combining PET and MR based on solid state light detectors that are insensitive to static magnetic fields, such as avalanche photodiode  technology . However technical challenges, primarily associated with cross talk effects, are still not fully resolved . The pre clinical combined PET/MR scanner described in the previous special issue of TCRT  has been assembled and a preliminary evaluation of its performance undertaken.
These findings illustrate the need for a more detailed understanding of CD8+ T cell mediated response to HIV/FIV infection and to define the direct cause for CD8+ dysfunction . Using the FIV model for HIV/AIDS, our group and others have demonstrated the progressive activation of regulatory CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells  during the course of infection, consistent with reports of activated regulatory cells being isolated from HIV patients . Although it is evident that Treg cells are able to suppress CD4+ and CD8+ effector T cells during the course of lentiviral infections, it is not clear if suppression is always harmful.
Aberrant hypermethylation of CpG islands in the glutathione S transferase pi  gene promoter is increasingly being recognized as a precursor to the genesis of prostate cancer. ,  A genetic variant of GSTP1 has been associated with cancer susceptibility and mice lacking GSTP1 exhibit increased skin tumorigenesis, findings that corroborate the notion that GSTP1 is a tumor suppressor. ,  The 5′ untranslated region of GSTP1 contains GC rich regions including CpG islands occupied by two putative Sp1 binding sites that play a central role in regulating basal levels of GSTP1 transcription.
Mental illness imposes an immense global disease burden, particularly in low and middle income countries where access to mental health services is lacking . Major depressive disorder  is the second leading contributor to years lived with disability  globally, and ranks within the top four causes of YLDs in all regions worldwide . A limited number of validation studies of depression screening tools have been conducted against diagnostic reference standards in sub Saharan African settings, but these studies have varied in their choice of context, screening tool, and diagnostic measure, making the results difficult to apply to a PHC context.
Although males and females generally have similar cortisol levels under basal conditions, there is some evidence that females exhibit greater cortisol responses to stress  and pharmacological challenges  than males . The relation between dominance rank and cortisol level is complex, as some primate studies have reported higher cortisol levels in low ranking individuals, whereas others have reported higher cortisol levels in high ranking individuals . In cercopithecine monkeys such as rhesus macaques and baboons, dominance ranks are stable for females but can be very unstable for males .
Subsequently, most postcrossing commissural axons turn rostrally into the longitudinal plane and project alongside the FP  or grow into an intermediate region of the spinal cord  , but never recross the FP. The bHLH  transcription factors, Atoh1 and Neurog1, define nonoverlapping progenitor populations that differentiate into genetically distinct dI1 and dI2 commissural neurons, respectively . After crossing the VM, commissural axons lose their responsiveness to midline attractants and gain responsiveness to the midline associated repellents, Slit13, in vitro.
Type 2 Diabetes mellitus  confers roughly a 40% increased risk for developing AF as compared to individuals without DM . Excess cardiovascular morbidity and mortality are attributable to AF in individuals with DM . In multiple studies, baseline AF was associated with a significantly greater risk for all cause mortality and comparable higher risk for cardiovascular death, stroke, and heart failure ; incident AF among individuals with DM leads to increased risk for stroke and heart failure .
Inhibition plays a central role in theorizing about human cognition. Inhibition refers to the suppression of thoughts, actions, and emotions and is often regarded as a key component of executive control . Researchers have used the concept of inhibition to explain a broad range of phenomena in clinical psychology, cognitive psychology, neuropsychology, lifespan development, and individual differences.
In 1939, WL Watson, after reviewing clinical records from 771 EC cases, wrote: “thermal irritation is probably the most constant factor predisposing to the cancer of the esophagus”. It has been argued that the temperature of hot foods and drinks may fall rapidly in the mouth and oropharynx so that it cannot cause thermal injury to the esophageal mucosa. To test this hypothesis, De Jong and colleagues measured intraesophageal temperature after consuming hot drinks.
The development of new surface modifications for titanium based implants has continuously improved the clinical outcomes in dental and orthopaedic applications and extended the coverage for populations of compromised patients. Additionally, the development of hierarchically structured surfaces that more closely mimic the natural environment of bone at the micro , submicro  and nanoscale levels, has provided insight into the complexity of the biological response that is required to activate osteogenic pathways that, in turn, will result in enhanced bone formation leading to appropriate osseointegration  . In recent years, several studies have been published reporting the beneficial effects of adding nanostructures  to microrough implants in vivo .
Much of histidine’s utility arises from the fact that histidine titrates near neutral pH. As such the quality of models used to describe the protonation of histidine is essential for the correct determination of pH dependent properties of proteins. Work continues to improve the continuum electrostatics description while new models incorporating higher levels of detail from both the solvent and protein models have been developed.
The opposable thumb has helped humans develop fine motor skills, allowing manipulation of a wide variety of objects. In particular, the ability to hold an object between the thumb and the lateral aspect of the index finger  is an important component of hand function. The thumb consists of the carpometacarpal , metacarpophalangeal , and interphalangeal  joints, connecting four bones, the trapezium, the first metacarpal, the proximal phalanx, and the distal phalanx.
These protective effects have been attributed, in part, to the high levels of endogenous  and/or exogenous  estrogens . Yet, the mechanism through which estrogens are protective against colon cancer is still unclear . While ERα has a more regulatory role in mammary carcinogenesis, ERβ is the predominant functional form in the human colon .
Healthy aging is associated with mild and gradual declines in cognition functions, with the greatest aging related changes involving memory, processing speed, and visuospatial skills . Paradoxically, fMRI studies have consistently found increased regional brain activity in healthy elders relative to their younger counterparts during the performance of a cognitive task. More recently, these authors  revised the STAC theory  to account for both positive  and negative  factors that contribute to the rate of change in cognitive function during aging.
Livers procured from Donors after Cardiac Death  represent the most underutilized potential resource of the donor pool . However, national data indicates an increasing reluctance of transplant programs to accept these grafts . The warm ischemia  that characterizes the process of DCD donation causes a dramatic drop of intracellular adenosine triphosphate  long before organ flushing and cooling.
The major function of this protein appears to be the stabilization of the myocyte membrane by forming a mechanical linkage between it and costameric actin. The muscle tissue as a whole can regenerate these lost cells at first, but eventually  the regenerative capacity diminishes, then is exhausted, and an increasingly rapid deterioration ensues, leading to death . Dystrophin has 24 STRs, and thus a rod ~120 nm long .
The paucity of effective control strategies for this widely problematic pest makes it crucial to understand the mechanisms responsible for its ability to infect plants so that novel control strategies can be developed . M. incognita engages in a complex interaction with its host plant. One such effector protein, 16D10, has been shown to interact with two plant SCARECROW like transcription factors, and in doing so it increases the susceptibility of the host to M. incognita infection .
The growth of axons is a fundamental biological process that is a prerequisite for the establishment of neuronal connectivity in the developing nervous system. Therefore, elucidation of the mechanisms that control the growth of axons is critical for our understanding of brain development and disease . Among cell intrinsic mechanisms, the transcriptional regulator SnoN has emerged as a critical regulator of axonal morphogenesis in mammalian neurons .
More than 40% of patients with the demyelinating disease multiple sclerosis  suffer some form of cognitive decline. Traditional imaging measures, such as assessment of macroscopic lesion burden, are weakly related to cognitive changes , leading some researchers to focus on the role of gray matter  pathology in cognitive dysfunction . The hippocampus has emerged as a target for much of this research  .
Morphometric analyses are highly automated — often combining images from hundreds of subjects — analyses using genetic statistical designs which can be performed with voxel based morphometry , tensor based morphometry , cortical surface modeling , subcortical surface modeling  and DTI . Single gene variations  are likely to influence the overall architecture of the brain only to a very minor extent. By exploiting the known genetic resemblance of family members, such as identical and fraternal twins, the relative contribution of genetic and environmental factors to a trait, such as the volume of a specific brain structure, can be identified.
More recently, sildenafil was indicated for management of pulmonary arterial hypertension . There has been a substantial growth in evidence supporting the cardioprotective role of PDE 5 inhibitors against ischemia/reperfusion injury . Several studies from our laboratory have shown that sildenafil and vardenafil reduce infarct size, apoptosis, and attenuate cardiac dysfunction following I/R or permanent coronary artery ligation .
Therefore, MRA methods that do not require contrast agents will have importance for patients with renal insufficiency. Furthermore, with CE MRA, the short contrast first pass window in arteries often limits imaging coverage or spatial resolution and venous contamination may be present at distal run off vessels, particularly for calf and foot arterial imaging. Noncontrast enhanced MRA  methods have the potential to overcome these limitations .
Filament severing accelerates the dynamic exchange of actin between monomers and filaments by simultaneously stimulating actin filament disassembly  and promoting actin polymerization on newly severed barbed ends . Indeed, inhibiting actin turnover during anoxic stress in neurons attenuates ATP depletion by as much as 50%  . Since limiting actin dynamics under energy depleted conditions would allow cells to retain ATP consumed by a cycling actin population, a cellular mechanism to inhibit actin cycling in response to ATP stress would be beneficial to cell types sensitive to energy drain.
Neuronal intermediate filament inclusion disease  is an uncommon neurodegenerative condition  that was first recognized as a unique entity, based on the neuropathological finding of neuronal inclusions that are immunoreactive for neurofilament  proteins but negative for tau and α synuclein . Twenty cases of NIFID have been published to date . The typical presentation is early onset, sporadic FTD, associated with a pyramidal and/or extrapyramidal movement disorder .
Absorption of a photon by a rhodopsin or cone opsin pigment induces isomerization of its retinaldehyde chromophore, activating the receptor. The first catalytic step of the visual cycle, reduction of all trans RAL to all trans retinol , occurs in photoreceptors. The remaining steps occur in cells of the adjacent retinal pigment epithelium .
Twin twin transfusion syndrome  arises in monochorionic twin gestations due to unequal exchange of blood through the placental vascular communications. Selective laser photocoagulation of communicating vessels  is the preferred treatment for TTTS resulting in improved prenatal and perinatal survival. However, few studies have reported risk factors associated with long term developmental outcomes among infants with TTTS post laser surgery and none in the United States .
Furthermore, coronary calcium score is a strong predictor of incident coronary heart disease  and stroke . Underscoring this problem, the American Heart Association has indicated that ESRD patients should be considered at the highest risk for CVD  . A broad spectrum of Vitamin D regulated genes have been identified including those involved in bone and mineral metabolism, cell proliferation and differentiation, and immunomodulation  .
Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria  is a non malignant clonal disorder of hematopoietic stem cells characterized by a somatic mutation in the PIG A gene. Due to a defect in the glycosylphosphatidylinositol  anchor, PNH stem cells and their progeny lack GPI anchored surface proteins, some of which  protect erythrocytes from complement mediated lysis. Patients with PNH may manifest with a variety of symptoms including recurrent intravascular hemolysis, venous thrombosis, and hematopoietic failure, all of which shorten survival compared to healthy age matched controls.
Aberrant promoter methylation of tumor suppressor genes is an important mechanism of gene transcriptional inactivation and has been associated with the development of many kinds of cancers , including lung cancer, the most common cause of cancer death worldwide. Although much attention has been paid to understand the molecular and cellular mechanisms of lung cancer, the 5 year overall survival rate for all stages combined is only 15% , due primarily to the presence of metastatic tumors in approximately two third of patients at the time of diagnosis . Detection of lung cancer at earlier stages could potentially increase survival rates by 1050 folds .
Reported rates have varied because of differences in definition and settings of studies. Insomnia has been defined in terms of symptoms, symptoms with duration or frequency of their occurrence, or diagnosis, such as those based on the criteria of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition . Lifestyle and environmental factors, which may differ from place to place, are often related to the occurrence of insomnia.
Thioredoxin 1  is a 12 kDa endogenous protein found in micromolar concentrations in the cytosol of cells . Once oxidized, Trx 1 can be reduced by thioredoxin reductase . Trx 1 has multiple functions in the cell, including antioxidant, anti inflammatory, and anti apoptotic activity.
Heterogeneity is observed in the patterns of cognition in Alzheimer's disease . Such heterogeneity might suggest the involvement of different aetiological pathways or different host responses to pathology . 627 subjects with mild/moderate AD underwent cognitive assessment with the Mini Mental Status Exam  and the Dementia Rating Scale 2 .
Mercury has primarily been recognized for its effects on the developing nervous system, first noted in tragic poisonings occurring in Japan as a result of contaminated fish consumption and Iraq as a result of contaminated grain consumption . Through the use of rodent models, awareness of the direct effects of mercury on the immune system has increased. Female mice tend to be more susceptible to mercury induced autoimmunity, consistent with sex differences observed in autoimmune diseases in humans .
Cancer is a genetic disease in which genomic abnormalities alter the transcriptome, thereby directly or indirectly deregulating the pathways that control proliferation and survival. Large scale efforts to systematically catalogue the landscape of somatic alterations that contributes to tumorigenesis, such as The Cancer Genome Atlas , have shown that extensive genomic heterogeneity within and across tumor types exists, but that alterations in pathways such as the p53 pathway or the receptor tyrosine kinase pathway represent common themes. However, this analysis may be hindered by the dominant effect of cellular differentiation on transcription levels, which is unrelated to tumorigenesis.
Thus, strategies to increase the durability of these responses are urgently needed . Immunotherapy is another area of success in the treatment of melanoma. In particular, the use of immune checkpoint inhibitors has shown tremendous promise.
Several studies have suggested that tobacco smoke is an independent risk factor for cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma . The aryl hydrocarbon receptor , a ligand activated transcription factor, binds with high affinity to PAH including benzopyrene . One UV photoproduct that has received substantial attention is FICZ  .
In 2006, the prevalence of overweight in U. S. children and adolescents had been estimated at 17%, and is predicted to rise to 20% by 2010 . Notably, this association of moderate adiposity at adolescence with premature death later in life was only partially explained by adult obesity. This finding implies that adolescent overweight status may be an independent predictor of lifetime health .
Cisplatin is a potent agent used in cancer chemotherapy. Many molecular processes including proliferation, differentiation, migration and apoptosis, are reported to be affected by this communication . Connexins have been viewed as therapeutic targets in cancer treatment due to two important mechanisms: the GJIC independent mechanism and GJIC dependent mechanism .
Interleukin  12p40  is a common subunit of both IL 12p70  and IL 23 . IL 12p70 plays a role in resistance and adaptive immunity and is also involved in antitumor responses,. In addition to associating with IL 12p35 and IL 23p19 to comprise the well studied heterodimeric cytokines IL 12 and IL 23, IL 12p40 can exist in a monomeric form; the monomeric form may play an independent role in immune responses.
Malignant gliomas are characterized by their invasiveness and dissemination, resulting in frequent tumor recurrence after surgical resection and/or other treatment. As one of the strategies to develop novel therapies for such brain tumors, it had been proposed that neural progenitor/stem cells  with tumor tracking capabilities  may be utilized as a vehicle to deliver therapeutic entities and to target the tumor . We had previously engineered Interleukin 12 producing murine primary NSCs and demonstrated that these NSCs migrated towards intracranial gliomas and induced T cell anti tumor immunity .
The concept of imidazoline binding sites was first proposed in 1984 ; since then, research has focused on understanding the nature of these binding sites . Imidazoline I2 receptors might be the most interesting of the imidazoline receptor subtypes because they are emerging as a possible drug target for some neurological and psychiatric disorders, such as pain, stroke and drug abuse . I2 receptors have not been cloned, although ligands selective for I2 receptors have been used to study this receptor system.
During automotive spray painting, workers may be exposed to HDI present in paint formulations via skin or inhalation routes. Repeated skin exposure at these trace levels to HDI monomer  may cause skin sensitization, which can develop to asthma following inhalation exposure to HDI monomer . HDA could be N acetylated by N acetyltransferase  to form N acetyl 1,6 hexamethylene diamine   and N,N′ diacetyl 1,6 hexamethylene diamine , which is rapidly excreted.
Between the years 2000 and 2010, the growth rate of the Hispanic community  was more than four times the growth rate of the total population . The estimation of the Hispanic population by the US Census Bureau in 2010 was nearly 1 million more than expected, based on the most recent Census Bureau estimates. By the year 2050, the population is estimated to nearly double to 24.4 million people.
The mechanical properties of bacteria are known to vary among and within species. Gram positive bacteria have a thicker cell wall and greater turgor pressure than Gram negative organisms, and are therefore more stiff than Gram negative organisms , . To date, the mechanical properties of bacteria have been examined using optical traps, atomic force microscopy, , scanning probe microscopy, and hydrogel encapsulation.
Cytokines control a large panel of biological functions, many of them mediated by the JAK STAT signal transduction pathway. In mammary tissue STAT5 is required for the establishment and maintenance of alveolar progenitors during puberty  as well as for alveolar proliferation and differentiation during pregnancy . Concentration dependent and stage specific STAT5 binding to respective regulatory elements ensures the temporally coordinated activation of genetic programs  .
Concurrent and discrete trial choice procedures are used to measure the relative reinforcing strength of abused drugs. When the alternative reinforcer to a drug injection is a non drug stimulus, such as food, the procedure more closely resembles the clinical abuse condition , in which choosing drug results in forfeiting another reinforcer . Previous studies have suggested that response rates do not correlate significantly with drug choice or preference .
Adeno associated virus  is a ssDNA virus from the Parvoviridae family. Initially AAV serotype 2 was considered as a vehicle for gene transfer in various in vitro and in vivo experimental and therapeutic settings. More recently, several alternative serotypes have been used as vectors for gene therapy.
Methylphenidate  enhances cognitive and behavioral function by acting, at least in part, on the prefrontal cortex . Recent reports state that the use of MPD as a cognitive enhancer has become widely abused among college students and adults. Due to the PFC’s critical role in higher cognitive functions, it is considered one of the main brain regions to respond to acute and chronic MPD administration., MPD binds to dopamine  and noradrenaline  transporters, blocking the reuptake of both DA and NE from the synaptic cleft to the presynaptic terminals, therefore leading to an increased level of DA and NE in the extracellular space.
Smoking prevalence among adults in the U.S. has decreased from 40% in 1964 to 20% currently . Compared to the general population, persons with substance abuse disorders have higher smoking prevalence , smokers with a history of alcoholism appear more heavily dependent on nicotine compared to those without such a history , and smokers in alcohol treatment may find it harder to quit smoking as compared to non alcoholic smokers . A smaller literature is available related to smoking and HIV, but studies suggest that smoking prevalence is elevated among HIV affected persons , that smoking is related to HIV related medical problems in this population , and that quitting smoking is recommended for persons living with HIV  .
Thymic derived CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells  have an important role in the mechanisms of peripheral immune tolerance and in the prevention of pathogenic autoimmunity through the suppression of proliferation and production of pro inflammatory cytokines in effector immune cells. Similar to other T cells, tTregs develop in the thymus, and are defined by expression of the forkhead family transcription factor Foxp3 . Mice deficient for Foxp3, or carrying a loss of function mutation in Foxp3 , present with fatal autoimmune like disease caused by hyper responsive CD4+ T cells .
mTOR’s ability to control cell size and cell cycle is due at least in part to its ability to regulate the translation of specific classes of mRNAs. The rapamycin sensitive translational functions mediated by S6K and 4EBP1 have been recently recognized to be a result of mTOR’s interaction with raptor to form the mTORC1 complex, while rapamycin insensitive functions are a result of mTOR’s interaction with rictor, forming mTORC2 . mTORC1, but not mTORC2, activates S6K, which can then inhibit insulin receptor substrate I , thereby limiting insulin receptor mediated signaling through PI3K.
Neural progenitor cells  of the embryonic neocortex initially comprise a large population of the neuroepithelial cells and, as development proceeds, radial glia located in the ventricular zone  continue to provide a source of NPCs. Radial glia undergo symmetric cell divisions to replenish themselves and asymmetric divisions to produce postmitotic neurons or intermediate neural progenitors  . Harnessing the potential of NPCs holds promise for the treatment of neuronal injury and neurodegenerative diseases, and dysfunction of NPCs is at the root of numerous neurological disorders ,.
Methamphetamine  is a highly addictive psychostimulant. In the United States, an estimated 600,000 people are weekly users of the drug. METH exerts pharmacological effects on the central nervous system  through a non exocytoxic mechanism that releases monoamine neurotransmitters including dopamine, norepinephrine, and serotonin.
Interferons may also be used therapeutically in some hematologic malignancies . Despite these observations, little is known about the effects of interferons on the hematopoietic stem cell . Since abnormal control of HSC quiescence may lead to bone marrow failure or leukemia, understanding the factors, both genetic and environmental, that control HSC function is of significant clinical importance .
In eukaryotic cells, several Cdk/cyclin complexes such as Cdk2/cyclin E, Cdk1/cyclin B, Cdk4/cyclin D, Cdk6/cyclin D, Cdk2/cyclin A, etc. drive cell cycle progression, and it was believed that their functions are confined to specific stages of the cell cycle . In addition, it was described that Cdk2 is present predominantly in the nucleus throughout the cell cycle .
Pain originating from the musculoskeletal system is common and costs billions of dollars in healthcare and lost wages . Once the hypersensitivity has developed, dorsal rhizotomy or local anesthetic blockade of afferent input has no effect on the contralateral hypersensitivity. Together these data suggest that the mechanisms underlying this long lasting mechanical hypersensitivity reside in the central nervous system and that this hypersensitivity is not dependent on continued nociceptive input from the periphery .
Several factor  VIII products of different origin and structure are being used for hemophilia A treatment worldwide. The assessment of FVIII concentration in these products is done using activity assays, which are dependent upon the assay and its modifications . Three activity  and two immunoassays  were used in this study with albumin free full length recombinant  FVIII as a standard .
Mφs respond to IFNγ, with or without LPS, to become classically activated . In contrast, IL 4 and IL 13 induce the alternative activation of Mφs by signalling through IL 4Rα , the common subunit of their receptors. Much of our understanding of the functional specialisation of Mφ subsets has been through the development of CX3CR1gfp/+ transgenic mice which express eGFP under the control of the CX3CR1 promoter .
Adults with epilepsy had poorer food security, less personal safety, poorer housing quality, and lower levels of educational attainment. Women with epilepsy were less likely to access healthcare services for antenatal care . Whether deprivation for people with epilepsy is an adult only phenomenon or extends to children is unclear, but early deprivation for children with epilepsy  would have long term implications for their potential lifelong health and well being .
Manganese superoxide dismutase  is responsible for converting superoxide to hydrogen peroxide in the mitochondrial matrix. This polymorphism is predicted to result in a change in the secondary structure in the MTS domain of the protein from an α helix  to a β sheet conformation  . The classic structure for the MTS domain in proteins that are imported into the mitochondria is the α helix.
Efavirenz, a potent non nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor , remains preferred component of highly active antiretroviral therapy  for treatment naïve patients despite an emergence of second generation of NNRTIs and new classes of antiretroviral agents . However, its propensity for clinically important drug drug interactions is high. It is predominantly cleared mainly by CYP2B6 mediated 8 hydroxylation, with small contribution from other CYPs   ).
Upon stimulation, NKT cells rapidly secrete large amounts of immune regulatory T helper cell 1  and T helper cell 2  cytokines, such as interferon γ  and interleukin 4 , respectively. α Galactosylceramide  is a potent CD1d stimulatory ligand that elicits secretion of these cytokines . The α1 and α2 domains form the antigen presenting superdomain that is also common to class 1 antigen presenting molecules.
Internalizing behaviours , prevalent in children born very preterm compared to full term, are evident by 2 years corrected age   and persist to school age, late adolescence and young adulthood . Animal studies have established that early life adversity, including maternal separation and pain exposure, induce long term behavioural changes . Little is known about the aetiology of internalizing behaviours in children born very preterm.
A promising research area from the 1950s through 1970s involved the therapeutic use of 5 HT2AR agonist hallucinogens in the treatment of drug dependence, including alcohol and opioid dependence . Some studies did not include the rigor and controls expected of modern clinical research, thus obscuring efficacy. However, a recent meta analysis of randomized controlled trials found that LSD facilitated treatment of alcoholism approximately doubled the success rates of control conditions at the first follow up .
Dose escalated external beam radiation therapy  for prostate cancer is associated with improved tumor control rates in all disease risk groups. Randomized controlled trials  conducted in the United States demonstrated improved PSA control following treatment of localized prostate cancer with EBRT doses of 78 Gy and 79.2 Gy compared to 70 Gy., Clinical guidelines of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network  have evolved over the last decade but have generally suggested doses between 7079 Gy for men with low risk disease and 7580+ Gy for men with intermediate and high risk disease., Thus, in 2007 the use of higher dose EBRT  was established as a clinical performance measure in assessing the quality of prostate cancer radiotherapy. Despite these observed benefits, selection of patients most likely to benefit from dose escalated EBRT is complicated by several factors.
For example, on a day that an individual jogged for 30 minutes, they might increase the amount of time spent being sedentary; whereas on a day that the same individual did not jog, they might increase the amount of time spent walking and decrease the amount of time in sedentary activities. Despite total physical activity remaining constant, inactivity varies on each of the three days to compensate for the changes in LPA and MVPA. The “activitystat” results in compensation for the periods of inactivity through increases in the intensity of activity during the rest of the day in order to maintain the total physical activity set point .
Fragile X syndrome , caused by a mutation in FMR1 at Xq27.3, is the most common inherited cause of mental impairment and the leading known single gene cause of autism. There are currently no empirically validated behavioral or pharmacological treatments available for individuals with FXS. An excellent candidate is prepulse inhibition , a measure of sensorimotor gating.
