These lipids appeared to be phosphatidylcholine  molecules, which do not exist naturally in the bacterial membrane. Normally, agonist binding to the extracellular  domains could trigger opening of the ion channels and stimulate the cation permeation.
Most illicit drug use initiation begins between the ages of 12 and 20, with peak periods of initiation of drug use between ages 15 and 19 . It has been suggested that these changes during adolescence could lead to differential responses to drugs compared to that seen in juveniles or adults . Thus, it is important to understand the effects of drugs during adolescence and to study further this developmental stage as a critical time period for drug use.
Wen et al.  and Montalibet et al.  developed a technique to image electrical conductivity using the ultrasonically induced Lorentz force. An ultrasonic wave is passed through tissue in the presence of a magnetic field. The wave causes the tissue  and the charged ions within the tissue  to move.
Throughout the vertebrate species, rod OSs maintain the same width throughout their length, whereas cone OSs are tapered toward the distal end. Such a transport system operates in an anterograde fashion, and runs on the major cytoskeleton of cilia, the axoneme. Such anterograde transport is mediated by a kinesin II motor and is essential for carrying cargoes, such as opsin and other phototransduction components, to the disk membranes .
Research on source memory  the ability to recall the conditions under which a memory was acquired  has increasingly come to focus on how agendas at the time of retrieval can influence which mnemonic features are retrieved and used to make source judgments . One factor that has been shown to influence source memory judgments is the number of sources mentioned in the test instructions: Subjects are more likely to falsely attribute items to a source if that source is the only one mentioned at test  vs. if multiple sources are mentioned at test  . Subjects may be more prone to apply this kind of constraint on single agenda vs. multi agenda tests.
At baseline, females reported lower HRQOL scores than males in all the domains except social functioning. At week 40, women scored lower in all of the domains except overall health. Women scored significantly less positive well being than the men despite less advanced disease.
Membrane proteins exhibit molecular motions on a wide range of time scales under physiological conditions and insight into their motions is the key to understanding their functions. Molecular motions on the order of milliseconds are frequently observed in many essential and fascinating biological processes ranging from ligand binding to enzyme catalysis. These motions often influence various NMR observables such as chemical shift anisotropy, dipolar coupling and quadrupole coupling.
One potentially important application of functional image information is in the planning, guidance, and assessment of therapeutic interventions. Oxygen imaging based on EPRI has been validated using an Oxylite optical oxygen probe as a gold standard . In concept, adaptive image guidance for fractionated therapies such as radiotherapy could involve the detection of an image derived “signature” of treatment effect following each fraction, the signature ideally reflecting the spatial distribution of response, or lack thereof, within the tumor.
Information about injuries sustained by survivors of airplane crashes is scant, although some information is available on fatal aviation related injuries. Objectives of this study were to explore the patterns of aviation related injuries admitted to U.S. hospitals and relate them to aviation deaths in the same period . The Healthcare Cost and Utilization Project  Nationwide Inpatient Sample  contains information for approximately 20% of all hospital admissions in the United States each year.
According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention , the aging process is associated with increased risk for disease that can cause physical and economic burden for older adults. Thus, the growing older adult population places significant burden on the health care system. From anti wrinkle creams to antioxidants, many companies are currently in the business of selling products to delay the aging process.
Heart disease is not only the leading cause of death, disability, and healthcare expense in the US, but also the leading cause of death worldwide, and treatments to reduce cardiac damage could have significant health and fiscal impacts. Current therapies assume that hypertrophy is mediated by neurohormonal activation of G protein signaling pathways. CXCR4 is a member of the G protein coupled receptor  family, and agonists or antagonists of GPCRs have been used to treat diseases of every major organ system including the cardiovascular system, becoming the most successful molecular targets in clinical medicine.,, Given the keen interest in using SDF 1αas a therapeutic target, it is essential to determine the direct effects of SDF 1α on myocardial function.
Chronic lower respiratory diseases are the third leading cause of death In the United States, resulting in 137,082 deaths in 2009. Lung function, as assessed by the spirometric measures of forced expiratory volume in one second , forced vital capacity  and the FEV1 to FVC ratio , is an objective indicator of general respiratory health, as well as an important long term predictor of morbidity and mortality. Recently, genome wide association studies  have begun to shed light on the complex genetic architecture of lung function measures.
The metabolic syndrome is a cluster of cardiovascular risk factors including elevated blood pressure, dyslipidemia, impaired glycemic control, and abdominal obesity. This syndrome affects about 25% of the adult US population and is reaching an epidemic spread in parallel to obesity, which is estimated to affect about 312 million people worldwide. With at least 1.1 billion overweight people, the incidence of the metabolic syndrome is expected to continue to rise, warranting thorough mechanistic understanding to enable optimal treatment at a socioeconomic scale .
High oil corn is particularly attractive as a feed, due to its high metabolizable energy . Increases in corn seed oil content are possible by traditional breeding. Despite a good understanding of the genes involved, there has been little success at transgenically increasing seed oil content .
Recent studies have shown that ATF5 is a regulator of cell survival that is specific to cancer cells . ATF5 is expressed in a number of gliomas  and breast cancers  and is down regulated in a number of cancer cell lines following growth factor deprivation, which leads to apoptosis . Expression of d/n ATF5 also causes death of brain tumor cells in vivo .
However, and despite the interest and importance of understanding the regulation of neurogenesis across the lifespan , there is no detailed quantitative information regarding postnatal neurogenesis in the primate dentate gyrus . Early studies of neurogenesis using the radioactive thymidine labeling technique in macaque monkeys reported a sharp decrease in neuron production within three to four months after birth, but failed to demonstrate neurogenesis in adult individuals . Furthermore, only limited descriptions of the number of neurons observed at birth as compared to that observed in adult primates have ever been published .
The rate limiting step in ubiquitin mediated proteolysis is substrate recognition by E3 ubiquitin ligases. RING finger like proteins can be either monomeric or members of multi subunit E3 ligase complexes. One major class of multi subunit E3 ubiquitin ligases is Skp1/Cullin/F box protein  complexes.
Elderly Sri Lankans  constituted 9.4% of the population in 2006, up from 9.1% in 2001 and from 6.9% in 1998 . As Sri Lanka's population lives longer, a larger proportion of the elderly will require help and care, either from formal  or informal  caregivers. Typically, children live in the family home until marriage, at which time the daughter moves in with her husband’s family; however, research has found that elders’ preferences to cohabit with an adult son or daughter depends on numerous factors, including number of children and employment status .
Active smoking has long been considered deleterious to health and a risk factor for a number of diseases . Cigarette smoke contains more than 4,000 chemicals and at least 60 known carcinogens . Nonsmoking individuals subjected to secondhand smoke  are exposed to these same toxins, but in varying amounts .
Over 50% of individuals with an anterior cruciate ligament  injury and reconstruction develop post traumatic osteoarthritis . Multiple studies have shown that individuals with ACL reconstruction  continue to demonstrate abnormal walking mechanics of the reconstructed knee when compared to the contralateral knee and compared to control subjects. It has been hypothesized that abnormal gait mechanics may contribute to altered cartilage loading and subsequent PTOA following an ACL R. Specifically, higher external knee adduction moment  and dynamic knee varus during walking have been implicated in the pathogenesis of knee OA.
Enormous progress has recently been made to understand the genetic basis of dilated cardiomyopathy . Furthermore, some of the genes that harbor DCM mutations are very large. Hence, examining coding sequence for variations in multiple genes has been costly and labor intensive .
While this phenomenon, termed peri saccadic mislocalization, is not often perceived in daily life, it has been repeatedly shown in controlled laboratory conditions. Specifically, a flashed stimulus presented shortly before or after saccade onset is likely to be mislocalized. One remaining mystery about this phenomenon is the non uniformity of the mislocalization.
Vietnam is disproportionately affected by the HIV epidemic amongst countries in Southeast Asia . The HIV epidemic in Vietnam is concentrated in high risk populations, including injection drug users, male and female sex workers, and men who have sex with men  . A large proportion of MSW in Vietnam are in urban areas, are frequently migrants from other regions, and have unstable housing .
Hidradenitis Suppurativa  is a follicular occlusion disorder occurring in apocrine rich areas that often presents with tender, occasionally draining, papules and nodules with an onset early in puberty, occasionally leading to sinus tract formation. Associations with other illnesses  have been described. Due to the involvement of many different sites, HS patients may see not only dermatologists, but also general internists, colorectal surgeons, plastic surgeons, gastroenterologists and family physicians.
The formation and retrieval of relational memories critically depends on the hippocampus, as demonstrated by numerous lesion, electrophysiological, and human imaging studies . Nonetheless, how it performs these operations remains poorly understood. Strictly in terms of neuronal firing rate, previously encoded events can be distinguished from novel ones by increased activity for events that match stored representations , or by greater activity for novel events .
A growing body of evidence indicates that group I metabotropic glutamate receptors , which include mGluR1 and mGluR5 receptors, play a critical role in the reinstatement of cocaine seeking behavior, an animal model of relapse. Group I mGluRs are expressed predominantly on postsynaptic membranes  throughout the brain including the nucleus accumbens . Administration of an mGluR5 antagonist into the accumbens shell attenuated cocaine priming induced reinstatement of drug seeking .
Phospholipase D  catalyzes the hydrolysis of phosphatidylcholine to generate the lipid second messenger phosphatidic acid , and choline, in response to mitogenic signals such as PDGF, EGF, FGF, insulin, IGF, VEGF and serum . Cell differentiation is accompanied with a very large increase in PLD2 expression. PLD activity has been reported to be elevated in cells transformed by v Src, v Fps, v Ras and v Raf and tyrosyl phosphorylated PLD2 has been reported .
Urinary catheters are frequently used for both short  and long term care in skilled nursing home  facilities. , A recent study of all skilled NHs in four states showed 12%13% of all new admissions had indwelling catheters. Indwelling urinary catheters are often used to manage refractory urinary retention, large skin wounds, and pressure ulcers in order to avoid contamination or for comfort care in patients under hospice care.
Huntington’s disease  is a neurodegenerative disorder caused by a polyglutamine repeat expansion in the huntingtin  protein, producing the pathological mutant huntingtin  . Synaptic dysfunction and striatal neurodegeneration in HD are attributed, in part, to abnormal localization, function and signaling of NMDA receptors  and subsequent elevated excitotoxicity . The NMDAR GluN2B subunit mediates increased vulnerability to excitotoxicity in mHtt expressing striatal medium spiny projection neurons  .
Recruitment of circulating monocytes, their differentiation into macrophages, uptake of LDL derived cholesterol, and the ensuing activation of a broad range of inflammatory responses are the major events leading to atherosclerosis initiation and progression. In addition to these cellular functions of the macrophage, increased numbers of circulating monocytes are associated with atherosclerosis and predict future cardiovascular disease. Hypercholesterolemia for example is intimately associated with monocytosis and gives rise to proinflammatory Ly 6C+ monocyte subsets, which infiltrate the arterial wall to contribute to atherosclerosis formation.
α Melanocyte stimulating hormone , a thirteen amino acid peptide derived from proopiomelanocortin , is involved in regulation of food intake and energy homeostasis in mammals,  and is an inhibitor of inflammatory reactions. In the CNS, it increases sensitivity to insulin,  while in peripheral tissues it seems to play a pivotal role in insulin resistance . α MSH is a potent agonist of the melanocortin 1  and melanocortin 4  receptors .
Multiple infectious forms of VACV , each with a different number of envelope layers, are produced during infection, including the mature virion  and the enveloped virion . The majority of studies investigating the entry of VACV into host cells have focused on the MV since they are more abundant and easier to purify than EV particles . Moreover, proteins on the MV surface are important for entry of both forms of VACV .
Herpetic stromal keratitis  is a chronic immunoinflammatory condition that develops in corneal tissue in response to recurrent herpes simplex virus 1  infection of the cornea. Studies carried out in mouse models have clearly shown the involvement of both innate and adaptive immune cells in regulating the severity of HSK . Adoptive transfer of ex vivo generated antigen specific Foxp3+ Tregs has also been shown to control the severity of HSV 1 induced immunoinflammatory reactions in inflamed corneas .
How are innate behaviors programmed into the genome? Answering this question requires identifying the genes that control specific behaviors, the neural circuitry on which they act, and how this circuitry controls behavior. Drosophila is unique amongst invertebrate genetic model organisms in that it exhibits both courtship and aggression .
A large class of cellular response systems regulates the flux and concentration of small molecules by controlling transport and metabolism pathways via two feedback loops connected by a common transcription factor  that senses the intracellular concentration of the small molecule. The simplest systems consist of two operons, a regulator gene and a regulated operon containing at least two cistrons, one encoding a transporter and the other encoding an enzyme which modifies/degrades the small molecule. Therefore, regulation of these operons occurs by “combinatorial control”, which is common in both prokaryotes and eukaryotes; .
Cryopreservation of oocytes or ovarian tissue provides a potential option for fertility preservation of women facing the loss of reproductive function, either due to diseases such as cancer or treatments, including radiation and chemotherapy . Cryopreserved and thawed ovarian tissue has been successfully reimplanted and has produced live births, with lower success rates for frozen tissue vs. fresh transplant . Although studies on each of these techniques report varying levels of success, there is evidence suggesting that slow cryopreservation is more efficient and produces a greater number of surviving and functional follicles after thawing .
Epithelial ovarian cancer is the most lethal gynecologic malignancy and the fourth leading cause of death from cancer among women. It is intriguing that mutations in the BRCA1 gene are relatively rare in the sporadic form of ovarian epithelial tumors given their important role in the familial form. This could be analogous to the rarity of P53 mutations in cervical carcinomas because the presence of the human papilloma virus E6 protein, which binds to P53 and is expressed in most of these tumors, eliminates the need for such mutations.
Candida albicans is a frequent cause of both mucocutaneous and systemic infections . Incidence of invasive candidiasis is increasing among immunocompromised patients with mortality rates ranging from 30 50% despite aggressive antifungal therapy . Central to the pathogenesis of this organism is its ability to respond to environmental signals by changing its growth morphology.
CPMG data is typically measured at multiple magnetic field strengths and combined with additional experiments  in order to determine the sign of the excited state chemical shift. A second class of dispersion experiments involves measuring the rotating frame relaxation rate constant  upon application of a radiofrequency  spin lock field with varying offset frequency  and power  . For processes occurring at even slower timescales  chemical exchange saturation transfer  experiments employing weak RF spin lock fields have recently been shown to be a robust approach to characterize lowly populated conformational states in both proteins and nucleic acids .
Designing and implementing a human research protocol has grown increasingly challenging due to the increasing expectations about scientific and biostatistical rigor, the growth in regulatory requirements, and the increasing subtlety of bioethical review. As a result, the successful design of a human research protocol requires inputs from a variety of content experts in addition to the investigator. We hypothesized that having an expert and experienced leader  coordinate and integrate those inputs in a structured program could expand opportunities for, and accelerate, translational research by: 1) lowering the barriers for basic investigators to develop human subjects protocols, 2) providing practical and comprehensive education in the principles of good clinical practice , 3) speeding IRB approval, and 4) insuring scientific quality .
The nitrone spin trap 5,5 dimethyl 1 pyrroline N oxide  was first introduced by Janzen and his colleagues about 40 years ago . Today, traditional immunoassays  in combination with anti DMPO antibody can be used as an alternative and convenient methodology to detect free radicals in vitro and also in vivo  . Free radicals and other reactive oxygen species  are ubiquitous in the living cells and are involved in various cellular processes.
These studies have been performed with adults, and here we examined the development of the brain basis of WM in children . Increased activation for greater loads has also been observed specifically during WM maintenance . Behavioral studies have documented an increase in WM ability from childhood to adulthood .
Early diagnosis under these conditions is aided by point of care  diagnostics that are able to detect viruses at low concentrations and without involved sample preparation. Lateral flow assays  are a rapid, cheap, and simple option for POC diagnosis. By contrast, complex laboratory methods such as plaque counting and polymerase chain reaction have much lower limits of detection.
The ADNI  is a large longitudinal study of patients with probable Alzheimer's disease , patients with mild cognitive impairment  and healthy elderly controls followed for at least 23 years. Many participants in the ADNI are being treated with medications, and these may have beneficial or deleterious effects . Diagnosis, demographics, medication status, psychometric data and MRI measures of hippocampal volume and entorhinal cortex thickness were obtained for 818 participants from the ADNI cohort.
These megasyndromes are coupled with gastrointestinal motility disturbances in patients with Chagas disease . Mega organ syndromes and associated symptoms are also exhibited in animal models of Chagas disease . The response to infection with T. cruzi includes upregulation of the inflammatory response including inducible nitric oxide synthase , tumor necrosis factor α interferon  γ, and other proinflammatory cytokines .
of Haemophilus influenzae type b  conjugate vaccines into childhood immunization programs has dramatically reduced the incidence of Hib meningitis in countries using Hib vaccines . Hib conjugate vaccines are highly efficacious against invasive Hib disease , decrease Hib carriage among vaccinated children and reduce transmission and invasive disease among non immunized children  . Hib conjugate vaccines do not prevent H. influenzae disease due to other serotypes, raising the potential for the emergence of H. influenzae disease due to virulent organisms with non type b capsules .
The intermediate host of T. solium are mainly pigs. Humans act as definitive hosts for the parasite. Gravid segments from humans infected with the adult tapeworm are passed in the faeces each containing around 40,000 eggs that resist destruction in the environment for a relatively long period of time.
The functional, three dimensional structure of a protein reflects a careful balance of diverse noncovalent interactions. Stabilizing forces such as hydrogen bonds, salt bridges, and hydrophobic effect have been studied extensively. In contrast, much less is known about cationπ interactions in proteins, in part because of the challenges inherent to rigorous characterization of these interactions.
Simian immunodeficiency viruses  belong to the group of lentiviruses that infect non human primates . Like HIV 1 and HIV 2, all known SIV subtypes use CD4 as a receptor and either CCR5, CXCR4, or, as for SIVrcm, CCR2 as a co receptor. In contrast, after SIV infection natural hosts generally do not progress to AIDS.
The recessive Arabidopsis acd11 mutant initiates defense related programmed cell death  at the early seedling stage, leading to a lethal phenotype before flowering . The ACD11 protein has homology to glycolipid transfer proteins  found in most eukaryotes . A biological role of a GLTP like protein has recently been found by studying mammalian FAPP2, which contains a c terminal domain homologous to GLTP as well as an N terminal PH domain.
Distinct types of neurons and glia are generated from progenitor cells following a precise spatial and temporal order during development of the nervous system. The spatial identity of a neuron is determined by the position of its progenitor cell in the neural tube and the signals that it receives along the dorsoventral  and rostrocaudal  axes . In addition, in vitro experiments performed with cultured cortical progenitor cells further indicated that the mechanisms governing the temporal order of neurogenesis are encoded within the progenitors and their immediate progeny  .
The estimated incidence of neonatal herpes varies by geographical region and study methodology, ranging from 1 case per 20,000  60,000 live births in European countries , 1 case per 17, 000 live births in Canada, 1 case per 11,000 live births in Australia, and up to 1 case per 3,200 live births in parts of the United States. To reduce the risk of perinatal transmission of HSV, the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists  and the Society of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists of Canada  have recommended that caesarean delivery be performed on women presenting with genital herpes lesions at the onset of labour. , This management strategy relies on the clinical recognition of genital infection.
Because necrotic regions do not usually occur in normal tissues and are generally anaerobic, we have proposed that they could be used to target anticancer drugs selectively to tumors using genetically engineered anaerobic bacteria of the genus Clostridium . Initially, efforts to use the tumor targeting properties of non pathogenic strains of Clostridia focused on the fact that following intravenous injection, spores of these strains localized and germinated in the necrotic areas of experimental tumors and produced extensive tumor lysis. These animal experiments were followed by clinical studies with cancer patients, which demonstrated that spores of non pathogenic strains of Clostridia could be given safely, that the spores germinate in the necrotic regions of tumors, and that lysis of the tumors can occur .
Adoptive cell transfer of T lymphocytes has demonstrated successful tumor regression in clinical trials. This may pose an obstacle to effective T cell therapy, as in some cases a suitable tumor antigen may not be available for TCR activation or T cell tolerance to the tumor may be induced and in other cases, T cells may undergo antigen induced cell death rather than clonal expansion prior to effector molecule expression. Furthermore, when cell surface density of FasL is increased on T cells by inhibiting its proteolytic cleavage to a soluble form, T cell cytotoxicity through FasL is enhanced.
The cross disciplinary research approach can be conceptualized along a continuum of increasing disciplinary integration, with unidisciplinary research at one end of the continuum and transdisciplinary  research at the other end . This definition highlights the goals not only to synthesize approaches from the contributing disciplines, but also to extend beyond these origins to produce new approaches that yield scientific innovations and findings with practical relevance to solving real world problems . Yet the approach also introduces unique challenges, including the added time and effort needed for communication with more diverse group of collaborators ; conflicts stemming from the varied goals, values, and implicit assumptions that collaborators from multiple disciplines and fields bring to the research endeavor ; competing obligations to one's home discipline/department ; and perhaps not unsurprisingly, a delay in productivity that likely results from the increased “start up” time needed for TD teams to overcome these and other challenges  .
In 2010, an estimated 59,000 Americans were diagnosed with renal cell carcinoma  and approximately 13,000 died from the disease . The different subtypes of RCC and their distinct molecular characteristics  has led to improved treatment and therapy directed by tumor subtype . Although cytokine therapy with interferon alfa or interleukin 2  was considered as the standard treatment for metastatic RCC  prior to the introduction of targeted therapies, the latter are now considered the standard of care for most patients with mRCC .
P27kip1 is frequently inactivated in human cancers through accelerated proteolysis, and reduced p27kip1 expression has been shown to be associated with poor prognosis in a variety of human malignancies , whereas restoration of p27kip1 levels can inhibit tumor growth and progression . SIRT1 is a nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide  dependent non histone and histone deacetylase that has been reported to play an important role in a variety of physiological processes including aging, DNA repair, apoptosis and cell senescence . P53 has been shown as an important target of SIRT1 to suppress apoptosis ; however, many studies show that SIRT1 regulates cancer cell growth regardless of p53 status .
Each domain is enriched in a unique set of ion channels, cell adhesion molecules , and cytoskeletal and scaffolding proteins . Among these polarized axonal domains, only the paranode regulates the organization of the other domains. In the CNS, some evidence suggests that paranodal junctions initiate the clustering of Na+ channels , and regulate the types of Na+ channels located in myelinated axons .
Apathy is increasingly being recognized as a common and clinically significant neurobehavioral syndrome. While clinicians appreciate the prevalence of apathy in dementia, little has been reported about its pathophysiology, characteristics, and behavioral associations . ,  Affective apathy would manifest as symptoms of indifference or lack of empathy.
CBS is the only known PLP dependent enzyme that also contains heme . The heme cofactor is six coordinate and in the low spin state with cysteine  and histidine  as axial ligands . The coordination between the thiolate and ferric iron can be observed at high enzyme concentrations  in the low energy region by the presence of two bands at 645 and 705 nm .
The toxic accumulation of BAs in the circulation leads to profound systemic metabolic disturbances by mechanisms that are not fully understood  . Nuclear receptors mediate the delayed actions of BAs that require transcription. G protein coupled bile acid receptor 1  is a membrane bound G protein coupled receptor for BAs .
Vitamin B12 , or cobalamin, plays a key role in cellular metabolism and DNA synthesis. Uncooked plant based foods contaminated with B12 synthesising bacteria, and fermented foods, may also be important sources. Prevalence rates of deficiency of 47 71% have been reported among adults.
Glioblastoma multiforme  is the highest grade primary glioma  with a median survival time of approximately 12 months . This poor survival rate is due to the inability of current therapies  to completely remove highly invasive tumor cells, resulting in the eventual regrowth of secondary tumors near the original resection cavity . Thus, current research for GBM therapy is focused on the elimination of these residual, post resection tumor cells.

B7 H3 preferentially down regulated TH1 mediated immune response in B7 H3 deficient mice , and 4Ig B7 H3 inhibited NK mediated lysis of neuroblastoma cells by interacting with a putative inhibitory receptor on the surface of NK cells . In more recent studies of patients with prostate cancer, tumor B7 H3 expression was strongly correlated with disease spread at time of surgery, increased risk of clinical cancer recurrence and cancer specific death .
Cigarette’s addictive properties are largely due to the psychoactive effects of nicotine. Therefore, factors that influence the intake or removal  of nicotine from the body can affect smoking behaviours such as the number of cigarettes smoked or the likelihood of cessation. In vivo, 7080% of nicotine is metabolized to cotinine, and cytochrome P450 2A6  mediates approximately 90% of this reaction.,  CYP2A6 also exclusively mediates cotinine’s  hydroxylation to trans 3′ hydroxycotinine , making the metabolic ratio of 3HC/COT a specific and reliable marker of CYP2A6 activity.
Farmers’ markets have been increasing in prevalence, and a 3.6% growth from 2012 to 2013 has led to 8,144 markets identified by the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s  directory. However, little is known about medical center farmers’ markets customers and current outreach efforts . Medical center farmers’ markets have the opportunity to accomplish more than simply selling produce.
Head and neck cancer  and its associated complications will account for 53,000 new cases and 13,000 deaths in 2013 . The current standard of care for cancer of this nature often includes operative resection, subsequent reconstruction, and adjuvant radiotherapy. Additionally, ischemia and hypovascularity as a result of radiation therapy  predisposes patients to the devastating complications of osteoradionecrosis, pathologic fracture, and non union .
Despite close monitoring and individualization of dosing, TDM has not prevented some transplant recipients from developing chronic calcineurin inhibitor nephrotoxicity   . However, there is evidence that the drug concentration in kidney tissue is more predictive of CNIT than systemic blood concentration . In addition, some studies suggest that a higher systemic exposure to tacrolimus metabolites or intrarenal production of potentially toxic metabolites may play a contributory role in the development of CNIT .
There is evidence that chronic infections might increase the risk for diabetogenesis. Studies have also examined the relationship between infection and early markers of impaired glucose metabolism to advance our understanding of the natural history of associations. Periodontal infection models are useful because minimally invasive clinical measures are manifestations of adverse subgingival microbial exposures.
Benzene has to be metabolized to elicit toxicity to the blood and bone marrow . These benzene metabolites, i.e., reactive quinones, are able to bind to and damage macromolecules, including DNA. Benzene metabolites and ROS may affect mitochondrial function.
Men are typically assumed to respond more to visual sexual stimuli than women. In contrast, women generally rate photos of both males and females comparably attractive or arousing . Genital measurement to same and opposite sex stimuli shows the same pattern for men and women with men showing highest genital responding to their preferred sex while women show comparable genital arousal independent of the sex of the actors  .
The first case of human immunodeficiency virus  in Vietnam was reported in 1990. In Vietnam, the HIV epidemic began and remains largely concentrated in injection drug users  and commercial sex workers . Heroin has replaced opium as the preferred illicit drug and the average age of drug users is declining.
For instance, using line scanning confocal microscopy, pancreatic islet blood flow in murine animals can be examined. In rodents, they are composed of a core of β cells, which produce insulin . Monitoring blood flow requires the acquisition of time series image sequences, t stacks, in living tissue and understanding the blood flow dynamics requires analytical methods.
The trigeminal sensory complex in the brainstem is the first relay in the central nervous system for facial somatosensation. The STN is divided into three subnuclei, subnuclei oralis , interpolaris  and caudalis   . Primary somatosensory axons from the face project to both the STN and PrV.
It is reported that LC neuronal numbers decrease during normal aging and in aging related diseases. Damage and loss of LC noradrenergic neurons are accelerated in certain progressive neurodegenerative diseases such asAlzheimer’s Diseases and Parkinson’s Diseases , which are early pathological indicators of these diseases. In the brain there are a large number of non proliferative neuronal cells, which are vulnerable to defective DNA repair.
Colorectal cancer  remains the third most common cancer in both men and women and the second leading cause of cancer related deaths in the U.S. National guidelines, including those from the United States Preventive Services Task Force and the American Cancer Society, recommend CRC screening for all men and women 50 years of age and older. While there is no ideal screening method, recommended screening modalities include fecal occult blood testing, sigmoidoscopy, colonoscopy, double contrast barium enema, as well as CT colonography and fecal DNA analysis. While studies suggest that up to 60% of colorectal cancer deaths could be prevented with routine CRC screening, a major barrier to decreasing colorectal cancer morbidity and mortality is poor utilization of CRC screening procedures.
Obstructive sleep apnea  is characterized by repeated episodes of upper airway obstruction that are associated with reductions in ventilation, arousals and/or oxyhemoglobin desaturations during sleep . In addition to neurocognitive sequelae , OSA is associated with increased cardiovascular disease  morbidity and mortality  . The evidence in support of this recommendation has been recently reviewed by Araghi and colleagues , who report that lifestyle programs are associated with a decrease in apnea hypopnea index  of between 6 events to 12 events per hour of sleep.
Effective communication is particularly critical when processes are “tightly coupled” such that failures in one subsystem are directly reflected or even amplified in others, as may be the case in surgery. Within the surgical domain, one analysis demonstrated incomplete, nonexistent, or erroneous communication to be a causal factor in 43% of errors . The same study also showed that as many as 30% of operating room communications fail in one regard or another, either due to poor timing , inaccurate or incomplete information , issues remaining unresolved  or failure to include key personnel .
Plasma high density lipoprotein  levels are inversely correlated with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease and raising HDL levels by lifestyle changes or pharmacological interventions is an emerging strategy that might help to reduce the residual burden of disease in patients treated with Low density lipoprotein  lowering approaches , . While increasing synthesis or infusion of apolipoprotein A I  or HDL reduces atherosclerosis in animals and humans, it is not clear that all approaches to raising HDL will reduce atherosclerosis . The scavenger receptor B I  is a major factor regulating HDL catabolism.
Radiolabeled antibody targeting of tumor associated antigens often requires several days for adequate visualization of tumors due to the slow pharmacokinetics and accretion of intact antibodies in tumors . The use of antibody fragments and engineered antibody formats 2, Fab′, diabodies, minibodies or scFv) has improved radioimmunodetection only to a limited extent. The disadvantages of the biotin avidin based approaches are the immunogenicity of avidin and the need for a clearing agent to remove the antibody conjugate from the blood .
Amino acid based radiotracers target tumor cells through increased uptake by membrane associated amino acid transport  systems. In the present study, four structurally related non natural 18F labeled amino acids,   and  FAMP 1 and   and  MeFAMP 2 have been prepared and evaluated in vitro and in vivo for their potential utility in brain and systemic tumor imaging based upon primarily system A transport with positron emission tomography  . The transport of enantiomers of FAMP 1 and MeFAMP 2 was measured through in vitro uptake assays in human derived cancer cells including A549 , DU145 , SKOV3 , MDA MB468  and U87  in the presence and absence of amino acid transporter inhibitors.
Under physiological conditions, the endothelial cells play an important role in regulating vascular tone and in maintaining an anti thrombogenic layer through the release of substances such as nitric oxide  and prostacyclin . In this process, NO is produced by endothelial nitric oxide synthase  during the enzymatic conversion of L arginine to L citrulline , while PGI2 is formed from arachidonic acid  through a series of enzymatic conversions mediated by cyclooxygenase  and PGI2 synthase  . Both NO and prostacyclin can increase local tissue perfusion and maintain microvascular homeostasis by eliciting vasodilation and inhibiting platelet and inflammatory cell adherence to the vessel wall.

To assess daily drinking, vaginal intercourse, contraception method used and effectiveness of method used, a Timeline Follow Back calendar based interview tested previously in Project CHOICES  was used.
Hepcidin is a peptide hormone synthesized in the liver and is the principal regulator of systemic iron homeostasis. Hepcidin controls plasma iron concentration and tissue iron distribution by inhibiting intestinal iron absorption, iron recycling by macrophages, and iron mobilization from hepatic stores . Hepcidin influences iron absorption through direct binding to ferroportin at the basolateral membrane, leading to decreased export of iron to the circulation system .
The progression towards disease begins with LDL, the major carriers of cholesterol in the blood plasma, which enter the arterial wall from the blood stream where it is sequestered by extracellular matrix molecules and becomes modified . OxLDL uptake is mediated by scavenger receptors, which unlike the receptors for native LDL, are not down regulated. This leads to unregulated cholesterol accumulation and results in the formation of foam cells and fatty streaks, which are the earliest visible atherosclerotic lesions.
Non invasive prenatal testing  using cell free DNA has proven to be highly sensitive and specific for the detection of fetal aneuploidy  . Invasive prenatal diagnostic tests are also currently used to detect recessive diseases in fetuses of pregnant women who are known to be carriers of Mendelian gene mutations. Because of its safety profile, NIPT can be particularly useful in the third trimester, allowing for diagnosis without the risk of premature labor, and appropriate planning and preparation for acute perinatal and neonatal management as required .
Myelinating oligodendrocytes originate from well characterized oligodendrocyte progenitor cells  whose major source in the postnatal brain is the subventricular zone . While differentiated oligodendrocytes cannot migrate, OPCs migrate from SVZ into developing white matter where they can again divide, before finally differentiating and myelinating axons  . These include extracellular matrix components , growth factors  and chemokines .
One way cancers arise is due to accumulation of varied types of genomic instabilities. The ability of cells to efficiently and faithfully replicate their genome is critical for maintaining the integrity of the genome and preventing tumorigenesis. However, the DNA replication machinery frequently encounters stress due to endogenous factors and environmental agents.
Constitutive MAPK activation is frequent in human cancer and is often the result of activating mutations in RAS  . Mutationally activated forms of RAS were first identified in the Harvey and Kirsten sarcoma viruses, in which they were determined to be oncogenic  . Shortly thereafter, somatic RAS mutations were detected in human tumors  .
Obesity is a primary risk factor for osteoarthritis; however, there is currently no comprehensive explanation for why obesity increases the risk of OA at sites throughout the body. Most hypotheses focus on mechanical factors because the risk of developing knee osteoarthritis increases with body weight . Increasing evidence in support of this hypothesis comes from recent studies showing that adipose tissue is not simply an inert energy storage depot, but rather it is an active endocrine organ that secretes numerous cytokines and cytokine like molecules termed adipokines.
One recent study concluded that 61% of deaths in PLWH were directly attributable to smoking, and that smoking reduced longevity by an average of 12 years . Smoking increases the risk of both opportunistic and “typical” infections in PLWH. It is driving alarming rises in the incidences of cardiovascular disease, lung cancer, and head and neck cancers in this population.
Each prostate lobe features unique ductal morphology and gene expression profiles, yet they all arise from a common primordium, the urogenital sinus . Buds on the anterior UGE surface emerge first, as early as embryonic day  16.5, and give rise to anterior prostate ducts. Dorsal prostate buds also emerge on E16.5 and lateral and ventral buds are the last to appear on approximately E17.5 .
Linked functionally to dynein, dynactin is an independent multisubunit complex first identified as a dynein cofactor and subsequently shown to contribute to the dynein driven transport of many cargos . The p150Glued subunit is widely recognized as the dynein binding subunit of dynactin, and has been shown to bind to the IC subunits of dynein . This interaction has been proposed as a mechanism to link dynein to cargo in both interphase and mitosis .
Carbon monoxide  is one of the more toxic agents present in the gas phase of tobacco smoke. It is a colourless, odourless, tasteless and non irritating gas formed when tobacco is not burned completely. The compound can also be found in sidestream smoke and is emitted into the atmosphere during puff breaks, on levels of 9 to 35 mg/cigarette .
Epigenetic dysfunction is a common and perhaps universal feature of human cancer. Studies into the biological consequences of hypo  and hypermethylation indicate that each plays a participative role in carcinogenesis . In this model, the transformation of normal finite lifespan HMEC to malignancy requires overcoming two distinct senescence associated barriers to immortality .
The production of the vasodilator nitric oxide  by endothelial nitric oxide synthase  is critical for the maintenance of normal vasomotor function. Tetrahydrobiopterin  is an essential cofactor required for activity of eNOS. We and others have shown that the vascular endothelium is a major source of BH4 in the arterial wall.
Insulin like growth factor 1 receptor  represents a ubiquitously expressed heterotetrameric protein involved in the regulation of proliferation and metabolic function of many cell types . IGF 1Rα contains a ligand binding domain while IGF 1Rβ is involved in signaling and contains tyrosine phosphorylation sites. While the functional consequence of associating with other receptors is not yet understood, complex formation might modulate TSH action and receptor activation .
Chronic inflammation can be a risk factor for the development of malignancy, and patients with ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease have an increased risk of colonic epithelial dysplasia and carcinoma . Azathioprine is a prodrug that is cleaved to 6 MP which in turn is metabolized to 6 thioguanine nucleotides . DNA 6 TG has two properties that distinguish it from the canonical DNA bases.

Components in the TIM22 translocation system include the small Tim proteins  and the membrane components Tim18, Tim22, and Tim54. The insertion complex in the inner membrane consists of a fraction of the Tim9 and Tim10 with Tim12 and membrane proteins Tim18, Tim22, and Tim54 . These substrates cross the TOM complex as a loop in an unfolded state.

Currently, there are few highly predictive mechanisms for early detection of EOC, with the exception being sequential screening with carbohydrate antigen 125 via the Risk of Ovarian Cancer Algorithm . Approximately 75% of women are not diagnosed until advanced stage III or IV disease, when prognosis is poor with low rates of long term survival  . Specifically, EOC risk is influenced by a number of epidemiological factors in addition to the genetic component, including reproductive history such as parity and oral contraceptive use , lifestyle factors such as obesity and smoking , and demographic factors .
This is an example of a phenomenon called pareidolia, which involves the perception of an ambiguous and random stimulus as significant, such as seeing faces in landscapes, clouds   or even in grilled toasts . Why and how do we tend to see faces in objects that have constituent parts resembling those of a face? Is it because our brains are hard wired to detect the presence of a face as quickly as possible, or is it a later cognitive construction or interpretation?
Periosteum contains a population of stem/progenitor cells that play key roles in cortical bone repair . During the first few days of fracture, hematoma is formed followed by infiltration of inflammatory cells and release of growth factors. COX 2 is the inducible isoform of cyclooxygenase, the key rate limiting enzyme in the prostaglandin biosynthesis pathway .
The first tumor suppressor to be cloned was the retinoblastoma gene, Rb. Overexpression of pRb causes G1 cell cycle arrest , while acute ablation of pRb induces cell cycle re entry in quiescent cells . During G1, pRb becomes hyperphosphorylated by the cyclin D   cdk4/6 complex and subsequently by cyclin E   cdk2.
, The electrochemical response at DNA self assembled monolayers  is remarkably sensitive to base stacking perturbations, with the efficiency of CT to an electro active probe reflecting the integrity of the base pair stack. Previously, the morphology of DNA SAMs on gold has been investigated by scanning tunneling microscopy , atomic force microscopy , and, most recently, scanning electrochemical microscopy . , In addition, SECM has been used successfully to monitor DNA hybridization and to detect DNA lesions.
To date, over 300 clinical trials involve the use of MSCs, with over 2000 patients safely treated with MSCs. MSCs are being investigated for the treatment of cardiovascular disorders , diabetes, connective tissue disorders , chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, nervous system disorders , kidney diseases and more., Effective preservation of MSCs is critical, in particular, for their use as a highly functional off the shelf therapy for patients. The ability to store the cells allows for completion of safety and quality control testing prior to use of the cells, permits transportation from the site of processing to the site of administration, and streamlines coordination of the cell therapy with patient care regimes.
The intramural injection of BoNT/A into the urinary bladder has proven to be a useful therapeutic approach for the treatment of various bladder disorders including refractory idiopathic detrusor overactivity as well as neurogenic detrusor overactivity., Following uptake into nerve terminals BoNT/A is thought to affect bladder function by targeting intracellular proteins involved in exocytosis and then suppressing the release of transmitters from intramural nerves . Though most of the studies on mechanism of action have focused on bladder nerves and change in neural control of the smooth muscle, other cellular targets may also be involved in the therapeutic effects of the toxin. Recent evidence has suggested that BoNT/A may act in part by targeting afferent mechanisms., This may be due to a direct effect on afferent nerves or an indirect effect to block release of transmitters from the epithelial cells that line the bladder wall .
Therefore, the majority of self reactive T cells involved in autoimmune disease have escaped thymic selection due to the lower affinity of their TCRs and/or the lack of tissue specific antigen expressed in the thymus. Multiple regulatory mechanisms, such as cell intrinsic negative regulators and cell extrinsic regulatory T cells, can modulate and to some degree control activation of pathogenic T cells. However, it is still unknown why some T cells are  more likely to escape central and peripheral tolerance mechanisms,  more pathogenic and  more efficient mediators of beta cell destruction.

Mutations in the known genes account for merely ~15% of cases of anophthalmia, microphthalmia and coloboma. For the remaining patients, the lack of a specific molecular diagnosis prevents prediction of long term outcomes, anticipation of systemic complications and estimation of the recurrence risk in their families .
The most abundant isotype, IgG, is comprised of four distinct subclasses , which provide comprehensive systemic immune protection by being equally present in both the blood and the extravascular fluids. Each IgG subclass is present in human serum at variable levels and displays a unique profile of effector activities that results in a distinct isotype/subclass profile to a given antigen within a defined local environment . Protein antigens characteristically invoke IgG1 and IgG3 responses whereas IgG2 often predominates in humoral responses to carbohydrate antigens .
Therapeutic strategies that target DC should aim for high transduction efficiency and specificity, as optimal TAA delivery to DC is critical for the therapeutic efficacy of DC based vaccination strategies. Adenovirus  based therapies are ideal for in vivo targeting and infection of DC, as adenoviruses can infect non replicating cells and can be genetically modified to express a TAA of choice. Other Ad types without pre existent immunity and with a natural tropism for DC associated molecules may be more readily translated to the clinic as vaccination vehicles, without a further need for genetic modification of their fiber knob to enable DC targeting.
A large body of work has shown that anxiety disorders aggregate within families . Indeed, family studies indicate that both children of parents with anxiety disorders  and parents of children with anxiety disorders  display higher rates of anxiety disorders than do relatives of family members without anxiety disorders. For instance, a meta analysis of 30 behavioral genetic studies revealed that both shared and non shared environmental factors account for approximately 70% of the variance in child anxiety problems, above and beyond that of additive genetic factors  .
A broader explanation may be found in multiple observations in which T cell defects were found in a still undefined proportion of human CVID patients. Some CVID patients have significantly decreased T cell numbers, in particular naïve CD4+ T cells . These studies reveal that the degree of reduction in naïve CD4+ T cells is correlated with clinical disease severity, and that this is independent of age, gender, and even Ig titer .

Besides mediating higher order chromatin folding, linker histone H1 has been shown to regulate gene expression in vivo in a specific manner .

Human health effects include cases of human intoxication from neurotoxic shellfish poisoning  and impacts on human respiratory function  . The most prevalent HABs along the Florida Gulf coast are caused by the dinoflagellate, K. brevis  . The suite of brevetoxins includes at least nine, and as many as 14 compounds  ranging in molecular weight from 868 to 936 .
Praziquantel, the drug of choice against schistosomiasis,  has shown excellent safety and therapeutic effect against schistosomiasis morbidity. In 2002, an informal consultation by the World Health Organisation reviewed experience on use of praziquantel in pregnancy. There was little evidence of adverse effects from case reports, or from inadvertent use during pregnancy in mass treatment programmes and it was recommended that pregnant and lactating women with schistosomiasis should be treated .
We have previously demonstrated that a single soluble protein can be produced in E. coli by the method termed the single protein production  . In this system, MazF, an mRNA interferase, is induced, which functions as an ACA specific endoribonuclease to eliminate almost all cellular mRNAs. Subsequent induction of an ACA less RNA for a target protein results in the production of only the target protein in the cells, without producing any other cellular proteins.
Circulating tumor cells  captured from peripheral blood recently were shown to predict disease outcome and therapy response in cancer patients . Currently, CTCs are isolated from blood by methods which rely on immuno magnetic binding of cell surface epithelial cell adhesion molecules , an expensive, labor intense approach that is limited to EpCAM expressing tumors . We previously reported an alternative platform using a novel parylene C pore microfilter which traps CTCs quickly and efficiently based on their size differential from other blood cells .
We have reported that levels of pituitary adenylate cyclase activating polypeptide  and a single nucleotide polymorphism  within an estrogen response element  for the PAC1 receptor gene were correlated with post traumatic stress disorder  in women, while PAC1 gene methylation correlated with PTSD in both men and women . PACAP has been called a “master regulator” of stress responses . The BNST plays a key role in regulating behavioral responses associated with anxiety and depression in animals and humans , and tightly regulates the output of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal  axis .
Characterizing EGJ barrier function is complicated by both its dynamic nature and complex anatomy. However, sphincter length, or intra abdominal length, speaks nothing to the magnitude of closure forces at the EGJ. Consequently, Bombeck and colleagues developed the concept of LES vector volume  in the late 1980s as a quantification of sphincter integrity ,.
Platinum based drugs, namely cisplatin, carboplatin, and oxaliplatin are regularly used to treat solid tumours., Cisplatin is highly effective against testicular and ovarian cancers while carboplatin and oxaliplatin are routinely used to treat lung, ovarian, and colorectal tumours. The current consensus is that cisplatin and its derivatives bind genomic DNA, forming DNA cross links that block DNA synthesis/transcription and cell cycle progression that ultimately induce tumour cell death. The shortcomings associated with platinum therapy,  such as inherent, acquired, or cross resistance, toxic side effects, and high incidence of relapse, highlight the need for new anticancer drugs with novel mechanisms of action that can target platinum resistant tumours, reduce general toxicity, and broaden the spectrum of activity .
Parkinson’s disease  is the second most common neurodegenerative disease and afflicts ~1.8 % of the population by age 65 years . The neuropathological hallmark of PD is an irreversible loss of dopaminergic neurons in the substantia nigra pars compacta  and their terminals in the striatum . Although, the majority  of PD cases are sporadic and the underlying molecular causes are unknown, postmortem studies have showed the involvement of several predisposing factors including viral infection and environmental toxins such as MPTP .
Upon induction by the ureteric bud, the metanephric mesenchyme undergoes a series of morphogenic events resulting in ingrowth of the ureteric bud into the metanephric blastema, mesenchymal to epithelial transition, and formation of tubules of the mature nephron . It arises from pluripotent renal precursors that are undergoing excessive proliferation resulting in undifferentiated stromal components, blastemal cells similar to the condensing mesenchyme and primitive epithelial structures resembling comma and S shaped bodies and glomeruli . The presence of associated nephrogenic rests  that consist of foci of persistent embryonal remnant tissues that failed to mature to normal renal parenchyma, further point towards impaired differentiation in early renal development .
National HIV prevalence in Kenya is 8% for the adult population 1549. With data on incidence, however, temporal changes in the epidemic can be identified and linked to risk behaviors over the same time period. According to a modes of transmission study in Kenya, heterosexual unions  are the largest source for new infections, followed by causal heterosexual sex , female sex workers  and clients , men who have sex with men  and prison populations , injecting drug users IDUs  and health facility related infections .

Similarly, patients with greater confidence in their ability to manage the symptoms of multiple sclerosis , arthritis , and colostomy  have all been shown to experience lesser impact on daily living and increased health related quality of life  . Higher self rating of general health , higher emotional functioning , and lower depression status  have all been associated with higher patient activation.

Most causative pathogens related to burns and chronic wound infections are susceptible to the levels of AgSD attainable topically.

In other words, the zero elements of the matrix are assumed to be fixed across all subjects .
Patients with inflammatory bowel diseases , ulcerative colitis ) are at increased risk for venous thromboembolism  and associated morbidity and mortality, . Inflammation is key determinant of VTE risk in IBD with ambulatory flares and hospitalization being associated with increased risk , , , . As the absolute VTE risk is greatest during hospitalization, experts recommend routine thromboprophylaxis in such settings, .
Allergic diseases involve the allergen induced Th2 response characterized by the production of Th2 cytokines, including IL 4, IL 5, and IL 13 critical in the development of the allergic response. Mast cells are critical tissue based effector cells that mediate IgE dependent allergic responses . Mast cells express IgE receptors  and binding of an allergen to IgE FcεR1 induces the release of three classes of proinflammatory mediators: 1) preformed granule associated chemical mediators; 2) newly synthesized arachidonic acid metabolites, such as leukotrienes ; and 3) proinflammatory cytokines, including TNF α and Th2 cytokines .
Dopaminergic neurons provide a critical modulatory influence in reward seeking , prediction error  and reinforcement . Under basal conditions these transients occur at highly variable frequencies with amplitudes of ~ 50 nM and durations of ~ 1 s . They are enhanced upon administration of drugs of abuse , and become time locked to cues that predict reward availability .

Dendritic cells  are key inducers of adaptive immunity and tolerance, as well as regulators of innate immunity. It is common to sub divide DCs into plasmacytoid DCs  and conventional DCs  . ResDCs and migDCs are heterogeneous and comprise multiple cDC subsets, often referred to as the CD8α+ cDC and the CD11b+ cDC families .
Their enzymatic activity results in the stereospecific insertion of an oxygen molecule at C 15 of arachidonic acid to form the lipid hydroperoxide 15 HpETE, which is reduced in cells to the lipid hydroxide 15 HETE. 15 LO 1 is up regulated in human peripheral monocytes and alveolar macrophages cultured in the presence of interleukin 4 or interleukin 13, both of which are inflammatory cytokines . In vivo studies also showed that 12/15 LO/apoE double knockout mice had a pronounced delay and attenuation of atherosclerotic lesion development when compared to apoE deficient mice expressing one or two gene copies of 12/15 LO .
Although Müller glia do not proliferate under normal conditions, they can enter the mitotic cell cycle in some pathological states. In addition, retinal injury in fish and birds triggers extensive proliferation in the Müller glia , which in fish can lead to nearly complete restoration of cells lost by the injury  . For example, insulin like growth factor  and insulin are potent mitogens for Müller glia .
Humans can be exposed to various kinds of ionizing radiation, including the diagnostic X rays, nuclear medicine and radiotherapy routinely used in clinics, radionuclides such as radon, potassium, uranium and nuclear waste, radiological weapons, and high energy particle radiation from galactic and solar cosmic rays . Bone marrow stem cells are among the most radiosensitive cells in the human body. Ionizing radiation impairs hematopoiesis through a variety of mechanisms.

Atrial fibrillation  is increasingly managed by radiofrequency ablation, in which left atrial  tissue is ablated around the pulmonary vein  antra to create scar with a primary goal of electrically isolating the pulmonary veins , . Further ablation to the posterior wall, roof or septum varies from center to center and is largely operator dependent . To guide ablation, preprocedural magnetic resonance angiography  or computerized tomography angiography is commonly acquired, segmented in an electroanatomic mapping  system, and merged with real time LA geometry to create a 3D model of the LA.
Tea tree oil  extracted from Melaleuca alternifolia is a complex hydrocarbon mixture that exhibits broad spectrum antimicrobial activity . Preliminary trials suggest that TTO formulations may be effective in the treatment and management of acne and fungal infections and could be useful in bacterial pathogen decolonization protocols . There is strong evidence that the components responsible for the oil’s cidal activity are the monoterpene alcohols, in particular terpinen 4 ol and α terpineol .
Vertical transmission of various DNA and RNA viruses among humans  and animals  is well documented. Transplacental transmission of BK virus  has been suggested based on detection of BKV DNA in fetal tissues , but others failed to detect evidence of transmission . The contamination occurred because vaccines were produced in cultures of kidney cells derived from rhesus macaques, which are frequently infected with SV40.
Nevirapine  was the first non nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor approved for use in combination therapy of HIV 1 infection . The most severe is an occasionally fatal hepatotoxicity, while the most common side effect is skin rash, which may be life threatening and lead to discontinuation of the drug. These toxic events raise concerns about the chronic administration of the drug, particularly in perinatal and pediatric settings .

Therefore, maternal immunetolerance of the fetus is essential for successful pregnancy. Regulating the numbers of postmitotic cells generated in the cortex requires control of two key aspects of proliferation:  the length of the cell cycle and  the proportion of newly generated cells that re enter the cell cycle as opposed to leaving it to differentiate. Two types of progenitor cell exist in the developing neocortex. A second proliferative population, derived from the APCs, forms in the subventricular zone: the majority of these cells divide symmetrically to produce two postmitotic neurons, and they have been designated non surface dividing cells or basal progenitor cells  .
In the United States it is estimated that 5% of pregnant women are infected with Chlamydia trachomatis, and as a result, nearly 3.5 million newborns become infected at the time of delivery. A total of 75,000 cases of inclusion conjunctivitis and 30,000 cases of C. trachomatis pneumonia are reported each year . However, some neonates develop persistent infections  .
While many modern missing data methods exist, these methods have not been thoroughly explicated and compared with clinical trial data . This investigation considers two missing data assumptions. The first assumption of missing at random  indicates that observed scores can effectively predict the propensity or probability of missing data and after controlling for these observed scores, missing data is unrelated to UA results.
The efficiency of cysteine rich proteins and peptides, e.g. metallothioneins and phytochelatins, in removing harmful heavy metals from the cells and tissues,,  has inspired assessment of cysteine as an eco friendly agent for extracting heavy metals from a contaminated environment. In recent years, cysteine has been introduced as an environmentally friendly source of sulfur for preparing nano crystalline PbS, a widely used semiconductor. It has been suggested that the precursor is polycrystalline HS CH2CHCOO Pb OH, or has a polymeric n structure, in well aligned one dimensional nanowires.
Atrial fibrillation  is a condition characterized by rapid, erratic electrical activation of the atrial myocardium, resulting in loss of effective contractility, an increased likelihood of clot formation and an increased risk of stroke. Prevalent in the aging population, AF is traditionally viewed as an acquired disorder occurring as a complication of cardiac and systemic diseases, such as hypertension, coronary artery disease, valvular heart disease, cardiomyopathies and thyroid disorders. However, recent recognition of familial aggregation has implicated a heritable basis for AF.
During the past three decades, the relationship between maternal hemoglobin level and fetal outcome has been examined at length. Maternal anemia has long been considered a risk factor for poor pregnancy outcome . In addition, elevated hemoglobin levels have also emerged as being predictive of intrauterine growth restriction  .
This Pax2 positive intermediate mesoderm generates the nephric, or Wolffian, duct, an outgrowth of the duct called the ureteric bud , and the surrounding metanephric mesenchyme . Kidney development starts when the UB invades the MM and transmits inductive signals, such as Wnt9b , to promote condensation of the MM around the UB tips. However, Pax2 expression is down regulated in the podocyte precursor cells and in the mature epithelial cells of the nephron as development comes to an end  .
The World Health Organization estimates that 50 million dengue virus infections occur each year within the nearly two fifths of the world population living in areas at risk for dengue transmission. With increasing urbanization as well as international travel, the range of the principal mosquito vector of dengue virus , Aedes agypti, is expanding. Co circulation of the four serotypes of DENV, DENV 1 4, along with the increased risk for severe disease during secondary DENV infections represents a serious global health problem.

Furthermore, well recognized co morbidities of epilepsy such as depression, anxiety, and sleep disorders  occur with increasing frequency with advancing age  and merit examination in this special population . Few studies have examined these comorbidities of epilepsy in the elderly.
This imaging method, termed “resting state fMRI” and often referred to as functional connectivity MRI , has revealed the presence of intrinsically connected cortical networks across subjects , across time , within behavioral states , and even across species  . The default mode, salience, dorsal attention, and control networks in particular have been heavily studied in cognitive aging, Alzheimer’s disease, schizophrenia, and autism among other disorders . Additionally, fcMRI will be used as a secondary outcome measure in at least three major Alzheimer’s disease prevention trials  .
Histone deacetylase  inhibition is a promising epigenetic strategy for cancer treatment, and several distinct small molecule histone deacetylase inhibitors  have been reported. Currently, significant efforts are ongoing to address these and other deficiencies of HDACi to bolster the potential of HDAC inhibition in cancer treatment . Most HDACi fit a three motif pharmacophoric model consisting of a zinc binding group , a linker, and a surface recognition cap group.
Vitamin A deficiency  is a major public health problem in many developing countries, including India. India has the largest percentage as well as the largest absolute number of vitamin A deficient children in the world. The Lancet child survival series lists vitamin A supplementation among the key interventions achievable at a large scale that have proven potential to reduce the number of preventable child deaths each year.
The incidence of cardiovascular disease in the United States  and other high income countries is higher in low socio economic status  and minority ethnic groups , with SES disparities reflecting not just a threshold effect of poverty versus non poverty, but rather a risk gradient across the SES range . Reduction of these disparities has been a focus of interest for policy makers , and requires the early detection and management of risk factors in underprivileged groups. Indeed, low SES and minority ethnic groups do report higher values of risk factors for cardiovascular disease  .
One of the possible solutions to reducing the microbial contamination of drinking water is small scale or point of use  systems for water treatment. POU systems are not connected to a central network, have low energy inputs, and can be used in emergency response following disasters. Key efforts aim to use renewable resources, nontoxic chemicals, and environmentally benign solvents, and to minimize waste generation.
Approximately 60 percent of epilepsy disorders are classified as partial epilepsy, of which temporal lobe epilepsy involving the hippocampus is the most common . Temporal lobe epilepsy is also among the most difficult to treat medically, often necessitating surgical resection of an epileptic focus. Electrical high frequency stimulation  is an alternative treatment for seizure disorders.
Osteocytes are thought to influence these processes in response to changes in tissue strain and fluid flow that result from physiological loading ; however, the mechanisms by which osteocytes perceive and respond to mechanical information are not well defined. Mechano responsiveness in many cell types is mediated by integrins, heterodimeric, signal transducing transmembrane glycoproteins that link extracellular matrix constituents and in some cases co receptors on adjoining cell surfaces to intracellular elements of the actin cytoskeleton . All bone cell types express integrins , and osteocytes in particular were reported to express integrins of both β1 and β3 families .
Normal development requires precisely regulated levels of cell survival, apoptosis, proliferation, and differentiation. Understanding the signaling pathways that control these cellular processes is essential for understanding the molecular basis of transformation. The group A family includes mammalian Pak1, Pak2, and Pak3 , whereas group B includes Pak4, Pak5, and Pak6 .
Neuroblastoma is the most common and deadly solid tumor of childhood and the most common cancer of infancy, accounting for about 15% of all pediatric cancer deaths . Neuroblastoma is characterized by biological and genetic heterogeneity that leads to diverse, often unpredictable, clinical behavior, from spontaneous regression to widespread dissemination . The NTRK genes code for the Trk family of neurotrophin receptors, a homologous group of transmembrane receptor tyrosine kinases that are critical for normal development of the central and peripheral nervous system.
The number of Americans over the age of 65 is expected to double between 2000 and 2050. Substance use disorder is an important comorbidity. An estimated 23.9 million people in the U. S. were current drug users in 2012 .
Systemic lupus erythematosus  is a complex, chronic multi system autoimmune inflammatory disease that targets young women and men . The up to 20% of SLE patients who are diagnosed during childhood, i.e. prior to the age of 16 years , tend to experience a more severe disease course than those with disease onset later on in life . Various measures of global disease activity have been developed for SLE in adults and subsequent validation confirmed these indices have concurrent validity for measuring disease activity with cSLE .
The interactions of membranes with cationic polymers such as linear poly L lysine , branched polyethylenimine , and ring containing diethylaminoethyl dextran  were studied experimentally by Hong et al. Although in these studies the hydrodynamic radius of the PEI used was smaller than that of DEAE DEX, the PEI polymer induced greater membrane permeability than did DEAE DEX, apparently due to the high charge density of the former. These results suggested that polymer size does not affect membrane permeabilization as much as charge density does.
In the United States, hepatitis C viral  infection is the leading cause of chronic liver disease including cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma , the most serious complication of the viral infection . Approximately 80% of HCC is associated with chronic viral infections world wide  and, in the US, 50 60% of HCC patient are HCV infected  . Stimulation of immune response by HCV antigens leads to increase in specific subclasses of immunoglobulins dominated by the IgG1 and IgG3 subclasses .
Arterial stiffness, which occurs most notably in the large, elastic arteries , is a hallmark of the aging process and is characterized by fragmentation and degeneration of elastin, increases in collagen, wall thickening, and progressive dilation . These structural changes are accompanied by increases in the pulse wave velocity, which causes the reflected wave to reach the heart at systole instead of diastole and pulsatile flow to extend further into the microcirculation. The consequences of arterial stiffening include increased systolic and pulse pressure, left ventricular  hypertrophy, impaired myocardial perfusion, and small vessel degeneration in the brain and kidneys .
Non invasive methods such as magneto  and electroencephalography  and functional magnetic resonance imaging  provide means to examine neural activity in various ways, for example, by determining locations, sequences, and connectivity patterns among regions in the human brain . In addition to these measures, identifying inter area communication in terms of the hierarchical organization of functional brain areas would be highly relevant in the quest for understanding the operation of the brain. However, this type of information is not readily available in human imaging data.
Ewing sarcoma  is the second most common primary bone tumor in childhood and is characterized by the EWS/FLI 1 translocation . The t translocation is identified in over 95% of EWS tumors and results in the formation of the EWS/ETS fusion gene . Several approaches have been used to target EWS cells for therapy.
In phonosurgery, injection laryngoplasty is an effective procedure for patients suffering from a variety of vocal pathologies. This procedure can also be employed to replace, repair, or augment lamina propria deficiencies such as scarring or atrophy, where biomaterials are injected into the lamina propria. Vocal fold vibration depends critically on the viscoelasticity of the vocal fold lamina propria, especially the superficial layer or the cover.

These modified approaches have improved the accuracy of prediction to some extent .

Recently, another study reported that women with significant premenstrual symptoms were subjectively sleepier in the late luteal phase than in their own follicular phase, and compared with the luteal phase of a group of women with minimal symptoms.
